123 // kv store prefixes
124 const string PREFIX_SUPER = "S"; // field -> value
125 const string PREFIX_STAT = "T"; // field -> value(int64 array)
126 const string PREFIX_COLL = "C"; // collection name -> cnode_t
127 const string PREFIX_OBJ = "O"; // object name -> onode_t
128 const string PREFIX_OMAP = "M"; // u64 + keyname -> value
129 const string PREFIX_PGMETA_OMAP = "P"; // u64 + keyname -> value(for meta coll)
130 const string PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP = "m"; // s64 + u64 + keyname -> value
131 const string PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP = "p"; // u64(pool) + u32(hash) + u64(id) + keyname -> value
132 const string PREFIX_DEFERRED = "L"; // id -> deferred_transaction_t
133 const string PREFIX_ALLOC = "B"; // u64 offset -> u64 length (freelist)
134 const string PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP = "b";// (see BitmapFreelistManager)
135 const string PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB = "X"; // u64 SB id -> shared_blob_t
136 
137 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
138 const string PREFIX_ZONED_FM_META = "Z"; // (see ZonedFreelistManager)
139 const string PREFIX_ZONED_FM_INFO = "z"; // (see ZonedFreelistManager)
140 const string PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO = "G"; // (per-zone cleaner metadata)
141 #endif
142 
143 const string BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY = "bluestore_statfs";
144 
145 #define OBJECT_MAX_SIZE 0xffffffff // 32 bits
146 
147 
148 /*
149  * extent map blob encoding
150  *
151  * we use the low bits of the blobid field to indicate some common scenarios
152  * and spanning vs local ids. See ExtentMap::{encode,decode}_some().
153  */
154 #define BLOBID_FLAG_CONTIGUOUS 0x1 // this extent starts at end of previous
155 #define BLOBID_FLAG_ZEROOFFSET 0x2 // blob_offset is 0
156 #define BLOBID_FLAG_SAMELENGTH 0x4 // length matches previous extent
157 #define BLOBID_FLAG_SPANNING 0x8 // has spanning blob id
158 #define BLOBID_SHIFT_BITS 4
159 
160 /*
161  * object name key structure
162  *
163  * encoded u8: shard + 2^7 (so that it sorts properly)
164  * encoded u64: poolid + 2^63 (so that it sorts properly)
165  * encoded u32: hash (bit reversed)
166  *
167  * escaped string: namespace
168  *
169  * escaped string: key or object name
170  * 1 char: '<', '=', or '>'. if =, then object key == object name, and
171  * we are done. otherwise, we are followed by the object name.
172  * escaped string: object name (unless '=' above)
173  *
174  * encoded u64: snap
175  * encoded u64: generation
176  * 'o'
177  */
178 #define ONODE_KEY_SUFFIX 'o'
179 
180 /*
181  * extent shard key
182  *
183  * object prefix key
184  * u32
185  * 'x'
186  */
187 #define EXTENT_SHARD_KEY_SUFFIX 'x'
188 
189 /*
190  * string encoding in the key
191  *
192  * The key string needs to lexicographically sort the same way that
193  * ghobject_t does. We do this by escaping anything <= to '#' with #
194  * plus a 2 digit hex string, and anything >= '~' with ~ plus the two
195  * hex digits.
196  *
197  * We use ! as a terminator for strings; this works because it is < #
198  * and will get escaped if it is present in the string.
199  *
200  * NOTE: There is a bug in this implementation: due to implicit
201  * character type conversion in comparison it may produce unexpected
202  * ordering. Unfortunately fixing the bug would mean invalidating the
203  * keys in existing deployments. Instead we do additional sorting
204  * where it is needed.
205  */
206 template<typename S>
207 static void append_escaped(const string &in, S *out)
208 {
209  char hexbyte[in.length() * 3 + 1];
210  char* ptr = &hexbyte[0];
211  for (string::const_iterator i = in.begin(); i != in.end(); ++i) {
212  if (*i <= '#') { // bug: unexpected result for *i > 0x7f
213  *ptr++ = '#';
214  *ptr++ = "0123456789abcdef"[(*i >> 4) & 0x0f];
215  *ptr++ = "0123456789abcdef"[*i & 0x0f];
216  } else if (*i >= '~') { // bug: unexpected result for *i > 0x7f
217  *ptr++ = '~';
218  *ptr++ = "0123456789abcdef"[(*i >> 4) & 0x0f];
219  *ptr++ = "0123456789abcdef"[*i & 0x0f];
220  } else {
221  *ptr++ = *i;
222  }
223  }
224  *ptr++ = '!';
225  out->append(hexbyte, ptr - &hexbyte[0]);
226 }
227 
228 inline unsigned h2i(char c)
229 {
230  if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) {
231  return c - 0x30;
232  } else if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'f')) {
233  return c - 'a' + 10;
234  } else if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'F')) {
235  return c - 'A' + 10;
236  } else {
237  return 256; // make it always larger than 255
238  }
239 }
240 
241 static int decode_escaped(const char *p, string *out)
242 {
243  char buff[256];
244  char* ptr = &buff[0];
245  char* max = &buff[252];
246  const char *orig_p = p;
247  while (*p && *p != '!') {
248  if (*p == '#' || *p == '~') {
249  unsigned hex = 0;
250  p++;
251  hex = h2i(*p++) << 4;
252  if (hex > 255) {
253  return -EINVAL;
254  }
255  hex |= h2i(*p++);
256  if (hex > 255) {
257  return -EINVAL;
258  }
259  *ptr++ = hex;
260  } else {
261  *ptr++ = *p++;
262  }
263  if (ptr > max) {
264  out->append(buff, ptr-buff);
265  ptr = &buff[0];
266  }
267  }
268  if (ptr != buff) {
269  out->append(buff, ptr-buff);
270  }
271  return p - orig_p;
272 }
273 
274 template<typename T>
275 static void _key_encode_shard(shard_id_t shard, T *key)
276 {
277  key->push_back((char)((uint8_t)shard.id + (uint8_t)0x80));
278 }
279 
280 static const char *_key_decode_shard(const char *key, shard_id_t *pshard)
281 {
282  pshard->id = (uint8_t)*key - (uint8_t)0x80;
283  return key + 1;
284 }
285 
286 static void get_coll_range(const coll_t& cid, int bits,
287  ghobject_t *temp_start, ghobject_t *temp_end,
288  ghobject_t *start, ghobject_t *end, bool legacy)
289 {
290  spg_t pgid;
291  constexpr uint32_t MAX_HASH = std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max();
292  // use different nspaces due to we use different schemes when encoding
293  // keys for listing objects
294  const std::string_view MAX_NSPACE = legacy ? "\x7f" : "\xff";
295  if (cid.is_pg(&pgid)) {
296  start->shard_id = pgid.shard;
297  *temp_start = *start;
298 
299  start->hobj.pool = pgid.pool();
300  temp_start->hobj.pool = -2ll - pgid.pool();
301 
302  *end = *start;
303  *temp_end = *temp_start;
304 
305  uint32_t reverse_hash = hobject_t::_reverse_bits(pgid.ps());
306  start->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(reverse_hash);
307  temp_start->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(reverse_hash);
308 
309  uint64_t end_hash = reverse_hash + (1ull << (32 - bits));
310  if (end_hash > MAX_HASH) {
311  // make sure end hobj is even greater than the maximum possible hobj
312  end->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(MAX_HASH);
313  temp_end->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(MAX_HASH);
314  end->hobj.nspace = MAX_NSPACE;
315  } else {
316  end->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(end_hash);
317  temp_end->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(end_hash);
318  }
319  } else {
320  start->shard_id = shard_id_t::NO_SHARD;
321  start->hobj.pool = -1ull;
322 
323  *end = *start;
324  start->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(0);
325  end->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(MAX_HASH);
326  end->hobj.nspace = MAX_NSPACE;
327  // no separate temp section
328  *temp_start = *end;
329  *temp_end = *end;
330  }
331 
332  start->generation = 0;
333  end->generation = 0;
334  temp_start->generation = 0;
335  temp_end->generation = 0;
336 }
337 
338 static void get_shared_blob_key(uint64_t sbid, string *key)
339 {
340  key->clear();
341  _key_encode_u64(sbid, key);
342 }
343 
344 static int get_key_shared_blob(const string& key, uint64_t *sbid)
345 {
346  const char *p = key.c_str();
347  if (key.length() < sizeof(uint64_t))
348  return -1;
349  _key_decode_u64(p, sbid);
350  return 0;
351 }
352 
353 template<typename S>
354 static void _key_encode_prefix(const ghobject_t& oid, S *key)
355 {
356  _key_encode_shard(oid.shard_id, key);
357  _key_encode_u64(oid.hobj.pool + 0x8000000000000000ull, key);
358  _key_encode_u32(oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32(), key);
359 }
360 
361 static const char *_key_decode_prefix(const char *p, ghobject_t *oid)
362 {
363  p = _key_decode_shard(p, &oid->shard_id);
364 
365  uint64_t pool;
366  p = _key_decode_u64(p, &pool);
367  oid->hobj.pool = pool - 0x8000000000000000ull;
368 
369  unsigned hash;
370  p = _key_decode_u32(p, &hash);
371 
372  oid->hobj.set_bitwise_key_u32(hash);
373 
374  return p;
375 }
376 
377 
378 #define ENCODED_KEY_PREFIX_LEN (1 + 8 + 4)
379 
380 static int _get_key_object(const char *p, ghobject_t *oid)
381 {
382  int r;
383 
384  p = _key_decode_prefix(p, oid);
385 
386  r = decode_escaped(p, &oid->hobj.nspace);
387  if (r < 0)
388  return -2;
389  p += r + 1;
390 
391  string k;
392  r = decode_escaped(p, &k);
393  if (r < 0)
394  return -3;
395  p += r + 1;
396  if (*p == '=') {
397  // no key
398  ++p;
399  oid->hobj.oid.name = k;
400  } else if (*p == '<' || *p == '>') {
401  // key + name
402  ++p;
403  r = decode_escaped(p, &oid->hobj.oid.name);
404  if (r < 0)
405  return -5;
406  p += r + 1;
407  oid->hobj.set_key(k);
408  } else {
409  // malformed
410  return -6;
411  }
412 
413  p = _key_decode_u64(p, &oid->hobj.snap.val);
414  p = _key_decode_u64(p, &oid->generation);
415 
416  if (*p != ONODE_KEY_SUFFIX) {
417  return -7;
418  }
419  p++;
420  if (*p) {
421  // if we get something other than a null terminator here,
422  // something goes wrong.
423  return -8;
424  }
425 
426  return 0;
427 }
428 
429 template<typename S>
430 static int get_key_object(const S& key, ghobject_t *oid)
431 {
432  if (key.length() < ENCODED_KEY_PREFIX_LEN)
433  return -1;
434  if (key.length() == ENCODED_KEY_PREFIX_LEN)
435  return -2;
436  const char *p = key.c_str();
437  return _get_key_object(p, oid);
438 }
439 
440 template<typename S>
441 static void _get_object_key(const ghobject_t& oid, S *key)
442 {
443  size_t max_len = ENCODED_KEY_PREFIX_LEN +
444  (oid.hobj.nspace.length() * 3 + 1) +
445  (oid.hobj.get_key().length() * 3 + 1) +
446  1 + // for '<', '=', or '>'
447  (oid.hobj.oid.name.length() * 3 + 1) +
448  8 + 8 + 1;
449  key->reserve(max_len);
450 
451  _key_encode_prefix(oid, key);
452 
453  append_escaped(oid.hobj.nspace, key);
454 
455  if (oid.hobj.get_key().length()) {
456  // is a key... could be < = or >.
457  append_escaped(oid.hobj.get_key(), key);
458  // (ASCII chars < = and > sort in that order, yay)
459  int r = oid.hobj.get_key().compare(oid.hobj.oid.name);
460  if (r) {
461  key->append(r > 0 ? ">" : "<");
462  append_escaped(oid.hobj.oid.name, key);
463  } else {
464  // same as no key
465  key->append("=");
466  }
467  } else {
468  // no key
469  append_escaped(oid.hobj.oid.name, key);
470  key->append("=");
471  }
472 
473  _key_encode_u64(oid.hobj.snap, key);
474  _key_encode_u64(oid.generation, key);
475 
476  key->push_back(ONODE_KEY_SUFFIX);
477 }
478 
479 template<typename S>
480 static void get_object_key(CephContext *cct, const ghobject_t& oid, S *key)
481 {
482  key->clear();
483  _get_object_key(oid, key);
484 
485  // sanity check
486  if (true) {
487  ghobject_t t;
488  int r = get_key_object(*key, &t);
489  if (r || t != oid) {
490  derr << " r " << r << dendl;
491  derr << "key " << pretty_binary_string(*key) << dendl;
492  derr << "oid " << oid << dendl;
493  derr << " t " << t << dendl;
494  ceph_assert(r == 0 && t == oid);
495  }
496  }
497 }
498 
499 // extent shard keys are the onode key, plus a u32, plus 'x'. the trailing
500 // char lets us quickly test whether it is a shard key without decoding any
501 // of the prefix bytes.
502 template<typename S>
503 static void get_extent_shard_key(const S& onode_key, uint32_t offset,
504  string *key)
505 {
506  key->clear();
507  key->reserve(onode_key.length() + 4 + 1);
508  key->append(onode_key.c_str(), onode_key.size());
509  _key_encode_u32(offset, key);
510  key->push_back(EXTENT_SHARD_KEY_SUFFIX);
511 }
512 
513 static void rewrite_extent_shard_key(uint32_t offset, string *key)
514 {
515  ceph_assert(key->size() > sizeof(uint32_t) + 1);
516  ceph_assert(*key->rbegin() == EXTENT_SHARD_KEY_SUFFIX);
517  _key_encode_u32(offset, key->size() - sizeof(uint32_t) - 1, key);
518 }
519 
520 template<typename S>
521 static void generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(
522  const S& onode_key,
523  uint32_t offset,
524  string *key,
525  std::function<void(const string& final_key)> apply)
526 {
527  if (key->empty()) { // make full key
528  ceph_assert(!onode_key.empty());
529  get_extent_shard_key(onode_key, offset, key);
530  } else {
531  rewrite_extent_shard_key(offset, key);
532  }
533  apply(*key);
534 }
535 
536 int get_key_extent_shard(const string& key, string *onode_key, uint32_t *offset)
537 {
538  ceph_assert(key.size() > sizeof(uint32_t) + 1);
539  ceph_assert(*key.rbegin() == EXTENT_SHARD_KEY_SUFFIX);
540  int okey_len = key.size() - sizeof(uint32_t) - 1;
541  *onode_key = key.substr(0, okey_len);
542  const char *p = key.data() + okey_len;
543  _key_decode_u32(p, offset);
544  return 0;
545 }
546 
547 static bool is_extent_shard_key(const string& key)
548 {
549  return *key.rbegin() == EXTENT_SHARD_KEY_SUFFIX;
550 }
551 
552 static void get_deferred_key(uint64_t seq, string *out)
553 {
554  _key_encode_u64(seq, out);
555 }
556 
557 static void get_pool_stat_key(int64_t pool_id, string *key)
558 {
559  key->clear();
560  _key_encode_u64(pool_id, key);
561 }
562 
563 static int get_key_pool_stat(const string& key, uint64_t* pool_id)
564 {
565  const char *p = key.c_str();
566  if (key.length() < sizeof(uint64_t))
567  return -1;
568  _key_decode_u64(p, pool_id);
569  return 0;
570 }
571 
572 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
573 static void get_zone_offset_object_key(
574  uint32_t zone,
575  uint64_t offset,
576  ghobject_t oid,
577  std::string *key)
578 {
579  key->clear();
580  _key_encode_u32(zone, key);
581  _key_encode_u64(offset, key);
582  _get_object_key(oid, key);
583 }
584 
585 static int get_key_zone_offset_object(
586  const string& key,
587  uint32_t *zone,
588  uint64_t *offset,
589  ghobject_t *oid)
590 {
591  const char *p = key.c_str();
592  if (key.length() < sizeof(uint64_t) + sizeof(uint32_t) + ENCODED_KEY_PREFIX_LEN + 1)
593  return -1;
594  p = _key_decode_u32(p, zone);
595  p = _key_decode_u64(p, offset);
596  int r = _get_key_object(p, oid);
597  if (r < 0) {
598  return r;
599  }
600  return 0;
601 }
602 #endif
603 
604 template <int LogLevelV>
605 void _dump_extent_map(CephContext *cct, const BlueStore::ExtentMap &em)
606 {
607  uint64_t pos = 0;
608  for (auto& s : em.shards) {
609  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " shard " << *s.shard_info
610  << (s.loaded ? " (loaded)" : "")
611  << (s.dirty ? " (dirty)" : "")
612  << dendl;
613  }
614  for (auto& e : em.extent_map) {
615  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " " << e << dendl;
616  ceph_assert(e.logical_offset >= pos);
617  pos = e.logical_offset + e.length;
618  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = e.blob->get_blob();
619  if (blob.has_csum()) {
620  vector<uint64_t> v;
621  unsigned n = blob.get_csum_count();
622  for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; ++i)
623  v.push_back(blob.get_csum_item(i));
624  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " csum: " << std::hex << v << std::dec
625  << dendl;
626  }
627  std::lock_guard l(e.blob->shared_blob->get_cache()->lock);
628  for (auto& i : e.blob->get_bc().buffer_map) {
629  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << i.first
630  << "~" << i.second->length << std::dec
631  << " " << *i.second << dendl;
632  }
633  }
634 }
635 
636 template <int LogLevelV>
637 void _dump_onode(CephContext *cct, const BlueStore::Onode& o)
638 {
639  if (!cct->_conf->subsys.should_gather<ceph_subsys_bluestore, LogLevelV>())
640  return;
641  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " " << &o << " " << o.oid
642  << " nid " << o.onode.nid
643  << " size 0x" << std::hex << o.onode.size
644  << " (" << std::dec << o.onode.size << ")"
645  << " expected_object_size " << o.onode.expected_object_size
646  << " expected_write_size " << o.onode.expected_write_size
647  << " in " << o.onode.extent_map_shards.size() << " shards"
648  << ", " << o.extent_map.spanning_blob_map.size()
649  << " spanning blobs"
650  << dendl;
651  for (auto& [zone, offset] : o.onode.zone_offset_refs) {
652  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " zone ref 0x" << std::hex << zone
653  << " offset 0x" << offset << std::dec << dendl;
654  }
655  for (auto p = o.onode.attrs.begin();
656  p != o.onode.attrs.end();
657  ++p) {
658  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " attr " << p->first
659  << " len " << p->second.length() << dendl;
660  }
661  _dump_extent_map<LogLevelV>(cct, o.extent_map);
662 }
663 
664 template <int LogLevelV>
665 void _dump_transaction(CephContext *cct, ObjectStore::Transaction *t)
666 {
667  dout(LogLevelV) << __func__ << " transaction dump:\n";
668  JSONFormatter f(true);
669  f.open_object_section("transaction");
670  t->dump(&f);
671  f.close_section();
672  f.flush(*_dout);
673  *_dout << dendl;
674 }
675 
676 // Buffer
677 
678 ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const BlueStore::Buffer& b)
679 {
680  out << "buffer(" << &b << " space " << b.space << " 0x" << std::hex
681  << b.offset << "~" << b.length << std::dec
682  << " " << BlueStore::Buffer::get_state_name(b.state);
683  if (b.flags)
684  out << " " << BlueStore::Buffer::get_flag_name(b.flags);
685  return out << ")";
686 }
687 
688 namespace {
689 
690 /*
691  * Due to a bug in key string encoding (see a comment for append_escaped)
692  * the KeyValueDB iterator does not lexicographically sort the same
693  * way that ghobject_t does: objects with the same hash may have wrong order.
694  *
695  * This is the iterator wrapper that fixes the keys order.
696  */
697 
698 class CollectionListIterator {
699 public:
700  CollectionListIterator(const KeyValueDB::Iterator &it)
701  : m_it(it) {
702  }
703  virtual ~CollectionListIterator() {
704  }
705 
706  virtual bool valid() const = 0;
707  virtual const ghobject_t &oid() const = 0;
708  virtual void lower_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) = 0;
709  virtual void upper_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) = 0;
710  virtual void next() = 0;
711 
712  virtual int cmp(const ghobject_t &oid) const = 0;
713 
714  bool is_ge(const ghobject_t &oid) const {
715  return cmp(oid) >= 0;
716  }
717 
718  bool is_lt(const ghobject_t &oid) const {
719  return cmp(oid) < 0;
720  }
721 
722 protected:
723  KeyValueDB::Iterator m_it;
724 };
725 
726 class SimpleCollectionListIterator : public CollectionListIterator {
727 public:
728  SimpleCollectionListIterator(CephContext *cct, const KeyValueDB::Iterator &it)
729  : CollectionListIterator(it), m_cct(cct) {
730  }
731 
732  bool valid() const override {
733  return m_it->valid();
734  }
735 
736  const ghobject_t &oid() const override {
737  ceph_assert(valid());
738 
739  return m_oid;
740  }
741 
742  void lower_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) override {
743  string key;
744  get_object_key(m_cct, oid, &key);
745 
746  m_it->lower_bound(key);
747  get_oid();
748  }
749 
750  void upper_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) override {
751  string key;
752  get_object_key(m_cct, oid, &key);
753 
754  m_it->upper_bound(key);
755  get_oid();
756  }
757 
758  void next() override {
759  ceph_assert(valid());
760 
761  m_it->next();
762  get_oid();
763  }
764 
765  int cmp(const ghobject_t &oid) const override {
766  ceph_assert(valid());
767 
768  string key;
769  get_object_key(m_cct, oid, &key);
770 
771  return m_it->key().compare(key);
772  }
773 
774 private:
775  CephContext *m_cct;
776  ghobject_t m_oid;
777 
778  void get_oid() {
779  m_oid = ghobject_t();
780  while (m_it->valid() && is_extent_shard_key(m_it->key())) {
781  m_it->next();
782  }
783  if (!valid()) {
784  return;
785  }
786 
787  int r = get_key_object(m_it->key(), &m_oid);
788  ceph_assert(r == 0);
789  }
790 };
791 
792 class SortedCollectionListIterator : public CollectionListIterator {
793 public:
794  SortedCollectionListIterator(const KeyValueDB::Iterator &it)
795  : CollectionListIterator(it), m_chunk_iter(m_chunk.end()) {
796  }
797 
798  bool valid() const override {
799  return m_chunk_iter != m_chunk.end();
800  }
801 
802  const ghobject_t &oid() const override {
803  ceph_assert(valid());
804 
805  return m_chunk_iter->first;
806  }
807 
808  void lower_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) override {
809  std::string key;
810  _key_encode_prefix(oid, &key);
811 
812  m_it->lower_bound(key);
813  m_chunk_iter = m_chunk.end();
814  if (!get_next_chunk()) {
815  return;
816  }
817 
818  if (this->oid().shard_id != oid.shard_id ||
819  this->oid().hobj.pool != oid.hobj.pool ||
820  this->oid().hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32() != oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32()) {
821  return;
822  }
823 
824  m_chunk_iter = m_chunk.lower_bound(oid);
825  if (m_chunk_iter == m_chunk.end()) {
826  get_next_chunk();
827  }
828  }
829 
830  void upper_bound(const ghobject_t &oid) override {
831  lower_bound(oid);
832 
833  if (valid() && this->oid() == oid) {
834  next();
835  }
836  }
837 
838  void next() override {
839  ceph_assert(valid());
840 
841  m_chunk_iter++;
842  if (m_chunk_iter == m_chunk.end()) {
843  get_next_chunk();
844  }
845  }
846 
847  int cmp(const ghobject_t &oid) const override {
848  ceph_assert(valid());
849 
850  if (this->oid() < oid) {
851  return -1;
852  }
853  if (this->oid() > oid) {
854  return 1;
855  }
856  return 0;
857  }
858 
859 private:
860  std::map<ghobject_t, std::string> m_chunk;
861  std::map<ghobject_t, std::string>::iterator m_chunk_iter;
862 
863  bool get_next_chunk() {
864  while (m_it->valid() && is_extent_shard_key(m_it->key())) {
865  m_it->next();
866  }
867 
868  if (!m_it->valid()) {
869  return false;
870  }
871 
872  ghobject_t oid;
873  int r = get_key_object(m_it->key(), &oid);
874  ceph_assert(r == 0);
875 
876  m_chunk.clear();
877  while (true) {
878  m_chunk.insert({oid, m_it->key()});
879 
880  do {
881  m_it->next();
882  } while (m_it->valid() && is_extent_shard_key(m_it->key()));
883 
884  if (!m_it->valid()) {
885  break;
886  }
887 
888  ghobject_t next;
889  r = get_key_object(m_it->key(), &next);
890  ceph_assert(r == 0);
891  if (next.shard_id != oid.shard_id ||
892  next.hobj.pool != oid.hobj.pool ||
893  next.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32() != oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32()) {
894  break;
895  }
896  oid = next;
897  }
898 
899  m_chunk_iter = m_chunk.begin();
900  return true;
901  }
902 };
903 
904 } // anonymous namespace
905 
906 // Garbage Collector
907 
908 void BlueStore::GarbageCollector::process_protrusive_extents(
909  const BlueStore::ExtentMap& extent_map,
910  uint64_t start_offset,
911  uint64_t end_offset,
912  uint64_t start_touch_offset,
913  uint64_t end_touch_offset,
914  uint64_t min_alloc_size)
915 {
916  ceph_assert(start_offset <= start_touch_offset && end_offset>= end_touch_offset);
917 
918  uint64_t lookup_start_offset = p2align(start_offset, min_alloc_size);
919  uint64_t lookup_end_offset = round_up_to(end_offset, min_alloc_size);
920 
921  dout(30) << __func__ << " (hex): [" << std::hex
922  << lookup_start_offset << ", " << lookup_end_offset
923  << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
924 
925  for (auto it = extent_map.seek_lextent(lookup_start_offset);
926  it != extent_map.extent_map.end() &&
927  it->logical_offset < lookup_end_offset;
928  ++it) {
929  uint64_t alloc_unit_start = it->logical_offset / min_alloc_size;
930  uint64_t alloc_unit_end = (it->logical_end() - 1) / min_alloc_size;
931 
932  dout(30) << __func__ << " " << *it
933  << "alloc_units: " << alloc_unit_start << ".." << alloc_unit_end
934  << dendl;
935 
936  Blob* b = it->blob.get();
937 
938  if (it->logical_offset >=start_touch_offset &&
939  it->logical_end() <= end_touch_offset) {
940  // Process extents within the range affected by
941  // the current write request.
942  // Need to take into account if existing extents
943  // can be merged with them (uncompressed case)
944  if (!b->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
945  if (blob_info_counted && used_alloc_unit == alloc_unit_start) {
946  --blob_info_counted->expected_allocations; // don't need to allocate
947  // new AU for compressed
948  // data since another
949  // collocated uncompressed
950  // blob already exists
951  dout(30) << __func__ << " --expected:"
952  << alloc_unit_start << dendl;
953  }
954  used_alloc_unit = alloc_unit_end;
955  blob_info_counted = nullptr;
956  }
957  } else if (b->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
958 
959  // additionally we take compressed blobs that were not impacted
960  // by the write into account too
961  BlobInfo& bi =
962  affected_blobs.emplace(
963  b, BlobInfo(b->get_referenced_bytes())).first->second;
964 
965  int adjust =
966  (used_alloc_unit && used_alloc_unit == alloc_unit_start) ? 0 : 1;
967  bi.expected_allocations += alloc_unit_end - alloc_unit_start + adjust;
968  dout(30) << __func__ << " expected_allocations="
969  << bi.expected_allocations << " end_au:"
970  << alloc_unit_end << dendl;
971 
972  blob_info_counted = &bi;
973  used_alloc_unit = alloc_unit_end;
974 
975  ceph_assert(it->length <= bi.referenced_bytes);
976  bi.referenced_bytes -= it->length;
977  dout(30) << __func__ << " affected_blob:" << *b
978  << " unref 0x" << std::hex << it->length
979  << " referenced = 0x" << bi.referenced_bytes
980  << std::dec << dendl;
981  // NOTE: we can't move specific blob to resulting GC list here
982  // when reference counter == 0 since subsequent extents might
983  // decrement its expected_allocation.
984  // Hence need to enumerate all the extents first.
985  if (!bi.collect_candidate) {
986  bi.first_lextent = it;
987  bi.collect_candidate = true;
988  }
989  bi.last_lextent = it;
990  } else {
991  if (blob_info_counted && used_alloc_unit == alloc_unit_start) {
992  // don't need to allocate new AU for compressed data since another
993  // collocated uncompressed blob already exists
994  --blob_info_counted->expected_allocations;
995  dout(30) << __func__ << " --expected_allocations:"
996  << alloc_unit_start << dendl;
997  }
998  used_alloc_unit = alloc_unit_end;
999  blob_info_counted = nullptr;
1000  }
1001  }
1002 
1003  for (auto b_it = affected_blobs.begin();
1004  b_it != affected_blobs.end();
1005  ++b_it) {
1006  Blob* b = b_it->first;
1007  BlobInfo& bi = b_it->second;
1008  if (bi.referenced_bytes == 0) {
1009  uint64_t len_on_disk = b_it->first->get_blob().get_ondisk_length();
1010  int64_t blob_expected_for_release =
1011  round_up_to(len_on_disk, min_alloc_size) / min_alloc_size;
1012 
1013  dout(30) << __func__ << " " << *(b_it->first)
1014  << " expected4release=" << blob_expected_for_release
1015  << " expected_allocations=" << bi.expected_allocations
1016  << dendl;
1017  int64_t benefit = blob_expected_for_release - bi.expected_allocations;
1018  if (benefit >= g_conf()->bluestore_gc_enable_blob_threshold) {
1019  if (bi.collect_candidate) {
1020  auto it = bi.first_lextent;
1021  bool bExit = false;
1022  do {
1023  if (it->blob.get() == b) {
1024  extents_to_collect.insert(it->logical_offset, it->length);
1025  }
1026  bExit = it == bi.last_lextent;
1027  ++it;
1028  } while (!bExit);
1029  }
1030  expected_for_release += blob_expected_for_release;
1031  expected_allocations += bi.expected_allocations;
1032  }
1033  }
1034  }
1035 }
1036 
1037 int64_t BlueStore::GarbageCollector::estimate(
1038  uint64_t start_offset,
1039  uint64_t length,
1040  const BlueStore::ExtentMap& extent_map,
1041  const BlueStore::old_extent_map_t& old_extents,
1042  uint64_t min_alloc_size)
1043 {
1044 
1045  affected_blobs.clear();
1046  extents_to_collect.clear();
1047  used_alloc_unit = boost::optional<uint64_t >();
1048  blob_info_counted = nullptr;
1049 
1050  uint64_t gc_start_offset = start_offset;
1051  uint64_t gc_end_offset = start_offset + length;
1052 
1053  uint64_t end_offset = start_offset + length;
1054 
1055  for (auto it = old_extents.begin(); it != old_extents.end(); ++it) {
1056  Blob* b = it->e.blob.get();
1057  if (b->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
1058 
1059  // update gc_start_offset/gc_end_offset if needed
1060  gc_start_offset = min(gc_start_offset, (uint64_t)it->e.blob_start());
1061  gc_end_offset = std::max(gc_end_offset, (uint64_t)it->e.blob_end());
1062 
1063  auto o = it->e.logical_offset;
1064  auto l = it->e.length;
1065 
1066  uint64_t ref_bytes = b->get_referenced_bytes();
1067  // micro optimization to bypass blobs that have no more references
1068  if (ref_bytes != 0) {
1069  dout(30) << __func__ << " affected_blob:" << *b
1070  << " unref 0x" << std::hex << o << "~" << l
1071  << std::dec << dendl;
1072  affected_blobs.emplace(b, BlobInfo(ref_bytes));
1073  }
1074  }
1075  }
1076  dout(30) << __func__ << " gc range(hex): [" << std::hex
1077  << gc_start_offset << ", " << gc_end_offset
1078  << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
1079 
1080  // enumerate preceeding extents to check if they reference affected blobs
1081  if (gc_start_offset < start_offset || gc_end_offset > end_offset) {
1082  process_protrusive_extents(extent_map,
1083  gc_start_offset,
1084  gc_end_offset,
1085  start_offset,
1086  end_offset,
1087  min_alloc_size);
1088  }
1089  return expected_for_release - expected_allocations;
1090 }
1091 
1092 // LruOnodeCacheShard
1093 struct LruOnodeCacheShard : public BlueStore::OnodeCacheShard {
1094  typedef boost::intrusive::list<
1095  BlueStore::Onode,
1096  boost::intrusive::member_hook<
1097  BlueStore::Onode,
1098  boost::intrusive::list_member_hook<>,
1099  &BlueStore::Onode::lru_item> > list_t;
1100 
1101  list_t lru;
1102 
1103  explicit LruOnodeCacheShard(CephContext *cct) : BlueStore::OnodeCacheShard(cct) {}
1104 
1105  void _add(BlueStore::Onode* o, int level) override
1106  {
1107  o->set_cached();
1108  if (o->pin_nref == 1) {
1109  (level > 0) ? lru.push_front(*o) : lru.push_back(*o);
1110  o->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1111  *(o->cache_age_bin) += 1;
1112  }
1113  ++num; // we count both pinned and unpinned entries
1114  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << o->oid << " added, num="
1115  << num << dendl;
1116  }
1117  void _rm(BlueStore::Onode* o) override
1118  {
1119  o->clear_cached();
1120  if (o->lru_item.is_linked()) {
1121  *(o->cache_age_bin) -= 1;
1122  lru.erase(lru.iterator_to(*o));
1123  }
1124  ceph_assert(num);
1125  --num;
1126  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << " " << o->oid << " removed, num=" << num << dendl;
1127  }
1128 
1129  void maybe_unpin(BlueStore::Onode* o) override
1130  {
1131  OnodeCacheShard* ocs = this;
1132  ocs->lock.lock();
1133  // It is possible that during waiting split_cache moved us to different OnodeCacheShard.
1134  while (ocs != o->c->get_onode_cache()) {
1135  ocs->lock.unlock();
1136  ocs = o->c->get_onode_cache();
1137  ocs->lock.lock();
1138  }
1139  if (o->is_cached() && o->pin_nref == 1) {
1140  if(!o->lru_item.is_linked()) {
1141  if (o->exists) {
1142  lru.push_front(*o);
1143  o->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1144  *(o->cache_age_bin) += 1;
1145  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << o->oid << " unpinned"
1146  << dendl;
1147  } else {
1148  ceph_assert(num);
1149  --num;
1150  o->clear_cached();
1151  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << o->oid << " removed"
1152  << dendl;
1153  // remove will also decrement nref
1154  o->c->onode_space._remove(o->oid);
1155  }
1156  } else if (o->exists) {
1157  // move onode within LRU
1158  lru.erase(lru.iterator_to(*o));
1159  lru.push_front(*o);
1160  if (o->cache_age_bin != age_bins.front()) {
1161  *(o->cache_age_bin) -= 1;
1162  o->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1163  *(o->cache_age_bin) += 1;
1164  }
1165  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << o->oid << " touched"
1166  << dendl;
1167  }
1168  }
1169  ocs->lock.unlock();
1170  }
1171 
1172  void _trim_to(uint64_t new_size) override
1173  {
1174  if (new_size >= lru.size()) {
1175  return; // don't even try
1176  }
1177  uint64_t n = num - new_size; // note: we might get empty LRU
1178  // before n == 0 due to pinned
1179  // entries. And hence being unable
1180  // to reach new_size target.
1181  while (n-- > 0 && lru.size() > 0) {
1182  BlueStore::Onode *o = &lru.back();
1183  lru.pop_back();
1184 
1185  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm " << o->oid << " "
1186  << o->nref << " " << o->cached << dendl;
1187 
1188  *(o->cache_age_bin) -= 1;
1189  if (o->pin_nref > 1) {
1190  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this << " " << " " << " " << o->oid << dendl;
1191  } else {
1192  ceph_assert(num);
1193  --num;
1194  o->clear_cached();
1195  o->c->onode_space._remove(o->oid);
1196  }
1197  }
1198  }
1199  void _move_pinned(OnodeCacheShard *to, BlueStore::Onode *o) override
1200  {
1201  if (to == this) {
1202  return;
1203  }
1204  _rm(o);
1205  ceph_assert(o->nref > 1);
1206  to->_add(o, 0);
1207  }
1208  void add_stats(uint64_t *onodes, uint64_t *pinned_onodes) override
1209  {
1210  std::lock_guard l(lock);
1211  *onodes += num;
1212  *pinned_onodes += num - lru.size();
1213  }
1214 #ifdef DEBUG_CACHE
1215  void _audit(const char *when) override
1216  {
1217  }
1218 #endif
1219 };
1220 
1221 // OnodeCacheShard
1222 BlueStore::OnodeCacheShard *BlueStore::OnodeCacheShard::create(
1223  CephContext* cct,
1224  string type,
1225  PerfCounters *logger)
1226 {
1227  BlueStore::OnodeCacheShard *c = nullptr;
1228  // Currently we only implement an LRU cache for onodes
1229  c = new LruOnodeCacheShard(cct);
1230  c->logger = logger;
1231  return c;
1232 }
1233 
1234 // LruBufferCacheShard
1235 struct LruBufferCacheShard : public BlueStore::BufferCacheShard {
1236  typedef boost::intrusive::list<
1237  BlueStore::Buffer,
1238  boost::intrusive::member_hook<
1239  BlueStore::Buffer,
1240  boost::intrusive::list_member_hook<>,
1241  &BlueStore::Buffer::lru_item> > list_t;
1242  list_t lru;
1243 
1244  explicit LruBufferCacheShard(CephContext *cct) : BlueStore::BufferCacheShard(cct) {}
1245 
1246  void _add(BlueStore::Buffer *b, int level, BlueStore::Buffer *near) override {
1247  if (near) {
1248  auto q = lru.iterator_to(*near);
1249  lru.insert(q, *b);
1250  } else if (level > 0) {
1251  lru.push_front(*b);
1252  } else {
1253  lru.push_back(*b);
1254  }
1255  buffer_bytes += b->length;
1256  b->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1257  *(b->cache_age_bin) += b->length;
1258  num = lru.size();
1259  }
1260  void _rm(BlueStore::Buffer *b) override {
1261  ceph_assert(buffer_bytes >= b->length);
1262  buffer_bytes -= b->length;
1263  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) >= b->length);
1264  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1265  auto q = lru.iterator_to(*b);
1266  lru.erase(q);
1267  num = lru.size();
1268  }
1269  void _move(BlueStore::BufferCacheShard *src, BlueStore::Buffer *b) override {
1270  src->_rm(b);
1271  _add(b, 0, nullptr);
1272  }
1273  void _adjust_size(BlueStore::Buffer *b, int64_t delta) override {
1274  ceph_assert((int64_t)buffer_bytes + delta >= 0);
1275  buffer_bytes += delta;
1276  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) + delta >= 0);
1277  *(b->cache_age_bin) += delta;
1278  }
1279  void _touch(BlueStore::Buffer *b) override {
1280  auto p = lru.iterator_to(*b);
1281  lru.erase(p);
1282  lru.push_front(*b);
1283  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1284  b->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1285  *(b->cache_age_bin) += b->length;
1286  num = lru.size();
1287  _audit("_touch_buffer end");
1288  }
1289 
1290  void _trim_to(uint64_t max) override
1291  {
1292  while (buffer_bytes > max) {
1293  auto i = lru.rbegin();
1294  if (i == lru.rend()) {
1295  // stop if lru is now empty
1296  break;
1297  }
1298 
1299  BlueStore::Buffer *b = &*i;
1300  ceph_assert(b->is_clean());
1301  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm " << *b << dendl;
1302  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) >= b->length);
1303  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1304  b->space->_rm_buffer(this, b);
1305  }
1306  num = lru.size();
1307  }
1308 
1309  void add_stats(uint64_t *extents,
1310  uint64_t *blobs,
1311  uint64_t *buffers,
1312  uint64_t *bytes) override {
1313  *extents += num_extents;
1314  *blobs += num_blobs;
1315  *buffers += num;
1316  *bytes += buffer_bytes;
1317  }
1318 #ifdef DEBUG_CACHE
1319  void _audit(const char *when) override
1320  {
1321  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << when << " start" << dendl;
1322  uint64_t s = 0;
1323  for (auto i = lru.begin(); i != lru.end(); ++i) {
1324  s += i->length;
1325  }
1326  if (s != buffer_bytes) {
1327  derr << __func__ << " buffer_size " << buffer_bytes << " actual " << s
1328  << dendl;
1329  for (auto i = lru.begin(); i != lru.end(); ++i) {
1330  derr << __func__ << " " << *i << dendl;
1331  }
1332  ceph_assert(s == buffer_bytes);
1333  }
1334  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << when << " buffer_bytes " << buffer_bytes
1335  << " ok" << dendl;
1336  }
1337 #endif
1338 };
1339 
1340 // TwoQBufferCacheShard
1341 
1342 struct TwoQBufferCacheShard : public BlueStore::BufferCacheShard {
1343  typedef boost::intrusive::list<
1344  BlueStore::Buffer,
1345  boost::intrusive::member_hook<
1346  BlueStore::Buffer,
1347  boost::intrusive::list_member_hook<>,
1348  &BlueStore::Buffer::lru_item> > list_t;
1349  list_t hot;
1350  list_t warm_in;
1351  list_t warm_out;
1352 
1353  enum {
1354  BUFFER_NEW = 0,
1355  BUFFER_WARM_IN,
1356  BUFFER_WARM_OUT,
1357  BUFFER_HOT,
1358  BUFFER_TYPE_MAX
1359  };
1360 
1361  uint64_t list_bytes[BUFFER_TYPE_MAX] = {0};
1362 
1363 public:
1364  explicit TwoQBufferCacheShard(CephContext *cct) : BufferCacheShard(cct) {}
1365 
1366  void _add(BlueStore::Buffer *b, int level, BlueStore::Buffer *near) override
1367  {
1368  dout(20) << __func__ << " level " << level << " near " << near
1369  << " on " << *b
1370  << " which has cache_private " << b->cache_private << dendl;
1371  if (near) {
1372  b->cache_private = near->cache_private;
1373  switch (b->cache_private) {
1374  case BUFFER_WARM_IN:
1375  warm_in.insert(warm_in.iterator_to(*near), *b);
1376  break;
1377  case BUFFER_WARM_OUT:
1378  ceph_assert(b->is_empty());
1379  warm_out.insert(warm_out.iterator_to(*near), *b);
1380  break;
1381  case BUFFER_HOT:
1382  hot.insert(hot.iterator_to(*near), *b);
1383  break;
1384  default:
1385  ceph_abort_msg("bad cache_private");
1386  }
1387  } else if (b->cache_private == BUFFER_NEW) {
1388  b->cache_private = BUFFER_WARM_IN;
1389  if (level > 0) {
1390  warm_in.push_front(*b);
1391  } else {
1392  // take caller hint to start at the back of the warm queue
1393  warm_in.push_back(*b);
1394  }
1395  } else {
1396  // we got a hint from discard
1397  switch (b->cache_private) {
1398  case BUFFER_WARM_IN:
1399  // stay in warm_in. move to front, even though 2Q doesn't actually
1400  // do this.
1401  dout(20) << __func__ << " move to front of warm " << *b << dendl;
1402  warm_in.push_front(*b);
1403  break;
1404  case BUFFER_WARM_OUT:
1405  b->cache_private = BUFFER_HOT;
1406  // move to hot. fall-thru
1407  case BUFFER_HOT:
1408  dout(20) << __func__ << " move to front of hot " << *b << dendl;
1409  hot.push_front(*b);
1410  break;
1411  default:
1412  ceph_abort_msg("bad cache_private");
1413  }
1414  }
1415  b->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1416  if (!b->is_empty()) {
1417  buffer_bytes += b->length;
1418  list_bytes[b->cache_private] += b->length;
1419  *(b->cache_age_bin) += b->length;
1420  }
1421  num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1422  }
1423 
1424  void _rm(BlueStore::Buffer *b) override
1425  {
1426  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << *b << dendl;
1427  if (!b->is_empty()) {
1428  ceph_assert(buffer_bytes >= b->length);
1429  buffer_bytes -= b->length;
1430  ceph_assert(list_bytes[b->cache_private] >= b->length);
1431  list_bytes[b->cache_private] -= b->length;
1432  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) >= b->length);
1433  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1434  }
1435  switch (b->cache_private) {
1436  case BUFFER_WARM_IN:
1437  warm_in.erase(warm_in.iterator_to(*b));
1438  break;
1439  case BUFFER_WARM_OUT:
1440  warm_out.erase(warm_out.iterator_to(*b));
1441  break;
1442  case BUFFER_HOT:
1443  hot.erase(hot.iterator_to(*b));
1444  break;
1445  default:
1446  ceph_abort_msg("bad cache_private");
1447  }
1448  num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1449  }
1450 
1451  void _move(BlueStore::BufferCacheShard *srcc, BlueStore::Buffer *b) override
1452  {
1453  TwoQBufferCacheShard *src = static_cast<TwoQBufferCacheShard*>(srcc);
1454  src->_rm(b);
1455 
1456  // preserve which list we're on (even if we can't preserve the order!)
1457  switch (b->cache_private) {
1458  case BUFFER_WARM_IN:
1459  ceph_assert(!b->is_empty());
1460  warm_in.push_back(*b);
1461  break;
1462  case BUFFER_WARM_OUT:
1463  ceph_assert(b->is_empty());
1464  warm_out.push_back(*b);
1465  break;
1466  case BUFFER_HOT:
1467  ceph_assert(!b->is_empty());
1468  hot.push_back(*b);
1469  break;
1470  default:
1471  ceph_abort_msg("bad cache_private");
1472  }
1473  if (!b->is_empty()) {
1474  buffer_bytes += b->length;
1475  list_bytes[b->cache_private] += b->length;
1476  *(b->cache_age_bin) += b->length;
1477  }
1478  num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1479  }
1480 
1481  void _adjust_size(BlueStore::Buffer *b, int64_t delta) override
1482  {
1483  dout(20) << __func__ << " delta " << delta << " on " << *b << dendl;
1484  if (!b->is_empty()) {
1485  ceph_assert((int64_t)buffer_bytes + delta >= 0);
1486  buffer_bytes += delta;
1487  ceph_assert((int64_t)list_bytes[b->cache_private] + delta >= 0);
1488  list_bytes[b->cache_private] += delta;
1489  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) + delta >= 0);
1490  *(b->cache_age_bin) += delta;
1491  }
1492  }
1493 
1494  void _touch(BlueStore::Buffer *b) override {
1495  switch (b->cache_private) {
1496  case BUFFER_WARM_IN:
1497  // do nothing (somewhat counter-intuitively!)
1498  break;
1499  case BUFFER_WARM_OUT:
1500  // move from warm_out to hot LRU
1501  ceph_abort_msg("this happens via discard hint");
1502  break;
1503  case BUFFER_HOT:
1504  // move to front of hot LRU
1505  hot.erase(hot.iterator_to(*b));
1506  hot.push_front(*b);
1507  break;
1508  }
1509  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1510  b->cache_age_bin = age_bins.front();
1511  *(b->cache_age_bin) += b->length;
1512  num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1513  _audit("_touch_buffer end");
1514  }
1515 
1516  void _trim_to(uint64_t max) override
1517  {
1518  if (buffer_bytes > max) {
1519  uint64_t kin = max * cct->_conf->bluestore_2q_cache_kin_ratio;
1520  uint64_t khot = max - kin;
1521 
1522  // pre-calculate kout based on average buffer size too,
1523  // which is typical(the warm_in and hot lists may change later)
1524  uint64_t kout = 0;
1525  uint64_t buffer_num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1526  if (buffer_num) {
1527  uint64_t avg_size = buffer_bytes / buffer_num;
1528  ceph_assert(avg_size);
1529  uint64_t calculated_num = max / avg_size;
1530  kout = calculated_num * cct->_conf->bluestore_2q_cache_kout_ratio;
1531  }
1532 
1533  if (list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT] < khot) {
1534  // hot is small, give slack to warm_in
1535  kin += khot - list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT];
1536  } else if (list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN] < kin) {
1537  // warm_in is small, give slack to hot
1538  khot += kin - list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN];
1539  }
1540 
1541  // adjust warm_in list
1542  int64_t to_evict_bytes = list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN] - kin;
1543  uint64_t evicted = 0;
1544 
1545  while (to_evict_bytes > 0) {
1546  auto p = warm_in.rbegin();
1547  if (p == warm_in.rend()) {
1548  // stop if warm_in list is now empty
1549  break;
1550  }
1551 
1552  BlueStore::Buffer *b = &*p;
1553  ceph_assert(b->is_clean());
1554  dout(20) << __func__ << " buffer_warm_in -> out " << *b << dendl;
1555  ceph_assert(buffer_bytes >= b->length);
1556  buffer_bytes -= b->length;
1557  ceph_assert(list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN] >= b->length);
1558  list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN] -= b->length;
1559  assert(*(b->cache_age_bin) >= b->length);
1560  *(b->cache_age_bin) -= b->length;
1561  to_evict_bytes -= b->length;
1562  evicted += b->length;
1563  b->state = BlueStore::Buffer::STATE_EMPTY;
1564  b->data.clear();
1565  warm_in.erase(warm_in.iterator_to(*b));
1566  warm_out.push_front(*b);
1567  b->cache_private = BUFFER_WARM_OUT;
1568  }
1569 
1570  if (evicted > 0) {
1571  dout(20) << __func__ << " evicted " << byte_u_t(evicted)
1572  << " from warm_in list, done evicting warm_in buffers"
1573  << dendl;
1574  }
1575 
1576  // adjust hot list
1577  to_evict_bytes = list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT] - khot;
1578  evicted = 0;
1579 
1580  while (to_evict_bytes > 0) {
1581  auto p = hot.rbegin();
1582  if (p == hot.rend()) {
1583  // stop if hot list is now empty
1584  break;
1585  }
1586 
1587  BlueStore::Buffer *b = &*p;
1588  dout(20) << __func__ << " buffer_hot rm " << *b << dendl;
1589  ceph_assert(b->is_clean());
1590  // adjust evict size before buffer goes invalid
1591  to_evict_bytes -= b->length;
1592  evicted += b->length;
1593  b->space->_rm_buffer(this, b);
1594  }
1595 
1596  if (evicted > 0) {
1597  dout(20) << __func__ << " evicted " << byte_u_t(evicted)
1598  << " from hot list, done evicting hot buffers"
1599  << dendl;
1600  }
1601 
1602  // adjust warm out list too, if necessary
1603  int64_t n = warm_out.size() - kout;
1604  while (n-- > 0) {
1605  BlueStore::Buffer *b = &*warm_out.rbegin();
1606  ceph_assert(b->is_empty());
1607  dout(20) << __func__ << " buffer_warm_out rm " << *b << dendl;
1608  b->space->_rm_buffer(this, b);
1609  }
1610  }
1611  num = hot.size() + warm_in.size();
1612  }
1613 
1614  void add_stats(uint64_t *extents,
1615  uint64_t *blobs,
1616  uint64_t *buffers,
1617  uint64_t *bytes) override {
1618  *extents += num_extents;
1619  *blobs += num_blobs;
1620  *buffers += num;
1621  *bytes += buffer_bytes;
1622  }
1623 
1624 #ifdef DEBUG_CACHE
1625  void _audit(const char *when) override
1626  {
1627  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << when << " start" << dendl;
1628  uint64_t s = 0;
1629  for (auto i = hot.begin(); i != hot.end(); ++i) {
1630  ceph_assert(i->cache_private == BUFFER_HOT);
1631  s += i->length;
1632  }
1633 
1634  uint64_t hot_bytes = s;
1635  if (hot_bytes != list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT]) {
1636  derr << __func__ << " hot_list_bytes "
1637  << list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT]
1638  << " != actual " << hot_bytes
1639  << dendl;
1640  ceph_assert(hot_bytes == list_bytes[BUFFER_HOT]);
1641  }
1642 
1643  for (auto i = warm_in.begin(); i != warm_in.end(); ++i) {
1644  ceph_assert(i->cache_private == BUFFER_WARM_IN);
1645  s += i->length;
1646  }
1647 
1648  uint64_t warm_in_bytes = s - hot_bytes;
1649  if (warm_in_bytes != list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN]) {
1650  derr << __func__ << " warm_in_list_bytes "
1651  << list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN]
1652  << " != actual " << warm_in_bytes
1653  << dendl;
1654  ceph_assert(warm_in_bytes == list_bytes[BUFFER_WARM_IN]);
1655  }
1656 
1657  if (s != buffer_bytes) {
1658  derr << __func__ << " buffer_bytes " << buffer_bytes << " actual " << s
1659  << dendl;
1660  ceph_assert(s == buffer_bytes);
1661  }
1662 
1663  for (auto i = warm_out.begin(); i != warm_out.end(); ++i) {
1664  ceph_assert(i->cache_private == BUFFER_WARM_OUT);
1665  ceph_assert(i->is_empty());
1666  }
1667  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << when << " buffer_bytes " << buffer_bytes
1668  << " ok" << dendl;
1669  }
1670 #endif
1671 };
1672 
1673 // BuferCacheShard
1674 
1675 BlueStore::BufferCacheShard *BlueStore::BufferCacheShard::create(
1676  CephContext* cct,
1677  string type,
1678  PerfCounters *logger)
1679 {
1680  BufferCacheShard *c = nullptr;
1681  if (type == "lru")
1682  c = new LruBufferCacheShard(cct);
1683  else if (type == "2q")
1684  c = new TwoQBufferCacheShard(cct);
1685  else
1686  ceph_abort_msg("unrecognized cache type");
1687  c->logger = logger;
1688  return c;
1689 }
1690 
1691 // BufferSpace
1692 
1693 #undef dout_prefix
1694 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.BufferSpace(" << this << " in " << cache << ") "
1695 
1696 void BlueStore::BufferSpace::_clear(BufferCacheShard* cache)
1697 {
1698  // note: we already hold cache->lock
1699  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << dendl;
1700  while (!buffer_map.empty()) {
1701  _rm_buffer(cache, buffer_map.begin());
1702  }
1703 }
1704 
1705 int BlueStore::BufferSpace::_discard(BufferCacheShard* cache, uint32_t offset, uint32_t length)
1706 {
1707  // note: we already hold cache->lock
1708  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << std::hex << " 0x" << offset << "~" << length
1709  << std::dec << dendl;
1710  int cache_private = 0;
1711  cache->_audit("discard start");
1712  auto i = _data_lower_bound(offset);
1713  uint32_t end = offset + length;
1714  while (i != buffer_map.end()) {
1715  Buffer *b = i->second.get();
1716  if (b->offset >= end) {
1717  break;
1718  }
1719  if (b->cache_private > cache_private) {
1720  cache_private = b->cache_private;
1721  }
1722  if (b->offset < offset) {
1723  int64_t front = offset - b->offset;
1724  if (b->end() > end) {
1725  // drop middle (split)
1726  uint32_t tail = b->end() - end;
1727  if (b->data.length()) {
1728  bufferlist bl;
1729  bl.substr_of(b->data, b->length - tail, tail);
1730  Buffer *nb = new Buffer(this, b->state, b->seq, end, bl, b->flags);
1731  nb->maybe_rebuild();
1732  _add_buffer(cache, nb, 0, b);
1733  } else {
1734  _add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(this, b->state, b->seq, end, tail,
1735  b->flags),
1736  0, b);
1737  }
1738  if (!b->is_writing()) {
1739  cache->_adjust_size(b, front - (int64_t)b->length);
1740  }
1741  b->truncate(front);
1742  b->maybe_rebuild();
1743  cache->_audit("discard end 1");
1744  break;
1745  } else {
1746  // drop tail
1747  if (!b->is_writing()) {
1748  cache->_adjust_size(b, front - (int64_t)b->length);
1749  }
1750  b->truncate(front);
1751  b->maybe_rebuild();
1752  ++i;
1753  continue;
1754  }
1755  }
1756  if (b->end() <= end) {
1757  // drop entire buffer
1758  _rm_buffer(cache, i++);
1759  continue;
1760  }
1761  // drop front
1762  uint32_t keep = b->end() - end;
1763  if (b->data.length()) {
1764  bufferlist bl;
1765  bl.substr_of(b->data, b->length - keep, keep);
1766  Buffer *nb = new Buffer(this, b->state, b->seq, end, bl, b->flags);
1767  nb->maybe_rebuild();
1768  _add_buffer(cache, nb, 0, b);
1769  } else {
1770  _add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(this, b->state, b->seq, end, keep,
1771  b->flags),
1772  0, b);
1773  }
1774  _rm_buffer(cache, i);
1775  cache->_audit("discard end 2");
1776  break;
1777  }
1778  return cache_private;
1779 }
1780 
1781 void BlueStore::BufferSpace::read(
1782  BufferCacheShard* cache,
1783  uint32_t offset,
1784  uint32_t length,
1785  BlueStore::ready_regions_t& res,
1786  interval_set<uint32_t>& res_intervals,
1787  int flags)
1788 {
1789  res.clear();
1790  res_intervals.clear();
1791  uint32_t want_bytes = length;
1792  uint32_t end = offset + length;
1793 
1794  {
1795  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
1796  for (auto i = _data_lower_bound(offset);
1797  i != buffer_map.end() && offset < end && i->first < end;
1798  ++i) {
1799  Buffer *b = i->second.get();
1800  ceph_assert(b->end() > offset);
1801 
1802  bool val = false;
1803  if (flags & BYPASS_CLEAN_CACHE)
1804  val = b->is_writing();
1805  else
1806  val = b->is_writing() || b->is_clean();
1807  if (val) {
1808  if (b->offset < offset) {
1809  uint32_t skip = offset - b->offset;
1810  uint32_t l = min(length, b->length - skip);
1811  res[offset].substr_of(b->data, skip, l);
1812  res_intervals.insert(offset, l);
1813  offset += l;
1814  length -= l;
1815  if (!b->is_writing()) {
1816  cache->_touch(b);
1817  }
1818  continue;
1819  }
1820  if (b->offset > offset) {
1821  uint32_t gap = b->offset - offset;
1822  if (length <= gap) {
1823  break;
1824  }
1825  offset += gap;
1826  length -= gap;
1827  }
1828  if (!b->is_writing()) {
1829  cache->_touch(b);
1830  }
1831  if (b->length > length) {
1832  res[offset].substr_of(b->data, 0, length);
1833  res_intervals.insert(offset, length);
1834  break;
1835  } else {
1836  res[offset].append(b->data);
1837  res_intervals.insert(offset, b->length);
1838  if (b->length == length)
1839  break;
1840  offset += b->length;
1841  length -= b->length;
1842  }
1843  }
1844  }
1845  }
1846 
1847  uint64_t hit_bytes = res_intervals.size();
1848  ceph_assert(hit_bytes <= want_bytes);
1849  uint64_t miss_bytes = want_bytes - hit_bytes;
1850  cache->logger->inc(l_bluestore_buffer_hit_bytes, hit_bytes);
1851  cache->logger->inc(l_bluestore_buffer_miss_bytes, miss_bytes);
1852 }
1853 
1854 void BlueStore::BufferSpace::_finish_write(BufferCacheShard* cache, uint64_t seq)
1855 {
1856  auto i = writing.begin();
1857  while (i != writing.end()) {
1858  if (i->seq > seq) {
1859  break;
1860  }
1861  if (i->seq < seq) {
1862  ++i;
1863  continue;
1864  }
1865 
1866  Buffer *b = &*i;
1867  ceph_assert(b->is_writing());
1868 
1869  if (b->flags & Buffer::FLAG_NOCACHE) {
1870  writing.erase(i++);
1871  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << " discard " << *b << dendl;
1872  buffer_map.erase(b->offset);
1873  } else {
1874  b->state = Buffer::STATE_CLEAN;
1875  writing.erase(i++);
1876  b->maybe_rebuild();
1877  b->data.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_data);
1878  cache->_add(b, 1, nullptr);
1879  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << " added " << *b << dendl;
1880  }
1881  }
1882  cache->_trim();
1883  cache->_audit("finish_write end");
1884 }
1885 
1886 /*
1887  copy Buffers that are in writing queue
1888  returns:
1889  true if something copied
1890  false if nothing copied
1891 */
1892 bool BlueStore::BufferSpace::_dup_writing(BufferCacheShard* cache, BufferSpace* to)
1893 {
1894  bool copied = false;
1895  if (!writing.empty()) {
1896  copied = true;
1897  for (auto it = writing.begin(); it != writing.end(); ++it) {
1898  Buffer& b = *it;
1899  Buffer* to_b = new Buffer(to, b.state, b.seq, b.offset, b.data, b.flags);
1900  ceph_assert(to_b->is_writing());
1901  to->_add_buffer(cache, to_b, 0, nullptr);
1902  }
1903  }
1904  return copied;
1905 }
1906 
1907 void BlueStore::BufferSpace::split(BufferCacheShard* cache, size_t pos, BlueStore::BufferSpace &r)
1908 {
1909  std::lock_guard lk(cache->lock);
1910  if (buffer_map.empty())
1911  return;
1912 
1913  auto p = --buffer_map.end();
1914  while (true) {
1915  if (p->second->end() <= pos)
1916  break;
1917 
1918  if (p->second->offset < pos) {
1919  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " cut " << *p->second << dendl;
1920  size_t left = pos - p->second->offset;
1921  size_t right = p->second->length - left;
1922  if (p->second->data.length()) {
1923  bufferlist bl;
1924  bl.substr_of(p->second->data, left, right);
1925  r._add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(&r, p->second->state, p->second->seq,
1926  0, bl, p->second->flags),
1927  0, p->second.get());
1928  } else {
1929  r._add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(&r, p->second->state, p->second->seq,
1930  0, right, p->second->flags),
1931  0, p->second.get());
1932  }
1933  cache->_adjust_size(p->second.get(), -right);
1934  p->second->truncate(left);
1935  break;
1936  }
1937 
1938  ceph_assert(p->second->end() > pos);
1939  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " move " << *p->second << dendl;
1940  if (p->second->data.length()) {
1941  r._add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(&r, p->second->state, p->second->seq,
1942  p->second->offset - pos, p->second->data, p->second->flags),
1943  0, p->second.get());
1944  } else {
1945  r._add_buffer(cache, new Buffer(&r, p->second->state, p->second->seq,
1946  p->second->offset - pos, p->second->length, p->second->flags),
1947  0, p->second.get());
1948  }
1949  if (p == buffer_map.begin()) {
1950  _rm_buffer(cache, p);
1951  break;
1952  } else {
1953  _rm_buffer(cache, p--);
1954  }
1955  }
1956  ceph_assert(writing.empty());
1957  cache->_trim();
1958 }
1959 
1960 // lists content of BufferSpace
1961 // BufferSpace must be under exclusive access
1962 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const BlueStore::BufferSpace& bc)
1963 {
1964  for (auto& [i, j] : bc.buffer_map) {
1965  out << " [0x" << std::hex << i << "]=" << *j << std::dec;
1966  }
1967  if (!bc.writing.empty()) {
1968  out << " writing:";
1969  for (auto i = bc.writing.begin(); i != bc.writing.end(); ++i) {
1970  out << " " << *i;
1971  }
1972  }
1973  return out;
1974 }
1975 
1976 
1977 // OnodeSpace
1978 
1979 #undef dout_prefix
1980 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.OnodeSpace(" << this << " in " << cache << ") "
1981 
1982 BlueStore::OnodeRef BlueStore::OnodeSpace::add_onode(const ghobject_t& oid,
1983  OnodeRef& o)
1984 {
1985  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
1986  // add entry or return existing one
1987  auto p = onode_map.emplace(oid, o);
1988  if (!p.second) {
1989  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " " << oid << " " << o
1990  << " raced, returning existing " << p.first->second
1991  << dendl;
1992  return p.first->second;
1993  }
1994  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << " " << oid << " " << o << dendl;
1995  cache->_add(o.get(), 1);
1996  cache->_trim();
1997  return o;
1998 }
1999 
2000 void BlueStore::OnodeSpace::_remove(const ghobject_t& oid)
2001 {
2002  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << " " << oid << " " << dendl;
2003  onode_map.erase(oid);
2004 }
2005 
2006 BlueStore::OnodeRef BlueStore::OnodeSpace::lookup(const ghobject_t& oid)
2007 {
2008  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << dendl;
2009  OnodeRef o;
2010 
2011  {
2012  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2013  ceph::unordered_map<ghobject_t,OnodeRef>::iterator p = onode_map.find(oid);
2014  if (p == onode_map.end()) {
2015  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " " << oid << " miss" << dendl;
2016  cache->logger->inc(l_bluestore_onode_misses);
2017  } else {
2018  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " " << oid << " hit " << p->second
2019  << " " << p->second->nref
2020  << " " << p->second->cached
2021  << dendl;
2022  // This will pin onode and implicitly touch the cache when Onode
2023  // eventually will become unpinned
2024  o = p->second;
2025 
2026  cache->logger->inc(l_bluestore_onode_hits);
2027  }
2028  }
2029 
2030  return o;
2031 }
2032 
2033 void BlueStore::OnodeSpace::clear()
2034 {
2035  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2036  ldout(cache->cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << onode_map.size()<< dendl;
2037  for (auto &p : onode_map) {
2038  cache->_rm(p.second.get());
2039  }
2040  onode_map.clear();
2041 }
2042 
2043 bool BlueStore::OnodeSpace::empty()
2044 {
2045  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2046  return onode_map.empty();
2047 }
2048 
2049 void BlueStore::OnodeSpace::rename(
2050  OnodeRef& oldo,
2051  const ghobject_t& old_oid,
2052  const ghobject_t& new_oid,
2053  const mempool::bluestore_cache_meta::string& new_okey)
2054 {
2055  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2056  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " " << old_oid << " -> " << new_oid
2057  << dendl;
2058  ceph::unordered_map<ghobject_t,OnodeRef>::iterator po, pn;
2059  po = onode_map.find(old_oid);
2060  pn = onode_map.find(new_oid);
2061  ceph_assert(po != pn);
2062 
2063  ceph_assert(po != onode_map.end());
2064  if (pn != onode_map.end()) {
2065  ldout(cache->cct, 30) << __func__ << " removing target " << pn->second
2066  << dendl;
2067  cache->_rm(pn->second.get());
2068  onode_map.erase(pn);
2069  }
2070  OnodeRef o = po->second;
2071 
2072  // install a non-existent onode at old location
2073  oldo.reset(new Onode(o->c, old_oid, o->key));
2074  po->second = oldo;
2075  cache->_add(oldo.get(), 1);
2076  // add at new position and fix oid, key.
2077  // This will pin 'o' and implicitly touch cache
2078  // when it will eventually become unpinned
2079  onode_map.insert(make_pair(new_oid, o));
2080 
2081  o->oid = new_oid;
2082  o->key = new_okey;
2083  cache->_trim();
2084 }
2085 
2086 bool BlueStore::OnodeSpace::map_any(std::function<bool(Onode*)> f)
2087 {
2088  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2089  ldout(cache->cct, 20) << __func__ << dendl;
2090  for (auto& i : onode_map) {
2091  if (f(i.second.get())) {
2092  return true;
2093  }
2094  }
2095  return false;
2096 }
2097 
2098 template <int LogLevelV = 30>
2099 void BlueStore::OnodeSpace::dump(CephContext *cct)
2100 {
2101  for (auto& i : onode_map) {
2102  ldout(cct, LogLevelV) << i.first << " : " << i.second
2103  << " " << i.second->nref
2104  << " " << i.second->cached
2105  << dendl;
2106  }
2107 }
2108 
2109 // SharedBlob
2110 
2111 #undef dout_prefix
2112 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.sharedblob(" << this << ") "
2113 #undef dout_context
2114 #define dout_context coll->store->cct
2115 
2116 void BlueStore::SharedBlob::dump(Formatter* f) const
2117 {
2118  f->dump_bool("loaded", loaded);
2119  if (loaded) {
2120  persistent->dump(f);
2121  } else {
2122  f->dump_unsigned("sbid_unloaded", sbid_unloaded);
2123  }
2124 }
2125 
2126 ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const BlueStore::SharedBlob& sb)
2127 {
2128  out << "SharedBlob(" << &sb;
2129 
2130  if (sb.loaded) {
2131  out << " loaded " << *sb.persistent;
2132  } else {
2133  out << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sb.sbid_unloaded << std::dec;
2134  }
2135  return out << ")";
2136 }
2137 
2138 BlueStore::SharedBlob::SharedBlob(uint64_t i, Collection *_coll)
2139  : coll(_coll), sbid_unloaded(i)
2140 {
2141  ceph_assert(sbid_unloaded > 0);
2142 }
2143 
2144 BlueStore::SharedBlob::~SharedBlob()
2145 {
2146  if (loaded && persistent) {
2147  delete persistent;
2148  }
2149 }
2150 
2151 void BlueStore::SharedBlob::put()
2152 {
2153  if (--nref == 0) {
2154  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << this
2155  << " removing self from set " << get_parent()
2156  << dendl;
2157  again:
2158  auto coll_snap = coll;
2159  if (coll_snap) {
2160  std::lock_guard l(coll_snap->cache->lock);
2161  if (coll_snap != coll) {
2162  goto again;
2163  }
2164  if (!coll_snap->shared_blob_set.remove(this, true)) {
2165  // race with lookup
2166  return;
2167  }
2168  }
2169  delete this;
2170  }
2171 }
2172 
2173 void BlueStore::SharedBlob::get_ref(uint64_t offset, uint32_t length)
2174 {
2175  ceph_assert(persistent);
2176  persistent->ref_map.get(offset, length);
2177 }
2178 
2179 void BlueStore::SharedBlob::put_ref(uint64_t offset, uint32_t length,
2180  PExtentVector *r,
2181  bool *unshare)
2182 {
2183  ceph_assert(persistent);
2184  persistent->ref_map.put(offset, length, r,
2185  unshare && !*unshare ? unshare : nullptr);
2186 }
2187 
2188 // SharedBlobSet
2189 
2190 #undef dout_prefix
2191 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.sharedblobset(" << this << ") "
2192 
2193 template <int LogLevelV = 30>
2194 void BlueStore::SharedBlobSet::dump(CephContext *cct)
2195 {
2196  std::lock_guard l(lock);
2197  for (auto& i : sb_map) {
2198  ldout(cct, LogLevelV) << i.first << " : " << *i.second << dendl;
2199  }
2200 }
2201 
2202 // Blob
2203 
2204 #undef dout_prefix
2205 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.blob(" << this << ") "
2206 
2207 BlueStore::Blob::~Blob()
2208 {
2209  SharedBlob* sb = shared_blob.get();
2210  if (!sb) {
2211  ceph_assert(bc.buffer_map.empty());
2212  return;
2213  }
2214  again:
2215  auto coll_cache = sb->get_cache();
2216  if (coll_cache) {
2217  std::lock_guard l(coll_cache->lock);
2218  if (coll_cache != sb->get_cache()) {
2219  goto again;
2220  }
2221  bc._clear(coll_cache);
2222  coll_cache->rm_blob();
2223  }
2224 }
2225 
2226 void BlueStore::Blob::dump(Formatter* f) const
2227 {
2228  if (is_spanning()) {
2229  f->dump_unsigned("spanning_id ", id);
2230  }
2231  blob.dump(f);
2232  if (shared_blob) {
2233  f->dump_object("shared", *shared_blob);
2234  }
2235 }
2236 
2237 ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const BlueStore::Blob& b)
2238 {
2239  out << "Blob(" << &b;
2240  if (b.is_spanning()) {
2241  out << " spanning " << b.id;
2242  }
2243  out << " " << b.get_blob() << " " << b.get_blob_use_tracker();
2244  if (b.shared_blob) {
2245  out << " " << *b.shared_blob;
2246  } else {
2247  out << " (shared_blob=NULL)";
2248  }
2249  out << ")";
2250  return out;
2251 }
2252 
2253 void BlueStore::Blob::discard_unallocated(Collection *coll)
2254 {
2255  if (get_blob().is_shared()) {
2256  return;
2257  }
2258  if (get_blob().is_compressed()) {
2259  bool discard = false;
2260  bool all_invalid = true;
2261  for (auto e : get_blob().get_extents()) {
2262  if (!e.is_valid()) {
2263  discard = true;
2264  } else {
2265  all_invalid = false;
2266  }
2267  }
2268  ceph_assert(discard == all_invalid); // in case of compressed blob all
2269  // or none pextents are invalid.
2270  if (discard) {
2271  dirty_bc().discard(shared_blob->get_cache(), 0,
2272  get_blob().get_logical_length());
2273  }
2274  } else {
2275  size_t pos = 0;
2276  for (auto e : get_blob().get_extents()) {
2277  if (!e.is_valid()) {
2278  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << pos
2279  << "~" << e.length
2280  << std::dec << dendl;
2281  dirty_bc().discard(shared_blob->get_cache(), pos, e.length);
2282  }
2283  pos += e.length;
2284  }
2285  if (get_blob().can_prune_tail()) {
2286  dirty_blob().prune_tail();
2287  used_in_blob.prune_tail(get_blob().get_ondisk_length());
2288  dout(20) << __func__ << " pruned tail, now " << get_blob() << dendl;
2289  }
2290  }
2291 }
2292 
2293 void BlueStore::Blob::get_ref(
2294  Collection *coll,
2295  uint32_t offset,
2296  uint32_t length)
2297 {
2298  // Caller has to initialize Blob's logical length prior to increment
2299  // references. Otherwise one is neither unable to determine required
2300  // amount of counters in case of per-au tracking nor obtain min_release_size
2301  // for single counter mode.
2302  ceph_assert(get_blob().get_logical_length() != 0);
2303  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
2304  << std::dec << " " << *this << dendl;
2305 
2306  if (used_in_blob.is_empty()) {
2307  uint32_t min_release_size =
2308  get_blob().get_release_size(coll->store->min_alloc_size);
2309  uint64_t l = get_blob().get_logical_length();
2310  dout(20) << __func__ << " init 0x" << std::hex << l << ", "
2311  << min_release_size << std::dec << dendl;
2312  used_in_blob.init(l, min_release_size);
2313  }
2314  used_in_blob.get(
2315  offset,
2316  length);
2317 }
2318 
2319 bool BlueStore::Blob::put_ref(
2320  Collection *coll,
2321  uint32_t offset,
2322  uint32_t length,
2323  PExtentVector *r)
2324 {
2325  PExtentVector logical;
2326 
2327  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
2328  << std::dec << " " << *this << dendl;
2329 
2330  bool empty = used_in_blob.put(
2331  offset,
2332  length,
2333  &logical);
2334  r->clear();
2335  // nothing to release
2336  if (!empty && logical.empty()) {
2337  return false;
2338  }
2339 
2340  bluestore_blob_t& b = dirty_blob();
2341  return b.release_extents(empty, logical, r);
2342 }
2343 
2344 bool BlueStore::Blob::can_reuse_blob(uint32_t min_alloc_size,
2345  uint32_t target_blob_size,
2346  uint32_t b_offset,
2347  uint32_t *length0) {
2348  ceph_assert(min_alloc_size);
2349  ceph_assert(target_blob_size);
2350  if (!get_blob().is_mutable()) {
2351  return false;
2352  }
2353 
2354  uint32_t length = *length0;
2355  uint32_t end = b_offset + length;
2356 
2357  // Currently for the sake of simplicity we omit blob reuse if data is
2358  // unaligned with csum chunk. Later we can perform padding if needed.
2359  if (get_blob().has_csum() &&
2360  ((b_offset % get_blob().get_csum_chunk_size()) != 0 ||
2361  (end % get_blob().get_csum_chunk_size()) != 0)) {
2362  return false;
2363  }
2364 
2365  auto blen = get_blob().get_logical_length();
2366  uint32_t new_blen = blen;
2367 
2368  // make sure target_blob_size isn't less than current blob len
2369  target_blob_size = std::max(blen, target_blob_size);
2370 
2371  if (b_offset >= blen) {
2372  // new data totally stands out of the existing blob
2373  new_blen = end;
2374  } else {
2375  // new data overlaps with the existing blob
2376  new_blen = std::max(blen, end);
2377 
2378  uint32_t overlap = 0;
2379  if (new_blen > blen) {
2380  overlap = blen - b_offset;
2381  } else {
2382  overlap = length;
2383  }
2384 
2385  if (!get_blob().is_unallocated(b_offset, overlap)) {
2386  // abort if any piece of the overlap has already been allocated
2387  return false;
2388  }
2389  }
2390 
2391  if (new_blen > blen) {
2392  int64_t overflow = int64_t(new_blen) - target_blob_size;
2393  // Unable to decrease the provided length to fit into max_blob_size
2394  if (overflow >= length) {
2395  return false;
2396  }
2397 
2398  // FIXME: in some cases we could reduce unused resolution
2399  if (get_blob().has_unused()) {
2400  return false;
2401  }
2402 
2403  if (overflow > 0) {
2404  new_blen -= overflow;
2405  length -= overflow;
2406  *length0 = length;
2407  }
2408 
2409  if (new_blen > blen) {
2410  ceph_assert(dirty_blob().is_mutable());
2411  dirty_blob().add_tail(new_blen);
2412  used_in_blob.add_tail(new_blen,
2413  get_blob().get_release_size(min_alloc_size));
2414  }
2415  }
2416  return true;
2417 }
2418 
2419 #undef dout_prefix
2420 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.blob(" << this << ") "
2421 #undef dout_context
2422 #define dout_context cct
2423 
2424 // Cut Buffers that are not covered by extents.
2425 // It happens when we punch hole in Blob, but not refill with new data.
2426 // Normally it is not a problem (other then wasted memory),
2427 // but when 2 Blobs are merged Buffers might collide.
2428 // Todo: in future cut Buffers when we delete extents from Blobs,
2429 // and get rid of this function.
2430 void BlueStore::Blob::discard_unused_buffers(CephContext* cct, BufferCacheShard* cache)
2431 {
2432  dout(25) << __func__ << " input " << *this << " bc=" << bc << dendl;
2433  const PExtentVector& extents = get_blob().get_extents();
2434  uint32_t epos = 0;
2435  auto e = extents.begin();
2436  while(e != extents.end()) {
2437  if (!e->is_valid()) {
2438  bc._discard(cache, epos, e->length);
2439  }
2440  epos += e->length;
2441  ++e;
2442  }
2443  ceph_assert(epos <= blob.get_logical_length());
2444  // Preferably, we would trim up to blob.get_logical_length(),
2445  // but we copied writing buffers (see _dup_writing) before blob logical_length is fixed.
2446  bc._discard(cache, epos, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE - epos);
2447  dout(25) << __func__ << " output bc=" << bc << dendl;
2448 }
2449 
2450 void BlueStore::Blob::dup(const Blob& from, bool copy_used_in_blob)
2451 {
2452  set_shared_blob(from.shared_blob);
2453  blob.dup(from.blob);
2454  if (copy_used_in_blob) {
2455  used_in_blob = from.used_in_blob;
2456  } else {
2457  ceph_assert(from.blob.is_compressed());
2458  ceph_assert(from.used_in_blob.num_au <= 1);
2459  used_in_blob.init(from.used_in_blob.au_size, from.used_in_blob.au_size);
2460  }
2461  for (auto p : blob.get_extents()) {
2462  if (p.is_valid()) {
2463  shared_blob->get_ref(p.offset, p.length);
2464  }
2465  }
2466 }
2467 
2468 // copies part of a Blob
2469 // it is used to create a consistent blob out of parts of other blobs
2470 void BlueStore::Blob::copy_from(
2471  CephContext* cct, const Blob& from, uint32_t min_release_size, uint32_t start, uint32_t len)
2472 {
2473  dout(20) << __func__ << " to=" << *this << " from=" << from
2474  << " [" << std::hex << start << "~" << len
2475  << "] min_release=" << min_release_size << std::dec << dendl;
2476 
2477  auto& bto = blob;
2478  auto& bfrom = from.blob;
2479  ceph_assert(!bfrom.is_compressed()); // not suitable for compressed (immutable) blobs
2480  ceph_assert(!bfrom.has_unused());
2481  // below to asserts are not required to make function work
2482  // they check if it is run in desired context
2483  ceph_assert(bfrom.is_shared());
2484  ceph_assert(shared_blob);
2485  ceph_assert(shared_blob == from.shared_blob);
2486 
2487  // split len to pre_len, main_len, post_len
2488  uint32_t start_aligned = p2align(start, min_release_size);
2489  uint32_t start_roundup = p2roundup(start, min_release_size);
2490  uint32_t end_aligned = p2align(start + len, min_release_size);
2491  uint32_t end_roundup = p2roundup(start + len, min_release_size);
2492  dout(25) << __func__ << " extent split:"
2493  << std::hex << start_aligned << "~" << start_roundup << "~"
2494  << end_aligned << "~" << end_roundup << std::dec << dendl;
2495 
2496  if (bto.get_logical_length() == 0) {
2497  // this is initialization
2498  bto.adjust_to(from.blob, end_roundup);
2499  ceph_assert(min_release_size == from.used_in_blob.au_size);
2500  used_in_blob.init(end_roundup, min_release_size);
2501  } else if (bto.get_logical_length() < end_roundup) {
2502  ceph_assert(!bto.is_compressed());
2503  bto.add_tail(end_roundup);
2504  used_in_blob.add_tail(end_roundup, used_in_blob.au_size);
2505  }
2506 
2507  if (end_aligned >= start_roundup) {
2508  copy_extents(cct, from, start_aligned,
2509  start_roundup - start_aligned,/*pre_len*/
2510  end_aligned - start_roundup,/*main_len*/
2511  end_roundup - end_aligned/*post_len*/);
2512  } else {
2513  // it is uncommon case that <start, start + len) in single allocation unit
2514  copy_extents(cct, from, start_aligned,
2515  start_roundup - start_aligned,/*pre_len*/
2516  0 /*main_len*/, 0/*post_len*/);
2517  }
2518  // copy relevant csum items
2519  if (bto.has_csum()) {
2520  size_t csd_value_size = bto.get_csum_value_size();
2521  size_t csd_item_start = p2align(start, uint32_t(1 << bto.csum_chunk_order)) >> bto.csum_chunk_order;
2522  size_t csd_item_end = p2roundup(start + len, uint32_t(1 << bto.csum_chunk_order)) >> bto.csum_chunk_order;
2523  ceph_assert(bto. csum_data.length() >= csd_item_end * csd_value_size);
2524  ceph_assert(bfrom.csum_data.length() >= csd_item_end * csd_value_size);
2525  memcpy(bto. csum_data.c_str() + csd_item_start * csd_value_size,
2526  bfrom.csum_data.c_str() + csd_item_start * csd_value_size,
2527  (csd_item_end - csd_item_start) * csd_value_size);
2528  }
2529  used_in_blob.get(start, len);
2530  dout(20) << __func__ << " result=" << *this << dendl;
2531 }
2532 
2533 void BlueStore::Blob::copy_extents(
2534  CephContext* cct, const Blob& from, uint32_t start,
2535  uint32_t pre_len, uint32_t main_len, uint32_t post_len)
2536 {
2537  constexpr uint64_t invalid = bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET;
2538  auto at = [&](const PExtentVector& e, uint32_t pos, uint32_t len) -> uint64_t {
2539  auto it = e.begin();
2540  while (it != e.end() && pos >= it->length) {
2541  pos -= it->length;
2542  ++it;
2543  }
2544  if (it == e.end()) {
2545  return invalid;
2546  }
2547  if (!it->is_valid()) {
2548  return invalid;
2549  }
2550  ceph_assert(pos + len <= it->length); // post_len should be single au, and we do not split
2551  return it->offset + pos;
2552  };
2553  const PExtentVector& exfrom = from.blob.get_extents();
2554  PExtentVector& exto = blob.dirty_extents();
2555  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << start << " "
2556  << pre_len << "/" << main_len << "/" << post_len << std::dec << dendl;
2557 
2558  // the extents that cover same area must be the same
2559  if (pre_len > 0) {
2560  uint64_t au_from = at(exfrom, start, pre_len);
2561  ceph_assert(au_from != bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET);
2562  uint64_t au_to = at(exto, start, pre_len);
2563  if (au_to == bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET) {
2564  main_len += pre_len; // also copy pre_len
2565  } else {
2566  ceph_assert(au_from == au_to);
2567  start += pre_len; // skip, already there
2568  }
2569  }
2570  if (post_len > 0) {
2571  uint64_t au_from = at(exfrom, start + main_len, post_len);
2572  ceph_assert(au_from != bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET);
2573  uint64_t au_to = at(exto, start + main_len, post_len);
2574  if (au_to == bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET) {
2575  main_len += post_len; // also copy post_len
2576  } else {
2577  ceph_assert(au_from == au_to);
2578  // skip, already there
2579  }
2580  }
2581  // it is possible that here is nothing to copy
2582  if (main_len > 0) {
2583  copy_extents_over_empty(cct, from, start, main_len);
2584  }
2585 }
2586 
2587 // assumes that target (this->extents) has hole in relevant location
2588 void BlueStore::Blob::copy_extents_over_empty(
2589  CephContext* cct, const Blob& from, uint32_t start, uint32_t len)
2590 {
2591  dout(20) << __func__ << " to=" << *this << " from=" << from
2592  << "[0x" << std::hex << start << "~" << len << std::dec << "]" << dendl;
2593  uint32_t padding;
2594  auto& exto = blob.dirty_extents();
2595  auto ito = exto.begin();
2596  PExtentVector::iterator prev = exto.end();
2597  uint32_t sto = start;
2598 
2599  auto try_append = [&](PExtentVector::iterator& it, uint64_t disk_offset, uint32_t disk_len) {
2600  if (prev != exto.end()) {
2601  if (prev->is_valid()) {
2602  if (prev->offset + prev->length == disk_offset) {
2603  shared_blob->get_ref(disk_offset, disk_len);
2604  prev->length += disk_len;
2605  return;
2606  }
2607  }
2608  }
2609  it = exto.insert(it, bluestore_pextent_t(disk_offset, disk_len));
2610  prev = it;
2611  ++it;
2612  shared_blob->get_ref(disk_offset, disk_len);
2613  };
2614 
2615  while (ito != exto.end() && sto >= ito->length) {
2616  sto -= ito->length;
2617  prev = ito;
2618  ++ito;
2619  }
2620  if (ito == exto.end()) {
2621  // putting data after end, just expand / push back
2622  if (sto > 0) {
2623  exto.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET, sto);
2624  ito = exto.end();
2625  prev = ito;
2626  }
2627  padding = 0;
2628  } else {
2629  ceph_assert(!ito->is_valid()); // there can be no collision
2630  ceph_assert(ito->length >= sto + len); // for at least len, starting with remainder sto
2631  padding = ito->length - (sto + len); // add this much after copying
2632  ito = exto.erase(ito); // cut a hole
2633  if (sto > 0) {
2634  ito = exto.insert(ito, bluestore_pextent_t(bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET, sto));
2635  prev = ito;
2636  ++ito;
2637  }
2638  }
2639 
2640  const auto& exfrom = from.blob.get_extents();
2641  auto itf = exfrom.begin();
2642  uint32_t sf = start;
2643  while (itf != exfrom.end() && sf >= itf->length) {
2644  sf -= itf->length;
2645  ++itf;
2646  }
2647 
2648  uint32_t skip_on_first = sf;
2649  while (itf != exfrom.end() && len > 0) {
2650  ceph_assert(itf->is_valid());
2651  uint32_t to_copy = std::min<uint32_t>(itf->length - skip_on_first, len);
2652  try_append(ito, itf->offset + skip_on_first, to_copy);
2653  len -= to_copy;
2654  skip_on_first = 0;
2655  ++itf;
2656  }
2657  ceph_assert(len == 0);
2658 
2659  if (padding > 0) {
2660  exto.insert(ito, bluestore_pextent_t(bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET, padding));
2661  }
2662  dout(20) << __func__ << " result=" << *this << dendl;
2663 }
2664 
2665 // Checks if two Blobs can be joined together.
2666 // The important (unchecked) condition is that both Blobs belong to the same object.
2667 // Verifies if 'other' Blob can be deleted but its content moved to 'this' Blob.
2668 // Requirements:
2669 // 1) checksums: same type and size
2670 // 2) tracker: same au size
2671 // 3) extents: must be disjointed
2672 // 4) unused: ignored, will be cleared
2673 //
2674 // Returns:
2675 // false - Blobs are incompatible
2676 // true - Blobs can be merged
2677 //
2678 // Returned blob_width is a distance between 'other' Blob's blob_start() and last logical_offset
2679 // that can refer to 'other' Blob extents. It is used to limit iteration on ExtentMap.
2680 bool BlueStore::Blob::can_merge_blob(const Blob* other, uint32_t& blob_width) const
2681 {
2682  const Blob* x = other;
2683  const Blob* y = this;
2684  // checksums
2685  const bluestore_blob_t& xb = x->get_blob();
2686  const bluestore_blob_t& yb = y->get_blob();
2687  if (xb.has_csum() != yb.has_csum()) return false;
2688  if (xb.has_csum()) {
2689  if (xb.csum_type != yb.csum_type) return false;
2690  if (xb.csum_chunk_order != yb.csum_chunk_order) return false;
2691  }
2692  // trackers
2693  const bluestore_blob_use_tracker_t& xtr = x->get_blob_use_tracker();
2694  const bluestore_blob_use_tracker_t& ytr = y->get_blob_use_tracker();
2695  if (xtr.au_size != ytr.au_size) return false;
2696  // unused
2697  // ignore unused, we will clear it up anyway
2698  // extents
2699  // the success is when there is no offset that is used by both blobs
2700  auto skip_empty = [&](const PExtentVector& list, PExtentVector::const_iterator& it, uint32_t& pos) {
2701  while (it != list.end() && !it->is_valid()) {
2702  pos += it->length;
2703  ++it;
2704  }
2705  };
2706  bool can_merge = true;
2707  const PExtentVector& xe = x->get_blob().get_extents();
2708  const PExtentVector& ye = y->get_blob().get_extents();
2709  PExtentVector::const_iterator xi = xe.begin();
2710  PExtentVector::const_iterator yi = ye.begin();
2711  uint32_t xp = 0;
2712  uint32_t yp = 0;
2713 
2714  skip_empty(xe, xi, xp);
