2715  skip_empty(ye, yi, yp);
2716 
2717  while (xi != xe.end() && yi != ye.end()) {
2718  if (xp <= yp) {
2719  if (yp < xp + xi->length) {
2720  // collision
2721  can_merge = false;
2722  break;
2723  }
2724  xp += xi->length;
2725  ++xi;
2726  skip_empty(xe, xi, xp);
2727  } else {
2728  if (xp < yp + yi->length) {
2729  // collision
2730  can_merge = false;
2731  break;
2732  }
2733  yp += yi->length;
2734  ++yi;
2735  skip_empty(ye, yi, yp);
2736  }
2737  }
2738  if (can_merge) {
2739  // scan remaining extents in x
2740  while (xi != xe.end()) {
2741  xp += xi->length;
2742  ++xi;
2743  }
2744  blob_width = xp;
2745  }
2746  return can_merge;
2747 }
2748 
2749 // Merges 2 blobs together. Move extents, csum, tracker from src to dst.
2750 uint32_t BlueStore::Blob::merge_blob(CephContext* cct, Blob* blob_to_dissolve)
2751 {
2752  Blob* dst = this;
2753  Blob* src = blob_to_dissolve;
2754  const bluestore_blob_t& src_blob = src->get_blob();
2755  bluestore_blob_t& dst_blob = dst->dirty_blob();
2756  dout(20) << __func__ << " to=" << *dst << " from" << *src << dendl;
2757 
2758  // drop unused, do not recalc it, unlikely those chunks could be used in future
2759  dst_blob.clear_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_HAS_UNUSED);
2760  if (dst_blob.get_logical_length() < src_blob.get_logical_length()) {
2761  // expand to accomodate
2762  ceph_assert(!dst_blob.is_compressed());
2763  dst_blob.add_tail(src_blob.get_logical_length());
2764  used_in_blob.add_tail(src_blob.get_logical_length(), used_in_blob.au_size);
2765  }
2766  const PExtentVector& src_extents = src_blob.get_extents();
2767  const PExtentVector& dst_extents = dst_blob.get_extents();
2768  PExtentVector tmp_extents;
2769  tmp_extents.reserve(src_extents.size() + dst_extents.size());
2770 
2771  uint32_t csum_chunk_order = src_blob.csum_chunk_order;
2772  uint32_t csum_value_size = 0;
2773  const char* src_csum_ptr = nullptr;
2774  char* dst_csum_ptr = nullptr;
2775  if (src_blob.has_csum()) {
2776  ceph_assert(src_blob.csum_type == dst_blob.csum_type);
2777  ceph_assert(src_blob.csum_chunk_order == dst_blob.csum_chunk_order);
2778  csum_value_size = src_blob.get_csum_value_size();
2779  src_csum_ptr = src_blob.csum_data.c_str();
2780  dst_csum_ptr = dst_blob.csum_data.c_str();
2781  }
2782  const bluestore_blob_use_tracker_t& src_tracker = src->get_blob_use_tracker();
2783  bluestore_blob_use_tracker_t& dst_tracker = dst->dirty_blob_use_tracker();
2784  ceph_assert(src_tracker.au_size == dst_tracker.au_size);
2785  uint32_t tracker_au_size = src_tracker.au_size;
2786  const uint32_t* src_tracker_aus = src_tracker.get_au_array();
2787  uint32_t* dst_tracker_aus = dst_tracker.dirty_au_array();
2788 
2789  auto skip_empty = [&](const PExtentVector& list, PExtentVector::const_iterator& it, uint32_t& pos) {
2790  while (it != list.end()) {
2791  if (it->is_valid()) {
2792  return;
2793  }
2794  pos += it->length;
2795  ++it;
2796  }
2797  pos = std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max();
2798  return;
2799  };
2800 
2801  auto move_data = [&](uint32_t pos, uint32_t len) {
2802  if (src_blob.has_csum()) {
2803  // copy csum
2804  ceph_assert((pos % (1 << csum_chunk_order)) == 0);
2805  ceph_assert((len % (1 << csum_chunk_order)) == 0);
2806  uint32_t start = p2align(pos, uint32_t(1 << csum_chunk_order));
2807  uint32_t end = p2roundup(pos + len, uint32_t(1 << csum_chunk_order));
2808  uint32_t item_no = start >> csum_chunk_order;
2809  uint32_t item_cnt = (end - start) >> csum_chunk_order;
2810  ceph_assert(dst_blob.csum_data.length() >= (item_no + item_cnt) * csum_value_size);
2811  memcpy(dst_csum_ptr + item_no * csum_value_size,
2812  src_csum_ptr + item_no * csum_value_size,
2813  item_cnt * csum_value_size);
2814  }
2815  uint32_t start = p2align(pos, tracker_au_size) / tracker_au_size;
2816  uint32_t end = p2roundup(pos + len, tracker_au_size) / tracker_au_size;
2817  for (uint32_t i = start; i < end; i++) {
2818  ceph_assert(i < dst_tracker.get_num_au());
2819  dst_tracker_aus[i] += src_tracker_aus[i];
2820  }
2821  };
2822 
2823  // Main loop creates new PExtentVector by merging src and dst PExtentVectors.
2824  // It will replace dst's PExtentVector.
2825  // When we process extent from dst, csum and tracer data is already in place.
2826  // When we process extent from src, we need to copy csum and tracer to dst.
2827 
2828  uint32_t src_pos = 0; //offset of next non-empty extent
2829  uint32_t dst_pos = 0;
2830  uint32_t pos = 0; //already processed amount
2831  auto src_it = src_extents.begin(); // iterator to next non-empty extent
2832  auto dst_it = dst_extents.begin();
2833 
2834  skip_empty(src_extents, src_it, src_pos);
2835  skip_empty(dst_extents, dst_it, dst_pos);
2836  while (src_it != src_extents.end() || dst_it != dst_extents.end()) {
2837  if (src_pos > pos) {
2838  if (dst_pos > pos) {
2839  // empty space
2840  uint32_t m = std::min(src_pos - pos, dst_pos - pos);
2841  // emit empty
2842  tmp_extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET, m);
2843  pos += m;
2844  } else {
2845  // copy from dst, src must not have conflicting extent
2846  ceph_assert(src_pos >= dst_pos + dst_it->length);
2847  // use extent from destination
2848  tmp_extents.push_back(*dst_it);
2849  dst_pos += dst_it->length;
2850  pos = dst_pos;
2851  ++dst_it;
2852  skip_empty(dst_extents, dst_it, dst_pos);
2853  }
2854  } else {
2855  // copy from src, dst must not have conflicting extent
2856  ceph_assert(dst_pos >= src_pos + src_it->length);
2857  // use extent from source
2858  tmp_extents.push_back(*src_it);
2859  // copy blob data
2860  move_data(src_pos, src_it->length);
2861  src_pos += src_it->length;
2862  pos = src_pos;
2863  ++src_it;
2864  skip_empty(src_extents, src_it, src_pos);
2865  }
2866  }
2867  if (pos < dst_blob.get_logical_length()) {
2868  // this is a candidate for improvement;
2869  // instead of artifically add extents, trim blob
2870  tmp_extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET, dst_blob.get_logical_length() - pos);
2871  }
2872  // now apply freshly merged tmp_extents into dst blob
2873  dst_blob.dirty_extents().swap(tmp_extents);
2874 
2875  // move BufferSpace buffers
2876  while(!src->bc.buffer_map.empty()) {
2877  auto buf = src->bc.buffer_map.extract(src->bc.buffer_map.cbegin());
2878  buf.mapped()->space = &dst->bc;
2879  if (dst->bc.buffer_map.count(buf.key()) == 0) {
2880  dst->bc.buffer_map[buf.key()] = std::move(buf.mapped());
2881  }
2882  }
2883  // move BufferSpace writing
2884  auto wrt_dst_it = dst->bc.writing.begin();
2885  while(!src->bc.writing.empty()) {
2886  Buffer& buf = src->bc.writing.front();
2887  src->bc.writing.pop_front();
2888  while (wrt_dst_it != dst->bc.writing.end() && wrt_dst_it->seq < buf.seq) {
2889  ++wrt_dst_it;
2890  }
2891  dst->bc.writing.insert(wrt_dst_it, buf);
2892  }
2893  dout(20) << __func__ << " result=" << *dst << dendl;
2894  return dst_blob.get_logical_length();
2895 }
2896 
2897 #undef dout_context
2898 #define dout_context coll->store->cct
2899 
2900 void BlueStore::Blob::finish_write(uint64_t seq)
2901 {
2902  while (true) {
2903  auto coll = shared_blob->coll;
2904  BufferCacheShard *cache = coll->cache;
2905  std::lock_guard l(cache->lock);
2906  if (coll->cache != cache) {
2907  dout(20) << __func__
2908  << " raced with sb cache update, was " << cache
2909  << ", now " << coll->cache << ", retrying"
2910  << dendl;
2911  continue;
2912  }
2913  bc._finish_write(cache, seq);
2914  break;
2915  }
2916 }
2917 
2918 void BlueStore::Blob::split(Collection *coll, uint32_t blob_offset, Blob *r)
2919 {
2920  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << blob_offset << std::dec
2921  << " start " << *this << dendl;
2922  ceph_assert(blob.can_split());
2923  ceph_assert(used_in_blob.can_split());
2924  bluestore_blob_t &lb = dirty_blob();
2925  bluestore_blob_t &rb = r->dirty_blob();
2926 
2927  used_in_blob.split(
2928  blob_offset,
2929  &(r->used_in_blob));
2930 
2931  lb.split(blob_offset, rb);
2932  dirty_bc().split(shared_blob->get_cache(), blob_offset, r->dirty_bc());
2933 
2934  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << blob_offset << std::dec
2935  << " finish " << *this << dendl;
2936  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << blob_offset << std::dec
2937  << " and " << *r << dendl;
2938 }
2939 
2940 #ifndef CACHE_BLOB_BL
2941 void BlueStore::Blob::decode(
2942  bufferptr::const_iterator& p,
2943  uint64_t struct_v,
2944  uint64_t* sbid,
2945  bool include_ref_map,
2946  Collection *coll)
2947 {
2948  denc(blob, p, struct_v);
2949  if (blob.is_shared()) {
2950  denc(*sbid, p);
2951  }
2952  if (include_ref_map) {
2953  if (struct_v > 1) {
2954  used_in_blob.decode(p);
2955  } else {
2956  used_in_blob.clear();
2957  bluestore_extent_ref_map_t legacy_ref_map;
2958  legacy_ref_map.decode(p);
2959  if (coll) {
2960  for (auto r : legacy_ref_map.ref_map) {
2961  get_ref(
2962  coll,
2963  r.first,
2964  r.second.refs * r.second.length);
2965  }
2966  }
2967  }
2968  }
2969 }
2970 #endif
2971 
2972 // Extent
2973 
2974 void BlueStore::Extent::dump(Formatter* f) const
2975 {
2976  f->dump_unsigned("logical_offset", logical_offset);
2977  f->dump_unsigned("length", length);
2978  f->dump_unsigned("blob_offset", blob_offset);
2979  f->dump_object("blob", *blob);
2980 }
2981 
2982 ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const BlueStore::Extent& e)
2983 {
2984  return out << std::hex << "0x" << e.logical_offset << "~" << e.length
2985  << ": 0x" << e.blob_offset << "~" << e.length << std::dec
2986  << " " << *e.blob;
2987 }
2988 
2989 // OldExtent
2990 BlueStore::OldExtent* BlueStore::OldExtent::create(CollectionRef c,
2991  uint32_t lo,
2992  uint32_t o,
2993  uint32_t l,
2994  BlobRef& b) {
2995  OldExtent* oe = new OldExtent(lo, o, l, b);
2996  b->put_ref(c.get(), o, l, &(oe->r));
2997  oe->blob_empty = !b->is_referenced();
2998  return oe;
2999 }
3000 
3001 // ExtentMap
3002 
3003 #undef dout_prefix
3004 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.extentmap(" << this << ") "
3005 #undef dout_context
3006 #define dout_context onode->c->store->cct
3007 
3008 BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentMap(Onode *o, size_t inline_shard_prealloc_size)
3009  : onode(o),
3010  inline_bl(inline_shard_prealloc_size) {
3011 }
3012 
3013 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::dump(Formatter* f) const
3014 {
3015  f->open_array_section("extents");
3016 
3017  for (auto& e : extent_map) {
3018  f->dump_object("extent", e);
3019  }
3020  f->close_section();
3021 }
3022 
3023 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::scan_shared_blobs(
3024  uint64_t start, uint64_t length,
3025  std::multimap<uint64_t /*blob.logical_offset*/, Blob*>& candidates)
3026 {
3027  Collection* c = onode->c;
3028  uint64_t end = start + length;
3029  // last_encoded_id will be used to process each blob only once
3030  // so reset them first
3031  auto ep_start = seek_lextent(start);
3032  for (auto ep = ep_start; ep != extent_map.end(); ++ep) {
3033  // ep->logical_offset and ep->blob_start() are different
3034  // ep->blob_start() allows us to include blobs that do have some empty space in the beginning
3035  if (ep->blob_start() >= end) {
3036  break;
3037  }
3038  ep->blob->last_encoded_id = -1;
3039  }
3040 
3041  // reuse, extent_map could not change
3042  for (auto ep = ep_start; ep != extent_map.end(); ++ep) {
3043  if (ep->blob_start() >= end) {
3044  break;
3045  }
3046  if (ep->blob->last_encoded_id == -1) {
3047  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = ep->blob->get_blob();
3048  if (blob.is_shared()) {
3049  // excellent time to load the blob
3050  c->load_shared_blob(ep->blob->shared_blob);
3051  if (!blob.is_compressed()) {
3052  // Restrict elastic shared blobs to non-compressed blobs.
3053  // Fsck cannot handle case when one shared blob contains refs to
3054  // both shared and non-shared blobs.
3055 
3056  // todo consider change to emplace_hint
3057  candidates.emplace(ep->blob_start(), ep->blob.get());
3058  }
3059  }
3060  // mark as processed
3061  ep->blob->last_encoded_id = 0;
3062  }
3063  }
3064 }
3065 
3066 BlueStore::Blob* BlueStore::ExtentMap::find_mergable_companion(
3067  Blob* blob_to_dissolve, uint32_t blob_start, uint32_t& blob_width,
3068  std::multimap<uint64_t /*blob_start*/, Blob*>& candidates)
3069 {
3070  dout(30) << __func__ << std::hex << " blob_start=0x" << blob_start << std::dec << dendl;
3071  Blob* result = nullptr;
3072  for (auto it = candidates.find(blob_start);
3073  it != candidates.end() && it->first == blob_start;
3074  ++it) {
3075  dout(30) << __func__ << " trying " << it->second << dendl;
3076  if (it->second->can_merge_blob(blob_to_dissolve, blob_width)) {
3077  dout(20) << __func__ << " merging " << blob_to_dissolve << " to " << it->second << dendl;
3078  result = it->second;
3079  break;
3080  }
3081  }
3082  return result;
3083 }
3084 
3085 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::reblob_extents(uint32_t blob_start, uint32_t blob_end,
3086  BlobRef from_blob, BlobRef to_blob)
3087 {
3088  if (from_blob->is_spanning()) {
3089  // Mark spanning blobs no longer spanning.
3090  // If needed will be re-spanned again in reshard().
3091  dout(20) << __func__ << " removing spanning blob" << dendl;
3092  spanning_blob_map.erase(from_blob->id);
3093  from_blob->id = -1;
3094  }
3095  auto prev = extent_map.end();
3096  for (auto ep = seek_lextent(blob_start); ep != extent_map.end();) {
3097  Extent* e = &(*ep);
3098  if (e->logical_offset > blob_end) break;
3099  if (e->blob == from_blob) {
3100  e->blob = to_blob;
3101  }
3102  if (prev != extent_map.end()) {
3103  if (prev->blob == e->blob &&
3104  prev->blob_offset + prev->length == e->blob_offset &&
3105  prev->logical_offset + prev->length == e->logical_offset) {
3106  prev->length += e->length;
3107  ep = extent_map.erase(ep);
3108  // we have to manually delete Extent, otherwise memory leak
3109  delete e;
3110  // prev still the same
3111  continue;
3112  }
3113  }
3114  prev = ep;
3115  ++ep;
3116  }
3117 }
3118 
3119 // Convert blobs in selected range to shared blobs.
3120 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::make_range_shared_maybe_merge(
3121  TransContext* txc, OnodeRef& onoderef, uint64_t srcoff, uint64_t length)
3122 {
3123  ceph_assert(onoderef == onode);
3124  uint64_t end = srcoff + length;
3125  uint32_t dirty_range_begin = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3126  uint32_t dirty_range_end = 0;
3127  Collection* c = onode->c;
3128  BlueStore* store = c->store;
3129  // load entire object; in most cases we clone entire object anyway
3130  fault_range(store->db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
3131  std::multimap<uint64_t /*blob_start*/, Blob*> candidates;
3132  scan_shared_blobs(srcoff, length, candidates);
3133 
3134  for (auto ep = seek_lextent(srcoff);
3135  ep != extent_map.end(); ) {
3136  auto& e = *ep;
3137  if (e.logical_offset >= end) {
3138  break;
3139  }
3140  dout(25) << __func__ << " src " << e
3141  << " bc=" << e.blob->bc << dendl;
3142  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = e.blob->get_blob();
3143  // make sure it is shared
3144  if (!blob.is_shared()) {
3145  dirty_range_begin = std::min<uint32_t>(dirty_range_begin, e.blob_start());
3146  // first try to find a shared blob nearby
3147  // that can accomodate extra extents
3148  uint32_t blob_width; //to signal when extents end
3149  dout(20) << __func__ << std::hex
3150  << " e.blob_start=" << e.blob_start()
3151  << " e.logical_offset=" << e.logical_offset
3152  << std::dec << dendl;
3153  Blob* b = blob.is_compressed() ? nullptr :
3154  find_mergable_companion(e.blob.get(), e.blob_start(), blob_width, candidates);
3155  if (b) {
3156  dout(20) << __func__ << " merging to: " << *b << " bc=" << b->bc << dendl;
3157  e.blob->discard_unused_buffers(store->cct, c->cache);
3158  b->discard_unused_buffers(store->cct, c->cache);
3159  uint32_t b_logical_length = b->merge_blob(store->cct, e.blob.get());
3160  for (auto p : blob.get_extents()) {
3161  if (p.is_valid()) {
3162  b->shared_blob->get_ref(p.offset, p.length);
3163  }
3164  }
3165  // reblob extents might erase e
3166  dirty_range_end = std::max<uint32_t>(dirty_range_end, e.blob_start() + b_logical_length);
3167  uint32_t goto_logical_offset = e.logical_offset + e.length;
3168  reblob_extents(e.blob_start(), e.blob_start() + blob_width,
3169  e.blob, b);
3170  ep = seek_lextent(goto_logical_offset);
3171  dout(20) << __func__ << " merged: " << *b << dendl;
3172  } else {
3173  // no candidate, has to convert to shared
3174  c->make_blob_shared(store->_assign_blobid(txc), e.blob);
3175  ceph_assert(e.logical_end() > 0);
3176  dirty_range_end = std::max<uint32_t>(dirty_range_end, e.logical_end());
3177  ++ep;
3178  }
3179  } else {
3180  c->load_shared_blob(e.blob->shared_blob);
3181  ++ep;
3182  }
3183  }
3184  if (dirty_range_begin < dirty_range_end) {
3185  // source onode got modified in the process
3186  dirty_range(dirty_range_begin, dirty_range_end - dirty_range_begin);
3187  maybe_reshard(dirty_range_begin, dirty_range_end);
3188  txc->write_onode(onoderef);
3189  }
3190 }
3191 
3192 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::dup(BlueStore* b, TransContext* txc,
3193  CollectionRef& c, OnodeRef& oldo, OnodeRef& newo, uint64_t& srcoff,
3194  uint64_t& length, uint64_t& dstoff) {
3195  //_dup_writing needs cache lock
3196  BufferCacheShard* bcs = c->cache;
3197  bcs->lock.lock();
3198  while(bcs != c->cache) {
3199  bcs->lock.unlock();
3200  bcs = c->cache;
3201  bcs->lock.lock();
3202  }
3203 
3204  vector<BlobRef> id_to_blob(oldo->extent_map.extent_map.size());
3205  for (auto& e : oldo->extent_map.extent_map) {
3206  e.blob->last_encoded_id = -1;
3207  }
3208 
3209  int n = 0;
3210  uint64_t end = srcoff + length;
3211  uint32_t dirty_range_begin = 0;
3212  uint32_t dirty_range_end = 0;
3213  bool src_dirty = false;
3214  for (auto ep = oldo->extent_map.seek_lextent(srcoff);
3215  ep != oldo->extent_map.extent_map.end();
3216  ++ep) {
3217  auto& e = *ep;
3218  if (e.logical_offset >= end) {
3219  break;
3220  }
3221  dout(20) << __func__ << " src " << e << dendl;
3222  BlobRef cb;
3223  bool blob_duped = true;
3224  if (e.blob->last_encoded_id >= 0) {
3225  cb = id_to_blob[e.blob->last_encoded_id];
3226  blob_duped = false;
3227  } else {
3228  // dup the blob
3229  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = e.blob->get_blob();
3230  // make sure it is shared
3231  if (!blob.is_shared()) {
3232  c->make_blob_shared(b->_assign_blobid(txc), e.blob);
3233  if (!src_dirty) {
3234  src_dirty = true;
3235  dirty_range_begin = e.logical_offset;
3236  }
3237  ceph_assert(e.logical_end() > 0);
3238  // -1 to exclude next potential shard
3239  dirty_range_end = e.logical_end() - 1;
3240  } else {
3241  c->load_shared_blob(e.blob->shared_blob);
3242  }
3243  cb = new Blob();
3244  e.blob->last_encoded_id = n;
3245  id_to_blob[n] = cb;
3246  e.blob->dup(*cb);
3247  // By default do not copy buffers to clones, and let them read data by themselves.
3248  // The exception are 'writing' buffers, which are not yet stable on device.
3249  bool some_copied = e.blob->bc._dup_writing(cb->shared_blob->get_cache(), &cb->bc);
3250  if (some_copied) {
3251  // Pretend we just wrote those buffers;
3252  // we need to get _finish_write called, so we can clear then from writing list.
3253  // Otherwise it will be stuck until someone does write-op on clone.
3254  txc->blobs_written.insert(cb);
3255  }
3256 
3257  // bump the extent refs on the copied blob's extents
3258  for (auto p : blob.get_extents()) {
3259  if (p.is_valid()) {
3260  e.blob->shared_blob->get_ref(p.offset, p.length);
3261  }
3262  }
3263  txc->write_shared_blob(e.blob->shared_blob);
3264  dout(20) << __func__ << " new " << *cb << dendl;
3265  }
3266 
3267  int skip_front, skip_back;
3268  if (e.logical_offset < srcoff) {
3269  skip_front = srcoff - e.logical_offset;
3270  } else {
3271  skip_front = 0;
3272  }
3273  if (e.logical_end() > end) {
3274  skip_back = e.logical_end() - end;
3275  } else {
3276  skip_back = 0;
3277  }
3278 
3279  Extent* ne = new Extent(e.logical_offset + skip_front + dstoff - srcoff,
3280  e.blob_offset + skip_front, e.length - skip_front - skip_back, cb);
3281  newo->extent_map.extent_map.insert(*ne);
3282  ne->blob->get_ref(c.get(), ne->blob_offset, ne->length);
3283  // fixme: we may leave parts of new blob unreferenced that could
3284  // be freed (relative to the shared_blob).
3285  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += ne->length;
3286  if (e.blob->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
3287  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_original() += ne->length;
3288  if (blob_duped) {
3289  txc->statfs_delta.compressed() +=
3290  cb->get_blob().get_compressed_payload_length();
3291  }
3292  }
3293  dout(20) << __func__ << " dst " << *ne << dendl;
3294  ++n;
3295  }
3296  if (src_dirty) {
3297  oldo->extent_map.dirty_range(dirty_range_begin,
3298  dirty_range_end - dirty_range_begin);
3299  txc->write_onode(oldo);
3300  }
3301  txc->write_onode(newo);
3302 
3303  if (dstoff + length > newo->onode.size) {
3304  newo->onode.size = dstoff + length;
3305  }
3306  newo->extent_map.dirty_range(dstoff, length);
3307  //_dup_writing needs cache lock
3308  bcs->lock.unlock();
3309 }
3310 
3311 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::dup_esb(BlueStore* b, TransContext* txc,
3312  CollectionRef& c, OnodeRef& oldo, OnodeRef& newo, uint64_t& srcoff,
3313  uint64_t& length, uint64_t& dstoff) {
3314  ceph_assert(onode == oldo);
3315  ceph_assert(onode->c == c);
3316  BufferCacheShard* bcs = c->cache;
3317  bcs->lock.lock();
3318  while(bcs != c->cache) {
3319  bcs->lock.unlock();
3320  bcs = c->cache;
3321  bcs->lock.lock();
3322  }
3323 
3324  dout(25) << __func__ << " start oldo=" << dendl;
3325  _dump_onode<25>(onode->c->store->cct, *oldo);
3326  dout(25) << __func__ << " start newo=" << dendl;
3327  _dump_onode<25>(onode->c->store->cct, *newo);
3328 
3329  make_range_shared_maybe_merge(txc, oldo, srcoff, length);
3330  vector<BlobRef> id_to_blob(extent_map.size());
3331  for (auto& e : extent_map) {
3332  e.blob->last_encoded_id = -1;
3333  }
3334 
3335  int n = 0;
3336  uint64_t end = srcoff + length;
3337  uint32_t dirty_range_begin = 0;
3338  uint32_t dirty_range_end = 0;
3339  bool src_dirty = false;
3340  for (auto ep = seek_lextent(srcoff); ep != extent_map.end(); ++ep) {
3341  auto& e = *ep;
3342  if (e.logical_offset >= end) {
3343  break;
3344  }
3345  dout(20) << __func__ << " src " << e << dendl;
3346  BlobRef cb;
3347  bool blob_duped = true;
3348  if (e.blob->last_encoded_id >= 0) {
3349  cb = id_to_blob[e.blob->last_encoded_id];
3350  blob_duped = false;
3351  } else {
3352  // dup the blob
3353  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = e.blob->get_blob();
3354  ceph_assert(blob.is_shared());
3355  ceph_assert(e.blob->shared_blob->is_loaded());
3356  ceph_assert(!blob.has_unused());
3357  cb = new Blob();
3358  e.blob->last_encoded_id = n;
3359  id_to_blob[n] = cb;
3360  ceph_assert(ep->blob_start() < end);
3361  // dup entire blob or dup parts only
3362  if (blob.is_compressed()) {
3363  // copy whole blob, but without used_in_blob
3364  cb->dup(*e.blob, false);
3365  } else if (e.blob_start() >= srcoff && e.blob_end() <= end) {
3366  // copy whole blob, including used_in_blob
3367  cb->dup(*e.blob, true);
3368  } else {
3369  // we must copy source blob diligently region-by-region
3370  // initialize shared_blob
3371  cb->dirty_blob().set_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_SHARED);
3372  cb->set_shared_blob(e.blob->shared_blob);
3373  }
3374  // By default do not copy buffers to clones, and let them read data by themselves.
3375  // The exception are 'writing' buffers, which are not yet stable on device.
3376  bool some_copied = e.blob->bc._dup_writing(cb->shared_blob->get_cache(), &cb->bc);
3377  if (some_copied) {
3378  // Pretend we just wrote those buffers;
3379  // we need to get _finish_write called, so we can clear then from writing list.
3380  // Otherwise it will be stuck until someone does write-op on the clone.
3381  txc->blobs_written.insert(cb);
3382  }
3383 
3384  txc->write_shared_blob(e.blob->shared_blob);
3385  dout(20) << __func__ << " new " << *cb << dendl;
3386  }
3387 
3388  int skip_front, skip_back;
3389  if (e.logical_offset < srcoff) {
3390  skip_front = srcoff - e.logical_offset;
3391  } else {
3392  skip_front = 0;
3393  }
3394  if (e.logical_end() > end) {
3395  skip_back = e.logical_end() - end;
3396  } else {
3397  skip_back = 0;
3398  }
3399 
3400  Extent* ne = new Extent(e.logical_offset + skip_front + dstoff - srcoff,
3401  e.blob_offset + skip_front, e.length - skip_front - skip_back, cb);
3402  newo->extent_map.extent_map.insert(*ne);
3403  if (e.blob->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
3404  // blob itself was copied, but used_in_blob was not
3405  cb->get_ref(c.get(), e.blob_offset + skip_front, e.length - skip_front - skip_back);
3406  } else
3407  if (e.blob_start() >= srcoff && e.blob_end() <= end) {
3408  // blob already copied
3409  } else {
3410  // copy part
3411  uint32_t min_release_size = e.blob->get_blob().get_release_size(c->store->min_alloc_size);
3412  cb->copy_from(b->cct, *e.blob, min_release_size,
3413  e.blob_offset + skip_front, e.length - skip_front - skip_back);
3414  }
3415 
3416  // fixme: we may leave parts of new blob unreferenced that could
3417  // be freed (relative to the shared_blob).
3418  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += ne->length;
3419  if (e.blob->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
3420  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_original() += ne->length;
3421  if (blob_duped) {
3422  txc->statfs_delta.compressed() +=
3423  cb->get_blob().get_compressed_payload_length();
3424  }
3425  }
3426  dout(20) << __func__ << " dst " << *ne << dendl;
3427  ++n;
3428  }
3429  if (src_dirty) {
3430  dirty_range(dirty_range_begin, dirty_range_end - dirty_range_begin);
3431  txc->write_onode(oldo);
3432  }
3433 
3434  if (dstoff + length > newo->onode.size) {
3435  newo->onode.size = dstoff + length;
3436  }
3437  newo->extent_map.dirty_range(dstoff, length);
3438  newo->extent_map.maybe_reshard(dstoff, dstoff + length);
3439  txc->write_onode(newo);
3440  dout(25) << __func__ << " end oldo=" << dendl;
3441  _dump_onode<25>(onode->c->store->cct, *oldo);
3442  dout(25) << __func__ << " end newo=" << dendl;
3443  _dump_onode<25>(onode->c->store->cct, *newo);
3444  bcs->lock.unlock();
3445 }
3446 
3447 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::update(KeyValueDB::Transaction t,
3448  bool force)
3449 {
3450  auto cct = onode->c->store->cct; //used by dout
3451  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << onode->oid << (force ? " force" : "") << dendl;
3452  if (onode->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
3453  if (inline_bl.length() == 0) {
3454  unsigned n;
3455  // we need to encode inline_bl to measure encoded length
3456  bool never_happen = encode_some(0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE, inline_bl, &n);
3457  inline_bl.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_inline_bl);
3458  ceph_assert(!never_happen);
3459  size_t len = inline_bl.length();
3460  dout(20) << __func__ << " inline shard " << len << " bytes from " << n
3461  << " extents" << dendl;
3462  if (!force && len > cct->_conf->bluestore_extent_map_shard_max_size) {
3463  request_reshard(0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
3464  return;
3465  }
3466  }
3467  // will persist in the onode key.
3468  } else {
3469  // pending shard update
3470  struct dirty_shard_t {
3471  Shard *shard;
3472  bufferlist bl;
3473  dirty_shard_t(Shard *s) : shard(s) {}
3474  };
3475  vector<dirty_shard_t> encoded_shards;
3476  // allocate slots for all shards in a single call instead of
3477  // doing multiple allocations - one per each dirty shard
3478  encoded_shards.reserve(shards.size());
3479 
3480  auto p = shards.begin();
3481  auto prev_p = p;
3482  while (p != shards.end()) {
3483  ceph_assert(p->shard_info->offset >= prev_p->shard_info->offset);
3484  auto n = p;
3485  ++n;
3486  if (p->dirty) {
3487  uint32_t endoff;
3488  if (n == shards.end()) {
3489  endoff = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3490  } else {
3491  endoff = n->shard_info->offset;
3492  }
3493  encoded_shards.emplace_back(dirty_shard_t(&(*p)));
3494  bufferlist& bl = encoded_shards.back().bl;
3495  if (encode_some(p->shard_info->offset, endoff - p->shard_info->offset,
3496  bl, &p->extents)) {
3497  if (force) {
3498  _dump_extent_map<-1>(cct, *this);
3499  derr << __func__ << " encode_some needs reshard" << dendl;
3500  ceph_assert(!force);
3501  }
3502  }
3503  size_t len = bl.length();
3504 
3505  dout(20) << __func__ << " shard 0x" << std::hex
3506  << p->shard_info->offset << std::dec << " is " << len
3507  << " bytes (was " << p->shard_info->bytes << ") from "
3508  << p->extents << " extents" << dendl;
3509 
3510  if (!force) {
3511  if (len > cct->_conf->bluestore_extent_map_shard_max_size) {
3512  // we are big; reshard ourselves
3513  request_reshard(p->shard_info->offset, endoff);
3514  }
3515  // avoid resharding the trailing shard, even if it is small
3516  else if (n != shards.end() &&
3517  len < g_conf()->bluestore_extent_map_shard_min_size) {
3518  ceph_assert(endoff != OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
3519  if (p == shards.begin()) {
3520  // we are the first shard, combine with next shard
3521  request_reshard(p->shard_info->offset, endoff + 1);
3522  } else {
3523  // combine either with the previous shard or the next,
3524  // whichever is smaller
3525  if (prev_p->shard_info->bytes > n->shard_info->bytes) {
3526  request_reshard(p->shard_info->offset, endoff + 1);
3527  } else {
3528  request_reshard(prev_p->shard_info->offset, endoff);
3529  }
3530  }
3531  }
3532  }
3533  }
3534  prev_p = p;
3535  p = n;
3536  }
3537  if (needs_reshard()) {
3538  return;
3539  }
3540 
3541  // schedule DB update for dirty shards
3542  string key;
3543  for (auto& it : encoded_shards) {
3544  dout(20) << __func__ << " encoding key for shard 0x" << std::hex
3545  << it.shard->shard_info->offset << std::dec << dendl;
3546  it.shard->dirty = false;
3547  it.shard->shard_info->bytes = it.bl.length();
3548  generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(
3549  onode->key,
3550  it.shard->shard_info->offset,
3551  &key,
3552  [&](const string& final_key) {
3553  t->set(PREFIX_OBJ, final_key, it.bl);
3554  }
3555  );
3556  }
3557  }
3558 }
3559 
3560 bid_t BlueStore::ExtentMap::allocate_spanning_blob_id()
3561 {
3562  if (spanning_blob_map.empty())
3563  return 0;
3564  bid_t bid = spanning_blob_map.rbegin()->first + 1;
3565  // bid is valid and available.
3566  if (bid >= 0)
3567  return bid;
3568  // Find next unused bid;
3569  bid = rand() % (numeric_limits<bid_t>::max() + 1);
3570  const auto begin_bid = bid;
3571  do {
3572  if (!spanning_blob_map.count(bid))
3573  return bid;
3574  else {
3575  bid++;
3576  if (bid < 0) bid = 0;
3577  }
3578  } while (bid != begin_bid);
3579  auto cct = onode->c->store->cct; // used by dout
3580  _dump_onode<0>(cct, *onode);
3581  ceph_abort_msg("no available blob id");
3582 }
3583 
3584 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::reshard(
3585  KeyValueDB *db,
3586  KeyValueDB::Transaction t)
3587 {
3588  auto cct = onode->c->store->cct; // used by dout
3589 
3590  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x[" << std::hex << needs_reshard_begin << ","
3591  << needs_reshard_end << ")" << std::dec
3592  << " of " << onode->onode.extent_map_shards.size()
3593  << " shards on " << onode->oid << dendl;
3594  for (auto& p : spanning_blob_map) {
3595  dout(20) << __func__ << " spanning blob " << p.first << " " << *p.second
3596  << dendl;
3597  }
3598  // determine shard index range
3599  unsigned si_begin = 0, si_end = 0;
3600  if (!shards.empty()) {
3601  while (si_begin + 1 < shards.size() &&
3602  shards[si_begin + 1].shard_info->offset <= needs_reshard_begin) {
3603  ++si_begin;
3604  }
3605  needs_reshard_begin = shards[si_begin].shard_info->offset;
3606  for (si_end = si_begin; si_end < shards.size(); ++si_end) {
3607  if (shards[si_end].shard_info->offset >= needs_reshard_end) {
3608  needs_reshard_end = shards[si_end].shard_info->offset;
3609  break;
3610  }
3611  }
3612  if (si_end == shards.size()) {
3613  needs_reshard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3614  }
3615  dout(20) << __func__ << " shards [" << si_begin << "," << si_end << ")"
3616  << " over 0x[" << std::hex << needs_reshard_begin << ","
3617  << needs_reshard_end << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
3618  } else {
3619  // When sharding is not applied yet, it is an error to request reshard on range.
3620  // The problem is that reshard() function will not touch any extent outside the range.
3621  // Thus initial reshard() must encompass whole object.
3622  needs_reshard_begin = 0;
3623  needs_reshard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3624  }
3625 
3626  fault_range(db, needs_reshard_begin, (needs_reshard_end - needs_reshard_begin));
3627 
3628  // we may need to fault in a larger interval later must have all
3629  // referring extents for spanning blobs loaded in order to have
3630  // accurate use_tracker values.
3631  uint32_t spanning_scan_begin = needs_reshard_begin;
3632  uint32_t spanning_scan_end = needs_reshard_end;
3633 
3634  // remove old keys
3635  string key;
3636  for (unsigned i = si_begin; i < si_end; ++i) {
3637  generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(
3638  onode->key, shards[i].shard_info->offset, &key,
3639  [&](const string& final_key) {
3640  t->rmkey(PREFIX_OBJ, final_key);
3641  }
3642  );
3643  }
3644 
3645  // calculate average extent size
3646  unsigned bytes = 0;
3647  unsigned extents = 0;
3648  if (onode->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
3649  bytes = inline_bl.length();
3650  extents = extent_map.size();
3651  } else {
3652  for (unsigned i = si_begin; i < si_end; ++i) {
3653  bytes += shards[i].shard_info->bytes;
3654  extents += shards[i].extents;
3655  }
3656  }
3657  unsigned target = cct->_conf->bluestore_extent_map_shard_target_size;
3658  unsigned slop = target *
3659  cct->_conf->bluestore_extent_map_shard_target_size_slop;
3660  unsigned extent_avg = bytes / std::max(1u, extents);
3661  dout(20) << __func__ << " extent_avg " << extent_avg << ", target " << target
3662  << ", slop " << slop << dendl;
3663 
3664  // reshard
3665  unsigned estimate = 0;
3666  unsigned offset = needs_reshard_begin;
3667  vector<bluestore_onode_t::shard_info> new_shard_info;
3668  unsigned max_blob_end = 0;
3669  Extent dummy(needs_reshard_begin);
3670  for (auto e = extent_map.lower_bound(dummy);
3671  e != extent_map.end();
3672  ++e) {
3673  if (e->logical_offset >= needs_reshard_end) {
3674  break;
3675  }
3676  dout(30) << " extent " << *e << dendl;
3677 
3678  // disfavor shard boundaries that span a blob
3679  bool would_span = (e->logical_offset < max_blob_end) || e->blob_offset;
3680  if (estimate &&
3681  estimate + extent_avg > target + (would_span ? slop : 0)) {
3682  // new shard
3683  if (offset == needs_reshard_begin) {
3684  new_shard_info.emplace_back(bluestore_onode_t::shard_info());
3685  new_shard_info.back().offset = offset;
3686  dout(20) << __func__ << " new shard 0x" << std::hex << offset
3687  << std::dec << dendl;
3688  }
3689  offset = e->logical_offset;
3690  new_shard_info.emplace_back(bluestore_onode_t::shard_info());
3691  new_shard_info.back().offset = offset;
3692  dout(20) << __func__ << " new shard 0x" << std::hex << offset
3693  << std::dec << dendl;
3694  estimate = 0;
3695  }
3696  estimate += extent_avg;
3697  unsigned bs = e->blob_start();
3698  if (bs < spanning_scan_begin) {
3699  spanning_scan_begin = bs;
3700  }
3701  uint32_t be = e->blob_end();
3702  if (be > max_blob_end) {
3703  max_blob_end = be;
3704  }
3705  if (be > spanning_scan_end) {
3706  spanning_scan_end = be;
3707  }
3708  }
3709  if (new_shard_info.empty() && (si_begin > 0 ||
3710  si_end < shards.size())) {
3711  // we resharded a partial range; we must produce at least one output
3712  // shard
3713  new_shard_info.emplace_back(bluestore_onode_t::shard_info());
3714  new_shard_info.back().offset = needs_reshard_begin;
3715  dout(20) << __func__ << " new shard 0x" << std::hex << needs_reshard_begin
3716  << std::dec << " (singleton degenerate case)" << dendl;
3717  }
3718 
3719  auto& sv = onode->onode.extent_map_shards;
3720  dout(20) << __func__ << " new " << new_shard_info << dendl;
3721  dout(20) << __func__ << " old " << sv << dendl;
3722  if (sv.empty()) {
3723  // no old shards to keep
3724  sv.swap(new_shard_info);
3725  init_shards(true, true);
3726  } else {
3727  // splice in new shards
3728  sv.erase(sv.begin() + si_begin, sv.begin() + si_end);
3729  shards.erase(shards.begin() + si_begin, shards.begin() + si_end);
3730  sv.insert(
3731  sv.begin() + si_begin,
3732  new_shard_info.begin(),
3733  new_shard_info.end());
3734  shards.insert(shards.begin() + si_begin, new_shard_info.size(), Shard());
3735  si_end = si_begin + new_shard_info.size();
3736 
3737  ceph_assert(sv.size() == shards.size());
3738 
3739  // note that we need to update every shard_info of shards here,
3740  // as sv might have been totally re-allocated above
3741  for (unsigned i = 0; i < shards.size(); i++) {
3742  shards[i].shard_info = &sv[i];
3743  }
3744 
3745  // mark newly added shards as dirty
3746  for (unsigned i = si_begin; i < si_end; ++i) {
3747  shards[i].loaded = true;
3748  shards[i].dirty = true;
3749  }
3750  }
3751  dout(20) << __func__ << " fin " << sv << dendl;
3752  inline_bl.clear();
3753 
3754  if (sv.empty()) {
3755  // no more shards; unspan all previously spanning blobs
3756  auto p = spanning_blob_map.begin();
3757  while (p != spanning_blob_map.end()) {
3758  p->second->id = -1;
3759  dout(30) << __func__ << " un-spanning " << *p->second << dendl;
3760  p = spanning_blob_map.erase(p);
3761  }
3762  } else {
3763  // identify new spanning blobs
3764  dout(20) << __func__ << " checking spanning blobs 0x[" << std::hex
3765  << spanning_scan_begin << "," << spanning_scan_end << ")" << dendl;
3766  if (spanning_scan_begin < needs_reshard_begin) {
3767  fault_range(db, spanning_scan_begin,
3768  needs_reshard_begin - spanning_scan_begin);
3769  }
3770  if (spanning_scan_end > needs_reshard_end) {
3771  fault_range(db, needs_reshard_end,
3772  spanning_scan_end - needs_reshard_end);
3773  }
3774  auto sp = sv.begin() + si_begin;
3775  auto esp = sv.end();
3776  unsigned shard_start = sp->offset;
3777  unsigned shard_end;
3778  ++sp;
3779  if (sp == esp) {
3780  shard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3781  } else {
3782  shard_end = sp->offset;
3783  }
3784  Extent dummy(needs_reshard_begin);
3785 
3786  bool was_too_many_blobs_check = false;
3787  auto too_many_blobs_threshold =
3788  g_conf()->bluestore_debug_too_many_blobs_threshold;
3789  auto& dumped_onodes = onode->c->onode_space.cache->dumped_onodes;
3790  decltype(onode->c->onode_space.cache->dumped_onodes)::value_type* oid_slot = nullptr;
3791  decltype(onode->c->onode_space.cache->dumped_onodes)::value_type* oldest_slot = nullptr;
3792 
3793  for (auto e = extent_map.lower_bound(dummy); e != extent_map.end(); ++e) {
3794  if (e->logical_offset >= needs_reshard_end) {
3795  break;
3796  }
3797  dout(30) << " extent " << *e << dendl;
3798  while (e->logical_offset >= shard_end) {
3799  shard_start = shard_end;
3800  ceph_assert(sp != esp);
3801  ++sp;
3802  if (sp == esp) {
3803  shard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
3804  } else {
3805  shard_end = sp->offset;
3806  }
3807  dout(30) << __func__ << " shard 0x" << std::hex << shard_start
3808  << " to 0x" << shard_end << std::dec << dendl;
3809  }
3810 
3811  if (e->blob_escapes_range(shard_start, shard_end - shard_start)) {
3812  if (!e->blob->is_spanning()) {
3813  // We have two options: (1) split the blob into pieces at the
3814  // shard boundaries (and adjust extents accordingly), or (2)
3815  // mark it spanning. We prefer to cut the blob if we can. Note that
3816  // we may have to split it multiple times--potentially at every
3817  // shard boundary.
3818  bool must_span = false;
3819  BlobRef b = e->blob;
3820  if (b->can_split()) {
3821  uint32_t bstart = e->blob_start();
3822  uint32_t bend = e->blob_end();
3823  for (const auto& sh : shards) {
3824  if (bstart < sh.shard_info->offset &&
3825  bend > sh.shard_info->offset) {
3826  uint32_t blob_offset = sh.shard_info->offset - bstart;
3827  if (b->can_split_at(blob_offset)) {
3828  dout(20) << __func__ << " splitting blob, bstart 0x"
3829  << std::hex << bstart << " blob_offset 0x"
3830  << blob_offset << std::dec << " " << *b << dendl;
3831  b = split_blob(b, blob_offset, sh.shard_info->offset);
3832  // switch b to the new right-hand side, in case it
3833  // *also* has to get split.
3834  bstart += blob_offset;
3835  onode->c->store->logger->inc(l_bluestore_blob_split);
3836  } else {
3837  must_span = true;
3838  break;
3839  }
3840  }
3841  }
3842  } else {
3843  must_span = true;
3844  }
3845  if (must_span) {
3846  auto bid = allocate_spanning_blob_id();
3847  b->id = bid;
3848  spanning_blob_map[b->id] = b;
3849  dout(20) << __func__ << " adding spanning " << *b << dendl;
3850  if (!was_too_many_blobs_check &&
3851  too_many_blobs_threshold &&
3852  spanning_blob_map.size() >= size_t(too_many_blobs_threshold)) {
3853 
3854  was_too_many_blobs_check = true;
3855  for (size_t i = 0; i < dumped_onodes.size(); ++i) {
3856  if (dumped_onodes[i].first == onode->oid) {
3857  oid_slot = &dumped_onodes[i];
3858  break;
3859  }
3860  if (!oldest_slot || (oldest_slot &&
3861  dumped_onodes[i].second < oldest_slot->second)) {
3862  oldest_slot = &dumped_onodes[i];
3863  }
3864  }
3865  }
3866  }
3867  }
3868  } else {
3869  if (e->blob->is_spanning()) {
3870  spanning_blob_map.erase(e->blob->id);
3871  e->blob->id = -1;
3872  dout(30) << __func__ << " un-spanning " << *e->blob << dendl;
3873  }
3874  }
3875  }
3876  bool do_dump = (!oid_slot && was_too_many_blobs_check) ||
3877  (oid_slot &&
3878  (mono_clock::now() - oid_slot->second >= make_timespan(5 * 60)));
3879  if (do_dump) {
3880  dout(0) << __func__
3881  << " spanning blob count exceeds threshold, "
3882  << spanning_blob_map.size() << " spanning blobs"
3883  << dendl;
3884  _dump_onode<0>(cct, *onode);
3885  if (oid_slot) {
3886  oid_slot->second = mono_clock::now();
3887  } else {
3888  ceph_assert(oldest_slot);
3889  oldest_slot->first = onode->oid;
3890  oldest_slot->second = mono_clock::now();
3891  }
3892  }
3893  }
3894 
3895  clear_needs_reshard();
3896 }
3897 
3898 bool BlueStore::ExtentMap::encode_some(
3899  uint32_t offset,
3900  uint32_t length,
3901  bufferlist& bl,
3902  unsigned *pn)
3903 {
3904  Extent dummy(offset);
3905  auto start = extent_map.lower_bound(dummy);
3906  uint32_t end = offset + length;
3907 
3908  __u8 struct_v = 2; // Version 2 differs from v1 in blob's ref_map
3909  // serialization only. Hence there is no specific
3910  // handling at ExtentMap level.
3911 
3912  unsigned n = 0;
3913  size_t bound = 0;
3914  bool must_reshard = false;
3915  for (auto p = start;
3916  p != extent_map.end() && p->logical_offset < end;
3917  ++p, ++n) {
3918  ceph_assert(p->logical_offset >= offset);
3919  p->blob->last_encoded_id = -1;
3920  if (!p->blob->is_spanning() && p->blob_escapes_range(offset, length)) {
3921  dout(30) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
3922  << std::dec << " hit new spanning blob " << *p << dendl;
3923  request_reshard(p->blob_start(), p->blob_end());
3924  must_reshard = true;
3925  }
3926  if (!must_reshard) {
3927  denc_varint(0, bound); // blobid
3928  denc_varint(0, bound); // logical_offset
3929  denc_varint(0, bound); // len
3930  denc_varint(0, bound); // blob_offset
3931 
3932  p->blob->bound_encode(
3933  bound,
3934  struct_v,
3935  p->blob->shared_blob->get_sbid(),
3936  false);
3937  }
3938  }
3939  if (must_reshard) {
3940  return true;
3941  }
3942 
3943  denc(struct_v, bound);
3944  denc_varint(0, bound); // number of extents
3945 
3946  {
3947  auto app = bl.get_contiguous_appender(bound);
3948  denc(struct_v, app);
3949  denc_varint(n, app);
3950  if (pn) {
3951  *pn = n;
3952  }
3953 
3954  n = 0;
3955  uint64_t pos = 0;
3956  uint64_t prev_len = 0;
3957  for (auto p = start;
3958  p != extent_map.end() && p->logical_offset < end;
3959  ++p, ++n) {
3960  unsigned blobid;
3961  bool include_blob = false;
3962  if (p->blob->is_spanning()) {
3963  blobid = p->blob->id << BLOBID_SHIFT_BITS;
3964  blobid |= BLOBID_FLAG_SPANNING;
3965  } else if (p->blob->last_encoded_id < 0) {
3966  p->blob->last_encoded_id = n + 1; // so it is always non-zero
3967  include_blob = true;
3968  blobid = 0; // the decoder will infer the id from n
3969  } else {
3970  blobid = p->blob->last_encoded_id << BLOBID_SHIFT_BITS;
3971  }
3972  if (p->logical_offset == pos) {
3973  blobid |= BLOBID_FLAG_CONTIGUOUS;
3974  }
3975  if (p->blob_offset == 0) {
3976  blobid |= BLOBID_FLAG_ZEROOFFSET;
3977  }
3978  if (p->length == prev_len) {
3979  blobid |= BLOBID_FLAG_SAMELENGTH;
3980  } else {
3981  prev_len = p->length;
3982  }
3983  denc_varint(blobid, app);
3984  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_CONTIGUOUS) == 0) {
3985  denc_varint_lowz(p->logical_offset - pos, app);
3986  }
3987  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_ZEROOFFSET) == 0) {
3988  denc_varint_lowz(p->blob_offset, app);
3989  }
3990  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_SAMELENGTH) == 0) {
3991  denc_varint_lowz(p->length, app);
3992  }
3993  pos = p->logical_end();
3994  if (include_blob) {
3995  p->blob->encode(app, struct_v, p->blob->shared_blob->get_sbid(), false);
3996  }
3997  }
3998  }
3999  /*derr << __func__ << bl << dendl;
4000  derr << __func__ << ":";
4001  bl.hexdump(*_dout);
4002  *_dout << dendl;
4003  */
4004  return false;
4005 }
4006 
4008 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoder::decode_extent(
4009  Extent* le,
4010  __u8 struct_v,
4011  bptr_c_it_t& p,
4012  Collection* c)
4013 {
4014  uint64_t blobid;
4015  denc_varint(blobid, p);
4016  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_CONTIGUOUS) == 0) {
4017  uint64_t gap;
4018  denc_varint_lowz(gap, p);
4019  pos += gap;
4020  }
4021  le->logical_offset = pos;
4022  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_ZEROOFFSET) == 0) {
4023  denc_varint_lowz(le->blob_offset, p);
4024  } else {
4025  le->blob_offset = 0;
4026  }
4027  if ((blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_SAMELENGTH) == 0) {
4028  denc_varint_lowz(prev_len, p);
4029  }
4030  le->length = prev_len;
4031  if (blobid & BLOBID_FLAG_SPANNING) {
4032  consume_blobid(le, true, blobid >> BLOBID_SHIFT_BITS);
4033  } else {
4034  blobid >>= BLOBID_SHIFT_BITS;
4035  if (blobid) {
4036  consume_blobid(le, false, blobid - 1);
4037  } else {
4038  Blob *b = new Blob();
4039  uint64_t sbid = 0;
4040  b->decode(p, struct_v, &sbid, false, c);
4041  consume_blob(le, extent_pos, sbid, b);
4042  }
4043  }
4044  pos += prev_len;
4045  ++extent_pos;
4046 }
4047 
4048 unsigned BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoder::decode_some(
4049  const bufferlist& bl, Collection* c)
4050 {
4051  __u8 struct_v;
4052  uint32_t num;
4053 
4054  ceph_assert(bl.get_num_buffers() <= 1);
4055  auto p = bl.front().begin_deep();
4056  denc(struct_v, p);
4057  // Version 2 differs from v1 in blob's ref_map
4058  // serialization only. Hence there is no specific
4059  // handling at ExtentMap level below.
4060  ceph_assert(struct_v == 1 || struct_v == 2);
4061  denc_varint(num, p);
4062 
4063  extent_pos = 0;
4064  while (!p.end()) {
4065  Extent* le = get_next_extent();
4066  decode_extent(le, struct_v, p, c);
4067  add_extent(le);
4068  }
4069  ceph_assert(extent_pos == num);
4070  return num;
4071 }
4072 
4073 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoder::decode_spanning_blobs(
4074  bptr_c_it_t& p, Collection* c)
4075 {
4076  __u8 struct_v;
4077  denc(struct_v, p);
4078  // Version 2 differs from v1 in blob's ref_map
4079  // serialization only. Hence there is no specific
4080  // handling at ExtentMap level.
4081  ceph_assert(struct_v == 1 || struct_v == 2);
4082 
4083  unsigned n;
4084  denc_varint(n, p);
4085  while (n--) {
4086  BlueStore::BlobRef b(new Blob());
4087  denc_varint(b->id, p);
4088  uint64_t sbid = 0;
4089  b->decode(p, struct_v, &sbid, true, c);
4090  consume_spanning_blob(sbid, b);
4091  }
4092 }
4093 
4095 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull::consume_blobid(
4096  BlueStore::Extent* le, bool spanning, uint64_t blobid) {
4097  ceph_assert(le);
4098  if (spanning) {
4099  le->assign_blob(extent_map.get_spanning_blob(blobid));
4100  } else {
4101  ceph_assert(blobid < blobs.size());
4102  le->assign_blob(blobs[blobid]);
4103  // we build ref_map dynamically for non-spanning blobs
4104  le->blob->get_ref(
4105  extent_map.onode->c,
4106  le->blob_offset,
4107  le->length);
4108  }
4109 }
4110 
4111 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull::consume_blob(
4112  BlueStore::Extent* le, uint64_t extent_no, uint64_t sbid, BlobRef b) {
4113  ceph_assert(le);
4114  blobs.resize(extent_no + 1);
4115  blobs[extent_no] = b;
4116  extent_map.onode->c->open_shared_blob(sbid, b);
4117  le->assign_blob(b);
4118  le->blob->get_ref(
4119  extent_map.onode->c,
4120  le->blob_offset,
4121  le->length);
4122 }
4123 
4124 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull::consume_spanning_blob(
4125  uint64_t sbid, BlueStore::BlobRef b) {
4126  extent_map.spanning_blob_map[b->id] = b;
4127  extent_map.onode->c->open_shared_blob(sbid, b);
4128 }
4129 
4130 BlueStore::Extent* BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull::get_next_extent()
4131 {
4132  return new Extent();
4133 }
4134 
4135 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull::add_extent(BlueStore::Extent* le)
4136 {
4137  extent_map.extent_map.insert(*le);
4138 }
4139 
4140 unsigned BlueStore::ExtentMap::decode_some(bufferlist& bl)
4141 {
4142  ExtentDecoderFull edecoder(*this);
4143  unsigned n = edecoder.decode_some(bl, onode->c);
4144  return n;
4145 }
4146 
4147 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::bound_encode_spanning_blobs(size_t& p)
4148 {
4149  // Version 2 differs from v1 in blob's ref_map
4150  // serialization only. Hence there is no specific
4151  // handling at ExtentMap level.
4152  __u8 struct_v = 2;
4153 
4154  denc(struct_v, p);
4155  denc_varint((uint32_t)0, p);
4156  size_t key_size = 0;
4157  denc_varint((uint32_t)0, key_size);
4158  p += spanning_blob_map.size() * key_size;
4159  for (const auto& i : spanning_blob_map) {
4160  i.second->bound_encode(p, struct_v, i.second->shared_blob->get_sbid(), true);
4161  }
4162 }
4163 
4164 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::encode_spanning_blobs(
4165  bufferlist::contiguous_appender& p)
4166 {
4167  // Version 2 differs from v1 in blob's ref_map
4168  // serialization only. Hence there is no specific
4169  // handling at ExtentMap level.
4170  __u8 struct_v = 2;
4171 
4172  denc(struct_v, p);
4173  denc_varint(spanning_blob_map.size(), p);
4174  for (auto& i : spanning_blob_map) {
4175  denc_varint(i.second->id, p);
4176  i.second->encode(p, struct_v, i.second->shared_blob->get_sbid(), true);
4177  }
4178 }
4179 
4180 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::init_shards(bool loaded, bool dirty)
4181 {
4182  shards.resize(onode->onode.extent_map_shards.size());
4183  unsigned i = 0;
4184  for (auto &s : onode->onode.extent_map_shards) {
4185  shards[i].shard_info = &s;
4186  shards[i].loaded = loaded;
4187  shards[i].dirty = dirty;
4188  ++i;
4189  }
4190 }
4191 
4192 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::fault_range(
4193  KeyValueDB *db,
4194  uint32_t offset,
4195  uint32_t length)
4196 {
4197  dout(30) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
4198  << std::dec << dendl;
4199  if (shards.size() == 0) {
4200  // no sharding yet; everyting is loaded
4201  return;
4202  }
4203  auto start = seek_shard(offset);
4204  auto last = seek_shard(offset + length);
4205  ceph_assert(last >= start);
4206  ceph_assert(start >= 0);
4207 
4208  string key;
4209  while (start <= last) {
4210  ceph_assert((size_t)start < shards.size());
4211  auto p = &shards[start];
4212  if (!p->loaded) {
4213  dout(30) << __func__ << " opening shard 0x" << std::hex
4214  << p->shard_info->offset << std::dec << dendl;
4215  bufferlist v;
4216  generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(
4217  onode->key, p->shard_info->offset, &key,
4218  [&](const string& final_key) {
4219  int r = db->get(PREFIX_OBJ, final_key, &v);
4220  if (r < 0) {
4221  derr << __func__ << " missing shard 0x" << std::hex
4222  << p->shard_info->offset << std::dec << " for " << onode->oid
4223  << dendl;
4224  ceph_assert(r >= 0);
4225  }
4226  }
4227  );
4228  p->extents = decode_some(v);
4229  p->loaded = true;
4230  dout(20) << __func__ << " open shard 0x" << std::hex
4231  << p->shard_info->offset
4232  << " for range 0x" << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
4233  << " (" << v.length() << " bytes)" << dendl;
4234  ceph_assert(p->dirty == false);
4235  ceph_assert(v.length() == p->shard_info->bytes);
4236  onode->c->store->logger->inc(l_bluestore_onode_shard_misses);
4237  } else {
4238  onode->c->store->logger->inc(l_bluestore_onode_shard_hits);
4239  }
4240  ++start;
4241  }
4242 }
4243 
4244 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::dirty_range(
4245  uint32_t offset,
4246  uint32_t length)
4247 {
4248  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
4249  << std::dec << dendl;
4250  if (shards.empty()) {
4251  dout(20) << __func__ << " mark inline shard dirty" << dendl;
4252  inline_bl.clear();
4253  return;
4254  }
4255  auto start = seek_shard(offset);
4256  if (length == 0) {
4257  length = 1;
4258  }
4259  auto last = seek_shard(offset + length - 1);
4260  if (start < 0)
4261  return;
4262 
4263  ceph_assert(last >= start);
4264  while (start <= last) {
4265  ceph_assert((size_t)start < shards.size());
4266  auto p = &shards[start];
4267  if (!p->loaded) {
4268  derr << __func__ << "on write 0x" << std::hex << offset
4269  << "~" << length << " shard 0x" << p->shard_info->offset
4270  << std::dec << " is not loaded, can't mark dirty" << dendl;
4271  ceph_abort_msg("can't mark unloaded shard dirty");
4272  }
4273  if (!p->dirty) {
4274  dout(20) << __func__ << " mark shard 0x" << std::hex
4275  << p->shard_info->offset << std::dec << " dirty" << dendl;
4276  p->dirty = true;
4277  }
4278  ++start;
4279  }
4280 }
4281 
4282 BlueStore::extent_map_t::iterator BlueStore::ExtentMap::find(
4283  uint64_t offset)
4284 {
4285  Extent dummy(offset);
4286  return extent_map.find(dummy);
4287 }
4288 
4289 BlueStore::extent_map_t::iterator BlueStore::ExtentMap::seek_lextent(
4290  uint64_t offset)
4291 {
4292  Extent dummy(offset);
4293  auto fp = extent_map.lower_bound(dummy);
4294  if (fp != extent_map.begin()) {
4295  --fp;
4296  if (fp->logical_end() <= offset) {
4297  ++fp;
4298  }
4299  }
4300  return fp;
4301 }
4302 
4303 BlueStore::extent_map_t::const_iterator BlueStore::ExtentMap::seek_lextent(
4304  uint64_t offset) const
4305 {
4306  Extent dummy(offset);
4307  auto fp = extent_map.lower_bound(dummy);
4308  if (fp != extent_map.begin()) {
4309  --fp;
4310  if (fp->logical_end() <= offset) {
4311  ++fp;
4312  }
4313  }
4314  return fp;
4315 }
4316 
4317 bool BlueStore::ExtentMap::has_any_lextents(uint64_t offset, uint64_t length)
4318 {
4319  auto fp = seek_lextent(offset);
4320  if (fp == extent_map.end() || fp->logical_offset >= offset + length) {
4321  return false;
4322  }
4323  return true;
4324 }
4325 
4326 int BlueStore::ExtentMap::compress_extent_map(
4327  uint64_t offset,
4328  uint64_t length)
4329 {
4330  if (extent_map.empty())
4331  return 0;
4332  int removed = 0;
4333  auto p = seek_lextent(offset);
4334  if (p != extent_map.begin()) {
4335  --p; // start to the left of offset
4336  }
4337  // the caller should have just written to this region
4338  ceph_assert(p != extent_map.end());
4339 
4340  // identify the *next* shard
4341  auto pshard = shards.begin();
4342  while (pshard != shards.end() &&
4343  p->logical_offset >= pshard->shard_info->offset) {
4344  ++pshard;
4345  }
4346  uint64_t shard_end;
4347  if (pshard != shards.end()) {
4348  shard_end = pshard->shard_info->offset;
4349  } else {
4350  shard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
4351  }
4352 
4353  auto n = p;
4354  for (++n; n != extent_map.end(); p = n++) {
4355  if (n->logical_offset > offset + length) {
4356  break; // stop after end
4357  }
4358  while (n != extent_map.end() &&
4359  p->logical_end() == n->logical_offset &&
4360  p->blob == n->blob &&
4361  p->blob_offset + p->length == n->blob_offset &&
4362  n->logical_offset < shard_end) {
4363  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
4364  << " next shard 0x" << shard_end << std::dec
4365  << " merging " << *p << " and " << *n << dendl;
4366  p->length += n->length;
4367  rm(n++);
4368  ++removed;
4369  }
4370  if (n == extent_map.end()) {
4371  break;
4372  }
4373  if (n->logical_offset >= shard_end) {
4374  ceph_assert(pshard != shards.end());
4375  ++pshard;
4376  if (pshard != shards.end()) {
4377  shard_end = pshard->shard_info->offset;
4378  } else {
4379  shard_end = OBJECT_MAX_SIZE;
4380  }
4381  }
4382  }
4383  if (removed) {
4384  onode->c->store->logger->inc(l_bluestore_extent_compress, removed);
4385  }
4386  return removed;
4387 }
4388 
4389 void BlueStore::ExtentMap::punch_hole(
4390  CollectionRef &c,
4391  uint64_t offset,
4392  uint64_t length,
4393  old_extent_map_t *old_extents)
4394 {
4395  auto p = seek_lextent(offset);
4396  uint64_t end = offset + length;
4397  while (p != extent_map.end()) {
4398  if (p->logical_offset >= end) {
4399  break;
4400  }
4401  if (p->logical_offset < offset) {
4402  if (p->logical_end() > end) {
4403  // split and deref middle
4404  uint64_t front = offset - p->logical_offset;
4405  OldExtent* oe = OldExtent::create(c, offset, p->blob_offset + front,
4406  length, p->blob);
4407  old_extents->push_back(*oe);
4408  add(end,
4409  p->blob_offset + front + length,
4410  p->length - front - length,
4411  p->blob);
4412  p->length = front;
4413  break;
4414  } else {
4415  // deref tail
4416  ceph_assert(p->logical_end() > offset); // else seek_lextent bug
4417  uint64_t keep = offset - p->logical_offset;
4418  OldExtent* oe = OldExtent::create(c, offset, p->blob_offset + keep,
4419  p->length - keep, p->blob);
4420  old_extents->push_back(*oe);
4421  p->length = keep;
4422  ++p;
4423  continue;
4424  }
4425  }
4426  if (p->logical_offset + p->length <= end) {
4427  // deref whole lextent
4428  OldExtent* oe = OldExtent::create(c, p->logical_offset, p->blob_offset,
4429  p->length, p->blob);
4430  old_extents->push_back(*oe);
4431  rm(p++);
4432  continue;
4433  }
4434  // deref head
4435  uint64_t keep = p->logical_end() - end;
4436  OldExtent* oe = OldExtent::create(c, p->logical_offset, p->blob_offset,
4437  p->length - keep, p->blob);
4438  old_extents->push_back(*oe);
4439 
4440  add(end, p->blob_offset + p->length - keep, keep, p->blob);
4441  rm(p);
4442  break;
4443  }
4444 }
4445 
4446 BlueStore::Extent *BlueStore::ExtentMap::set_lextent(
4447  CollectionRef &c,
4448  uint64_t logical_offset,
4449  uint64_t blob_offset, uint64_t length, BlobRef b,
4450  old_extent_map_t *old_extents)
4451 {
4452  // We need to have completely initialized Blob to increment its ref counters.
4453  ceph_assert(b->get_blob().get_logical_length() != 0);
4454 
4455  // Do get_ref prior to punch_hole to prevent from putting reused blob into
4456  // old_extents list if we overwre the blob totally
4457  // This might happen during WAL overwrite.
4458  b->get_ref(onode->c, blob_offset, length);
4459 
4460  if (old_extents) {
4461  punch_hole(c, logical_offset, length, old_extents);
4462  }
4463 
4464  Extent *le = new Extent(logical_offset, blob_offset, length, b);
4465  extent_map.insert(*le);
4466  maybe_reshard(logical_offset, logical_offset + length);
4467  return le;
4468 }
4469 
4470 BlueStore::BlobRef BlueStore::ExtentMap::split_blob(
4471  BlobRef lb,
4472  uint32_t blob_offset,
4473  uint32_t pos)
4474 {
4475  uint32_t end_pos = pos + lb->get_blob().get_logical_length() - blob_offset;
4476  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << pos << " end 0x" << end_pos
4477  << " blob_offset 0x" << blob_offset << std::dec << " " << *lb
4478  << dendl;
4479  BlobRef rb = onode->c->new_blob();
4480  lb->split(onode->c, blob_offset, rb.get());
4481 
4482  for (auto ep = seek_lextent(pos);
4483  ep != extent_map.end() && ep->logical_offset < end_pos;
4484  ++ep) {
4485  if (ep->blob != lb) {
4486  continue;
4487  }
4488  if (ep->logical_offset < pos) {
4489  // split extent
4490  size_t left = pos - ep->logical_offset;
4491  Extent *ne = new Extent(pos, 0, ep->length - left, rb);
4492  extent_map.insert(*ne);
4493  ep->length = left;
4494  dout(30) << __func__ << " split " << *ep << dendl;
4495  dout(30) << __func__ << " to " << *ne << dendl;
4496  } else {
4497  // switch blob
4498  ceph_assert(ep->blob_offset >= blob_offset);
4499 
4500  ep->blob = rb;
4501  ep->blob_offset -= blob_offset;
4502  dout(30) << __func__ << " adjusted " << *ep << dendl;
4503  }
4504  }
4505  return rb;
4506 }
4507 
4508 BlueStore::ExtentMap::debug_au_vector_t
4509 BlueStore::ExtentMap::debug_list_disk_layout()
4510 {
4511  BlueStore::ExtentMap::debug_au_vector_t res;
4512  uint32_t l_pos = 0;
4513  for (auto ep = extent_map.begin(); ep != extent_map.end(); ++ep) {
4514  if (l_pos < ep->logical_offset) {
4515  // a hole in logical mapping, mark it
4516  res.emplace_back(-1ULL, ep->logical_offset - l_pos, 0, 0);
4517  }
4518  l_pos = ep->logical_offset + ep->length;
4519  const bluestore_blob_t& bblob = ep->blob->get_blob();
4520  uint32_t chunk_size = bblob.get_chunk_size(onode->c->store->block_size);
4521  uint32_t length_left = ep->length;
4522 
4523  bluestore_extent_ref_map_t* ref_map = nullptr;
4524  if (bblob.is_shared()) {
4525  ceph_assert(ep->blob->shared_blob->is_loaded());
4526  bluestore_shared_blob_t* bsblob = ep->blob->shared_blob->persistent;
4527  ref_map = &bsblob->ref_map;
4528  }
4529 
4530  unsigned csum_i = 0;
4531  size_t csum_cnt;
4532  uint32_t length;
4533  if (bblob.has_csum()) {
4534  csum_cnt = bblob.get_csum_count();
4535  uint32_t csum_chunk_size = bblob.get_csum_chunk_size();
4536  uint64_t csum_offset_align = p2align(ep->blob_offset, csum_chunk_size);
4537  csum_i = csum_offset_align / csum_chunk_size;
4538  // size of first chunk
4539  length = p2align(ep->blob_offset + csum_chunk_size, csum_chunk_size) - ep->blob_offset;
4540  length = std::min<uint32_t>(length_left, length);
4541  if (csum_chunk_size < chunk_size) {
4542  chunk_size = csum_chunk_size;
4543  }
4544  } else {
4545  length = p2align(ep->blob_offset + chunk_size, chunk_size) - ep->blob_offset;
4546  length = std::min<uint32_t>(length_left, length);
4547  }
4548 
4549  uint32_t bo = ep->blob_offset;
4550  while (length_left > 0) {
4551  uint64_t csum_val = 0;
4552  if (bblob.has_csum()) {
4553  ceph_assert(csum_cnt > csum_i);
4554  csum_val = bblob.get_csum_item(csum_i);
4555  ++csum_i;
4556  }
4557  //extract AU from extents
4558  uint64_t disk_extent_left; // length till the end of disk extent
4559  uint64_t disk_offset = bblob.calc_offset(bo, &disk_extent_left);
4560  bluestore_extent_ref_map_t::debug_len_cnt l_c = {0, std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max()};
4561  if (bblob.is_shared()) {
4562  l_c = ref_map->debug_peek(disk_offset);
4563  if (l_c.len < length) {
4564  length = l_c.len;
4565  }
4566  }
4567  res.emplace_back(disk_offset, length, csum_val, l_c.cnt);
4568  bo += length;
4569  length_left -= length;
4570  length = chunk_size;
4571  };
4572  }
4573  return res;
4574 }
4575 
4576 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const BlueStore::ExtentMap::debug_au_vector_t& auv)
4577 {
4578  out << "[";
4579  for (size_t i = 0; i < auv.size(); ++i) {
4580  if (i != 0) {
4581  out << " ";
4582  }
4583  out << "0x" << std::hex;
4584  if (auv[i].disk_offset != -1ULL) {
4585  out << auv[i].disk_offset << "~" << auv[i].disk_length
4586  << "(" << std::dec << int32_t(auv[i].ref_cnts)
4587  << "):" << std::hex << auv[i].chksum;
4588  } else {
4589  out << "~" << auv[i].disk_length << std::dec;
4590  }
4591  }
4592  out << "]" << std::dec;
4593  return out;
4594 }
4595 
4596 // Onode
4597 //
4598 // Mapping blobs over Onode's logical offsets.
4599 //
4600 // Blob is always continous. Blobs may overlap.
4601 // Non-mapped regions are "0" when read.
4602 // 1 2 3
4603 // 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef
4604 // <blob.a.blob.a><blob.b.blo> <blob.c.blob.c.blob.c.blob>
4605 // <blob.d.blob.d.b> <blob.e.blob.e>
4606 // blob.a starts at 0x0 length 0xe
4607 // blob.b starts at 0xf length 0xb
4608 // blob.c starts at 0x23 length 0x1b
4609 // blob.d starts at 0x06 length 0x12
4610 // blob.e starts at 0x2d length 0xf
4611 //
4612 // Blobs can have non-encoded parts:
4613 // 1 2 3
4614 // 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef
4615 // aaaaaa......aaabbbbb...bbbb ccccccccccccccc..........cc
4616 // dddddd........ddd .....eeeeeeeeee
4617 // "." - non-encoded parts of blob (holes)
4618 //
4619 // Mapping logical to blob:
4620 // extent_map maps {Onode's logical offset, length}=>{Blob, in-blob offset}
4621 // {0x0, 0x6}=>{blob.a, 0x0}
4622 // {0x6, 0x6}=>{blob.d, 0x0}
4623 // {0xc, 0x3}=>{blob.a, 0xc}
4624 // {0xf, 0x5}=>{blob.b, 0x0}
4625 // {0x14, 0x3}=>{blob.d, 0xe}
4626 // {0x17, 0x4}=>{blob.b, 0x8}
4627 // a hole here
4628 // {0x23, 0xe}=>{blob.c, 0x0}
4629 // and so on...
4630 //
4631 // Compressed blobs do not have non-encoded parts.
4632 // Same example as above but all blobs are compressed:
4633 // 1 2 3
4634 // 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef
4635 // aaaaaaAAAAAAaaabbbbbBBBbbbb cccccccccccccccCCCCCCCCCCcc
4636 // ddddddDDDDDDDDddd EEEEEeeeeeeeeee
4637 // A-E: parts of blobs that are never used.
4638 // This can happen when a compressed blob is overwritten partially.
4639 // The target ranges are no longer used, but are left there because they are necessary
4640 // for successful decompression.
4641 //
4642 // In compressed blobs PExtentVector and csum refer to actually occupied disk space.
4643 // Blob's logical length is larger then occupied disk space.
4644 // Mapping from extent_map always uses offsets of decompressed data.
4645 
4646 #undef dout_prefix
4647 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.onode(" << this << ")." << __func__ << " "
4648 
4649 const std::string& BlueStore::Onode::calc_omap_prefix(uint8_t flags)
4650 {
4651  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_pgmeta_omap(flags)) {
4652  return PREFIX_PGMETA_OMAP;
4653  }
4654  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpg_omap(flags)) {
4655  return PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP;
4656  }
4657  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpool_omap(flags)) {
4658  return PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP;
4659  }
4660  return PREFIX_OMAP;
4661 }
4662 
4663 // '-' < '.' < '~'
4664 void BlueStore::Onode::calc_omap_header(
4665  uint8_t flags,
4666  const Onode* o,
4667  std::string* out)
4668 {
4669  if (!bluestore_onode_t::is_pgmeta_omap(flags)) {
4670  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpg_omap(flags)) {
4671  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4672  _key_encode_u32(o->oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32(), out);
4673  } else if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpool_omap(flags)) {
4674  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4675  }
4676  }
4677  _key_encode_u64(o->onode.nid, out);
4678  out->push_back('-');
4679 }
4680 
4681 void BlueStore::Onode::calc_omap_key(uint8_t flags,
4682  const Onode* o,
4683  const std::string& key,
4684  std::string* out)
4685 {
4686  if (!bluestore_onode_t::is_pgmeta_omap(flags)) {
4687  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpg_omap(flags)) {
4688  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4689  _key_encode_u32(o->oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32(), out);
4690  } else if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpool_omap(flags)) {
4691  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4692  }
4693  }
4694  _key_encode_u64(o->onode.nid, out);
4695  out->push_back('.');
4696  out->append(key);
4697 }
4698 
4699 void BlueStore::Onode::calc_omap_tail(
4700  uint8_t flags,
4701  const Onode* o,
4702  std::string* out)
4703 {
4704  if (!bluestore_onode_t::is_pgmeta_omap(flags)) {
4705  if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpg_omap(flags)) {
4706  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4707  _key_encode_u32(o->oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32(), out);
4708  } else if (bluestore_onode_t::is_perpool_omap(flags)) {
4709  _key_encode_u64(o->c->pool(), out);
4710  }
4711  }
4712  _key_encode_u64(o->onode.nid, out);
4713  out->push_back('~');
4714 }
4715 
4716 void BlueStore::Onode::get()
4717 {
4718  ++nref;
4719  ++pin_nref;
4720 }
4721 void BlueStore::Onode::put()
4722 {
4723  if (--pin_nref == 1) {
4724  c->get_onode_cache()->maybe_unpin(this);
4725  }
4726  if (--nref == 0) {
4727  delete this;
4728  }
4729 }
4730 
4731 void BlueStore::Onode::decode_raw(
4732  BlueStore::Onode* on,
4733  const bufferlist& v,
4734  BlueStore::ExtentMap::ExtentDecoder& edecoder)
4735 {
4736  on->exists = true;
4737  auto p = v.front().begin_deep();
4738  on->onode.decode(p);
4739 
4740  // initialize extent_map
4741  edecoder.decode_spanning_blobs(p, on->c);
4742  if (on->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
4743  denc(on->extent_map.inline_bl, p);
4744  edecoder.decode_some(on->extent_map.inline_bl, on->c);
4745  }
4746 }
4747 
4748 BlueStore::Onode* BlueStore::Onode::create_decode(
4749  CollectionRef c,
4750  const ghobject_t& oid,
4751  const string& key,
4752  const bufferlist& v,
4753  bool allow_empty)
4754 {
4755  ceph_assert(v.length() || allow_empty);
4756  Onode* on = new Onode(c.get(), oid, key);
4757 
4758  if (v.length()) {
4759  ExtentMap::ExtentDecoderFull edecoder(on->extent_map);
4760  decode_raw(on, v, edecoder);
4761 
4762  for (auto& i : on->onode.attrs) {
4763  i.second.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_meta);
4764  }
4765 
4766  // initialize extent_map
4767  if (on->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
4768  on->extent_map.inline_bl.reassign_to_mempool(
4769  mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_data);
4770  } else {
4771  on->extent_map.init_shards(false, false);
4772  }
4773  }
4774  return on;
4775 }
4776 
4777 void BlueStore::Onode::flush()
4778 {
4779  if (flushing_count.load()) {
4780  ldout(c->store->cct, 20) << __func__ << " cnt:" << flushing_count << dendl;
4781  waiting_count++;
4782  std::unique_lock l(flush_lock);
4783  while (flushing_count.load()) {
4784  flush_cond.wait(l);
4785  }
4786  waiting_count--;
4787  }
4788  ldout(c->store->cct, 20) << __func__ << " done" << dendl;
4789 }
4790 
4791 void BlueStore::Onode::dump(Formatter* f) const
4792 {
4793  onode.dump(f);
4794  extent_map.dump(f);
4795 }
4796 
4797 void BlueStore::Onode::rewrite_omap_key(const string& old, string *out)
4798 {
4799  if (!onode.is_pgmeta_omap()) {
4800  if (onode.is_perpg_omap()) {
4801  _key_encode_u64(c->pool(), out);
4802  _key_encode_u32(oid.hobj.get_bitwise_key_u32(), out);
4803  } else if (onode.is_perpool_omap()) {
4804  _key_encode_u64(c->pool(), out);
4805  }
4806  }
4807  _key_encode_u64(onode.nid, out);
4808  out->append(old.c_str() + out->length(), old.size() - out->length());
4809 }
4810 
4811 void BlueStore::Onode::decode_omap_key(const string& key, string *user_key)
4812 {
4813  size_t pos = sizeof(uint64_t) + 1;
4814  if (!onode.is_pgmeta_omap()) {
4815  if (onode.is_perpg_omap()) {
4816  pos += sizeof(uint64_t) + sizeof(uint32_t);
4817  } else if (onode.is_perpool_omap()) {
4818  pos += sizeof(uint64_t);
4819  }
4820  }
4821  *user_key = key.substr(pos);
4822 }
4823 
4824 // =======================================================
4825 // WriteContext
4826 
4828 bool BlueStore::WriteContext::has_conflict(
4829  BlobRef b,
4830  uint64_t loffs,
4831  uint64_t loffs_end,
4832  uint64_t min_alloc_size)
4833 {
4834  ceph_assert((loffs % min_alloc_size) == 0);
4835  ceph_assert((loffs_end % min_alloc_size) == 0);
4836  for (auto w : writes) {
4837  if (b == w.b) {
4838  auto loffs2 = p2align(w.logical_offset, min_alloc_size);
4839  auto loffs2_end = p2roundup(w.logical_offset + w.length0, min_alloc_size);
4840  if ((loffs <= loffs2 && loffs_end > loffs2) ||
4841  (loffs >= loffs2 && loffs < loffs2_end)) {
4842  return true;
4843  }
4844  }
4845  }
4846  return false;
4847 }
4848 
4849 // =======================================================
4850 
4851 // DeferredBatch
4852 #undef dout_prefix
4853 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore.DeferredBatch(" << this << ") "
4854 #undef dout_context
4855 #define dout_context cct
4856 
4857 void BlueStore::DeferredBatch::prepare_write(
4858  CephContext *cct,
4859  uint64_t seq, uint64_t offset, uint64_t length,
4860  bufferlist::const_iterator& blp)
4861 {
4862  _discard(cct, offset, length);
4863  auto i = iomap.insert(make_pair(offset, deferred_io()));
4864  ceph_assert(i.second); // this should be a new insertion
4865  i.first->second.seq = seq;
4866  blp.copy(length, i.first->second.bl);
4867  i.first->second.bl.reassign_to_mempool(
4868  mempool::mempool_bluestore_writing_deferred);
4869  dout(20) << __func__ << " seq " << seq
4870  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
4871  << " crc " << i.first->second.bl.crc32c(-1)
4872  << std::dec << dendl;
4873  seq_bytes[seq] += length;
4874 #ifdef DEBUG_DEFERRED
4875  _audit(cct);
4876 #endif
4877 }
4878 
4879 void BlueStore::DeferredBatch::_discard(
4880  CephContext *cct, uint64_t offset, uint64_t length)
4881 {
4882  generic_dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
4883  << std::dec << dendl;
4884  auto p = iomap.lower_bound(offset);
4885  if (p != iomap.begin()) {
4886  --p;
4887  auto end = p->first + p->second.bl.length();
4888  if (end > offset) {
4889  bufferlist head;
4890  head.substr_of(p->second.bl, 0, offset - p->first);
4891  dout(20) << __func__ << " keep head " << p->second.seq
4892  << " 0x" << std::hex << p->first << "~" << p->second.bl.length()
4893  << " -> 0x" << head.length() << std::dec << dendl;
4894  auto i = seq_bytes.find(p->second.seq);
4895  ceph_assert(i != seq_bytes.end());
4896  if (end > offset + length) {
4897  bufferlist tail;
4898  tail.substr_of(p->second.bl, offset + length - p->first,
4899  end - (offset + length));
4900  dout(20) << __func__ << " keep tail " << p->second.seq
4901  << " 0x" << std::hex << p->first << "~" << p->second.bl.length()
4902  << " -> 0x" << tail.length() << std::dec << dendl;
4903  auto &n = iomap[offset + length];
4904  n.bl.swap(tail);
4905  n.seq = p->second.seq;
4906  i->second -= length;
4907  } else {
4908  i->second -= end - offset;
4909  }
4910  ceph_assert(i->second >= 0);
4911  p->second.bl.swap(head);
4912  }
4913  ++p;
4914  }
4915  while (p != iomap.end()) {
4916  if (p->first >= offset + length) {
4917  break;
4918  }
4919  auto i = seq_bytes.find(p->second.seq);
4920  ceph_assert(i != seq_bytes.end());
4921  auto end = p->first + p->second.bl.length();
4922  if (end > offset + length) {
4923  unsigned drop_front = offset + length - p->first;
4924  unsigned keep_tail = end - (offset + length);
4925  dout(20) << __func__ << " truncate front " << p->second.seq
4926  << " 0x" << std::hex << p->first << "~" << p->second.bl.length()
4927  << " drop_front 0x" << drop_front << " keep_tail 0x" << keep_tail
4928  << " to 0x" << (offset + length) << "~" << keep_tail
4929  << std::dec << dendl;
4930  auto &s = iomap[offset + length];
4931  s.seq = p->second.seq;
4932  s.bl.substr_of(p->second.bl, drop_front, keep_tail);
4933  i->second -= drop_front;
4934  } else {
4935  dout(20) << __func__ << " drop " << p->second.seq
4936  << " 0x" << std::hex << p->first << "~" << p->second.bl.length()
4937  << std::dec << dendl;
4938  i->second -= p->second.bl.length();
4939  }
4940  ceph_assert(i->second >= 0);
4941  p = iomap.erase(p);
4942  }
4943 }
4944 
4945 void BlueStore::DeferredBatch::_audit(CephContext *cct)
4946 {
4947  map<uint64_t,int> sb;
4948  for (auto p : seq_bytes) {
4949  sb[p.first] = 0; // make sure we have the same set of keys
4950  }
4951  uint64_t pos = 0;
4952  for (auto& p : iomap) {
4953  ceph_assert(p.first >= pos);
4954  sb[p.second.seq] += p.second.bl.length();
4955  pos = p.first + p.second.bl.length();
4956  }
4957  ceph_assert(sb == seq_bytes);
4958 }
4959 
4960 
4961 // Collection
4962 
4963 #undef dout_prefix
4964 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore(" << store->path << ").collection(" << cid << " " << this << ") "
4965 
4966 BlueStore::Collection::Collection(BlueStore *store_, OnodeCacheShard *oc, BufferCacheShard *bc, coll_t cid)
4967  : CollectionImpl(store_->cct, cid),
4968  store(store_),
4969  cache(bc),
4970  exists(true),
4971  onode_space(oc),
4972  commit_queue(nullptr)
4973 {
4974 }
4975 
4976 bool BlueStore::Collection::flush_commit(Context *c)
4977 {
4978  return osr->flush_commit(c);
4979 }
4980 
4981 void BlueStore::Collection::flush()
4982 {
4983  osr->flush();
4984 }
4985 
4986 void BlueStore::Collection::flush_all_but_last()
4987 {
4988  osr->flush_all_but_last();
4989 }
4990 
4991 void BlueStore::Collection::open_shared_blob(uint64_t sbid, BlobRef b)
4992 {
4993  ceph_assert(!b->shared_blob);
4994  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = b->get_blob();
4995  if (!blob.is_shared()) {
4996  b->set_shared_blob(new SharedBlob(this));
4997  return;
4998  }
4999 
5000  SharedBlobRef sb = shared_blob_set.lookup(sbid);
5001  if (sb) {
5002  b->set_shared_blob(sb);
5003  ldout(store->cct, 10) << __func__ << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid
5004  << std::dec << " had " << *b->shared_blob << dendl;
5005  } else {
5006  b->set_shared_blob(new SharedBlob(sbid, this));
5007  shared_blob_set.add(this, b->shared_blob.get());
5008  ldout(store->cct, 10) << __func__ << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid
5009  << std::dec << " opened " << *b->shared_blob
5010  << dendl;
5011  }
5012 }
5013 
5014 void BlueStore::Collection::load_shared_blob(SharedBlobRef sb)
5015 {
5016  if (!sb->is_loaded()) {
5017 
5018  bufferlist v;
5019  string key;
5020  auto sbid = sb->get_sbid();
5021  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
5022  int r = store->db->get(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key, &v);
5023  if (r < 0) {
5024  lderr(store->cct) << __func__ << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid
5025  << std::dec << " not found at key "
5026  << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
5027  ceph_abort_msg("uh oh, missing shared_blob");
5028  }
5029 
5030  sb->loaded = true;
5031  sb->persistent = new bluestore_shared_blob_t(sbid);
5032  auto p = v.cbegin();
5033  decode(*(sb->persistent), p);
5034  ldout(store->cct, 10) << __func__ << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid
5035  << std::dec << " loaded shared_blob " << *sb << dendl;
5036  }
5037 }
5038 
5039 void BlueStore::Collection::make_blob_shared(uint64_t sbid, BlobRef b)
5040 {
5041  ldout(store->cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << *b << dendl;
5042  ceph_assert(!b->shared_blob->is_loaded());
5043 
5044  // update blob
5045  bluestore_blob_t& blob = b->dirty_blob();
5046  blob.set_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_SHARED);
5047  // drop any unused parts, unlikely we could use them in future
5048  blob.clear_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_HAS_UNUSED);
5049  // update shared blob
5050  b->shared_blob->loaded = true;
5051  b->shared_blob->persistent = new bluestore_shared_blob_t(sbid);
5052  shared_blob_set.add(this, b->shared_blob.get());
5053  for (auto p : blob.get_extents()) {
5054  if (p.is_valid()) {
5055  b->shared_blob->get_ref(
5056  p.offset,
5057  p.length);
5058  }
5059  }
5060  ldout(store->cct, 20) << __func__ << " now " << *b << dendl;
5061 }
5062 
5063 uint64_t BlueStore::Collection::make_blob_unshared(SharedBlob *sb)
5064 {
5065  ldout(store->cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << *sb << dendl;
5066  ceph_assert(sb->is_loaded());
5067 
5068  uint64_t sbid = sb->get_sbid();
5069  shared_blob_set.remove(sb);
5070  sb->loaded = false;
5071  delete sb->persistent;
5072  sb->sbid_unloaded = 0;
5073  ldout(store->cct, 20) << __func__ << " now " << *sb << dendl;
5074  return sbid;
5075 }
5076 
5077 BlueStore::OnodeRef BlueStore::Collection::get_onode(
5078  const ghobject_t& oid,
5079  bool create,
5080  bool is_createop)
5081 {
5082  ceph_assert(create ? ceph_mutex_is_wlocked(lock) : ceph_mutex_is_locked(lock));
5083 
5084  spg_t pgid;
5085  if (cid.is_pg(&pgid)) {
5086  if (!oid.match(cnode.bits, pgid.ps())) {
5087  lderr(store->cct) << __func__ << " oid " << oid << " not part of "
5088  << pgid << " bits " << cnode.bits << dendl;
5089  ceph_abort();
5090  }
5091  }
5092 
5093  OnodeRef o = onode_space.lookup(oid);
5094  if (o)
5095  return o;
5096 
5097  string key;
5098  get_object_key(store->cct, oid, &key);
5099 
5100  ldout(store->cct, 20) << __func__ << " oid " << oid << " key "
