7387  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_volume_selection_policy == "fit_to_fast") {
7388  vselector = new FitToFastVolumeSelector(
7389  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_WAL) * 95 / 100,
7390  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_DB) * 95 / 100,
7391  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW) * 95 / 100);
7392  } else {
7393  double reserved_factor = cct->_conf->bluestore_volume_selection_reserved_factor;
7394  vselector =
7395  new RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector(
7396  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_WAL) * 95 / 100,
7397  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_DB) * 95 / 100,
7398  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW) * 95 / 100,
7399  1024 * 1024 * 1024, //FIXME: set expected l0 size here
7400  rocks_opts.max_bytes_for_level_base,
7401  rocks_opts.max_bytes_for_level_multiplier,
7402  reserved_factor,
7403  cct->_conf->bluestore_volume_selection_reserved,
7404  cct->_conf->bluestore_volume_selection_policy.find("use_some_extra")
7405  == 0);
7406  }
7407  }
7408  if (create) {
7409  bluefs->mkfs(fsid, bluefs_layout);
7410  }
7411  bluefs->set_volume_selector(vselector);
7412  r = bluefs->mount();
7413  if (r < 0) {
7414  derr << __func__ << " failed bluefs mount: " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
7415  }
7416  ceph_assert_always(bluefs->maybe_verify_layout(bluefs_layout) == 0);
7417  return r;
7418 }
7419 
7420 void BlueStore::_close_bluefs()
7421 {
7422  bluefs->umount(db_was_opened_read_only);
7423  _minimal_close_bluefs();
7424 }
7425 
7426 void BlueStore::_minimal_close_bluefs()
7427 {
7428  delete bluefs;
7429  bluefs = NULL;
7430 }
7431 
7432 int BlueStore::_is_bluefs(bool create, bool* ret)
7433 {
7434  if (create) {
7435  *ret = cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs;
7436  } else {
7437  string s;
7438  int r = read_meta("bluefs", &s);
7439  if (r < 0) {
7440  derr << __func__ << " unable to read 'bluefs' meta" << dendl;
7441  return -EIO;
7442  }
7443  if (s == "1") {
7444  *ret = true;
7445  } else if (s == "0") {
7446  *ret = false;
7447  } else {
7448  derr << __func__ << " bluefs = " << s << " : not 0 or 1, aborting"
7449  << dendl;
7450  return -EIO;
7451  }
7452  }
7453  return 0;
7454 }
7455 
7456 /*
7457 * opens both DB and dependant super_meta, FreelistManager and allocator
7458 * in the proper order
7459 */
7460 int BlueStore::_open_db_and_around(bool read_only, bool to_repair)
7461 {
7462  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::read_only=" << read_only << ", to_repair=" << to_repair << dendl;
7463  {
7464  string type;
7465  int r = read_meta("type", &type);
7466  if (r < 0) {
7467  derr << __func__ << " failed to load os-type: " << cpp_strerror(r)
7468  << dendl;
7469  return r;
7470  }
7471 
7472  if (type != "bluestore") {
7473  derr << __func__ << " expected bluestore, but type is " << type << dendl;
7474  return -EIO;
7475  }
7476  }
7477 
7478  // SMR devices may require a freelist adjustment, but that can only happen after
7479  // the db is read-write. we'll stash pending changes here.
7480  std::map<uint64_t, uint64_t> zone_adjustments;
7481 
7482  int r = _open_path();
7483  if (r < 0)
7484  return r;
7485  r = _open_fsid(false);
7486  if (r < 0)
7487  goto out_path;
7488 
7489  r = _read_fsid(&fsid);
7490  if (r < 0)
7491  goto out_fsid;
7492 
7493  r = _lock_fsid();
7494  if (r < 0)
7495  goto out_fsid;
7496 
7497  r = _open_bdev(false);
7498  if (r < 0)
7499  goto out_fsid;
7500 
7501  // GBH: can probably skip open_db step in REad-Only mode when operating in NULL-FM mode
7502  // (might need to open if failed to restore from file)
7503 
7504  // open in read-only first to read FM list and init allocator
7505  // as they might be needed for some BlueFS procedures
7506  r = _open_db(false, false, true);
7507  if (r < 0)
7508  goto out_bdev;
7509 
7510  r = _open_super_meta();
7511  if (r < 0) {
7512  goto out_db;
7513  }
7514 
7515  r = _open_fm(nullptr, true, false);
7516  if (r < 0)
7517  goto out_db;
7518 
7519  r = _init_alloc(&zone_adjustments);
7520  if (r < 0)
7521  goto out_fm;
7522 
7523  // Re-open in the proper mode(s).
7524 
7525  // Can't simply bypass second open for read-only mode as we need to
7526  // load allocated extents from bluefs into allocator.
7527  // And now it's time to do that
7528  //
7529  _close_db();
7530  r = _open_db(false, to_repair, read_only);
7531  if (r < 0) {
7532  goto out_alloc;
7533  }
7534 
7535  if (!read_only) {
7536  _post_init_alloc(zone_adjustments);
7537  }
7538 
7539  // when function is called in repair mode (to_repair=true) we skip db->open()/create()
7540  // we can't change bluestore allocation so no need to invlidate allocation-file
7541  if (fm->is_null_manager() && !read_only && !to_repair) {
7542  // Now that we load the allocation map we need to invalidate the file as new allocation won't be reflected
7543  // Changes to the allocation map (alloc/release) are not updated inline and will only be stored on umount()
7544  // This means that we should not use the existing file on failure case (unplanned shutdown) and must resort
7545  // to recovery from RocksDB::ONodes
7546  r = invalidate_allocation_file_on_bluefs();
7547  if (r != 0) {
7548  derr << __func__ << "::NCB::invalidate_allocation_file_on_bluefs() failed!" << dendl;
7549  goto out_alloc;
7550  }
7551  }
7552 
7553  // when function is called in repair mode (to_repair=true) we skip db->open()/create()
7554  if (!is_db_rotational() && !read_only && !to_repair && cct->_conf->bluestore_allocation_from_file
7555 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
7556  && !bdev->is_smr()
7557 #endif
7558  ) {
7559  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::Commit to Null-Manager" << dendl;
7560  commit_to_null_manager();
7561  need_to_destage_allocation_file = true;
7562  dout(10) << __func__ << "::NCB::need_to_destage_allocation_file was set" << dendl;
7563  }
7564 
7565  return 0;
7566 
7567 out_alloc:
7568  _close_alloc();
7569 out_fm:
7570  _close_fm();
7571  out_db:
7572  _close_db();
7573  out_bdev:
7574  _close_bdev();
7575  out_fsid:
7576  _close_fsid();
7577  out_path:
7578  _close_path();
7579  return r;
7580 }
7581 
7582 void BlueStore::_close_db_and_around()
7583 {
7584  if (db) {
7585  _close_db();
7586  }
7587  _close_around_db();
7588 }
7589 
7590 void BlueStore::_close_around_db()
7591 {
7592  if (bluefs) {
7593  _close_bluefs();
7594  }
7595  _close_fm();
7596  _close_alloc();
7597  _close_bdev();
7598  _close_fsid();
7599  _close_path();
7600 }
7601 
7602 int BlueStore::open_db_environment(KeyValueDB **pdb, bool to_repair)
7603 {
7604  _kv_only = true;
7605  int r = _open_db_and_around(false, to_repair);
7606  if (r == 0) {
7607  *pdb = db;
7608  } else {
7609  *pdb = nullptr;
7610  }
7611  return r;
7612 }
7613 
7614 int BlueStore::close_db_environment()
7615 {
7616  if (db) {
7617  delete db;
7618  db = nullptr;
7619  }
7620  _close_around_db();
7621  return 0;
7622 }
7623 
7624 /* gets access to bluefs supporting RocksDB */
7625 BlueFS* BlueStore::get_bluefs() {
7626  return bluefs;
7627 }
7628 
7629 int BlueStore::_prepare_db_environment(bool create, bool read_only,
7630  std::string* _fn, std::string* _kv_backend)
7631 {
7632  int r;
7633  ceph_assert(!db);
7634  std::string& fn=*_fn;
7635  std::string& kv_backend=*_kv_backend;
7636  fn = path + "/db";
7637  std::shared_ptr<Int64ArrayMergeOperator> merge_op(new Int64ArrayMergeOperator);
7638 
7639  if (create) {
7640  kv_backend = cct->_conf->bluestore_kvbackend;
7641  } else {
7642  r = read_meta("kv_backend", &kv_backend);
7643  if (r < 0) {
7644  derr << __func__ << " unable to read 'kv_backend' meta" << dendl;
7645  return -EIO;
7646  }
7647  }
7648  dout(10) << __func__ << " kv_backend = " << kv_backend << dendl;
7649 
7650  bool do_bluefs;
7651  r = _is_bluefs(create, &do_bluefs);
7652  if (r < 0) {
7653  return r;
7654  }
7655  dout(10) << __func__ << " do_bluefs = " << do_bluefs << dendl;
7656 
7657  map<string,string> kv_options;
7658  // force separate wal dir for all new deployments.
7659  kv_options["separate_wal_dir"] = 1;
7660  rocksdb::Env *env = NULL;
7661  if (do_bluefs) {
7662  dout(10) << __func__ << " initializing bluefs" << dendl;
7663  if (kv_backend != "rocksdb") {
7664  derr << " backend must be rocksdb to use bluefs" << dendl;
7665  return -EINVAL;
7666  }
7667 
7668  r = _open_bluefs(create, read_only);
7669  if (r < 0) {
7670  return r;
7671  }
7672 
7673  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs_env_mirror) {
7674  rocksdb::Env* a = new BlueRocksEnv(bluefs);
7675  rocksdb::Env* b = rocksdb::Env::Default();
7676  if (create) {
7677  string cmd = "rm -rf " + path + "/db " +
7678  path + "/db.slow " +
7679  path + "/db.wal";
7680  int r = system(cmd.c_str());
7681  (void)r;
7682  }
7683  env = new rocksdb::EnvMirror(b, a, false, true);
7684  } else {
7685  env = new BlueRocksEnv(bluefs);
7686 
7687  // simplify the dir names, too, as "seen" by rocksdb
7688  fn = "db";
7689  }
7690  BlueFSVolumeSelector::paths paths;
7691  bluefs->get_vselector_paths(fn, paths);
7692 
7693  {
7694  ostringstream db_paths;
7695  bool first = true;
7696  for (auto& p : paths) {
7697  if (!first) {
7698  db_paths << " ";
7699  }
7700  first = false;
7701  db_paths << p.first << "," << p.second;
7702 
7703  }
7704  kv_options["db_paths"] = db_paths.str();
7705  dout(1) << __func__ << " set db_paths to " << db_paths.str() << dendl;
7706  }
7707 
7708  if (create) {
7709  for (auto& p : paths) {
7710  env->CreateDir(p.first);
7711  }
7712  // Selectors don't provide wal path so far hence create explicitly
7713  env->CreateDir(fn + ".wal");
7714  } else {
7715  std::vector<std::string> res;
7716  // check for dir presence
7717  auto r = env->GetChildren(fn+".wal", &res);
7718  if (r.IsNotFound()) {
7719  kv_options.erase("separate_wal_dir");
7720  }
7721  }
7722  } else {
7723  string walfn = path + "/db.wal";
7724 
7725  if (create) {
7726  int r = ::mkdir(fn.c_str(), 0755);
7727  if (r < 0)
7728  r = -errno;
7729  if (r < 0 && r != -EEXIST) {
7730  derr << __func__ << " failed to create " << fn << ": " << cpp_strerror(r)
7731  << dendl;
7732  return r;
7733  }
7734 
7735  // wal_dir, too!
7736  r = ::mkdir(walfn.c_str(), 0755);
7737  if (r < 0)
7738  r = -errno;
7739  if (r < 0 && r != -EEXIST) {
7740  derr << __func__ << " failed to create " << walfn
7741  << ": " << cpp_strerror(r)
7742  << dendl;
7743  return r;
7744  }
7745  } else {
7746  struct stat st;
7747  r = ::stat(walfn.c_str(), &st);
7748  if (r < 0 && errno == ENOENT) {
7749  kv_options.erase("separate_wal_dir");
7750  }
7751  }
7752  }
7753 
7754 
7755  db = KeyValueDB::create(cct,
7756  kv_backend,
7757  fn,
7758  kv_options,
7759  static_cast<void*>(env));
7760  if (!db) {
7761  derr << __func__ << " error creating db" << dendl;
7762  if (bluefs) {
7763  _close_bluefs();
7764  }
7765  // delete env manually here since we can't depend on db to do this
7766  // under this case
7767  delete env;
7768  env = NULL;
7769  return -EIO;
7770  }
7771 
7772  FreelistManager::setup_merge_operators(db, freelist_type);
7773  db->set_merge_operator(PREFIX_STAT, merge_op);
7774  db->set_cache_size(cache_kv_ratio * cache_size);
7775  return 0;
7776 }
7777 
7778 int BlueStore::_open_db(bool create, bool to_repair_db, bool read_only)
7779 {
7780  int r;
7781  ceph_assert(!(create && read_only));
7782  string options;
7783  string options_annex;
7784  stringstream err;
7785  string kv_dir_fn;
7786  string kv_backend;
7787  std::string sharding_def;
7788  // prevent write attempts to BlueFS in case we failed before BlueFS was opened
7789  db_was_opened_read_only = true;
7790  r = _prepare_db_environment(create, read_only, &kv_dir_fn, &kv_backend);
7791  if (r < 0) {
7792  derr << __func__ << " failed to prepare db environment: " << err.str() << dendl;
7793  return -EIO;
7794  }
7795  // if reached here then BlueFS is already opened
7796  db_was_opened_read_only = read_only;
7797  dout(10) << __func__ << "::db_was_opened_read_only was set to " << read_only << dendl;
7798  if (kv_backend == "rocksdb") {
7799  options = cct->_conf->bluestore_rocksdb_options;
7800  options_annex = cct->_conf->bluestore_rocksdb_options_annex;
7801  if (!options_annex.empty()) {
7802  if (!options.empty() &&
7803  *options.rbegin() != ',') {
7804  options += ',';
7805  }
7806  options += options_annex;
7807  }
7808 
7809  if (cct->_conf.get_val<bool>("bluestore_rocksdb_cf")) {
7810  sharding_def = cct->_conf.get_val<std::string>("bluestore_rocksdb_cfs");
7811  }
7812  }
7813 
7814  db->init(options);
7815  if (to_repair_db)
7816  return 0;
7817  if (create) {
7818  r = db->create_and_open(err, sharding_def);
7819  } else {
7820  // we pass in cf list here, but it is only used if the db already has
7821  // column families created.
7822  r = read_only ?
7823  db->open_read_only(err, sharding_def) :
7824  db->open(err, sharding_def);
7825  }
7826  if (r) {
7827  derr << __func__ << " erroring opening db: " << err.str() << dendl;
7828  _close_db();
7829  return -EIO;
7830  }
7831  dout(1) << __func__ << " opened " << kv_backend
7832  << " path " << kv_dir_fn << " options " << options << dendl;
7833  return 0;
7834 }
7835 
7836 void BlueStore::_close_db()
7837 {
7838  dout(10) << __func__ << ":read_only=" << db_was_opened_read_only
7839  << " fm=" << fm
7840  << " destage_alloc_file=" << need_to_destage_allocation_file
7841  << " per_pool=" << per_pool_stat_collection
7842  << " pool stats=" << osd_pools.size()
7843  << dendl;
7844  bool do_destage = !db_was_opened_read_only && need_to_destage_allocation_file;
7845  if (do_destage && is_statfs_recoverable()) {
7846  auto t = db->get_transaction();
7847  store_statfs_t s;
7848  if (per_pool_stat_collection) {
7849  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_STAT, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
7850  uint64_t pool_id;
7851  for (it->upper_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
7852  int r = get_key_pool_stat(it->key(), &pool_id);
7853  if (r >= 0) {
7854  dout(10) << __func__ << " wiping statfs for: " << pool_id << dendl;
7855  } else {
7856  derr << __func__ << " wiping invalid statfs key: " << it->key() << dendl;
7857  }
7858  t->rmkey(PREFIX_STAT, it->key());
7859  }
7860 
7861  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
7862  for(auto &p : osd_pools) {
7863  string key;
7864  get_pool_stat_key(p.first, &key);
7865  bufferlist bl;
7866  if (!p.second.is_empty()) {
7867  p.second.encode(bl);
7868  p.second.publish(&s);
7869  t->set(PREFIX_STAT, key, bl);
7870  dout(10) << __func__ << " persisting: "
7871  << p.first << "->" << s
7872  << dendl;
7873  }
7874  }
7875  } else {
7876  bufferlist bl;
7877  {
7878  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
7879  vstatfs.encode(bl);
7880  vstatfs.publish(&s);
7881  }
7882  t->set(PREFIX_STAT, BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY, bl);
7883  dout(10) << __func__ << "persisting: " << s << dendl;
7884  }
7885  int r = db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
7886  dout(10) << __func__ << " statfs persisted." << dendl;
7887  ceph_assert(r >= 0);
7888  }
7889  ceph_assert(db);
7890  delete db;
7891  db = nullptr;
7892 
7893  if (do_destage && fm && fm->is_null_manager()) {
7894  int ret = store_allocator(alloc);
7895  if (ret != 0) {
7896  derr << __func__ << "::NCB::store_allocator() failed (continue with bitmapFreelistManager)" << dendl;
7897  }
7898  }
7899 
7900  if (bluefs) {
7901  _close_bluefs();
7902  }
7903 }
7904 
7905 void BlueStore::_dump_alloc_on_failure()
7906 {
7907  auto dump_interval =
7908  cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs_alloc_failure_dump_interval;
7909  if (dump_interval > 0 &&
7910  next_dump_on_bluefs_alloc_failure <= ceph_clock_now()) {
7911  shared_alloc.a->dump();
7912  next_dump_on_bluefs_alloc_failure = ceph_clock_now();
7913  next_dump_on_bluefs_alloc_failure += dump_interval;
7914  }
7915 }
7916 
7917 int BlueStore::_open_collections()
7918 {
7919  if (!coll_map.empty()) {
7920  // could be opened from another path
7921  dout(20) << __func__ << "::NCB::collections are already opened, nothing to do" << dendl;
7922  return 0;
7923  }
7924 
7925  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
7926  collections_had_errors = false;
7927  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_COLL);
7928  size_t load_cnt = 0;
7929  for (it->upper_bound(string());
7930  it->valid();
7931  it->next()) {
7932  coll_t cid;
7933  if (cid.parse(it->key())) {
7934  auto c = ceph::make_ref<Collection>(
7935  this,
7936  onode_cache_shards[cid.hash_to_shard(onode_cache_shards.size())],
7937  buffer_cache_shards[cid.hash_to_shard(buffer_cache_shards.size())],
7938  cid);
7939  bufferlist bl = it->value();
7940  auto p = bl.cbegin();
7941  try {
7942  decode(c->cnode, p);
7943  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
7944  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode cnode, key:"
7945  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
7946  return -EIO;
7947  }
7948  dout(20) << __func__ << " opened " << cid << " " << c
7949  << " " << c->cnode << dendl;
7950  _osr_attach(c.get());
7951  coll_map[cid] = c;
7952  load_cnt++;
7953  } else {
7954  derr << __func__ << " unrecognized collection " << it->key() << dendl;
7955  collections_had_errors = true;
7956  }
7957  }
7958  dout(10) << __func__ << " collections loaded: " << load_cnt
7959  << dendl;
7960  return 0;
7961 }
7962 
7963 void BlueStore::_fsck_collections(int64_t* errors)
7964 {
7965  if (collections_had_errors) {
7966  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
7967  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_COLL, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
7968  for (it->upper_bound(string());
7969  it->valid();
7970  it->next()) {
7971  coll_t cid;
7972  if (!cid.parse(it->key())) {
7973  derr << __func__ << " unrecognized collection " << it->key() << dendl;
7974  if (errors) {
7975  (*errors)++;
7976  }
7977  }
7978  }
7979  }
7980 }
7981 
7982 void BlueStore::_set_per_pool_omap()
7983 {
7984  per_pool_omap = OMAP_BULK;
7985  bufferlist bl;
7986  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "per_pool_omap", &bl);
7987  if (bl.length()) {
7988  auto s = bl.to_str();
7989  if (s == stringify(OMAP_PER_POOL)) {
7990  per_pool_omap = OMAP_PER_POOL;
7991  } else if (s == stringify(OMAP_PER_PG)) {
7992  per_pool_omap = OMAP_PER_PG;
7993  } else {
7994  ceph_assert(s == stringify(OMAP_BULK));
7995  }
7996  dout(10) << __func__ << " per_pool_omap = " << per_pool_omap << dendl;
7997  } else {
7998  dout(10) << __func__ << " per_pool_omap not present" << dendl;
7999  }
8000  _check_no_per_pg_or_pool_omap_alert();
8001 }
8002 
8003 void BlueStore::_open_statfs()
8004 {
8005  osd_pools.clear();
8006  vstatfs.reset();
8007 
8008  bufferlist bl;
8009  int r = db->get(PREFIX_STAT, BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY, &bl);
8010  if (r >= 0) {
8011  per_pool_stat_collection = false;
8012  if (size_t(bl.length()) >= sizeof(vstatfs.values)) {
8013  auto it = bl.cbegin();
8014  vstatfs.decode(it);
8015  dout(10) << __func__ << " store_statfs is found" << dendl;
8016  } else {
8017  dout(10) << __func__ << " store_statfs is corrupt, using empty" << dendl;
8018  }
8019  _check_legacy_statfs_alert();
8020  } else {
8021  per_pool_stat_collection = true;
8022  dout(10) << __func__ << " per-pool statfs is enabled" << dendl;
8023  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_STAT, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
8024  for (it->upper_bound(string());
8025  it->valid();
8026  it->next()) {
8027 
8028  uint64_t pool_id;
8029  int r = get_key_pool_stat(it->key(), &pool_id);
8030  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8031 
8032  bufferlist bl;
8033  bl = it->value();
8034  auto p = bl.cbegin();
8035  auto& st = osd_pools[pool_id];
8036  try {
8037  st.decode(p);
8038  vstatfs += st;
8039 
8040  dout(10) << __func__ << " pool " << std::hex << pool_id
8041  << " statfs(hex) " << st
8042  << std::dec << dendl;
8043  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
8044  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode pool stats, key:"
8045  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
8046  }
8047  }
8048  }
8049  dout(10) << __func__ << " statfs " << std::hex
8050  << vstatfs << std::dec << dendl;
8051 
8052 }
8053 
8054 int BlueStore::_setup_block_symlink_or_file(
8055  string name,
8056  string epath,
8057  uint64_t size,
8058  bool create)
8059 {
8060  dout(20) << __func__ << " name " << name << " path " << epath
8061  << " size " << size << " create=" << (int)create << dendl;
8062  int r = 0;
8063  int flags = O_RDWR|O_CLOEXEC;
8064  if (create)
8065  flags |= O_CREAT;
8066  if (epath.length()) {
8067  r = ::symlinkat(epath.c_str(), path_fd, name.c_str());
8068  if (r < 0) {
8069  r = -errno;
8070  derr << __func__ << " failed to create " << name << " symlink to "
8071  << epath << ": " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8072  return r;
8073  }
8074 
8075  if (!epath.compare(0, strlen(SPDK_PREFIX), SPDK_PREFIX)) {
8076  int fd = ::openat(path_fd, epath.c_str(), flags, 0644);
8077  if (fd < 0) {
8078  r = -errno;
8079  derr << __func__ << " failed to open " << epath << " file: "
8080  << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8081  return r;
8082  }
8083  // write the Transport ID of the NVMe device
8084  // a transport id for PCIe looks like: "trtype:PCIe traddr:0000:02:00.0"
8085  // where "0000:02:00.0" is the selector of a PCI device, see
8086  // the first column of "lspci -mm -n -D"
8087  // a transport id for tcp looks like: "trype:TCP adrfam:IPv4 traddr:172.31.89.152 trsvcid:4420"
8088  string trid = epath.substr(strlen(SPDK_PREFIX));
8089  r = ::write(fd, trid.c_str(), trid.size());
8090  ceph_assert(r == static_cast<int>(trid.size()));
8091  dout(1) << __func__ << " created " << name << " symlink to "
8092  << epath << dendl;
8093  VOID_TEMP_FAILURE_RETRY(::close(fd));
8094  }
8095  }
8096  if (size) {
8097  int fd = ::openat(path_fd, name.c_str(), flags, 0644);
8098  if (fd >= 0) {
8099  // block file is present
8100  struct stat st;
8101  int r = ::fstat(fd, &st);
8102  if (r == 0 &&
8103  S_ISREG(st.st_mode) && // if it is a regular file
8104  st.st_size == 0) { // and is 0 bytes
8105  r = ::ftruncate(fd, size);
8106  if (r < 0) {
8107  r = -errno;
8108  derr << __func__ << " failed to resize " << name << " file to "
8109  << size << ": " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8110  VOID_TEMP_FAILURE_RETRY(::close(fd));
8111  return r;
8112  }
8113 
8114  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_block_preallocate_file) {
8115  r = ::ceph_posix_fallocate(fd, 0, size);
8116  if (r > 0) {
8117  derr << __func__ << " failed to prefallocate " << name << " file to "
8118  << size << ": " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8119  VOID_TEMP_FAILURE_RETRY(::close(fd));
8120  return -r;
8121  }
8122  }
8123  dout(1) << __func__ << " resized " << name << " file to "
8124  << byte_u_t(size) << dendl;
8125  }
8126  VOID_TEMP_FAILURE_RETRY(::close(fd));
8127  } else {
8128  int r = -errno;
8129  if (r != -ENOENT) {
8130  derr << __func__ << " failed to open " << name << " file: "
8131  << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8132  return r;
8133  }
8134  }
8135  }
8136  return 0;
8137 }
8138 
8139 int BlueStore::mkfs()
8140 {
8141  dout(1) << __func__ << " path " << path << dendl;
8142  int r;
8143  uuid_d old_fsid;
8144  uint64_t reserved;
8145  if (cct->_conf->osd_max_object_size > OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
8146  derr << __func__ << " osd_max_object_size "
8147  << cct->_conf->osd_max_object_size << " > bluestore max "
8148  << OBJECT_MAX_SIZE << dendl;
8149  return -EINVAL;
8150  }
8151 
8152  {
8153  string done;
8154  r = read_meta("mkfs_done", &done);
8155  if (r == 0) {
8156  dout(1) << __func__ << " already created" << dendl;
8157  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mkfs) {
8158  r = fsck(cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mkfs_deep);
8159  if (r < 0) {
8160  derr << __func__ << " fsck found fatal error: " << cpp_strerror(r)
8161  << dendl;
8162  return r;
8163  }
8164  if (r > 0) {
8165  derr << __func__ << " fsck found " << r << " errors" << dendl;
8166  r = -EIO;
8167  }
8168  }
8169  return r; // idempotent
8170  }
8171  }
8172 
8173  {
8174  string type;
8175  r = read_meta("type", &type);
8176  if (r == 0) {
8177  if (type != "bluestore") {
8178  derr << __func__ << " expected bluestore, but type is " << type << dendl;
8179  return -EIO;
8180  }
8181  } else {
8182  r = write_meta("type", "bluestore");
8183  if (r < 0)
8184  return r;
8185  }
8186  }
8187 
8188  r = _open_path();
8189  if (r < 0)
8190  return r;
8191 
8192  r = _open_fsid(true);
8193  if (r < 0)
8194  goto out_path_fd;
8195 
8196  r = _lock_fsid();
8197  if (r < 0)
8198  goto out_close_fsid;
8199 
8200  r = _read_fsid(&old_fsid);
8201  if (r < 0 || old_fsid.is_zero()) {
8202  if (fsid.is_zero()) {
8203  fsid.generate_random();
8204  dout(1) << __func__ << " generated fsid " << fsid << dendl;
8205  } else {
8206  dout(1) << __func__ << " using provided fsid " << fsid << dendl;
8207  }
8208  // we'll write it later.
8209  } else {
8210  if (!fsid.is_zero() && fsid != old_fsid) {
8211  derr << __func__ << " on-disk fsid " << old_fsid
8212  << " != provided " << fsid << dendl;
8213  r = -EINVAL;
8214  goto out_close_fsid;
8215  }
8216  fsid = old_fsid;
8217  }
8218 
8219  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file("block", cct->_conf->bluestore_block_path,
8220  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_size,
8221  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_create);
8222  if (r < 0)
8223  goto out_close_fsid;
8224  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs) {
8225  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file("block.wal", cct->_conf->bluestore_block_wal_path,
8226  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_wal_size,
8227  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_wal_create);
8228  if (r < 0)
8229  goto out_close_fsid;
8230  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file("block.db", cct->_conf->bluestore_block_db_path,
8231  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_db_size,
8232  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_db_create);
8233  if (r < 0)
8234  goto out_close_fsid;
8235  }
8236 
8237  r = _open_bdev(true);
8238  if (r < 0)
8239  goto out_close_fsid;
8240 
8241  // choose freelist manager
8242 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
8243  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
8244  freelist_type = "zoned";
8245  zone_size = bdev->get_zone_size();
8246  first_sequential_zone = bdev->get_conventional_region_size() / zone_size;
8247  bdev->reset_all_zones();
8248  } else
8249 #endif
8250  {
8251  freelist_type = "bitmap";
8252  }
8253  dout(10) << " freelist_type " << freelist_type << dendl;
8254 
8255  // choose min_alloc_size
8256  dout(5) << __func__ << " optimal_io_size 0x" << std::hex << optimal_io_size
8257  << " block_size: 0x" << block_size << std::dec << dendl;
8258  if ((cct->_conf->bluestore_use_optimal_io_size_for_min_alloc_size) && (optimal_io_size != 0)) {
8259  dout(5) << __func__ << " optimal_io_size 0x" << std::hex << optimal_io_size
8260  << " for min_alloc_size 0x" << min_alloc_size << std::dec << dendl;
8261  min_alloc_size = optimal_io_size;
8262  }
8263  else if (cct->_conf->bluestore_min_alloc_size) {
8264  min_alloc_size = cct->_conf->bluestore_min_alloc_size;
8265  } else {
8266  ceph_assert(bdev);
8267  if (_use_rotational_settings()) {
8268  min_alloc_size = cct->_conf->bluestore_min_alloc_size_hdd;
8269  } else {
8270  min_alloc_size = cct->_conf->bluestore_min_alloc_size_ssd;
8271  }
8272  }
8273  _validate_bdev();
8274 
8275  // make sure min_alloc_size is power of 2 aligned.
8276  if (!std::has_single_bit(min_alloc_size)) {
8277  derr << __func__ << " min_alloc_size 0x"
8278  << std::hex << min_alloc_size << std::dec
8279  << " is not power of 2 aligned!"
8280  << dendl;
8281  r = -EINVAL;
8282  goto out_close_bdev;
8283  }
8284 
8285  // make sure min_alloc_size is >= and aligned with block size
8286  if (min_alloc_size % block_size != 0) {
8287  derr << __func__ << " min_alloc_size 0x"
8288  << std::hex << min_alloc_size
8289  << " is less or not aligned with block_size: 0x"
8290  << block_size << std::dec << dendl;
8291  r = -EINVAL;
8292  goto out_close_bdev;
8293  }
8294 
8295  r = _create_alloc();
8296  if (r < 0) {
8297  goto out_close_bdev;
8298  }
8299 
8300  reserved = _get_ondisk_reserved();
8301  alloc->init_add_free(reserved,
8302  p2align(bdev->get_size(), min_alloc_size) - reserved);
8303 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
8304  if (bdev->is_smr() && alloc != shared_alloc.a) {
8305  shared_alloc.a->init_add_free(reserved,
8306  p2align(bdev->get_conventional_region_size(),
8307  min_alloc_size) - reserved);
8308  }
8309 #endif
8310 
8311  r = _open_db(true);
8312  if (r < 0)
8313  goto out_close_alloc;
8314 
8315  {
8316  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
8317  r = _open_fm(t, false, true);
8318  if (r < 0)
8319  goto out_close_db;
8320  {
8321  bufferlist bl;
8322  encode((uint64_t)0, bl);
8323  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "nid_max", bl);
8324  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "blobid_max", bl);
8325  }
8326 
8327  {
8328  bufferlist bl;
8329  encode((uint64_t)min_alloc_size, bl);
8330  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_alloc_size", bl);
8331  }
8332  {
8333  bufferlist bl;
8334  if (cct->_conf.get_val<bool>("bluestore_debug_legacy_omap")) {
8335  bl.append(stringify(OMAP_BULK));
8336  } else {
8337  bl.append(stringify(OMAP_PER_PG));
8338  }
8339  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "per_pool_omap", bl);
8340  }
8341 
8342 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
8343  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
8344  {
8345  bufferlist bl;
8346  encode((uint64_t)zone_size, bl);
8347  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "zone_size", bl);
8348  }
8349  {
8350  bufferlist bl;
8351  encode((uint64_t)first_sequential_zone, bl);
8352  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "first_sequential_zone", bl);
8353  }
8354  }
8355 #endif
8356 
8357  ondisk_format = latest_ondisk_format;
8358  _prepare_ondisk_format_super(t);
8359  db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
8360  }
8361 
8362  r = write_meta("kv_backend", cct->_conf->bluestore_kvbackend);
8363  if (r < 0)
8364  goto out_close_fm;
8365 
8366  r = write_meta("bluefs", stringify(bluefs ? 1 : 0));
8367  if (r < 0)
8368  goto out_close_fm;
8369 
8370  r = write_meta("elastic_shared_blobs",
8371  cct->_conf.get_val<bool>("bluestore_elastic_shared_blobs") ? "1" : "0");
8372  if (r < 0)
8373  goto out_close_fm;
8374 
8375  if (fsid != old_fsid) {
8376  r = _write_fsid();
8377  if (r < 0) {
8378  derr << __func__ << " error writing fsid: " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8379  goto out_close_fm;
8380  }
8381  }
8382 
8383  out_close_fm:
8384  _close_fm();
8385  out_close_db:
8386  _close_db();
8387  out_close_alloc:
8388  _close_alloc();
8389  out_close_bdev:
8390  _close_bdev();
8391  out_close_fsid:
8392  _close_fsid();
8393  out_path_fd:
8394  _close_path();
8395 
8396  if (r == 0 &&
8397  cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mkfs) {
8398  int rc = fsck(cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mkfs_deep);
8399  if (rc < 0)
8400  return rc;
8401  if (rc > 0) {
8402  derr << __func__ << " fsck found " << rc << " errors" << dendl;
8403  r = -EIO;
8404  }
8405  }
8406 
8407  if (r == 0) {
8408  // indicate success by writing the 'mkfs_done' file
8409  r = write_meta("mkfs_done", "yes");
8410  }
8411 
8412  if (r < 0) {
8413  derr << __func__ << " failed, " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8414  } else {
8415  dout(0) << __func__ << " success" << dendl;
8416  }
8417  return r;
8418 }
8419 
8420 int BlueStore::add_new_bluefs_device(int id, const string& dev_path)
8421 {
8422  dout(10) << __func__ << " path " << dev_path << " id:" << id << dendl;
8423  int r;
8424  ceph_assert(path_fd < 0);
8425 
8426  ceph_assert(id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL || id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB);
8427 
8428  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs) {
8429  derr << __func__ << " bluefs isn't configured, can't add new device " << dendl;
8430  return -EIO;
8431  }
8432  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::calling open_db_and_around(read-only)" << dendl;
8433  r = _open_db_and_around(true);
8434  if (r < 0) {
8435  return r;
8436  }
8437 
8438  if (id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL) {
8439  string p = path + "/block.wal";
8440  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file("block.wal", dev_path,
8441  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_wal_size,
8442  true);
8443  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8444 
8445  r = bluefs->add_block_device(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL, p,
8446  cct->_conf->bdev_enable_discard);
8447  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8448 
8449  if (bluefs->bdev_support_label(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL)) {
8450  r = _check_or_set_bdev_label(
8451  p,
8452  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL),
8453  "bluefs wal",
8454  true);
8455  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8456  }
8457 
8458  bluefs_layout.dedicated_wal = true;
8459  } else if (id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB) {
8460  string p = path + "/block.db";
8461  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file("block.db", dev_path,
8462  cct->_conf->bluestore_block_db_size,
8463  true);
8464  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8465 
8466  r = bluefs->add_block_device(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB, p,
8467  cct->_conf->bdev_enable_discard);
8468  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8469 
8470  if (bluefs->bdev_support_label(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB)) {
8471  r = _check_or_set_bdev_label(
8472  p,
8473  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB),
8474  "bluefs db",
8475  true);
8476  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8477  }
8478  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev = BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW;
8479  bluefs_layout.dedicated_db = true;
8480  }
8481  bluefs->umount();
8482  bluefs->mount();
8483 
8484  r = bluefs->prepare_new_device(id, bluefs_layout);
8485  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8486 
8487  if (r < 0) {
8488  derr << __func__ << " failed, " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8489  } else {
8490  dout(0) << __func__ << " success" << dendl;
8491  }
8492 
8493  _close_db_and_around();
8494  return r;
8495 }
8496 
8497 int BlueStore::migrate_to_existing_bluefs_device(const set<int>& devs_source,
8498  int id)
8499 {
8500  dout(10) << __func__ << " id:" << id << dendl;
8501  ceph_assert(path_fd < 0);
8502 
8503  ceph_assert(id == BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW || id == BlueFS::BDEV_DB);
8504 
8505  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs) {
8506  derr << __func__ << " bluefs isn't configured, can't add new device " << dendl;
8507  return -EIO;
8508  }
8509 
8510  int r = _open_db_and_around(true);
8511  if (r < 0) {
8512  return r;
8513  }
8514  auto close_db = make_scope_guard([&] {
8515  _close_db_and_around();
8516  });
8517  uint64_t used_space = 0;
8518  for(auto src_id : devs_source) {
8519  used_space += bluefs->get_used(src_id);
8520  }
8521  uint64_t target_free = bluefs->get_free(id);
8522  if (target_free < used_space) {
8523  derr << __func__
8524  << " can't migrate, free space at target: " << target_free
8525  << " is less than required space: " << used_space
8526  << dendl;
8527  return -ENOSPC;
8528  }
8529  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_DB)) {
8530  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev = BlueFS::BDEV_DB;
8531  bluefs_layout.dedicated_db = false;
8532  }
8533  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_WAL)) {
8534  bluefs_layout.dedicated_wal = false;
8535  }
8536  r = bluefs->device_migrate_to_existing(cct, devs_source, id, bluefs_layout);
8537  if (r < 0) {
8538  derr << __func__ << " failed during BlueFS migration, " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8539  return r;
8540  }
8541 
8542  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_DB)) {
8543  r = unlink(string(path + "/block.db").c_str());
8544  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8545  }
8546  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_WAL)) {
8547  r = unlink(string(path + "/block.wal").c_str());
8548  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8549  }
8550  return r;
8551 }
8552 
8553 int BlueStore::migrate_to_new_bluefs_device(const set<int>& devs_source,
8554  int id,
8555  const string& dev_path)
8556 {
8557  dout(10) << __func__ << " path " << dev_path << " id:" << id << dendl;
8558  ceph_assert(path_fd < 0);
8559 
8560  ceph_assert(id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL || id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB);
8561 
8562  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_bluefs) {
8563  derr << __func__ << " bluefs isn't configured, can't add new device " << dendl;
8564  return -EIO;
8565  }
8566 
8567  int r = _open_db_and_around(true);
8568  if (r < 0) {
8569  return r;
8570  }
8571  auto close_db = make_scope_guard([&] {
8572  _close_db_and_around();
8573  });
8574 
8575  string link_db;
8576  string link_wal;
8577  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_DB) &&
8578  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev != BlueFS::BDEV_DB) {
8579  link_db = path + "/block.db";
8580  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev = BlueFS::BDEV_DB;
8581  bluefs_layout.dedicated_db = false;
8582  }
8583  if (devs_source.count(BlueFS::BDEV_WAL)) {
8584  link_wal = path + "/block.wal";
8585  bluefs_layout.dedicated_wal = false;
8586  }
8587 
8588  size_t target_size = 0;
8589  string target_name;
8590  if (id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL) {
8591  target_name = "block.wal";
8592  target_size = cct->_conf->bluestore_block_wal_size;
8593  bluefs_layout.dedicated_wal = true;
8594 
8595  r = bluefs->add_block_device(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL, dev_path,
8596  cct->_conf->bdev_enable_discard);
8597  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8598 
8599  if (bluefs->bdev_support_label(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL)) {
8600  r = _check_or_set_bdev_label(
8601  dev_path,
8602  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWWAL),
8603  "bluefs wal",
8604  true);
8605  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8606  }
8607  } else if (id == BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB) {
8608  target_name = "block.db";
8609  target_size = cct->_conf->bluestore_block_db_size;
8610  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev = BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW;
8611  bluefs_layout.dedicated_db = true;
8612 
8613  r = bluefs->add_block_device(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB, dev_path,
8614  cct->_conf->bdev_enable_discard);
8615  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8616 
8617  if (bluefs->bdev_support_label(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB)) {
8618  r = _check_or_set_bdev_label(
8619  dev_path,
8620  bluefs->get_block_device_size(BlueFS::BDEV_NEWDB),
8621  "bluefs db",
8622  true);
8623  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8624  }
8625  }
8626 
8627  bluefs->umount();
8628  bluefs->mount();
8629 
8630  r = bluefs->device_migrate_to_new(cct, devs_source, id, bluefs_layout);
8631 
8632  if (r < 0) {
8633  derr << __func__ << " failed during BlueFS migration, " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8634  return r;
8635  }
8636 
8637  if (!link_db.empty()) {
8638  r = unlink(link_db.c_str());
8639  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8640  }
8641  if (!link_wal.empty()) {
8642  r = unlink(link_wal.c_str());
8643  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8644  }
8645  r = _setup_block_symlink_or_file(
8646  target_name,
8647  dev_path,
8648  target_size,
8649  true);
8650  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8651  dout(0) << __func__ << " success" << dendl;
8652 
8653  return r;
8654 }
8655 
8656 string BlueStore::get_device_path(unsigned id)
8657 {
8658  string res;
8659  if (id < BlueFS::MAX_BDEV) {
8660  switch (id) {
8661  case BlueFS::BDEV_WAL:
8662  res = path + "/block.wal";
8663  break;
8664  case BlueFS::BDEV_DB:
8665  if (id == bluefs_layout.shared_bdev) {
8666  res = path + "/block";
8667  } else {
8668  res = path + "/block.db";
8669  }
8670  break;
8671  case BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW:
8672  res = path + "/block";
8673  break;
8674  }
8675  }
8676  return res;
8677 }
8678 
8679 int BlueStore::_set_bdev_label_size(const string& path, uint64_t size)
8680 {
8681  bluestore_bdev_label_t label;
8682  int r = _read_bdev_label(cct, path, &label);
8683  if (r < 0) {
8684  derr << "unable to read label for " << path << ": "
8685  << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8686  } else {
8687  label.size = size;
8688  r = _write_bdev_label(cct, path, label);
8689  if (r < 0) {
8690  derr << "unable to write label for " << path << ": "
8691  << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
8692  }
8693  }
8694  return r;
8695 }
8696 
8697 int BlueStore::expand_devices(ostream& out)
8698 {
8699  int r = _open_db_and_around(true);
8700  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8701  bluefs->dump_block_extents(out);
8702  out << "Expanding DB/WAL..." << std::endl;
8703  for (auto devid : { BlueFS::BDEV_WAL, BlueFS::BDEV_DB}) {
8704  if (devid == bluefs_layout.shared_bdev ) {
8705  continue;
8706  }
8707  uint64_t size = bluefs->get_block_device_size(devid);
8708  if (size == 0) {
8709  // no bdev
8710  continue;
8711  }
8712 
8713  out << devid
8714  <<" : expanding " << " to 0x" << size << std::dec << std::endl;
8715  string p = get_device_path(devid);
8716  const char* path = p.c_str();
8717  if (path == nullptr) {
8718  derr << devid
8719  <<": can't find device path " << dendl;
8720  continue;
8721  }
8722  if (bluefs->bdev_support_label(devid)) {
8723  if (_set_bdev_label_size(p, size) >= 0) {
8724  out << devid
8725  << " : size label updated to " << size
8726  << std::endl;
8727  }
8728  }
8729  }
8730  uint64_t size0 = fm->get_size();
8731  uint64_t size = bdev->get_size();
8732  if (size0 < size) {
8733  out << bluefs_layout.shared_bdev
8734  << " : expanding " << " from 0x" << std::hex
8735  << size0 << " to 0x" << size << std::dec << std::endl;
8736  _write_out_fm_meta(size);
8737  if (bdev->supported_bdev_label()) {
8738  if (_set_bdev_label_size(path, size) >= 0) {
8739  out << bluefs_layout.shared_bdev
8740  << " : size label updated to " << size
8741  << std::endl;
8742  }
8743  }
8744 
8745  if (fm && fm->is_null_manager()) {
8746  // we grow the allocation range, must reflect it in the allocation file
8747  alloc->init_add_free(size0, size - size0);
8748  need_to_destage_allocation_file = true;
8749  }
8750  _close_db_and_around();
8751 
8752  // mount in read/write to sync expansion changes
8753  r = _mount();
8754  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8755  umount();
8756  } else {
8757  _close_db_and_around();
8758  }
8759  return r;
8760 }
8761 
8762 int BlueStore::dump_bluefs_sizes(ostream& out)
8763 {
8764  int r = _open_db_and_around(true);
8765  ceph_assert(r == 0);
8766  bluefs->dump_block_extents(out);
8767  _close_db_and_around();
8768  return r;
8769 }
8770 
8771 void BlueStore::set_cache_shards(unsigned num)
8772 {
8773  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << num << dendl;
8774  size_t oold = onode_cache_shards.size();
8775  size_t bold = buffer_cache_shards.size();
8776  ceph_assert(num >= oold && num >= bold);
8777  onode_cache_shards.resize(num);
8778  buffer_cache_shards.resize(num);
8779  for (unsigned i = oold; i < num; ++i) {
8780  onode_cache_shards[i] =
8781  OnodeCacheShard::create(cct, cct->_conf->bluestore_cache_type,
8782  logger);
8783  }
8784  for (unsigned i = bold; i < num; ++i) {
8785  buffer_cache_shards[i] =
8786  BufferCacheShard::create(cct, cct->_conf->bluestore_cache_type,
8787  logger);
8788  }
8789 }
8790 
8791 //---------------------------------------------
8792 bool BlueStore::has_null_manager() const
8793 {
8794  return (fm && fm->is_null_manager());
8795 }
8796 
8797 int BlueStore::_mount()
8798 {
8799  dout(5) << __func__ << " path " << path << dendl;
8800 
8801  {
8802  int r = read_meta_conf_check_env();
8803  if (r < 0) {
8804  return r;
8805  }
8806  }
8807 
8808  _kv_only = false;
8809  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mount) {
8810  int rc = fsck(cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_mount_deep);
8811  if (rc < 0)
8812  return rc;
8813  if (rc > 0) {
8814  derr << __func__ << " fsck found " << rc << " errors" << dendl;
8815  return -EIO;
8816  }
8817  }
8818 
8819  if (cct->_conf->osd_max_object_size > OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
8820  derr << __func__ << " osd_max_object_size "
8821  << cct->_conf->osd_max_object_size << " > bluestore max "
8822  << OBJECT_MAX_SIZE << dendl;
8823  return -EINVAL;
8824  }
8825 
8826  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::calling open_db_and_around(read/write)" << dendl;
8827  int r = _open_db_and_around(false);
8828  if (r < 0) {
8829  return r;
8830  }
8831  auto close_db = make_scope_guard([&] {
8832  if (!mounted) {
8833  _close_db_and_around();
8834  }
8835  });
8836 
8837  r = _upgrade_super();
8838  if (r < 0) {
8839  return r;
8840  }
8841 
8842  // The recovery process for allocation-map needs to open collection early
8843  r = _open_collections();
8844  if (r < 0) {
8845  return r;
8846  }
8847  auto shutdown_cache = make_scope_guard([&] {
8848  if (!mounted) {
8849  _shutdown_cache();
8850  }
8851  });
8852 
8853  r = _reload_logger();
8854  if (r < 0) {
8855  return r;
8856  }
8857 
8858  _kv_start();
8859  auto stop_kv = make_scope_guard([&] {
8860  if (!mounted) {
8861  _kv_stop();
8862  }
8863  });
8864 
8865  r = _deferred_replay();
8866  if (r < 0) {
8867  return r;
8868  }
8869 
8870 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
8871  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
8872  _zoned_cleaner_start();
8873  }
8874 #endif
8875 
8876  mempool_thread.init();
8877 
8878  if ((!per_pool_stat_collection || per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_PG) &&
8879  cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_quick_fix_on_mount == true) {
8880 
8881  auto was_per_pool_omap = per_pool_omap;
8882 
8883  dout(1) << __func__ << " quick-fix on mount" << dendl;
8884  _fsck_on_open(FSCK_SHALLOW, true);
8885 
8886  //set again as hopefully it has been fixed
8887  if (was_per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_PG) {
8888  _set_per_pool_omap();
8889  }
8890  }
8891 
8892  mounted = true;
8893  return 0;
8894 }
8895 
8896 int BlueStore::umount()
8897 {
8898  ceph_assert(_kv_only || mounted);
8899  _osr_drain_all();
8900 
8901  mounted = false;
8902 
8903  ceph_assert(alloc);
8904 
8905  if (!_kv_only) {
8906  mempool_thread.shutdown();
8907 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
8908  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
8909  dout(20) << __func__ << " stopping zone cleaner thread" << dendl;
8910  _zoned_cleaner_stop();
8911  }
8912 #endif
8913  dout(20) << __func__ << " stopping kv thread" << dendl;
8914  _kv_stop();
8915  // skip cache cleanup step on fast shutdown
8916  if (likely(!m_fast_shutdown)) {
8917  _shutdown_cache();
8918  }
8919  dout(20) << __func__ << " closing" << dendl;
8920  }
8921  _close_db_and_around();
8922  // disable fsck on fast-shutdown
8923  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_umount && !m_fast_shutdown) {
8924  int rc = fsck(cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_on_umount_deep);
8925  if (rc < 0)
8926  return rc;
8927  if (rc > 0) {
8928  derr << __func__ << " fsck found " << rc << " errors" << dendl;
8929  return -EIO;
8930  }
8931  }
8932  return 0;
8933 }
8934 
8935 int BlueStore::cold_open()
8936 {
8937  return _open_db_and_around(true);
8938 }
8939 
8940 int BlueStore::cold_close()
8941 {
8942  _close_db_and_around();
8943  return 0;
8944 }
8945 
8946 // derr wrapper to limit enormous output and avoid log flooding.
8947 // Of limited use where such output is expected for now
8948 #define fsck_derr(err_cnt, threshold) \
8949  if (err_cnt <= threshold) { \
8950  bool need_skip_print = err_cnt == threshold; \
8951  derr
8952 
8953 #define fsck_dendl \
8954  dendl; \
8955  if (need_skip_print) \
8956  derr << "more error lines skipped..." << dendl; \
8957  }
8958 
8959 int _fsck_sum_extents(
8960  const PExtentVector& extents,
8961  bool compressed,
8962  store_statfs_t& expected_statfs)
8963 {
8964  for (auto e : extents) {
8965  if (!e.is_valid())
8966  continue;
8967  expected_statfs.allocated += e.length;
8968  if (compressed) {
8969  expected_statfs.data_compressed_allocated += e.length;
8970  }
8971  }
8972  return 0;
8973 }
8974 
8975 int BlueStore::_fsck_check_extents(
8976  std::string_view ctx_descr,
8977  const PExtentVector& extents,
8978  bool compressed,
8979  mempool_dynamic_bitset &used_blocks,
8980  uint64_t granularity,
8981  BlueStoreRepairer* repairer,
8982  store_statfs_t& expected_statfs,
8983  FSCKDepth depth)
8984 {
8985  dout(30) << __func__ << " " << ctx_descr << ", extents " << extents << dendl;
8986  int errors = 0;
8987  for (auto e : extents) {
8988  if (!e.is_valid())
8989  continue;
8990  expected_statfs.allocated += e.length;
8991  if (compressed) {
8992  expected_statfs.data_compressed_allocated += e.length;
8993  }
8994  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
8995  bool already = false;
8996  apply_for_bitset_range(
8997  e.offset, e.length, granularity, used_blocks,
8998  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset &bs) {
8999  if (bs.test(pos)) {
9000  if (repairer) {
9001  repairer->note_misreference(
9002  pos * min_alloc_size, min_alloc_size, !already);
9003  }
9004  if (!already) {
9005  derr << __func__ << "::fsck error: " << ctx_descr << ", extent " << e
9006  << " or a subset is already allocated (misreferenced)" << dendl;
9007  ++errors;
9008  already = true;
9009  }
9010  }
9011  else
9012  bs.set(pos);
9013  });
9014 
9015  if (e.end() > bdev->get_size()) {
9016  derr << "fsck error: " << ctx_descr << ", extent " << e
9017  << " past end of block device" << dendl;
9018  ++errors;
9019  }
9020  }
9021  }
9022  return errors;
9023 }
9024 
9025 void BlueStore::_fsck_check_statfs(
9026  const store_statfs_t& expected_statfs,
9027  const per_pool_statfs& expected_pool_statfs,
9028  int64_t& errors,
9029  int64_t& warnings,
9030  BlueStoreRepairer* repairer)
9031 {
9032  string key;
9033  store_statfs_t actual_statfs;
9034  store_statfs_t s;
9035  {
9036  // make a copy
9037  per_pool_statfs my_expected_pool_statfs(expected_pool_statfs);
9038  auto op = osd_pools.begin();
9039  while (op != osd_pools.end()) {
9040  get_pool_stat_key(op->first, &key);
9041  op->second.publish(&s);
9042  auto it_expected = my_expected_pool_statfs.find(op->first);
9043  if (it_expected == my_expected_pool_statfs.end()) {
9044  auto op0 = op++;
9045  if (op0->second.is_empty()) {
9046  // It's OK to lack relevant empty statfs record
9047  continue;
9048  }
9049  derr << __func__ << "::fsck error: " << std::hex
9050  << "pool " << op0->first << " has got no statfs to match against: "
9051  << s
9052  << std::dec << dendl;
9053  ++errors;
9054  if (repairer) {
9055  osd_pools.erase(op0);
9056  repairer->remove_key(db, PREFIX_STAT, key);
9057  }
9058  } else {
9059  if (!(s == it_expected->second)) {
9060  derr << "fsck error: actual " << s
9061  << " != expected " << it_expected->second
9062  << " for pool "
9063  << std::hex << op->first << std::dec << dendl;
9064  ++errors;
9065  if (repairer) {
9066  // repair in-memory in a hope this would be flushed properly on shutdown
9067  s = it_expected->second;
9068  op->second = it_expected->second;
9069  repairer->fix_statfs(db, key, it_expected->second);
9070  }
9071  }
9072  actual_statfs.add(s);
9073  my_expected_pool_statfs.erase(it_expected);
9074  ++op;
9075  }
9076  }
9077  // check stats that lack matching entities in osd_pools
9078  for (auto &p : my_expected_pool_statfs) {
9079  if (p.second.is_zero()) {
9080  // It's OK to lack relevant empty statfs record
9081  continue;
9082  }
9083  get_pool_stat_key(p.first, &key);
9084  derr << __func__ << "::fsck error: " << std::hex
9085  << "pool " << p.first << " has got no actual statfs: "
9086  << std::dec << p.second
9087  << dendl;
9088  ++errors;
9089  if (repairer) {
9090  osd_pools[p.first] = p.second;
9091  repairer->fix_statfs(db, key, p.second);
9092  actual_statfs.add(p.second);
9093  }
9094  }
9095  }
9096  // process global statfs
9097  if (repairer) {
9098  if (!per_pool_stat_collection) {
9099  // by virtue of running this method, we correct the top-level
9100  // error of having global stats
9101  repairer->remove_key(db, PREFIX_STAT, BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY);
9102  per_pool_stat_collection = true;
9103  }
9104  vstatfs = actual_statfs;
9105  dout(20) << __func__ << " setting vstatfs to " << actual_statfs << dendl;
9106  } else if (!per_pool_stat_collection) {
9107  // check global stats only if fscking (not repairing) w/o per-pool stats
9108  vstatfs.publish(&s);
9109  if (!(s == expected_statfs)) {
9110  derr << "fsck error: actual " << s
9111  << " != expected " << expected_statfs << dendl;
9112  ++errors;
9113  }
9114  }
9115 }
9116 
9117 void BlueStore::_fsck_foreach_shared_blob(
9118  std::function< bool (coll_t, ghobject_t, uint64_t, const bluestore_blob_t&)> cb) {
9119  auto it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
9120  if (it) {
9121  CollectionRef c;
9122  spg_t pgid;
9123  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
9124  dout(30) << __func__ << " key "
9125  << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
9126  << dendl;
9127  if (is_extent_shard_key(it->key())) {
9128  continue;
9129  }
9130 
9131  ghobject_t oid;
9132  int r = get_key_object(it->key(), &oid);
9133  if (r < 0) {
9134  continue;
9135  }
9136 
9137  if (!c ||
9138  oid.shard_id != pgid.shard ||
9139  oid.hobj.get_logical_pool() != (int64_t)pgid.pool() ||
9140  !c->contains(oid)) {
9141  c = nullptr;
9142  for (auto& p : coll_map) {
9143  if (p.second->contains(oid)) {
9144  c = p.second;
9145  break;
9146  }
9147  }
9148  if (!c) {
9149  continue;
9150  }
9151  }
9152  dout(20) << __func__
9153  << " inspecting shared blob refs for col:" << c->cid
9154  << " obj:" << oid
9155  << dendl;
9156 
9157  OnodeRef o;
9158  o.reset(Onode::create_decode(c, oid, it->key(), it->value()));
9159  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
9160 
9161  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
9162 
9163  mempool::bluestore_fsck::set<BlobRef> passed_sbs;
9164  for (auto& e : o->extent_map.extent_map) {
9165  auto& b = e.blob->get_blob();
9166  if (b.is_shared() && passed_sbs.count(e.blob) == 0) {
9167  auto sbid = e.blob->shared_blob->get_sbid();
9168  if (cb(c->cid, oid, sbid, b) == false) {
9169  goto stop_iterating;
9170  }
9171  passed_sbs.emplace(e.blob);
9172  }
9173  } // for ... extent_map
9174  } // for ... it->valid
9175  } //if (it(PREFIX_OBJ))
9176  stop_iterating:;
9177 }
9178 
9179 void BlueStore::_fsck_repair_shared_blobs(
9180  BlueStoreRepairer& repairer,
9181  shared_blob_2hash_tracker_t& sb_ref_counts,
9182  sb_info_space_efficient_map_t& sb_info)
9183 {
9184  auto sb_ref_mismatches = sb_ref_counts.count_non_zero();
9185  dout(1) << __func__ << " repairing shared_blobs, ref mismatch estimate: "
9186  << sb_ref_mismatches << dendl;
9187  if (!sb_ref_mismatches) // not expected to succeed, just in case
9188  return;
9189 
9190  mempool::bluestore_fsck::map<uint64_t, bluestore_extent_ref_map_t> refs_map;
9191 
9192  // first iteration over objects to identify all the broken sbids
9193  _fsck_foreach_shared_blob( [&](coll_t cid,
9194  ghobject_t oid,
9195  uint64_t sbid,
9196  const bluestore_blob_t& b) {
9197  auto it = refs_map.lower_bound(sbid);
9198  if(it != refs_map.end() && it->first == sbid) {
9199  return true;
9200  }
9201  for (auto& p : b.get_extents()) {
9202  if (p.is_valid() &&
9203  !sb_ref_counts.test_all_zero_range(sbid,
9204  p.offset,
9205  p.length)) {
9206  refs_map.emplace_hint(it, sbid, bluestore_extent_ref_map_t());
9207  dout(20) << __func__
9208  << " broken shared blob found for col:" << cid
9209  << " obj:" << oid
9210  << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
9211  << dendl;
9212  break;
9213  }
9214  }
9215  return true;
9216  });
9217 
9218  // second iteration over objects to build new ref map for the broken sbids
9219  _fsck_foreach_shared_blob( [&](coll_t cid,
9220  ghobject_t oid,
9221  uint64_t sbid,
9222  const bluestore_blob_t& b) {
9223  auto it = refs_map.find(sbid);
9224  if(it == refs_map.end()) {
9225  return true;
9226  }
9227  for (auto& p : b.get_extents()) {
9228  if (p.is_valid()) {
9229  it->second.get(p.offset, p.length);
9230  break;
9231  }
9232  }
9233  return true;
9234  });
9235 
9236  // update shared blob records
9237  auto ref_it = refs_map.begin();
9238  while (ref_it != refs_map.end()) {
9239  size_t cnt = 0;
9240  const size_t max_transactions = 4096;
9241  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
9242  for (cnt = 0;
9243  cnt < max_transactions && ref_it != refs_map.end();
9244  ref_it++) {
9245  auto sbid = ref_it->first;
9246  dout(20) << __func__ << " repaired shared_blob 0x"
9247  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
9248  << ref_it->second << dendl;
9249  repairer.fix_shared_blob(txn, sbid, &ref_it->second, 0);
9250  cnt++;
9251  }
9252  if (cnt) {
9253  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9254  cnt = 0;
9255  }
9256  }
9257  // remove stray shared blob records
9258  size_t cnt = 0;
9259  const size_t max_transactions = 4096;
9260  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
9261  sb_info.foreach_stray([&](const sb_info_t& sbi) {
9262  auto sbid = sbi.get_sbid();
9263  dout(20) << __func__ << " removing stray shared_blob 0x"
9264  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
9265  << dendl;
9266  repairer.fix_shared_blob(txn, sbid, nullptr, 0);
9267  cnt++;
9268  if (cnt >= max_transactions) {}
9269  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9270  txn = db->get_transaction();
9271  cnt = 0;
9272  });
9273  if (cnt > 0) {
9274  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9275  }
9276 
9277  // amount of repairs to report to be equal to previously
9278  // determined error estimation, not the actual number of updated shared blobs
9279  repairer.inc_repaired(sb_ref_mismatches);
9280 }
9281 
9282 BlueStore::OnodeRef BlueStore::fsck_check_objects_shallow(
9283  BlueStore::FSCKDepth depth,
9284  int64_t pool_id,
9285  BlueStore::CollectionRef c,
9286  const ghobject_t& oid,
9287  const string& key,
9288  const bufferlist& value,
9289  mempool::bluestore_fsck::list<string>* expecting_shards,
9290  map<BlobRef, bluestore_blob_t::unused_t>* referenced,
9291  const BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx& ctx)
9292 {
9293  auto& errors = ctx.errors;
9294  auto& num_objects = ctx.num_objects;
9295  auto& num_extents = ctx.num_extents;
9296  auto& num_blobs = ctx.num_blobs;
9297  auto& num_sharded_objects = ctx.num_sharded_objects;
9298  auto& num_spanning_blobs = ctx.num_spanning_blobs;
9299  auto used_blocks = ctx.used_blocks;
9300  auto sb_info_lock = ctx.sb_info_lock;
9301  auto& sb_info = ctx.sb_info;
9302  auto& sb_ref_counts = ctx.sb_ref_counts;
9303  auto repairer = ctx.repairer;
9304 
9305  store_statfs_t* res_statfs = (per_pool_stat_collection || repairer) ?
9306  &ctx.expected_pool_statfs[pool_id] :
9307  &ctx.expected_store_statfs;
9308 
9309  map<uint32_t, uint64_t> zone_first_offsets; // for zoned/smr devices
9310 
9311  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << oid << dendl;
9312  OnodeRef o;
9313  o.reset(Onode::create_decode(c, oid, key, value));
9314  ++num_objects;
9315 
9316  num_spanning_blobs += o->extent_map.spanning_blob_map.size();
9317 
9318  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
9319  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
9320  // shards
9321  if (!o->extent_map.shards.empty()) {
9322  ++num_sharded_objects;
9323  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
9324  ceph_assert(expecting_shards);
9325  for (auto& s : o->extent_map.shards) {
9326  dout(20) << __func__ << " shard " << *s.shard_info << dendl;
9327  expecting_shards->push_back(string());
9328  get_extent_shard_key(o->key, s.shard_info->offset,
9329  &expecting_shards->back());
9330  if (s.shard_info->offset >= o->onode.size) {
9331  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " shard 0x" << std::hex
9332  << s.shard_info->offset << " past EOF at 0x" << o->onode.size
9333  << std::dec << dendl;
9334  ++errors;
9335  }
9336  }
9337  }
9338  }
9339 
9340  // lextents
9341  uint64_t pos = 0;
9342  mempool::bluestore_fsck::map<BlobRef,
9343  bluestore_blob_use_tracker_t> ref_map;
9344  for (auto& l : o->extent_map.extent_map) {
9345  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << l << dendl;
9346  if (l.logical_offset < pos) {
9347  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " lextent at 0x"
9348  << std::hex << l.logical_offset
9349  << " overlaps with the previous, which ends at 0x" << pos
9350  << std::dec << dendl;
9351  ++errors;
9352  }
9353  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW &&
9354  o->extent_map.spans_shard(l.logical_offset, l.length)) {
9355  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " lextent at 0x"
9356  << std::hex << l.logical_offset << "~" << l.length
9357  << " spans a shard boundary"
9358  << std::dec << dendl;
9359  ++errors;
9360  }
9361  pos = l.logical_offset + l.length;
9362  res_statfs->data_stored += l.length;
9363  ceph_assert(l.blob);
9364  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = l.blob->get_blob();
9365 
9366 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
9367  if (bdev->is_smr() && depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
9368  for (auto& e : blob.get_extents()) {
9369  if (e.is_valid()) {
9370  uint32_t zone = e.offset / zone_size;
9371  uint64_t offset = e.offset % zone_size;
9372  auto p = zone_first_offsets.find(zone);
9373  if (p == zone_first_offsets.end() || p->second > offset) {
9374  // FIXME: use interator for guided insert?
9375  zone_first_offsets[zone] = offset;
9376  }
9377  }
9378  }
9379  }
9380 #endif
9381 
9382  auto& ref = ref_map[l.blob];
9383  if (ref.is_empty()) {
9384  uint32_t min_release_size = blob.get_release_size(min_alloc_size);
9385  uint32_t l = blob.get_logical_length();
9386  ref.init(l, min_release_size);
9387  }
9388  ref.get(
9389  l.blob_offset,
9390  l.length);
9391  ++num_extents;
9392  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW &&
9393  blob.has_unused()) {
9394  ceph_assert(referenced);
9395  auto p = referenced->find(l.blob);
9396  bluestore_blob_t::unused_t* pu;
9397  if (p == referenced->end()) {
9398  pu = &(*referenced)[l.blob];
9399  }
9400  else {
9401  pu = &p->second;
9402  }
9403  uint64_t blob_len = blob.get_logical_length();
9404  ceph_assert((blob_len % (sizeof(*pu) * 8)) == 0);
9405  ceph_assert(l.blob_offset + l.length <= blob_len);
9406  uint64_t chunk_size = blob_len / (sizeof(*pu) * 8);
9407  uint64_t start = l.blob_offset / chunk_size;
9408  uint64_t end =
9409  round_up_to(l.blob_offset + l.length, chunk_size) / chunk_size;
9410  for (auto i = start; i < end; ++i) {
9411  (*pu) |= (1u << i);
9412  }
9413  }
9414  } //for (auto& l : o->extent_map.extent_map)
9415 
9416  for (auto& i : ref_map) {
9417  ++num_blobs;
9418  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = i.first->get_blob();
9419  bool equal =
9420  depth == FSCK_SHALLOW ? true :
9421  i.first->get_blob_use_tracker().equal(i.second);
9422  if (!equal) {
9423  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " blob " << *i.first
9424  << " doesn't match expected ref_map " << i.second << dendl;
9425  ++errors;
9426  }
9427  if (blob.is_compressed()) {
9428  res_statfs->data_compressed += blob.get_compressed_payload_length();
9429  res_statfs->data_compressed_original +=
9430  i.first->get_referenced_bytes();
9431  }
9432  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW && repairer) {
9433  for (auto e : blob.get_extents()) {
9434  if (!e.is_valid())
9435  continue;
9436  repairer->set_space_used(e.offset, e.length, c->cid, oid);
9437  }
9438  }
9439  if (blob.is_shared()) {
9440  if (i.first->shared_blob->get_sbid() > blobid_max) {
9441  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " blob " << blob
9442  << " sbid " << i.first->shared_blob->get_sbid() << " > blobid_max "
9443  << blobid_max << dendl;
9444  ++errors;
9445  } else if (i.first->shared_blob->get_sbid() == 0) {
9446  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " blob " << blob
9447  << " marked as shared but has uninitialized sbid"
9448  << dendl;
9449  ++errors;
9450  }
9451  // the below lock is optional and provided in multithreading mode only
9452  if (sb_info_lock) {
9453  sb_info_lock->lock();
9454  }
9455  auto sbid = i.first->shared_blob->get_sbid();
9456  sb_info_t& sbi = sb_info.add_or_adopt(i.first->shared_blob->get_sbid());
9457  ceph_assert(sbi.pool_id == sb_info_t::INVALID_POOL_ID ||
9458  sbi.pool_id == oid.hobj.get_logical_pool());
9459  sbi.pool_id = oid.hobj.get_logical_pool();
9460  bool compressed = blob.is_compressed();
9461  for (auto e : blob.get_extents()) {
9462  if (e.is_valid()) {
9463  if (compressed) {
9464  ceph_assert(sbi.allocated_chunks <= 0);
9465  sbi.allocated_chunks -= (e.length >> min_alloc_size_order);
9466  } else {
9467  ceph_assert(sbi.allocated_chunks >= 0);
9468  sbi.allocated_chunks += (e.length >> min_alloc_size_order);
9469  }
9470  sb_ref_counts.inc_range(sbid, e.offset, e.length, 1);
9471  }
9472  }
9473  if (sb_info_lock) {
9474  sb_info_lock->unlock();
9475  }
9476  } else if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
9477  ceph_assert(used_blocks);
9478  string ctx_descr = " oid " + stringify(oid);
9479  errors += _fsck_check_extents(ctx_descr,
9480  blob.get_extents(),
9481  blob.is_compressed(),
9482  *used_blocks,
9483  fm->get_alloc_size(),
9484  repairer,
9485  *res_statfs,
9486  depth);
9487  } else {
9488  errors += _fsck_sum_extents(
9489  blob.get_extents(),
9490  blob.is_compressed(),
9491  *res_statfs);
9492  }
9493  } // for (auto& i : ref_map)
9494 
9495  {
9496  auto &sbm = o->extent_map.spanning_blob_map;
9497  size_t broken = 0;
9498  BlobRef first_broken;
9499  for (auto it = sbm.begin(); it != sbm.end();) {
9500  auto it1 = it++;
9501  if (ref_map.count(it1->second) == 0) {
9502  if (!broken) {
9503  first_broken = it1->second;
9504  ++errors;
9505  derr << "fsck error:" << " stray spanning blob found:" << it1->first
9506  << dendl;
9507  }
9508  broken++;
9509  if (repairer) {
9510  sbm.erase(it1);
9511  }
9512  }
9513  }
9514 
9515 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
9516  if (bdev->is_smr() && depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
9517  for (auto& [zone, first_offset] : zone_first_offsets) {
9518  auto p = (*ctx.zone_refs)[zone].find(oid);
9519  if (p != (*ctx.zone_refs)[zone].end()) {
9520  if (first_offset < p->second) {
9521  dout(20) << " slightly wonky zone ref 0x" << std::hex << zone
9522  << " offset 0x" << p->second
9523  << " but first offset is 0x" << first_offset
9524  << "; this can happen due to clone_range"
9525  << dendl;
9526  } else {
9527  dout(20) << " good zone ref 0x" << std::hex << zone << " offset 0x" << p->second
9528  << " <= first offset 0x" << first_offset
9529  << std::dec << dendl;
9530  }
9531  (*ctx.zone_refs)[zone].erase(p);
9532  } else {
9533  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " references zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
9534  << " but there is no zone ref" << std::dec << dendl;
9535  // FIXME: add repair
9536  ++errors;
9537  }
9538  }
9539  }
9540 #endif
9541 
9542  if (broken) {
9543  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " - " << broken
9544  << " zombie spanning blob(s) found, the first one: "
9545  << *first_broken << dendl;
9546  if(repairer) {
9547  repairer->fix_spanning_blobs(
9548  db,
9549  [&](KeyValueDB::Transaction txn) {
9550  _record_onode(o, txn);
9551  });
9552  }
9553  }
9554  }
9555 
9556  if (o->onode.has_omap()) {
9557  _fsck_check_object_omap(depth, o, ctx);
9558  }
9559 
9560  return o;
9561 }
9562 
9563 class ShallowFSCKThreadPool : public ThreadPool
9564 {
9565 public:
9566  ShallowFSCKThreadPool(CephContext* cct_, std::string nm, std::string tn, int n) :
9567  ThreadPool(cct_, nm, tn, n) {
9568  }
9569  void worker(ThreadPool::WorkThread* wt) override {
9570  int next_wq = 0;
9571  while (!_stop) {
9572  next_wq %= work_queues.size();
9573  WorkQueue_ *wq = work_queues[next_wq++];
9574 
9575  void* item = wq->_void_dequeue();
9576  if (item) {
9577  processing++;
9578  TPHandle tp_handle(cct, nullptr, wq->timeout_interval.load(), wq->suicide_interval.load());
9579  wq->_void_process(item, tp_handle);
9580  processing--;
9581  }
9582  }
9583  }
9584  template <size_t BatchLen>
9585  struct FSCKWorkQueue : public ThreadPool::WorkQueue_
9586  {
9587  struct Entry {
9588  int64_t pool_id;
9589  BlueStore::CollectionRef c;
9590  ghobject_t oid;
9591  string key;
9592  bufferlist value;
9593  };
9594  struct Batch {
9595  std::atomic<size_t> running = { 0 };
9596  size_t entry_count = 0;
9597  std::array<Entry, BatchLen> entries;
9598 
9599  int64_t errors = 0;
9600  int64_t warnings = 0;
9601  uint64_t num_objects = 0;
9602  uint64_t num_extents = 0;
9603  uint64_t num_blobs = 0;
9604  uint64_t num_sharded_objects = 0;
9605  uint64_t num_spanning_blobs = 0;
9606  store_statfs_t expected_store_statfs;
9607  BlueStore::per_pool_statfs expected_pool_statfs;
9608  };
9609 
9610  size_t batchCount;
9611  BlueStore* store = nullptr;
9612 
9613  ceph::mutex* sb_info_lock = nullptr;
9614  sb_info_space_efficient_map_t* sb_info = nullptr;
9615  shared_blob_2hash_tracker_t* sb_ref_counts = nullptr;
9616  BlueStoreRepairer* repairer = nullptr;
9617 
9618  Batch* batches = nullptr;
9619  size_t last_batch_pos = 0;
9620  bool batch_acquired = false;
9621 
9622  FSCKWorkQueue(std::string n,
9623  size_t _batchCount,
9624  BlueStore* _store,
9625  ceph::mutex* _sb_info_lock,
9626  sb_info_space_efficient_map_t& _sb_info,
9627  shared_blob_2hash_tracker_t& _sb_ref_counts,
9628  BlueStoreRepairer* _repairer) :
9629  WorkQueue_(n, ceph::timespan::zero(), ceph::timespan::zero()),
9630  batchCount(_batchCount),
9631  store(_store),
9632  sb_info_lock(_sb_info_lock),
9633  sb_info(&_sb_info),
9634  sb_ref_counts(&_sb_ref_counts),
9635  repairer(_repairer)
9636  {
9637  batches = new Batch[batchCount];
9638  }
9639  ~FSCKWorkQueue() {
9640  delete[] batches;
9641  }
9642 
9644  void _clear() override {
9645  //do nothing
9646  }
9648  bool _empty() override {
9649  ceph_assert(false);
9650  }
9651 
9653  void* _void_dequeue() override {
9654  size_t pos = rand() % batchCount;
9655  size_t pos0 = pos;
9656  do {
9657  auto& batch = batches[pos];
9658  if (batch.running.fetch_add(1) == 0) {
9659  if (batch.entry_count) {
9660  return &batch;
9661  }
9662  }
9663  batch.running--;
9664  pos++;
9665  pos %= batchCount;
9666  } while (pos != pos0);
9667  return nullptr;
9668  }
9672  void _void_process(void* item, TPHandle& handle) override {
9673  Batch* batch = (Batch*)item;
9674 
9675  BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx ctx(
9676  batch->errors,
9677  batch->warnings,
9678  batch->num_objects,
9679  batch->num_extents,
9680  batch->num_blobs,
9681  batch->num_sharded_objects,
9682  batch->num_spanning_blobs,
9683  nullptr, // used_blocks
9684  nullptr, //used_omap_head
9685  nullptr,
9686  sb_info_lock,
9687  *sb_info,
9688  *sb_ref_counts,
9689  batch->expected_store_statfs,
9690  batch->expected_pool_statfs,
9691  repairer);
9692 
9693  for (size_t i = 0; i < batch->entry_count; i++) {
9694  auto& entry = batch->entries[i];
9695 
9696  store->fsck_check_objects_shallow(
9697  BlueStore::FSCK_SHALLOW,
9698  entry.pool_id,
9699  entry.c,
9700  entry.oid,
9701  entry.key,
9702  entry.value,
9703  nullptr, // expecting_shards - this will need a protection if passed
9704  nullptr, // referenced
9705  ctx);
9706  }
9707  batch->entry_count = 0;
9708  batch->running--;
9709  }
9714  void _void_process_finish(void*) override {
9715  ceph_assert(false);
9716  }
9717 
9718  bool queue(
9719  int64_t pool_id,
9720  BlueStore::CollectionRef c,
9721  const ghobject_t& oid,
9722  const string& key,
9723  const bufferlist& value) {
9724  bool res = false;
9725  size_t pos0 = last_batch_pos;
9726  if (!batch_acquired) {
9727  do {
9728  auto& batch = batches[last_batch_pos];
9729  if (batch.running.fetch_add(1) == 0) {
9730  if (batch.entry_count < BatchLen) {
9731  batch_acquired = true;
9732  break;
9733  }
9734  }
9735  batch.running.fetch_sub(1);
9736  last_batch_pos++;
9737  last_batch_pos %= batchCount;
9738  } while (last_batch_pos != pos0);
9739  }
9740  if (batch_acquired) {
9741  auto& batch = batches[last_batch_pos];
9742  ceph_assert(batch.running);
9743  ceph_assert(batch.entry_count < BatchLen);
9744 
9745  auto& entry = batch.entries[batch.entry_count];
9746  entry.pool_id = pool_id;
9747  entry.c = c;
9748  entry.oid = oid;
9749  entry.key = key;
9750  entry.value = value;
9751 
9752  ++batch.entry_count;
9753  if (batch.entry_count == BatchLen) {
9754  batch_acquired = false;
9755  batch.running.fetch_sub(1);
9756  last_batch_pos++;
9757  last_batch_pos %= batchCount;
9758  }
9759  res = true;
9760  }
9761  return res;
9762  }
9763 
9764  void finalize(ThreadPool& tp,
9765  BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx& ctx) {
9766  if (batch_acquired) {
9767  auto& batch = batches[last_batch_pos];
9768  ceph_assert(batch.running);
9769  batch.running.fetch_sub(1);
9770  }
9771  tp.stop();
9772 
9773  for (size_t i = 0; i < batchCount; i++) {
9774  auto& batch = batches[i];
9775 
9776  //process leftovers if any
9777  if (batch.entry_count) {
9778  TPHandle tp_handle(store->cct,
9779  nullptr,
9780  timeout_interval.load(),
9781  suicide_interval.load());
9782  ceph_assert(batch.running == 0);
9783 
9784  batch.running++; // just to be on-par with the regular call
9785  _void_process(&batch, tp_handle);
9786  }
9787  ceph_assert(batch.entry_count == 0);
9788 
9789  ctx.errors += batch.errors;
9790  ctx.warnings += batch.warnings;
9791  ctx.num_objects += batch.num_objects;
9792  ctx.num_extents += batch.num_extents;
9793  ctx.num_blobs += batch.num_blobs;
9794  ctx.num_sharded_objects += batch.num_sharded_objects;
9795  ctx.num_spanning_blobs += batch.num_spanning_blobs;
9796 
9797  ctx.expected_store_statfs.add(batch.expected_store_statfs);
9798 
9799  for (auto it = batch.expected_pool_statfs.begin();
9800  it != batch.expected_pool_statfs.end();
9801  it++) {
9802  ctx.expected_pool_statfs[it->first].add(it->second);
9803  }
9804  }
9805  }
9806  };
9807 };
9808 
9809 void BlueStore::_fsck_check_object_omap(FSCKDepth depth,
9810  OnodeRef& o,
9811  const BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx& ctx)
9812 {
9813  auto& errors = ctx.errors;
9814  auto& warnings = ctx.warnings;
9815  auto repairer = ctx.repairer;
9816 
9817  ceph_assert(o->onode.has_omap());
9818  if (!o->onode.is_perpool_omap() && !o->onode.is_pgmeta_omap()) {
9819  if (per_pool_omap == OMAP_PER_POOL) {
9820  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
9821  << "fsck error: " << o->oid
9822  << " has omap that is not per-pool or pgmeta"
9823  << fsck_dendl;
9824  ++errors;
9825  } else {
9826  const char* w;
9827  int64_t num;
9828  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_error_on_no_per_pool_omap) {
9829  ++errors;
9830  num = errors;
9831  w = "error";
9832  } else {
9833  ++warnings;
9834  num = warnings;
9835  w = "warning";
9836  }
9837  fsck_derr(num, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
9838  << "fsck " << w << ": " << o->oid
9839  << " has omap that is not per-pool or pgmeta"
9840  << fsck_dendl;
9841  }
9842  } else if (!o->onode.is_perpg_omap() && !o->onode.is_pgmeta_omap()) {
9843  if (per_pool_omap == OMAP_PER_PG) {
9844  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
9845  << "fsck error: " << o->oid
9846  << " has omap that is not per-pg or pgmeta"
9847  << fsck_dendl;
9848  ++errors;
9849  } else {
9850  const char* w;
9851  int64_t num;
9852  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_error_on_no_per_pg_omap) {
9853  ++errors;
9854  num = errors;
9855  w = "error";
9856  } else {
9857  ++warnings;
9858  num = warnings;
9859  w = "warning";
9860  }
9861  fsck_derr(num, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
9862  << "fsck " << w << ": " << o->oid
9863  << " has omap that is not per-pg or pgmeta"
9864  << fsck_dendl;
9865  }
9866  }
9867  if (repairer &&
9868  !o->onode.is_perpg_omap() &&
9869  !o->onode.is_pgmeta_omap()) {
9870  dout(10) << "fsck converting " << o->oid << " omap to per-pg" << dendl;
9871  bufferlist header;
9872  map<string, bufferlist> kv;
9873  {
9874  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
9875  uint64_t txn_cost = 0;
9876  const string& prefix = Onode::calc_omap_prefix(o->onode.flags);
9877  uint8_t new_flags = o->onode.flags |
9878  bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPOOL_OMAP |
9879  bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPG_OMAP;
9880  const string& new_omap_prefix = Onode::calc_omap_prefix(new_flags);
9881 
9882  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(prefix);
9883  string head, tail;
9884  o->get_omap_header(&head);
9885  o->get_omap_tail(&tail);
9886  it->lower_bound(head);
9887  // head
9888  if (it->valid() && it->key() == head) {
9889  dout(30) << __func__ << " got header" << dendl;
9890  header = it->value();
9891  if (header.length()) {
9892  string new_head;
9893  Onode::calc_omap_header(new_flags, o.get(), &new_head);
9894  txn->set(new_omap_prefix, new_head, header);
9895  txn_cost += new_head.length() + header.length();
9896  }
9897  it->next();
9898  }
9899  // tail
9900  {
9901  string new_tail;
9902  Onode::calc_omap_tail(new_flags, o.get(), &new_tail);
9903  bufferlist empty;
9904  txn->set(new_omap_prefix, new_tail, empty);
9905  txn_cost += new_tail.length() + new_tail.length();
9906  }
9907  // values
9908  string final_key;
9909  Onode::calc_omap_key(new_flags, o.get(), string(), &final_key);
9910  size_t base_key_len = final_key.size();
9911  while (it->valid() && it->key() < tail) {
9912  string user_key;
9913  o->decode_omap_key(it->key(), &user_key);
9914  dout(20) << __func__ << " got " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
9915  << " -> " << user_key << dendl;
9916 
9917  final_key.resize(base_key_len);
9918  final_key += user_key;
9919  auto v = it->value();
9920  txn->set(new_omap_prefix, final_key, v);
9921  txn_cost += final_key.length() + v.length();
9922 
9923  // submit a portion if cost exceeds 16MB
9924  if (txn_cost >= 16 * (1 << 20) ) {
9925  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9926  txn = db->get_transaction();
9927  txn_cost = 0;
9928  }
9929  it->next();
9930  }
9931  if (txn_cost > 0) {
9932  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9933  }
9934  }
9935  // finalize: remove legacy data
9936  {
9937  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
9938  // remove old keys
9939  const string& old_omap_prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
9940  string old_head, old_tail;
9941  o->get_omap_header(&old_head);
9942  o->get_omap_tail(&old_tail);
9943  txn->rm_range_keys(old_omap_prefix, old_head, old_tail);
9944  txn->rmkey(old_omap_prefix, old_tail);
9945  // set flag
9946  o->onode.set_flag(bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPOOL_OMAP | bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPG_OMAP);
9947  _record_onode(o, txn);
9948  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
9949  repairer->inc_repaired();
9950  repairer->request_compaction();
9951  }
9952  }
9953 }
9954 
9955 void BlueStore::_fsck_check_objects(
9956  FSCKDepth depth,
9957  BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx& ctx)
9958 {
9959  auto& errors = ctx.errors;
9960  auto sb_info_lock = ctx.sb_info_lock;
9961  auto& sb_info = ctx.sb_info;
9962  auto& sb_ref_counts = ctx.sb_ref_counts;
9963  auto repairer = ctx.repairer;
9964 
9965  uint64_t_btree_t used_nids;
9966 
9967  size_t processed_myself = 0;
9968 
9969  auto it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
9970  mempool::bluestore_fsck::list<string> expecting_shards;
9971  if (it) {
9972  const size_t thread_count = cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_quick_fix_threads;
9973  typedef ShallowFSCKThreadPool::FSCKWorkQueue<256> WQ;
9974  std::unique_ptr<WQ> wq(
9975  new WQ(
9976  "FSCKWorkQueue",
9977  (thread_count ? : 1) * 32,
9978  this,
9979  sb_info_lock,
9980  sb_info,
9981  sb_ref_counts,
9982  repairer));
9983 
9984  ShallowFSCKThreadPool thread_pool(cct, "ShallowFSCKThreadPool", "ShallowFSCK", thread_count);
9985 
9986  thread_pool.add_work_queue(wq.get());
9987  if (depth == FSCK_SHALLOW && thread_count > 0) {
9988  //not the best place but let's check anyway
9989  ceph_assert(sb_info_lock);
9990  thread_pool.start();
9991  }
9992 
9993  // fill global if not overriden below
9994  CollectionRef c;
9995  int64_t pool_id = -1;
9996  spg_t pgid;
9997  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
9998  dout(30) << __func__ << " key "
9999  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
10000  if (is_extent_shard_key(it->key())) {
10001  if (depth == FSCK_SHALLOW) {
10002  continue;
10003  }
10004  while (!expecting_shards.empty() &&
10005  expecting_shards.front() < it->key()) {
10006  derr << "fsck error: missing shard key "
10007  << pretty_binary_string(expecting_shards.front())
10008  << dendl;
10009  ++errors;
10010  expecting_shards.pop_front();
10011  }
10012  if (!expecting_shards.empty() &&
10013  expecting_shards.front() == it->key()) {
10014  // all good
10015  expecting_shards.pop_front();
10016  continue;
10017  }
10018 
10019  uint32_t offset;
10020  string okey;
10021  get_key_extent_shard(it->key(), &okey, &offset);
10022  derr << "fsck error: stray shard 0x" << std::hex << offset
10023  << std::dec << dendl;
10024  if (expecting_shards.empty()) {
10025  derr << "fsck error: " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
10026  << " is unexpected" << dendl;
10027  ++errors;
10028  continue;
10029  }
10030  while (expecting_shards.front() > it->key()) {
10031  derr << "fsck error: saw " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
10032  << dendl;
10033  derr << "fsck error: exp "
10034  << pretty_binary_string(expecting_shards.front()) << dendl;
10035  ++errors;
10036  expecting_shards.pop_front();
10037  if (expecting_shards.empty()) {
10038  break;
10039  }
10040  }
10041  continue;
10042  }
10043 
10044  ghobject_t oid;
10045  int r = get_key_object(it->key(), &oid);
10046  if (r < 0) {
10047  derr << "fsck error: bad object key "
10048  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
10049  ++errors;
10050  continue;
10051  }
10052  if (!c ||
10053  oid.shard_id != pgid.shard ||
10054  oid.hobj.get_logical_pool() != (int64_t)pgid.pool() ||
10055  !c->contains(oid)) {
10056  c = nullptr;
10057  for (auto& p : coll_map) {
10058  if (p.second->contains(oid)) {
10059  c = p.second;
10060  break;
10061  }
10062  }
10063  if (!c) {
10064  derr << "fsck error: stray object " << oid
10065  << " not owned by any collection" << dendl;
10066  ++errors;
10067  continue;
10068  }
