10069  pool_id = c->cid.is_pg(&pgid) ? pgid.pool() : META_POOL_ID;
10070  dout(20) << __func__ << " collection " << c->cid << " " << c->cnode
10071  << dendl;
10072  }
10073 
10074  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW &&
10075  !expecting_shards.empty()) {
10076  for (auto& k : expecting_shards) {
10077  derr << "fsck error: missing shard key "
10078  << pretty_binary_string(k) << dendl;
10079  }
10080  ++errors;
10081  expecting_shards.clear();
10082  }
10083 
10084  bool queued = false;
10085  if (depth == FSCK_SHALLOW && thread_count > 0) {
10086  queued = wq->queue(
10087  pool_id,
10088  c,
10089  oid,
10090  it->key(),
10091  it->value());
10092  }
10093  OnodeRef o;
10094  map<BlobRef, bluestore_blob_t::unused_t> referenced;
10095 
10096  if (!queued) {
10097  ++processed_myself;
10098  o = fsck_check_objects_shallow(
10099  depth,
10100  pool_id,
10101  c,
10102  oid,
10103  it->key(),
10104  it->value(),
10105  &expecting_shards,
10106  &referenced,
10107  ctx);
10108  }
10109 
10110  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
10111  ceph_assert(o != nullptr);
10112  if (o->onode.nid) {
10113  if (o->onode.nid > nid_max) {
10114  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " nid " << o->onode.nid
10115  << " > nid_max " << nid_max << dendl;
10116  ++errors;
10117  }
10118  if (used_nids.count(o->onode.nid)) {
10119  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " nid " << o->onode.nid
10120  << " already in use" << dendl;
10121  ++errors;
10122  continue; // go for next object
10123  }
10124  used_nids.insert(o->onode.nid);
10125  }
10126  for (auto& i : referenced) {
10127  dout(20) << __func__ << " referenced 0x" << std::hex << i.second
10128  << std::dec << " for " << *i.first << dendl;
10129  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = i.first->get_blob();
10130  if (i.second & blob.unused) {
10131  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << " blob claims unused 0x"
10132  << std::hex << blob.unused
10133  << " but extents reference 0x" << i.second << std::dec
10134  << " on blob " << *i.first << dendl;
10135  ++errors;
10136  }
10137  if (blob.has_csum()) {
10138  uint64_t blob_len = blob.get_logical_length();
10139  uint64_t unused_chunk_size = blob_len / (sizeof(blob.unused) * 8);
10140  unsigned csum_count = blob.get_csum_count();
10141  unsigned csum_chunk_size = blob.get_csum_chunk_size();
10142  for (unsigned p = 0; p < csum_count; ++p) {
10143  unsigned pos = p * csum_chunk_size;
10144  unsigned firstbit = pos / unused_chunk_size; // [firstbit,lastbit]
10145  unsigned lastbit = (pos + csum_chunk_size - 1) / unused_chunk_size;
10146  unsigned mask = 1u << firstbit;
10147  for (unsigned b = firstbit + 1; b <= lastbit; ++b) {
10148  mask |= 1u << b;
10149  }
10150  if ((blob.unused & mask) == mask) {
10151  // this csum chunk region is marked unused
10152  if (blob.get_csum_item(p) != 0) {
10153  derr << "fsck error: " << oid
10154  << " blob claims csum chunk 0x" << std::hex << pos
10155  << "~" << csum_chunk_size
10156  << " is unused (mask 0x" << mask << " of unused 0x"
10157  << blob.unused << ") but csum is non-zero 0x"
10158  << blob.get_csum_item(p) << std::dec << " on blob "
10159  << *i.first << dendl;
10160  ++errors;
10161  }
10162  }
10163  }
10164  }
10165  }
10166  // omap
10167  if (o->onode.has_omap()) {
10168  ceph_assert(ctx.used_omap_head);
10169  if (ctx.used_omap_head->count(o->onode.nid)) {
10170  derr << "fsck error: " << o->oid << " omap_head " << o->onode.nid
10171  << " already in use" << dendl;
10172  ++errors;
10173  } else {
10174  ctx.used_omap_head->insert(o->onode.nid);
10175  }
10176  } // if (o->onode.has_omap())
10177  if (depth == FSCK_DEEP) {
10178  bufferlist bl;
10179  uint64_t max_read_block = cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_read_bytes_cap;
10180  uint64_t offset = 0;
10181  do {
10182  uint64_t l = std::min(uint64_t(o->onode.size - offset), max_read_block);
10183  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o, offset, l, bl,
10184  CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_NOCACHE);
10185  if (r < 0) {
10186  ++errors;
10187  derr << "fsck error: " << oid << std::hex
10188  << " error during read: "
10189  << " " << offset << "~" << l
10190  << " " << cpp_strerror(r) << std::dec
10191  << dendl;
10192  break;
10193  }
10194  offset += l;
10195  } while (offset < o->onode.size);
10196  } // deep
10197  } //if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW)
10198  } // for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next())
10199  if (depth == FSCK_SHALLOW && thread_count > 0) {
10200  wq->finalize(thread_pool, ctx);
10201  if (processed_myself) {
10202  // may be needs more threads?
10203  dout(0) << __func__ << " partial offload"
10204  << ", done myself " << processed_myself
10205  << " of " << ctx.num_objects
10206  << "objects, threads " << thread_count
10207  << dendl;
10208  }
10209  }
10210  } // if (it)
10211 }
10248 int BlueStore::_fsck(BlueStore::FSCKDepth depth, bool repair)
10249 {
10250  dout(5) << __func__
10251  << (repair ? " repair" : " check")
10252  << (depth == FSCK_DEEP ? " (deep)" :
10253  depth == FSCK_SHALLOW ? " (shallow)" : " (regular)")
10254  << dendl;
10255 
10256  // in deep mode we need R/W write access to be able to replay deferred ops
10257  const bool read_only = !(repair || depth == FSCK_DEEP);
10258  int r = _open_db_and_around(read_only);
10259  if (r < 0) {
10260  return r;
10261  }
10262  auto close_db = make_scope_guard([&] {
10263  _close_db_and_around();
10264  });
10265 
10266  if (!read_only) {
10267  r = _upgrade_super();
10268  if (r < 0) {
10269  return r;
10270  }
10271  }
10272 
10273  // NullFreelistManager needs to open collection early
10274  r = _open_collections();
10275  if (r < 0) {
10276  return r;
10277  }
10278 
10279  mempool_thread.init();
10280  auto stop_mempool = make_scope_guard([&] {
10281  mempool_thread.shutdown();
10282  _shutdown_cache();
10283  });
10284  // we need finisher and kv_{sync,finalize}_thread *just* for replay
10285  // enable in repair or deep mode modes only
10286  if (!read_only) {
10287  _kv_start();
10288  r = _deferred_replay();
10289  _kv_stop();
10290  }
10291 
10292  if (r < 0) {
10293  return r;
10294  }
10295  return _fsck_on_open(depth, repair);
10296 }
10297 
10298 int BlueStore::_fsck_on_open(BlueStore::FSCKDepth depth, bool repair)
10299 {
10300  uint64_t sb_hash_size = uint64_t(
10301  cct->_conf.get_val<Option::size_t>("osd_memory_target") *
10302  cct->_conf.get_val<double>(
10303  "bluestore_fsck_shared_blob_tracker_size"));
10304 
10305  dout(1) << __func__
10306  << " <<<START>>>"
10307  << (repair ? " repair" : " check")
10308  << (depth == FSCK_DEEP ? " (deep)" :
10309  depth == FSCK_SHALLOW ? " (shallow)" : " (regular)")
10310  << " start sb_tracker_hash_size:" << sb_hash_size
10311  << dendl;
10312  int64_t errors = 0;
10313  int64_t warnings = 0;
10314  unsigned repaired = 0;
10315 
10316  uint64_t_btree_t used_omap_head;
10317  uint64_t_btree_t used_sbids;
10318 
10319  mempool_dynamic_bitset used_blocks, bluefs_used_blocks;
10320  KeyValueDB::Iterator it;
10321  store_statfs_t expected_store_statfs;
10322  per_pool_statfs expected_pool_statfs;
10323 
10324  sb_info_space_efficient_map_t sb_info;
10325  shared_blob_2hash_tracker_t sb_ref_counts(
10326  sb_hash_size,
10327  min_alloc_size);
10328  size_t sb_ref_mismatches = 0;
10329 
10331  std::vector<std::unordered_map<ghobject_t, uint64_t>> zone_refs; // FIXME: this may be a lot of RAM!
10332 
10333  uint64_t num_objects = 0;
10334  uint64_t num_extents = 0;
10335  uint64_t num_blobs = 0;
10336  uint64_t num_spanning_blobs = 0;
10337  uint64_t num_shared_blobs = 0;
10338  uint64_t num_sharded_objects = 0;
10339  BlueStoreRepairer repairer;
10340 
10341  auto alloc_size = fm->get_alloc_size();
10342 
10343  utime_t start = ceph_clock_now();
10344 
10345  _fsck_collections(&errors);
10346  used_blocks.resize(fm->get_alloc_units());
10347 
10348  if (bluefs) {
10349  interval_set<uint64_t> bluefs_extents;
10350 
10351  bluefs->foreach_block_extents(
10352  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev,
10353  [&](uint64_t start, uint32_t len) {
10354  apply_for_bitset_range(start, len, alloc_size, used_blocks,
10355  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset& bs) {
10356  ceph_assert(pos < bs.size());
10357  bs.set(pos);
10358  }
10359  );
10360  }
10361  );
10362  }
10363 
10364  bluefs_used_blocks = used_blocks;
10365 
10366  apply_for_bitset_range(
10367  0, std::max<uint64_t>(min_alloc_size, DB_SUPER_RESERVED), alloc_size, used_blocks,
10368  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset &bs) {
10369  bs.set(pos);
10370  }
10371  );
10372 
10373 
10374  if (repair) {
10375  repairer.init_space_usage_tracker(
10376  bdev->get_size(),
10377  min_alloc_size);
10378  }
10379 
10380  if (bluefs) {
10381  int r = bluefs->fsck();
10382  if (r < 0) {
10383  return r;
10384  }
10385  if (r > 0)
10386  errors += r;
10387  }
10388 
10389  if (!per_pool_stat_collection) {
10390  const char *w;
10391  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_error_on_no_per_pool_stats) {
10392  w = "error";
10393  ++errors;
10394  } else {
10395  w = "warning";
10396  ++warnings;
10397  }
10398  derr << "fsck " << w << ": store not yet converted to per-pool stats"
10399  << dendl;
10400  }
10401  if (per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_PG) {
10402  const char *w;
10403  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_fsck_error_on_no_per_pool_omap) {
10404  w = "error";
10405  ++errors;
10406  } else {
10407  w = "warning";
10408  ++warnings;
10409  }
10410  derr << "fsck " << w << ": store not yet converted to per-pg omap"
10411  << dendl;
10412  }
10413 
10414  if (g_conf()->bluestore_debug_fsck_abort) {
10415  dout(1) << __func__ << " debug abort" << dendl;
10416  goto out_scan;
10417  }
10418 
10419 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
10420  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
10421  auto a = dynamic_cast<ZonedAllocator*>(alloc);
10422  ceph_assert(a);
10423  auto f = dynamic_cast<ZonedFreelistManager*>(fm);
10424  ceph_assert(f);
10425  vector<uint64_t> wp = bdev->get_zones();
10426  vector<zone_state_t> zones = f->get_zone_states(db);
10427  ceph_assert(wp.size() == zones.size());
10428  auto num_zones = bdev->get_size() / zone_size;
10429  for (unsigned i = first_sequential_zone; i < num_zones; ++i) {
10430  uint64_t p = wp[i] == (i + 1) * zone_size ? zone_size : wp[i] % zone_size;
10431  if (zones[i].write_pointer > p &&
10432  zones[i].num_dead_bytes < zones[i].write_pointer) {
10433  derr << "fsck error: zone 0x" << std::hex << i
10434  << " bluestore write pointer 0x" << zones[i].write_pointer
10435  << " > device write pointer 0x" << p
10436  << " (with only 0x" << zones[i].num_dead_bytes << " dead bytes)"
10437  << std::dec << dendl;
10438  ++errors;
10439  }
10440  }
10441 
10442  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
10443  // load zone refs
10444  zone_refs.resize(bdev->get_size() / zone_size);
10445  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10446  if (it) {
10447  for (it->lower_bound(string());
10448  it->valid();
10449  it->next()) {
10450  uint32_t zone = 0;
10451  uint64_t offset = 0;
10452  ghobject_t oid;
10453  string key = it->key();
10454  int r = get_key_zone_offset_object(key, &zone, &offset, &oid);
10455  if (r < 0) {
10456  derr << "fsck error: invalid zone ref key " << pretty_binary_string(key)
10457  << dendl;
10458  if (repair) {
10459  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key);
10460  }
10461  ++errors;
10462  continue;
10463  }
10464  dout(30) << " zone ref 0x" << std::hex << zone << " offset 0x" << offset
10465  << " -> " << std::dec << oid << dendl;
10466  if (zone_refs[zone].count(oid)) {
10467  derr << "fsck error: second zone ref in zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
10468  << " offset 0x" << offset << std::dec << " for " << oid << dendl;
10469  if (repair) {
10470  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key);
10471  }
10472  ++errors;
10473  continue;
10474  }
10475  zone_refs[zone][oid] = offset;
10476  }
10477  }
10478  }
10479  }
10480 #endif
10481 
10482  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking shared_blobs (phase 1)" << dendl;
10483  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10484  if (it) {
10485  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10486  string key = it->key();
10487  uint64_t sbid;
10488  if (get_key_shared_blob(key, &sbid) < 0) {
10489  // Failed to parse the key.
10490  // This gonna to be handled at the second stage
10491  continue;
10492  }
10493  bluestore_shared_blob_t shared_blob(sbid);
10494  bufferlist bl = it->value();
10495  auto blp = bl.cbegin();
10496  try {
10497  decode(shared_blob, blp);
10498  }
10499  catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
10500  // this gonna to be handled at the second stage
10501  continue;
10502  }
10503  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << shared_blob << dendl;
10504  auto& sbi = sb_info.add_maybe_stray(sbid);
10505 
10506  // primarily to silent the 'unused' warning
10507  ceph_assert(sbi.pool_id == sb_info_t::INVALID_POOL_ID);
10508 
10509  for (auto& r : shared_blob.ref_map.ref_map) {
10510  sb_ref_counts.inc_range(
10511  sbid,
10512  r.first,
10513  r.second.length,
10514  -r.second.refs);
10515  }
10516  }
10517  } // if (it) //checking shared_blobs (phase1)
10518 
10519  // walk PREFIX_OBJ
10520  {
10521  dout(1) << __func__ << " walking object keyspace" << dendl;
10522  ceph::mutex sb_info_lock = ceph::make_mutex("BlueStore::fsck::sbinfo_lock");
10523  BlueStore::FSCK_ObjectCtx ctx(
10524  errors,
10525  warnings,
10526  num_objects,
10527  num_extents,
10528  num_blobs,
10529  num_sharded_objects,
10530  num_spanning_blobs,
10531  &used_blocks,
10532  &used_omap_head,
10533  &zone_refs,
10534  //no need for the below lock when in non-shallow mode as
10535  // there is no multithreading in this case
10536  depth == FSCK_SHALLOW ? &sb_info_lock : nullptr,
10537  sb_info,
10538  sb_ref_counts,
10539  expected_store_statfs,
10540  expected_pool_statfs,
10541  repair ? &repairer : nullptr);
10542 
10543  _fsck_check_objects(depth, ctx);
10544  }
10545 
10546 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
10547  if (bdev->is_smr() && depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
10548  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking for leaked zone refs" << dendl;
10549  for (uint32_t zone = 0; zone < zone_refs.size(); ++zone) {
10550  for (auto& [oid, offset] : zone_refs[zone]) {
10551  derr << "fsck error: stray zone ref 0x" << std::hex << zone
10552  << " offset 0x" << offset << " -> " << std::dec << oid << dendl;
10553  // FIXME: add repair
10554  ++errors;
10555  }
10556  }
10557  }
10558 #endif
10559 
10560  sb_ref_mismatches = sb_ref_counts.count_non_zero();
10561  if (sb_ref_mismatches != 0) {
10562  derr << "fsck error:" << "*" << sb_ref_mismatches
10563  << " shared blob references aren't matching, at least "
10564  << sb_ref_mismatches << " found" << dendl;
10565  errors += sb_ref_mismatches;
10566  if (!repair) {
10567  uint32_t cnts = 0;
10568  _fsck_foreach_shared_blob( [&](coll_t cid,
10569  ghobject_t oid,
10570  uint64_t sbid,
10571  const bluestore_blob_t& b) {
10572  for (auto& p : b.get_extents()) {
10573  if (p.is_valid() &&
10574  !sb_ref_counts.test_all_zero_range(sbid,
10575  p.offset,
10576  p.length)) {
10577  derr << "fsck possibly broken shared blob found for col:" << cid
10578  << " obj:" << oid
10579  << " sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
10580  << " " << p
10581  << dendl;
10582  ++cnts;
10583  break;
10584  }
10585  }
10586  return cnts <= MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES;
10587  });
10588  }
10589  }
10590 
10591  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW && repair) {
10592  _fsck_repair_shared_blobs(repairer, sb_ref_counts, sb_info);
10593  }
10594  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking shared_blobs (phase 2)" << dendl;
10595  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10596  if (it) {
10597  // FIXME minor: perhaps simplify for shallow mode?
10598  // fill global if not overriden below
10599  auto expected_statfs = &expected_store_statfs;
10600  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10601  string key = it->key();
10602  uint64_t sbid;
10603  if (get_key_shared_blob(key, &sbid)) {
10604  derr << "fsck error: bad key '" << key
10605  << "' in shared blob namespace" << dendl;
10606  if (repair) {
10607  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
10608  }
10609  ++errors;
10610  continue;
10611  }
10612  auto p = sb_info.find(sbid);
10613  if (p == sb_info.end()) {
10614  if (sb_ref_mismatches > 0) {
10615  // highly likely this has been already reported before, ignoring...
10616  dout(5) << __func__ << " found duplicate(?) stray shared blob data for sbid 0x"
10617  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec << dendl;
10618  } else {
10619  derr<< "fsck error: found stray shared blob data for sbid 0x"
10620  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec << dendl;
10621  ++errors;
10622  if (repair) {
10623  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
10624  }
10625  }
10626  } else {
10627  ++num_shared_blobs;
10628  sb_info_t& sbi = *p;
10629  bluestore_shared_blob_t shared_blob(sbid);
10630  bufferlist bl = it->value();
10631  auto blp = bl.cbegin();
10632  try {
10633  decode(shared_blob, blp);
10634  }
10635  catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
10636  ++errors;
10637 
10638  derr << "fsck error: failed to decode Shared Blob"
10639  << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
10640  if (repair) {
10641  dout(20) << __func__ << " undecodable Shared Blob, key:'"
10642  << pretty_binary_string(key)
10643  << "', removing" << dendl;
10644  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
10645  }
10646  continue;
10647  }
10648  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << shared_blob << dendl;
10649  PExtentVector extents;
10650  for (auto& r : shared_blob.ref_map.ref_map) {
10651  extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(r.first, r.second.length));
10652  }
10653  if (sbi.pool_id != sb_info_t::INVALID_POOL_ID &&
10654  (per_pool_stat_collection || repair)) {
10655  expected_statfs = &expected_pool_statfs[sbi.pool_id];
10656  }
10657  std::stringstream ss;
10658  ss << "sbid 0x" << std::hex << sbid << std::dec;
10659  errors += _fsck_check_extents(ss.str(),
10660  extents,
10661  sbi.allocated_chunks < 0,
10662  used_blocks,
10663  fm->get_alloc_size(),
10664  repair ? &repairer : nullptr,
10665  *expected_statfs,
10666  depth);
10667  }
10668  }
10669  } // if (it) /* checking shared_blobs (phase 2)*/
10670 
10671  if (repair && repairer.preprocess_misreference(db)) {
10672 
10673  dout(1) << __func__ << " sorting out misreferenced extents" << dendl;
10674  auto& misref_extents = repairer.get_misreferences();
10675  interval_set<uint64_t> to_release;
10676  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10677  if (it) {
10678  // fill global if not overriden below
10679  auto expected_statfs = &expected_store_statfs;
10680 
10681  CollectionRef c;
10682  spg_t pgid;
10683  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = repairer.get_fix_misreferences_txn();
10684  bool bypass_rest = false;
10685  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid() && !bypass_rest;
10686  it->next()) {
10687  dout(30) << __func__ << " key "
10688  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
10689  if (is_extent_shard_key(it->key())) {
10690  continue;
10691  }
10692 
10693  ghobject_t oid;
10694  int r = get_key_object(it->key(), &oid);
10695  if (r < 0 || !repairer.is_used(oid)) {
10696  continue;
10697  }
10698 
10699  if (!c ||
10700  oid.shard_id != pgid.shard ||
10701  oid.hobj.get_logical_pool() != (int64_t)pgid.pool() ||
10702  !c->contains(oid)) {
10703  c = nullptr;
10704  for (auto& p : coll_map) {
10705  if (p.second->contains(oid)) {
10706  c = p.second;
10707  break;
10708  }
10709  }
10710  if (!c) {
10711  continue;
10712  }
10713  if (per_pool_stat_collection || repair) {
10714  auto pool_id = c->cid.is_pg(&pgid) ? pgid.pool() : META_POOL_ID;
10715  expected_statfs = &expected_pool_statfs[pool_id];
10716  }
10717  }
10718  if (!repairer.is_used(c->cid)) {
10719  continue;
10720  }
10721 
10722  dout(20) << __func__ << " check misreference for col:" << c->cid
10723  << " obj:" << oid << dendl;
10724 
10725  OnodeRef o;
10726  o.reset(Onode::create_decode(c, oid, it->key(), it->value()));
10727  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
10728  mempool::bluestore_fsck::set<BlobRef> blobs;
10729 
10730  for (auto& e : o->extent_map.extent_map) {
10731  blobs.insert(e.blob);
10732  }
10733  bool need_onode_update = false;
10734  bool first_dump = true;
10735  for(auto b : blobs) {
10736  bool broken_blob = false;
10737  auto& pextents = b->dirty_blob().dirty_extents();
10738  for (auto& e : pextents) {
10739  if (!e.is_valid()) {
10740  continue;
10741  }
10742  // for the sake of simplicity and proper shared blob handling
10743  // always rewrite the whole blob even when it's partially
10744  // misreferenced.
10745  if (misref_extents.intersects(e.offset, e.length)) {
10746  if (first_dump) {
10747  first_dump = false;
10748  _dump_onode<10>(cct, *o);
10749  }
10750  broken_blob = true;
10751  break;
10752  }
10753  }
10754  if (!broken_blob)
10755  continue;
10756  bool compressed = b->get_blob().is_compressed();
10757  need_onode_update = true;
10758  dout(10) << __func__
10759  << " fix misreferences in oid:" << oid
10760  << " " << *b << dendl;
10761  uint64_t b_off = 0;
10762  PExtentVector pext_to_release;
10763  pext_to_release.reserve(pextents.size());
10764  // rewriting all valid pextents
10765  for (auto e = pextents.begin(); e != pextents.end();
10766  e++) {
10767  auto b_off_cur = b_off;
10768  b_off += e->length;
10769  if (!e->is_valid()) {
10770  continue;
10771  }
10772  PExtentVector exts;
10773  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::(F)alloc=" << alloc << ", length=" << e->length << dendl;
10774  int64_t alloc_len =
10775  alloc->allocate(e->length, min_alloc_size,
10776  0, 0, &exts);
10777  if (alloc_len < 0 || alloc_len < (int64_t)e->length) {
10778  derr << __func__
10779  << " failed to allocate 0x" << std::hex << e->length
10780  << " allocated 0x " << (alloc_len < 0 ? 0 : alloc_len)
10781  << " min_alloc_size 0x" << min_alloc_size
10782  << " available 0x " << alloc->get_free()
10783  << std::dec << dendl;
10784  if (alloc_len > 0) {
10785  alloc->release(exts);
10786  }
10787  bypass_rest = true;
10788  break;
10789  }
10790  expected_statfs->allocated += e->length;
10791  if (compressed) {
10792  expected_statfs->data_compressed_allocated += e->length;
10793  }
10794 
10795  bufferlist bl;
10796  IOContext ioc(cct, NULL, !cct->_conf->bluestore_fail_eio);
10797  r = bdev->read(e->offset, e->length, &bl, &ioc, false);
10798  if (r < 0) {
10799  derr << __func__ << " failed to read from 0x" << std::hex << e->offset
10800  <<"~" << e->length << std::dec << dendl;
10801  ceph_abort_msg("read failed, wtf");
10802  }
10803  pext_to_release.push_back(*e);
10804  e = pextents.erase(e);
10805  e = pextents.insert(e, exts.begin(), exts.end());
10806  b->get_blob().map_bl(
10807  b_off_cur, bl,
10808  [&](uint64_t offset, bufferlist& t) {
10809  int r = bdev->write(offset, t, false);
10810  ceph_assert(r == 0);
10811  });
10812  e += exts.size() - 1;
10813  for (auto& p : exts) {
10814  fm->allocate(p.offset, p.length, txn);
10815  }
10816  } // for (auto e = pextents.begin(); e != pextents.end(); e++) {
10817 
10818  if (b->get_blob().is_shared()) {
10819  b->dirty_blob().clear_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_SHARED);
10820 
10821  auto sbid = b->shared_blob->get_sbid();
10822  auto sb_it = sb_info.find(sbid);
10823  ceph_assert(sb_it != sb_info.end());
10824  sb_info_t& sbi = *sb_it;
10825 
10826  if (sbi.allocated_chunks < 0) {
10827  // NB: it's crucial to use compressed_allocated_chunks from sb_info_t
10828  // as we originally used that value while accumulating
10829  // expected_statfs
10830  expected_statfs->allocated -= uint64_t(-sbi.allocated_chunks) << min_alloc_size_order;
10831  expected_statfs->data_compressed_allocated -=
10832  uint64_t(-sbi.allocated_chunks) << min_alloc_size_order;
10833  } else {
10834  expected_statfs->allocated -= uint64_t(sbi.allocated_chunks) << min_alloc_size_order;
10835  }
10836  sbi.allocated_chunks = 0;
10837  repairer.fix_shared_blob(txn, sbid, nullptr, 0);
10838 
10839  // relying on blob's pextents to decide what to release.
10840  for (auto& p : pext_to_release) {
10841  to_release.union_insert(p.offset, p.length);
10842  }
10843  } else {
10844  for (auto& p : pext_to_release) {
10845  expected_statfs->allocated -= p.length;
10846  if (compressed) {
10847  expected_statfs->data_compressed_allocated -= p.length;
10848  }
10849  to_release.union_insert(p.offset, p.length);
10850  }
10851  }
10852  if (bypass_rest) {
10853  break;
10854  }
10855  } // for(auto b : blobs)
10856  if (need_onode_update) {
10857  o->extent_map.dirty_range(0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
10858  _record_onode(o, txn);
10859  }
10860  } // for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next())
10861 
10862  for (auto it = to_release.begin(); it != to_release.end(); ++it) {
10863  dout(10) << __func__ << " release 0x" << std::hex << it.get_start()
10864  << "~" << it.get_len() << std::dec << dendl;
10865  fm->release(it.get_start(), it.get_len(), txn);
10866  }
10867  alloc->release(to_release);
10868  to_release.clear();
10869  } // if (it) {
10870  } //if (repair && repairer.preprocess_misreference()) {
10871  sb_info.clear();
10872  sb_ref_counts.reset();
10873 
10874  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking pool_statfs" << dendl;
10875  _fsck_check_statfs(expected_store_statfs, expected_pool_statfs,
10876  errors, warnings, repair ? &repairer : nullptr);
10877  if (depth != FSCK_SHALLOW) {
10878  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking for stray omap data " << dendl;
10879  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OMAP, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10880  if (it) {
10881  uint64_t last_omap_head = 0;
10882  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10883  uint64_t omap_head;
10884 
10885  _key_decode_u64(it->key().c_str(), &omap_head);
10886 
10887  if (used_omap_head.count(omap_head) == 0 &&
10888  omap_head != last_omap_head) {
10889  pair<string,string> rk = it->raw_key();
10890  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
10891  << "fsck error: found stray omap data on omap_head "
10892  << omap_head << " " << last_omap_head
10893  << " prefix/key: " << url_escape(rk.first)
10894  << " " << url_escape(rk.second)
10895  << fsck_dendl;
10896  ++errors;
10897  last_omap_head = omap_head;
10898  }
10899  }
10900  }
10901  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_PGMETA_OMAP, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10902  if (it) {
10903  uint64_t last_omap_head = 0;
10904  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10905  uint64_t omap_head;
10906  _key_decode_u64(it->key().c_str(), &omap_head);
10907  if (used_omap_head.count(omap_head) == 0 &&
10908  omap_head != last_omap_head) {
10909  pair<string,string> rk = it->raw_key();
10910  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
10911  << "fsck error: found stray (pgmeta) omap data on omap_head "
10912  << omap_head << " " << last_omap_head
10913  << " prefix/key: " << url_escape(rk.first)
10914  << " " << url_escape(rk.second)
10915  << fsck_dendl;
10916  last_omap_head = omap_head;
10917  ++errors;
10918  }
10919  }
10920  }
10921  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10922  if (it) {
10923  uint64_t last_omap_head = 0;
10924  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10925  uint64_t pool;
10926  uint64_t omap_head;
10927  string k = it->key();
10928  const char *c = k.c_str();
10929  c = _key_decode_u64(c, &pool);
10930  c = _key_decode_u64(c, &omap_head);
10931  if (used_omap_head.count(omap_head) == 0 &&
10932  omap_head != last_omap_head) {
10933  pair<string,string> rk = it->raw_key();
10934  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
10935  << "fsck error: found stray (per-pool) omap data on omap_head "
10936  << omap_head << " " << last_omap_head
10937  << " prefix/key: " << url_escape(rk.first)
10938  << " " << url_escape(rk.second)
10939  << fsck_dendl;
10940  ++errors;
10941  last_omap_head = omap_head;
10942  }
10943  }
10944  }
10945  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10946  if (it) {
10947  uint64_t last_omap_head = 0;
10948  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10949  uint64_t pool;
10950  uint32_t hash;
10951  uint64_t omap_head;
10952  string k = it->key();
10953  const char* c = k.c_str();
10954  c = _key_decode_u64(c, &pool);
10955  c = _key_decode_u32(c, &hash);
10956  c = _key_decode_u64(c, &omap_head);
10957  if (used_omap_head.count(omap_head) == 0 &&
10958  omap_head != last_omap_head) {
10959  fsck_derr(errors, MAX_FSCK_ERROR_LINES)
10960  << "fsck error: found stray (per-pg) omap data on omap_head "
10961  << " key " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
10962  << omap_head << " " << last_omap_head << " " << used_omap_head.count(omap_head) << fsck_dendl;
10963  ++errors;
10964  last_omap_head = omap_head;
10965  }
10966  }
10967  }
10968  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking deferred events" << dendl;
10969  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_DEFERRED, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
10970  if (it) {
10971  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
10972  bufferlist bl = it->value();
10973  auto p = bl.cbegin();
10974  bluestore_deferred_transaction_t wt;
10975  try {
10976  decode(wt, p);
10977  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
10978  derr << "fsck error: failed to decode deferred txn "
10979  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
10980  if (repair) {
10981  dout(20) << __func__ << " undecodable deferred TXN record, key: '"
10982  << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
10983  << "', removing" << dendl;
10984  repairer.remove_key(db, PREFIX_DEFERRED, it->key());
10985  }
10986  continue;
10987  }
10988  dout(20) << __func__ << " deferred " << wt.seq
10989  << " ops " << wt.ops.size()
10990  << " released 0x" << std::hex << wt.released << std::dec << dendl;
10991  for (auto e = wt.released.begin(); e != wt.released.end(); ++e) {
10992  apply_for_bitset_range(
10993  e.get_start(), e.get_len(), alloc_size, used_blocks,
10994  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset &bs) {
10995  bs.set(pos);
10996  }
10997  );
10998  }
10999  }
11000  }
11001 
11002  // skip freelist vs allocated compare when we have Null fm
11003  if (!fm->is_null_manager()) {
11004  dout(1) << __func__ << " checking freelist vs allocated" << dendl;
11005 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
11006  if (freelist_type == "zoned") {
11007  // verify per-zone state
11008  // - verify no allocations beyond write pointer
11009  // - verify num_dead_bytes count (neither allocated nor
11010  // free space past the write pointer)
11011  auto a = dynamic_cast<ZonedAllocator*>(alloc);
11012  auto num_zones = bdev->get_size() / zone_size;
11013 
11014  // mark the free space past the write pointer
11015  for (uint32_t zone = first_sequential_zone; zone < num_zones; ++zone) {
11016  auto wp = a->get_write_pointer(zone);
11017  uint64_t offset = zone_size * zone + wp;
11018  uint64_t length = zone_size - wp;
11019  if (!length) {
11020  continue;
11021  }
11022  bool intersects = false;
11023  dout(10) << " marking zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
11024  << " region after wp 0x" << offset << "~" << length
11025  << std::dec << dendl;
11026  apply_for_bitset_range(
11027  offset, length, alloc_size, used_blocks,
11028  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset &bs) {
11029  if (bs.test(pos)) {
11030  derr << "fsck error: zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
11031  << " has used space at 0x" << pos * alloc_size
11032  << " beyond write pointer 0x" << wp
11033  << std::dec << dendl;
11034  intersects = true;
11035  } else {
11036  bs.set(pos);
11037  }
11038  }
11039  );
11040  if (intersects) {
11041  ++errors;
11042  }
11043  }
11044 
11045  used_blocks.flip();
11046 
11047  // skip conventional zones
11048  uint64_t pos = (first_sequential_zone * zone_size) / min_alloc_size - 1;
11049  pos = used_blocks.find_next(pos);
11050 
11051  uint64_t zone_dead = 0;
11052  for (uint32_t zone = first_sequential_zone;
11053  zone < num_zones;
11054  ++zone, zone_dead = 0) {
11055  while (pos != decltype(used_blocks)::npos &&
11056  (pos * min_alloc_size) / zone_size == zone) {
11057  dout(40) << " zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
11058  << " dead 0x" << (pos * min_alloc_size) << "~" << min_alloc_size
11059  << std::dec << dendl;
11060  zone_dead += min_alloc_size;
11061  pos = used_blocks.find_next(pos);
11062  }
11063  dout(20) << " zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << " dead is 0x" << zone_dead
11064  << std::dec << dendl;
11065  // cross-check dead bytes against zone state
11066  if (a->get_dead_bytes(zone) != zone_dead) {
11067  derr << "fsck error: zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << " has 0x" << zone_dead
11068  << " dead bytes but freelist says 0x" << a->get_dead_bytes(zone)
11069  << dendl;
11070  ++errors;
11071  // TODO: repair
11072  }
11073  }
11074  used_blocks.flip();
11075  } else
11076 #endif
11077  {
11078  fm->enumerate_reset();
11079  uint64_t offset, length;
11080  while (fm->enumerate_next(db, &offset, &length)) {
11081  bool intersects = false;
11082  apply_for_bitset_range(
11083  offset, length, alloc_size, used_blocks,
11084  [&](uint64_t pos, mempool_dynamic_bitset &bs) {
11085  ceph_assert(pos < bs.size());
11086  if (bs.test(pos) && !bluefs_used_blocks.test(pos)) {
11087  if (offset == DB_SUPER_RESERVED &&
11088  length == min_alloc_size - DB_SUPER_RESERVED) {
11089  // this is due to the change just after luminous to min_alloc_size
11090  // granularity allocations, and our baked in assumption at the top
11091  // of _fsck that 0~round_up_to(DB_SUPER_RESERVED,min_alloc_size) is used
11092  // (vs luminous's round_up_to(DB_SUPER_RESERVED,block_size)). harmless,
11093  // since we will never allocate this region below min_alloc_size.
11094  dout(10) << __func__ << " ignoring free extent between DB_SUPER_RESERVED"
11095  << " and min_alloc_size, 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~"
11096  << length << std::dec << dendl;
11097  } else {
11098  intersects = true;
11099  if (repair) {
11100  repairer.fix_false_free(db, fm,
11101  pos * min_alloc_size,
11102  min_alloc_size);
11103  }
11104  }
11105  } else {
11106  bs.set(pos);
11107  }
11108  }
11109  );
11110  if (intersects) {
11111  derr << "fsck error: free extent 0x" << std::hex << offset
11112  << "~" << length << std::dec
11113  << " intersects allocated blocks" << dendl;
11114  ++errors;
11115  }
11116  }
11117  fm->enumerate_reset();
11118 
11119  // check for leaked extents
11120  size_t count = used_blocks.count();
11121  if (used_blocks.size() != count) {
11122  ceph_assert(used_blocks.size() > count);
11123  used_blocks.flip();
11124  size_t start = used_blocks.find_first();
11125  while (start != decltype(used_blocks)::npos) {
11126  size_t cur = start;
11127  while (true) {
11128  size_t next = used_blocks.find_next(cur);
11129  if (next != cur + 1) {
11130  ++errors;
11131  derr << "fsck error: leaked extent 0x" << std::hex
11132  << ((uint64_t)start * fm->get_alloc_size()) << "~"
11133  << ((cur + 1 - start) * fm->get_alloc_size()) << std::dec
11134  << dendl;
11135  if (repair) {
11136  repairer.fix_leaked(db,
11137  fm,
11138  start * min_alloc_size,
11139  (cur + 1 - start) * min_alloc_size);
11140  }
11141  start = next;
11142  break;
11143  }
11144  cur = next;
11145  }
11146  }
11147  used_blocks.flip();
11148  }
11149  }
11150  }
11151  }
11152  if (repair) {
11153  if (per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_PG) {
11154  dout(5) << __func__ << " fixing per_pg_omap" << dendl;
11155  repairer.fix_per_pool_omap(db, OMAP_PER_PG);
11156  }
11157 
11158  dout(5) << __func__ << " applying repair results" << dendl;
11159  repaired = repairer.apply(db);
11160  dout(5) << __func__ << " repair applied" << dendl;
11161  }
11162 
11163 out_scan:
11164  dout(2) << __func__ << " " << num_objects << " objects, "
11165  << num_sharded_objects << " of them sharded. "
11166  << dendl;
11167  dout(2) << __func__ << " " << num_extents << " extents to "
11168  << num_blobs << " blobs, "
11169  << num_spanning_blobs << " spanning, "
11170  << num_shared_blobs << " shared."
11171  << dendl;
11172 
11173  utime_t duration = ceph_clock_now() - start;
11174  dout(1) << __func__ << " <<<FINISH>>> with " << errors << " errors, "
11175  << warnings << " warnings, "
11176  << repaired << " repaired, "
11177  << (errors + warnings - (int)repaired) << " remaining in "
11178  << duration << " seconds" << dendl;
11179 
11180  // In non-repair mode we should return error count only as
11181  // it indicates if store status is OK.
11182  // In repair mode both errors and warnings are taken into account
11183  // since repaired counter relates to them both.
11184  return repair ? errors + warnings - (int)repaired : errors;
11185 }
11186 
11188 void BlueStore::inject_broken_shared_blob_key(const string& key,
11189  const bufferlist& bl)
11190 {
11191  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11192  txn = db->get_transaction();
11193  txn->set(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key, bl);
11194  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11195 };
11196 
11197 void BlueStore::inject_no_shared_blob_key()
11198 {
11199  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11200  txn = db->get_transaction();
11201  ceph_assert(blobid_last > 0);
11202  // kill the last used sbid, this can be broken due to blobid preallocation
11203  // in rare cases, leaving as-is for the sake of simplicity
11204  uint64_t sbid = blobid_last;
11205 
11206  string key;
11207  dout(5) << __func__<< " " << sbid << dendl;
11208  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
11209  txn->rmkey(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
11210  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11211 };
11212 
11213 void BlueStore::inject_stray_shared_blob_key(uint64_t sbid)
11214 {
11215  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11216  txn = db->get_transaction();
11217 
11218  dout(5) << __func__ << " " << sbid << dendl;
11219 
11220  string key;
11221  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
11222  bluestore_shared_blob_t persistent(sbid);
11223  persistent.ref_map.get(0xdead0000, min_alloc_size);
11224  bufferlist bl;
11225  encode(persistent, bl);
11226  dout(20) << __func__ << " sbid " << sbid
11227  << " takes " << bl.length() << " bytes, updating"
11228  << dendl;
11229 
11230  txn->set(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key, bl);
11231  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11232 };
11233 
11234 
11235 void BlueStore::inject_leaked(uint64_t len)
11236 {
11237  PExtentVector exts;
11238  int64_t alloc_len = alloc->allocate(len, min_alloc_size,
11239  min_alloc_size * 256, 0, &exts);
11240 
11241  if (fm->is_null_manager()) {
11242  return;
11243  }
11244 
11245  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11246  txn = db->get_transaction();
11247 
11248  ceph_assert(alloc_len >= (int64_t)len);
11249  for (auto& p : exts) {
11250  fm->allocate(p.offset, p.length, txn);
11251  }
11252  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11253 }
11254 
11255 void BlueStore::inject_false_free(coll_t cid, ghobject_t oid)
11256 {
11257  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
11258 
11259  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11260  OnodeRef o;
11261  CollectionRef c = _get_collection(cid);
11262  ceph_assert(c);
11263  {
11264  std::unique_lock l{c->lock}; // just to avoid internal asserts
11265  o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11266  ceph_assert(o);
11267  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
11268  }
11269 
11270  bool injected = false;
11271  txn = db->get_transaction();
11272  auto& em = o->extent_map.extent_map;
11273  std::vector<const PExtentVector*> v;
11274  if (em.size()) {
11275  v.push_back(&em.begin()->blob->get_blob().get_extents());
11276  }
11277  if (em.size() > 1) {
11278  auto it = em.end();
11279  --it;
11280  v.push_back(&(it->blob->get_blob().get_extents()));
11281  }
11282  for (auto pext : v) {
11283  if (pext->size()) {
11284  auto p = pext->begin();
11285  while (p != pext->end()) {
11286  if (p->is_valid()) {
11287  dout(20) << __func__ << " release 0x" << std::hex << p->offset
11288  << "~" << p->length << std::dec << dendl;
11289  fm->release(p->offset, p->length, txn);
11290  injected = true;
11291  break;
11292  }
11293  ++p;
11294  }
11295  }
11296  }
11297  ceph_assert(injected);
11298  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11299 }
11300 
11301 void BlueStore::inject_legacy_omap()
11302 {
11303  dout(1) << __func__ << dendl;
11304  per_pool_omap = OMAP_BULK;
11305  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11306  txn = db->get_transaction();
11307  txn->rmkey(PREFIX_SUPER, "per_pool_omap");
11308  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11309 }
11310 
11311 void BlueStore::inject_legacy_omap(coll_t cid, ghobject_t oid)
11312 {
11313  dout(1) << __func__ << " "
11314  << cid << " " << oid
11315  <<dendl;
11316  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11317  OnodeRef o;
11318  CollectionRef c = _get_collection(cid);
11319  ceph_assert(c);
11320  {
11321  std::unique_lock l{ c->lock }; // just to avoid internal asserts
11322  o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11323  ceph_assert(o);
11324  }
11325  o->onode.clear_flag(
11326  bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPG_OMAP |
11327  bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PERPOOL_OMAP |
11328  bluestore_onode_t::FLAG_PGMETA_OMAP);
11329  txn = db->get_transaction();
11330  _record_onode(o, txn);
11331  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11332 }
11333 
11334 void BlueStore::inject_stray_omap(uint64_t head, const string& name)
11335 {
11336  dout(1) << __func__ << dendl;
11337  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
11338 
11339  string key;
11340  bufferlist bl;
11341  _key_encode_u64(head, &key);
11342  key.append(name);
11343  txn->set(PREFIX_OMAP, key, bl);
11344 
11345  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11346 }
11347 
11348 void BlueStore::inject_statfs(const string& key, const store_statfs_t& new_statfs)
11349 {
11350  BlueStoreRepairer repairer;
11351  repairer.fix_statfs(db, key, new_statfs);
11352  repairer.apply(db);
11353 }
11354 
11355 void BlueStore::inject_global_statfs(const store_statfs_t& new_statfs)
11356 {
11357  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
11358  volatile_statfs v;
11359  v = new_statfs;
11360  bufferlist bl;
11361  v.encode(bl);
11362  t->set(PREFIX_STAT, BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY, bl);
11363  db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
11364  // must set these; are needed at _close_db() statfs persisting
11365  per_pool_stat_collection = false;
11366  vstatfs = new_statfs;
11367 }
11368 
11369 void BlueStore::inject_misreference(coll_t cid1, ghobject_t oid1,
11370  coll_t cid2, ghobject_t oid2,
11371  uint64_t offset)
11372 {
11373  OnodeRef o1;
11374  CollectionRef c1 = _get_collection(cid1);
11375  ceph_assert(c1);
11376  {
11377  std::unique_lock l{c1->lock}; // just to avoid internal asserts
11378  o1 = c1->get_onode(oid1, false);
11379  ceph_assert(o1);
11380  o1->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
11381  }
11382  OnodeRef o2;
11383  CollectionRef c2 = _get_collection(cid2);
11384  ceph_assert(c2);
11385  {
11386  std::unique_lock l{c2->lock}; // just to avoid internal asserts
11387  o2 = c2->get_onode(oid2, false);
11388  ceph_assert(o2);
11389  o2->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
11390  }
11391  Extent& e1 = *(o1->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset));
11392  Extent& e2 = *(o2->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset));
11393 
11394  // require onode/extent layout to be the same (and simple)
11395  // to make things easier
11396  ceph_assert(o1->onode.extent_map_shards.empty());
11397  ceph_assert(o2->onode.extent_map_shards.empty());
11398  ceph_assert(o1->extent_map.spanning_blob_map.size() == 0);
11399  ceph_assert(o2->extent_map.spanning_blob_map.size() == 0);
11400  ceph_assert(e1.logical_offset == e2.logical_offset);
11401  ceph_assert(e1.length == e2.length);
11402  ceph_assert(e1.blob_offset == e2.blob_offset);
11403 
11404  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11405  txn = db->get_transaction();
11406 
11407  // along with misreference error this will create space leaks errors
11408  e2.blob->dirty_blob() = e1.blob->get_blob();
11409  o2->extent_map.dirty_range(offset, e2.length);
11410  o2->extent_map.update(txn, false);
11411 
11412  _record_onode(o2, txn);
11413  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11414 }
11415 
11416 void BlueStore::inject_zombie_spanning_blob(coll_t cid, ghobject_t oid,
11417  int16_t blob_id)
11418 {
11419  OnodeRef o;
11420  CollectionRef c = _get_collection(cid);
11421  ceph_assert(c);
11422  {
11423  std::unique_lock l{ c->lock }; // just to avoid internal asserts
11424  o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11425  ceph_assert(o);
11426  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
11427  }
11428 
11429  BlobRef b = c->new_blob();
11430  b->id = blob_id;
11431  o->extent_map.spanning_blob_map[blob_id] = b;
11432 
11433  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn;
11434  txn = db->get_transaction();
11435 
11436  _record_onode(o, txn);
11437  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
11438 }
11439 
11440 void BlueStore::inject_bluefs_file(std::string_view dir, std::string_view name, size_t new_size)
11441 {
11442  ceph_assert(bluefs);
11443 
11444  BlueFS::FileWriter* p_handle = nullptr;
11445  auto ret = bluefs->open_for_write(dir, name, &p_handle, false);
11446  ceph_assert(ret == 0);
11447 
11448  std::string s('0', new_size);
11449  bufferlist bl;
11450  bl.append(s);
11451  p_handle->append(bl);
11452 
11453  bluefs->fsync(p_handle);
11454  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
11455 }
11456 
11457 void BlueStore::collect_metadata(map<string,string> *pm)
11458 {
11459  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
11460  bdev->collect_metadata("bluestore_bdev_", pm);
11461  if (bluefs) {
11462  (*pm)["bluefs"] = "1";
11463  // this value is for backward compatibility only
11464  (*pm)["bluefs_single_shared_device"] = \
11465  stringify((int)bluefs_layout.single_shared_device());
11466  (*pm)["bluefs_dedicated_db"] = \
11467  stringify((int)bluefs_layout.dedicated_db);
11468  (*pm)["bluefs_dedicated_wal"] = \
11469  stringify((int)bluefs_layout.dedicated_wal);
11470  bluefs->collect_metadata(pm, bluefs_layout.shared_bdev);
11471  } else {
11472  (*pm)["bluefs"] = "0";
11473  }
11474 
11475  // report numa mapping for underlying devices
11476  int node = -1;
11477  set<int> nodes;
11478  set<string> failed;
11479  int r = get_numa_node(&node, &nodes, &failed);
11480  if (r >= 0) {
11481  if (!failed.empty()) {
11482  (*pm)["objectstore_numa_unknown_devices"] = stringify(failed);
11483  }
11484  if (!nodes.empty()) {
11485  dout(1) << __func__ << " devices span numa nodes " << nodes << dendl;
11486  (*pm)["objectstore_numa_nodes"] = stringify(nodes);
11487  }
11488  if (node >= 0) {
11489  (*pm)["objectstore_numa_node"] = stringify(node);
11490  }
11491  }
11492  (*pm)["bluestore_min_alloc_size"] = stringify(min_alloc_size);
11493 }
11494 
11495 int BlueStore::get_numa_node(
11496  int *final_node,
11497  set<int> *out_nodes,
11498  set<string> *out_failed)
11499 {
11500  int node = -1;
11501  set<string> devices;
11502  get_devices(&devices);
11503  set<int> nodes;
11504  set<string> failed;
11505  for (auto& devname : devices) {
11506  int n;
11507  BlkDev bdev(devname);
11508  int r = bdev.get_numa_node(&n);
11509  if (r < 0) {
11510  dout(10) << __func__ << " bdev " << devname << " can't detect numa_node"
11511  << dendl;
11512  failed.insert(devname);
11513  continue;
11514  }
11515  dout(10) << __func__ << " bdev " << devname << " on numa_node " << n
11516  << dendl;
11517  nodes.insert(n);
11518  if (node < 0) {
11519  node = n;
11520  }
11521  }
11522  if (node >= 0 && nodes.size() == 1 && failed.empty()) {
11523  *final_node = node;
11524  }
11525  if (out_nodes) {
11526  *out_nodes = nodes;
11527  }
11528  if (out_failed) {
11529  *out_failed = failed;
11530  }
11531  return 0;
11532 }
11533 
11534 void BlueStore::prepare_for_fast_shutdown()
11535 {
11536  m_fast_shutdown = true;
11537 }
11538 
11539 int BlueStore::get_devices(set<string> *ls)
11540 {
11541  if (bdev) {
11542  bdev->get_devices(ls);
11543  if (bluefs) {
11544  bluefs->get_devices(ls);
11545  }
11546  return 0;
11547  }
11548 
11549  // grumble, we haven't started up yet.
11550  if (int r = _open_path(); r < 0) {
11551  return r;
11552  }
11553  auto close_path = make_scope_guard([&] {
11554  _close_path();
11555  });
11556  if (int r = _open_fsid(false); r < 0) {
11557  return r;
11558  }
11559  auto close_fsid = make_scope_guard([&] {
11560  _close_fsid();
11561  });
11562  if (int r = _read_fsid(&fsid); r < 0) {
11563  return r;
11564  }
11565  if (int r = _lock_fsid(); r < 0) {
11566  return r;
11567  }
11568  if (int r = _open_bdev(false); r < 0) {
11569  return r;
11570  }
11571  auto close_bdev = make_scope_guard([&] {
11572  _close_bdev();
11573  });
11574  if (int r = _minimal_open_bluefs(false); r < 0) {
11575  return r;
11576  }
11577  bdev->get_devices(ls);
11578  if (bluefs) {
11579  bluefs->get_devices(ls);
11580  }
11581  _minimal_close_bluefs();
11582  return 0;
11583 }
11584 
11585 void BlueStore::_get_statfs_overall(struct store_statfs_t *buf)
11586 {
11587  buf->reset();
11588 
11589  auto prefix = per_pool_omap == OMAP_BULK ?
11590  PREFIX_OMAP :
11591  per_pool_omap == OMAP_PER_POOL ?
11592  PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP :
11593  PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP;
11594  buf->omap_allocated =
11595  db->estimate_prefix_size(prefix, string());
11596 
11597  uint64_t bfree = alloc->get_free();
11598 
11599  if (bluefs) {
11600  buf->internally_reserved = 0;
11601  // include dedicated db, too, if that isn't the shared device.
11602  if (bluefs_layout.shared_bdev != BlueFS::BDEV_DB) {
11603  buf->total += bluefs->get_total(BlueFS::BDEV_DB);
11604  }
11605  // call any non-omap bluefs space "internal metadata"
11606  buf->internal_metadata =
11607  bluefs->get_used()
11608  - buf->omap_allocated;
11609  }
11610 
11611  ExtBlkDevState ebd_state;
11612  int rc = bdev->get_ebd_state(ebd_state);
11613  if (rc == 0) {
11614  buf->total += ebd_state.get_physical_total();
11615 
11616  // we are limited by both the size of the virtual device and the
11617  // underlying physical device.
11618  bfree = std::min(bfree, ebd_state.get_physical_avail());
11619 
11620  buf->allocated = ebd_state.get_physical_total() - ebd_state.get_physical_avail();;
11621  } else {
11622  buf->total += bdev->get_size();
11623  }
11624  buf->available = bfree;
11625 }
11626 
11627 int BlueStore::statfs(struct store_statfs_t *buf,
11628  osd_alert_list_t* alerts)
11629 {
11630  if (alerts) {
11631  alerts->clear();
11632  _log_alerts(*alerts);
11633  }
11634  _get_statfs_overall(buf);
11635  {
11636  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
11637  buf->allocated = vstatfs.allocated();
11638  buf->data_stored = vstatfs.stored();
11639  buf->data_compressed = vstatfs.compressed();
11640  buf->data_compressed_original = vstatfs.compressed_original();
11641  buf->data_compressed_allocated = vstatfs.compressed_allocated();
11642  }
11643 
11644  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << *buf << dendl;
11645  return 0;
11646 }
11647 
11648 int BlueStore::pool_statfs(uint64_t pool_id, struct store_statfs_t *buf,
11649  bool *out_per_pool_omap)
11650 {
11651  dout(20) << __func__ << " pool " << pool_id<< dendl;
11652 
11653  if (!per_pool_stat_collection) {
11654  dout(20) << __func__ << " not supported in legacy mode " << dendl;
11655  return -ENOTSUP;
11656  }
11657  buf->reset();
11658 
11659  {
11660  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
11661  osd_pools[pool_id].publish(buf);
11662  }
11663 
11664  string key_prefix;
11665  _key_encode_u64(pool_id, &key_prefix);
11666  *out_per_pool_omap = per_pool_omap != OMAP_BULK;
11667  // stop calls after db was closed
11668  if (*out_per_pool_omap && db) {
11669  auto prefix = per_pool_omap == OMAP_PER_POOL ?
11670  PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP :
11671  PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP;
11672  buf->omap_allocated = db->estimate_prefix_size(prefix, key_prefix);
11673  }
11674 
11675  dout(10) << __func__ << *buf << dendl;
11676  return 0;
11677 }
11678 
11679 void BlueStore::_check_legacy_statfs_alert()
11680 {
11681  string s;
11682  if (!per_pool_stat_collection &&
11683  cct->_conf->bluestore_warn_on_legacy_statfs) {
11684  s = "legacy statfs reporting detected, "
11685  "suggest to run store repair to get consistent statistic reports";
11686  }
11687  std::lock_guard l(qlock);
11688  legacy_statfs_alert = s;
11689 }
11690 
11691 void BlueStore::_check_no_per_pg_or_pool_omap_alert()
11692 {
11693  string per_pg, per_pool;
11694  if (per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_PG) {
11695  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_warn_on_no_per_pg_omap) {
11696  per_pg = "legacy (not per-pg) omap detected, "
11697  "suggest to run store repair to benefit from faster PG removal";
11698  }
11699  if (per_pool_omap != OMAP_PER_POOL) {
11700  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_warn_on_no_per_pool_omap) {
11701  per_pool = "legacy (not per-pool) omap detected, "
11702  "suggest to run store repair to benefit from per-pool omap usage statistics";
11703  }
11704  }
11705  }
11706  std::lock_guard l(qlock);
11707  no_per_pg_omap_alert = per_pg;
11708  no_per_pool_omap_alert = per_pool;
11709 }
11710 
11711 // ---------------
11712 // cache
11713 
11714 BlueStore::CollectionRef BlueStore::_get_collection(const coll_t& cid)
11715 {
11716  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
11717  ceph::unordered_map<coll_t,CollectionRef>::iterator cp = coll_map.find(cid);
11718  if (cp == coll_map.end())
11719  return CollectionRef();
11720  return cp->second;
11721 }
11722 
11723 BlueStore::CollectionRef BlueStore::_get_collection_by_oid(const ghobject_t& oid)
11724 {
11725  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
11726 
11727  // FIXME: we must replace this with something more efficient
11728 
11729  for (auto& i : coll_map) {
11730  spg_t spgid;
11731  if (i.first.is_pg(&spgid) &&
11732  i.second->contains(oid)) {
11733  return i.second;
11734  }
11735  }
11736  return CollectionRef();
11737 }
11738 
11739 void BlueStore::_queue_reap_collection(CollectionRef& c)
11740 {
11741  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c << " " << c->cid << dendl;
11742  // _reap_collections and this in the same thread,
11743  // so no need a lock.
11744  removed_collections.push_back(c);
11745 }
11746 
11747 void BlueStore::_reap_collections()
11748 {
11749 
11750  list<CollectionRef> removed_colls;
11751  {
11752  // _queue_reap_collection and this in the same thread.
11753  // So no need a lock.
11754  if (!removed_collections.empty())
11755  removed_colls.swap(removed_collections);
11756  else
11757  return;
11758  }
11759 
11760  list<CollectionRef>::iterator p = removed_colls.begin();
11761  while (p != removed_colls.end()) {
11762  CollectionRef c = *p;
11763  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c << " " << c->cid << dendl;
11764  if (c->onode_space.map_any([&](Onode* o) {
11765  ceph_assert(!o->exists);
11766  if (o->flushing_count.load()) {
11767  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
11768  << " flush_txns " << o->flushing_count << dendl;
11769  return true;
11770  }
11771  return false;
11772  })) {
11773  ++p;
11774  continue;
11775  }
11776  c->onode_space.clear();
11777  p = removed_colls.erase(p);
11778  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c << " " << c->cid << " done" << dendl;
11779  }
11780  if (removed_colls.empty()) {
11781  dout(10) << __func__ << " all reaped" << dendl;
11782  } else {
11783  removed_collections.splice(removed_collections.begin(), removed_colls);
11784  }
11785 }
11786 
11787 void BlueStore::_update_logger()
11788 {
11789  uint64_t num_onodes = 0;
11790  uint64_t num_pinned_onodes = 0;
11791  uint64_t num_extents = 0;
11792  uint64_t num_blobs = 0;
11793  uint64_t num_buffers = 0;
11794  uint64_t num_buffer_bytes = 0;
11795  for (auto c : onode_cache_shards) {
11796  c->add_stats(&num_onodes, &num_pinned_onodes);
11797  }
11798  for (auto c : buffer_cache_shards) {
11799  c->add_stats(&num_extents, &num_blobs,
11800  &num_buffers, &num_buffer_bytes);
11801  }
11802  logger->set(l_bluestore_onodes, num_onodes);
11803  logger->set(l_bluestore_pinned_onodes, num_pinned_onodes);
11804  logger->set(l_bluestore_extents, num_extents);
11805  logger->set(l_bluestore_blobs, num_blobs);
11806  logger->set(l_bluestore_buffers, num_buffers);
11807  logger->set(l_bluestore_buffer_bytes, num_buffer_bytes);
11808 }
11809 
11810 // ---------------
11811 // read operations
11812 
11813 ObjectStore::CollectionHandle BlueStore::open_collection(const coll_t& cid)
11814 {
11815  return _get_collection(cid);
11816 }
11817 
11818 ObjectStore::CollectionHandle BlueStore::create_new_collection(
11819  const coll_t& cid)
11820 {
11821  std::unique_lock l{coll_lock};
11822  auto c = ceph::make_ref<Collection>(
11823  this,
11824  onode_cache_shards[cid.hash_to_shard(onode_cache_shards.size())],
11825  buffer_cache_shards[cid.hash_to_shard(buffer_cache_shards.size())],
11826  cid);
11827  new_coll_map[cid] = c;
11828  _osr_attach(c.get());
11829  return c;
11830 }
11831 
11832 void BlueStore::set_collection_commit_queue(
11833  const coll_t& cid,
11834  ContextQueue *commit_queue)
11835 {
11836  if (commit_queue) {
11837  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
11838  if (coll_map.count(cid)) {
11839  coll_map[cid]->commit_queue = commit_queue;
11840  } else if (new_coll_map.count(cid)) {
11841  new_coll_map[cid]->commit_queue = commit_queue;
11842  }
11843  }
11844 }
11845 
11846 
11847 bool BlueStore::exists(CollectionHandle &c_, const ghobject_t& oid)
11848 {
11849  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
11850  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << dendl;
11851  if (!c->exists)
11852  return false;
11853 
11854  bool r = true;
11855 
11856  {
11857  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
11858  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11859  if (!o || !o->exists)
11860  r = false;
11861  }
11862 
11863  return r;
11864 }
11865 
11866 int BlueStore::stat(
11867  CollectionHandle &c_,
11868  const ghobject_t& oid,
11869  struct stat *st,
11870  bool allow_eio)
11871 {
11872  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
11873  if (!c->exists)
11874  return -ENOENT;
11875  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " " << oid << dendl;
11876 
11877  {
11878  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
11879  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11880  if (!o || !o->exists)
11881  return -ENOENT;
11882  st->st_size = o->onode.size;
11883  st->st_blksize = 4096;
11884  st->st_blocks = (st->st_size + st->st_blksize - 1) / st->st_blksize;
11885  st->st_nlink = 1;
11886  }
11887 
11888  int r = 0;
11889  if (_debug_mdata_eio(oid)) {
11890  r = -EIO;
11891  derr << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " INJECT EIO" << dendl;
11892  }
11893  return r;
11894 }
11895 int BlueStore::set_collection_opts(
11896  CollectionHandle& ch,
11897  const pool_opts_t& opts)
11898 {
11899  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(ch.get());
11900  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << ch->cid << " options " << opts << dendl;
11901  if (!c->exists)
11902  return -ENOENT;
11903  std::unique_lock l{c->lock};
11904  c->pool_opts = opts;
11905  return 0;
11906 }
11907 
11908 int BlueStore::read(
11909  CollectionHandle &c_,
11910  const ghobject_t& oid,
11911  uint64_t offset,
11912  size_t length,
11913  bufferlist& bl,
11914  uint32_t op_flags)
11915 {
11916  auto start = mono_clock::now();
11917  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
11918  const coll_t &cid = c->get_cid();
11919  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << cid << " " << oid
11920  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
11921  << dendl;
11922  if (!c->exists)
11923  return -ENOENT;
11924 
11925  bl.clear();
11926  int r;
11927  {
11928  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
11929  auto start1 = mono_clock::now();
11930  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
11931  log_latency("get_onode@read",
11932  l_bluestore_read_onode_meta_lat,
11933  mono_clock::now() - start1,
11934  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
11935  "", l_bluestore_slow_read_onode_meta_count);
11936  if (!o || !o->exists) {
11937  r = -ENOENT;
11938  goto out;
11939  }
11940 
11941  if (offset == length && offset == 0)
11942  length = o->onode.size;
11943 
11944  r = _do_read(c, o, offset, length, bl, op_flags);
11945  if (r == -EIO) {
11946  logger->inc(l_bluestore_read_eio);
11947  }
11948  }
11949 
11950  out:
11951  if (r >= 0 && _debug_data_eio(oid)) {
11952  r = -EIO;
11953  derr << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " INJECT EIO" << dendl;
11954  } else if (oid.hobj.pool > 0 && /* FIXME, see #23029 */
11955  cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_random_read_err &&
11956  (rand() % (int)(cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_random_read_err *
11957  100.0)) == 0) {
11958  dout(0) << __func__ << ": inject random EIO" << dendl;
11959  r = -EIO;
11960  }
11961  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid << " " << oid
11962  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
11963  << " = " << r << dendl;
11964  log_latency(__func__,
11965  l_bluestore_read_lat,
11966  mono_clock::now() - start,
11967  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
11968  return r;
11969 }
11970 
11971 void BlueStore::_read_cache(
11972  OnodeRef& o,
11973  uint64_t offset,
11974  size_t length,
11975  int read_cache_policy,
11976  ready_regions_t& ready_regions,
11977  blobs2read_t& blobs2read)
11978 {
11979  // build blob-wise list to of stuff read (that isn't cached)
11980  unsigned left = length;
11981  uint64_t pos = offset;
11982  auto lp = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset);
11983  while (left > 0 && lp != o->extent_map.extent_map.end()) {
11984  if (pos < lp->logical_offset) {
11985  unsigned hole = lp->logical_offset - pos;
11986  if (hole >= left) {
11987  break;
11988  }
11989  dout(30) << __func__ << " hole 0x" << std::hex << pos << "~" << hole
11990  << std::dec << dendl;
11991  pos += hole;
11992  left -= hole;
11993  }
11994  BlobRef& bptr = lp->blob;
11995  unsigned l_off = pos - lp->logical_offset;
11996  unsigned b_off = l_off + lp->blob_offset;
11997  unsigned b_len = std::min(left, lp->length - l_off);
11998 
11999  ready_regions_t cache_res;
12000  interval_set<uint32_t> cache_interval;
12001  bptr->dirty_bc().read(
12002  bptr->shared_blob->get_cache(), b_off, b_len, cache_res, cache_interval,
12003  read_cache_policy);
12004  dout(20) << __func__ << " blob " << *bptr << std::hex
12005  << " need 0x" << b_off << "~" << b_len
12006  << " cache has 0x" << cache_interval
12007  << std::dec << dendl;
12008 
12009  auto pc = cache_res.begin();
12010  uint64_t chunk_size = bptr->get_blob().get_chunk_size(block_size);
12011  while (b_len > 0) {
12012  unsigned l;
12013  if (pc != cache_res.end() &&
12014  pc->first == b_off) {
12015  l = pc->second.length();
12016  ready_regions[pos] = std::move(pc->second);
12017  dout(30) << __func__ << " use cache 0x" << std::hex << pos << ": 0x"
12018  << b_off << "~" << l << std::dec << dendl;
12019  ++pc;
12020  } else {
12021  l = b_len;
12022  if (pc != cache_res.end()) {
12023  ceph_assert(pc->first > b_off);
12024  l = pc->first - b_off;
12025  }
12026  dout(30) << __func__ << " will read 0x" << std::hex << pos << ": 0x"
12027  << b_off << "~" << l << std::dec << dendl;
12028  // merge regions
12029  {
12030  uint64_t r_off = b_off;
12031  uint64_t r_len = l;
12032  uint64_t front = r_off % chunk_size;
12033  if (front) {
12034  r_off -= front;
12035  r_len += front;
12036  }
12037  unsigned tail = r_len % chunk_size;
12038  if (tail) {
12039  r_len += chunk_size - tail;
12040  }
12041  bool merged = false;
12042  regions2read_t& r2r = blobs2read[bptr];
12043  if (r2r.size()) {
12044  read_req_t& pre = r2r.back();
12045  if (r_off <= (pre.r_off + pre.r_len)) {
12046  front += (r_off - pre.r_off);
12047  pre.r_len += (r_off + r_len - pre.r_off - pre.r_len);
12048  pre.regs.emplace_back(region_t(pos, b_off, l, front));
12049  merged = true;
12050  }
12051  }
12052  if (!merged) {
12053  read_req_t req(r_off, r_len);
12054  req.regs.emplace_back(region_t(pos, b_off, l, front));
12055  r2r.emplace_back(std::move(req));
12056  }
12057  }
12058  }
12059  pos += l;
12060  b_off += l;
12061  left -= l;
12062  b_len -= l;
12063  }
12064  ++lp;
12065  }
12066 }
12067 
12068 int BlueStore::_prepare_read_ioc(
12069  blobs2read_t& blobs2read,
12070  vector<bufferlist>* compressed_blob_bls,
12071  IOContext* ioc)
12072 {
12073  for (auto& p : blobs2read) {
12074  const BlobRef& bptr = p.first;
12075  regions2read_t& r2r = p.second;
12076  dout(20) << __func__ << " blob " << *bptr << " need "
12077  << r2r << dendl;
12078  if (bptr->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
12079  // read the whole thing
12080  if (compressed_blob_bls->empty()) {
12081  // ensure we avoid any reallocation on subsequent blobs
12082  compressed_blob_bls->reserve(blobs2read.size());
12083  }
12084  compressed_blob_bls->push_back(bufferlist());
12085  bufferlist& bl = compressed_blob_bls->back();
12086  auto r = bptr->get_blob().map(
12087  0, bptr->get_blob().get_ondisk_length(),
12088  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
12089  int r = bdev->aio_read(offset, length, &bl, ioc);
12090  if (r < 0)
12091  return r;
12092  return 0;
12093  });
12094  if (r < 0) {
12095  derr << __func__ << " bdev-read failed: " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
12096  if (r == -EIO) {
12097  // propagate EIO to caller
12098  return r;
12099  }
12100  ceph_assert(r == 0);
12101  }
12102  } else {
12103  // read the pieces
12104  for (auto& req : r2r) {
12105  dout(20) << __func__ << " region 0x" << std::hex
12106  << req.regs.front().logical_offset
12107  << ": 0x" << req.regs.front().blob_xoffset
12108  << " reading 0x" << req.r_off
12109  << "~" << req.r_len << std::dec
12110  << dendl;
12111 
12112  // read it
12113  auto r = bptr->get_blob().map(
12114  req.r_off, req.r_len,
12115  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
12116  int r = bdev->aio_read(offset, length, &req.bl, ioc);
12117  if (r < 0)
12118  return r;
12119  return 0;
12120  });
12121  if (r < 0) {
12122  derr << __func__ << " bdev-read failed: " << cpp_strerror(r)
12123  << dendl;
12124  if (r == -EIO) {
12125  // propagate EIO to caller
12126  return r;
12127  }
12128  ceph_assert(r == 0);
12129  }
12130  ceph_assert(req.bl.length() == req.r_len);
12131  }
12132  }
12133  }
12134  return 0;
12135 }
12136 
12137 int BlueStore::_generate_read_result_bl(
12138  OnodeRef& o,
12139  uint64_t offset,
12140  size_t length,
12141  ready_regions_t& ready_regions,
12142  vector<bufferlist>& compressed_blob_bls,
12143  blobs2read_t& blobs2read,
12144  bool buffered,
12145  bool* csum_error,
12146  bufferlist& bl)
12147 {
12148  // enumerate and decompress desired blobs
12149  auto p = compressed_blob_bls.begin();
12150  blobs2read_t::iterator b2r_it = blobs2read.begin();
12151  while (b2r_it != blobs2read.end()) {
12152  const BlobRef& bptr = b2r_it->first;
12153  regions2read_t& r2r = b2r_it->second;
12154  dout(20) << __func__ << " blob " << *bptr << " need "
12155  << r2r << dendl;
12156  if (bptr->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
12157  ceph_assert(p != compressed_blob_bls.end());
12158  bufferlist& compressed_bl = *p++;
12159  if (_verify_csum(o, &bptr->get_blob(), 0, compressed_bl,
12160  r2r.front().regs.front().logical_offset) < 0) {
12161  *csum_error = true;
12162  return -EIO;
12163  }
12164  bufferlist raw_bl;
12165  auto r = _decompress(compressed_bl, &raw_bl);
12166  if (r < 0)
12167  return r;
12168  if (buffered) {
12169  bptr->dirty_bc().did_read(bptr->shared_blob->get_cache(), 0,
12170  raw_bl);
12171  }
12172  for (auto& req : r2r) {
12173  for (auto& r : req.regs) {
12174  ready_regions[r.logical_offset].substr_of(
12175  raw_bl, r.blob_xoffset, r.length);
12176  }
12177  }
12178  } else {
12179  for (auto& req : r2r) {
12180  if (_verify_csum(o, &bptr->get_blob(), req.r_off, req.bl,
12181  req.regs.front().logical_offset) < 0) {
12182  *csum_error = true;
12183  return -EIO;
12184  }
12185  if (buffered) {
12186  bptr->dirty_bc().did_read(bptr->shared_blob->get_cache(),
12187  req.r_off, req.bl);
12188  }
12189 
12190  // prune and keep result
12191  for (const auto& r : req.regs) {
12192  ready_regions[r.logical_offset].substr_of(req.bl, r.front, r.length);
12193  }
12194  }
12195  }
12196  ++b2r_it;
12197  }
12198 
12199  // generate a resulting buffer
12200  auto pr = ready_regions.begin();
12201  auto pr_end = ready_regions.end();
12202  uint64_t pos = 0;
12203  while (pos < length) {
12204  if (pr != pr_end && pr->first == pos + offset) {
12205  dout(30) << __func__ << " assemble 0x" << std::hex << pos
12206  << ": data from 0x" << pr->first << "~" << pr->second.length()
12207  << std::dec << dendl;
12208  pos += pr->second.length();
12209  bl.claim_append(pr->second);
12210  ++pr;
12211  } else {
12212  uint64_t l = length - pos;
12213  if (pr != pr_end) {
12214  ceph_assert(pr->first > pos + offset);
12215  l = pr->first - (pos + offset);
12216  }
12217  dout(30) << __func__ << " assemble 0x" << std::hex << pos
12218  << ": zeros for 0x" << (pos + offset) << "~" << l
12219  << std::dec << dendl;
12220  bl.append_zero(l);
12221  pos += l;
12222  }
12223  }
12224  ceph_assert(bl.length() == length);
12225  ceph_assert(pos == length);
12226  ceph_assert(pr == pr_end);
12227  return 0;
12228 }
12229 
12230 int BlueStore::_do_read(
12231  Collection *c,
12232  OnodeRef& o,
12233  uint64_t offset,
12234  size_t length,
12235  bufferlist& bl,
12236  uint32_t op_flags,
12237  uint64_t retry_count)
12238 {
12239  FUNCTRACE(cct);
12240  int r = 0;
12241  int read_cache_policy = 0; // do not bypass clean or dirty cache
12242 
12243  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
12244  << " size 0x" << o->onode.size << " (" << std::dec
12245  << o->onode.size << ")" << dendl;
12246  bl.clear();
12247 
12248  if (offset >= o->onode.size) {
12249  return r;
12250  }
12251 
12252  // generally, don't buffer anything, unless the client explicitly requests
12253  // it.
12254  bool buffered = false;
12255  if (op_flags & CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_WILLNEED) {
12256  dout(20) << __func__ << " will do buffered read" << dendl;
12257  buffered = true;
12258  } else if (cct->_conf->bluestore_default_buffered_read &&
12259  (op_flags & (CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_DONTNEED |
12260  CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_NOCACHE)) == 0) {
12261  dout(20) << __func__ << " defaulting to buffered read" << dendl;
12262  buffered = true;
12263  }
12264 
12265  if (offset + length > o->onode.size) {
12266  length = o->onode.size - offset;
12267  }
12268 
12269  auto start = mono_clock::now();
12270  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, length);
12271  log_latency(__func__,
12272  l_bluestore_read_onode_meta_lat,
12273  mono_clock::now() - start,
12274  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
12275  "", l_bluestore_slow_read_onode_meta_count);
12276  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
12277 
12278  // for deep-scrub, we only read dirty cache and bypass clean cache in
12279  // order to read underlying block device in case there are silent disk errors.
12280  if (op_flags & CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_BYPASS_CLEAN_CACHE) {
12281  dout(20) << __func__ << " will bypass cache and do direct read" << dendl;
12282  read_cache_policy = BufferSpace::BYPASS_CLEAN_CACHE;
12283  }
12284 
12285  // build blob-wise list to of stuff read (that isn't cached)
12286  ready_regions_t ready_regions;
12287  blobs2read_t blobs2read;
12288  _read_cache(o, offset, length, read_cache_policy, ready_regions, blobs2read);
12289 
12290 
12291  // read raw blob data.
12292  start = mono_clock::now(); // for the sake of simplicity
12293  // measure the whole block below.
12294  // The error isn't that much...
12295  vector<bufferlist> compressed_blob_bls;
12296  IOContext ioc(cct, NULL, !cct->_conf->bluestore_fail_eio);
12297  r = _prepare_read_ioc(blobs2read, &compressed_blob_bls, &ioc);
12298  // we always issue aio for reading, so errors other than EIO are not allowed
12299  if (r < 0)
12300  return r;
12301 
12302  int64_t num_ios = blobs2read.size();
12303  if (ioc.has_pending_aios()) {
12304  num_ios = ioc.get_num_ios();
12305  bdev->aio_submit(&ioc);
12306  dout(20) << __func__ << " waiting for aio" << dendl;
12307  ioc.aio_wait();
12308  r = ioc.get_return_value();
12309  if (r < 0) {
12310  ceph_assert(r == -EIO); // no other errors allowed
12311  return -EIO;
12312  }
12313  }
12314  log_latency_fn(__func__,
12315  l_bluestore_read_wait_aio_lat,
12316  mono_clock::now() - start,
12317  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
12318  [&](auto lat) { return ", num_ios = " + stringify(num_ios); },
12319  l_bluestore_slow_read_wait_aio_count
12320  );
12321 
12322  bool csum_error = false;
12323  r = _generate_read_result_bl(o, offset, length, ready_regions,
12324  compressed_blob_bls, blobs2read,
12325  buffered && !ioc.skip_cache(),
12326  &csum_error, bl);
12327  if (csum_error) {
12328  // Handles spurious read errors caused by a kernel bug.
12329  // We sometimes get all-zero pages as a result of the read under
12330  // high memory pressure. Retrying the failing read succeeds in most
12331  // cases.
12332  // See also: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/22464
12333  if (retry_count >= cct->_conf->bluestore_retry_disk_reads) {
12334  return -EIO;
12335  }
12336  return _do_read(c, o, offset, length, bl, op_flags, retry_count + 1);
12337  }
12338  r = bl.length();
12339  if (retry_count) {
12340  logger->inc(l_bluestore_reads_with_retries);
12341  dout(5) << __func__ << " read at 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
12342  << " failed " << std::dec << retry_count << " times before succeeding" << dendl;
12343  stringstream s;
12344  s << " reads with retries: " << logger->get(l_bluestore_reads_with_retries);
12345  _set_spurious_read_errors_alert(s.str());
12346  }
12347  return r;
12348 }
12349 
12350 int BlueStore::_verify_csum(OnodeRef& o,
12351  const bluestore_blob_t* blob, uint64_t blob_xoffset,
12352  const bufferlist& bl,
12353  uint64_t logical_offset) const
12354 {
12355  int bad;
12356  uint64_t bad_csum;
12357  auto start = mono_clock::now();
12358  int r = blob->verify_csum(blob_xoffset, bl, &bad, &bad_csum);
12359  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_inject_csum_err_probability > 0 &&
12360  (rand() % 10000) < cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_inject_csum_err_probability * 10000.0) {
12361  derr << __func__ << " injecting bluestore checksum verifcation error" << dendl;
12362  bad = blob_xoffset;
12363  r = -1;
12364  bad_csum = 0xDEADBEEF;
12365  }
12366  if (r < 0) {
12367  if (r == -1) {
12368  PExtentVector pex;
12369  blob->map(
12370  bad,
12371  blob->get_csum_chunk_size(),
12372  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
12373  pex.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(offset, length));
12374  return 0;
12375  });
12376  derr << __func__ << " bad "
12377  << Checksummer::get_csum_type_string(blob->csum_type)
12378  << "/0x" << std::hex << blob->get_csum_chunk_size()
12379  << " checksum at blob offset 0x" << bad
12380  << ", got 0x" << bad_csum << ", expected 0x"
12381  << blob->get_csum_item(bad / blob->get_csum_chunk_size()) << std::dec
12382  << ", device location " << pex
12383  << ", logical extent 0x" << std::hex
12384  << (logical_offset + bad - blob_xoffset) << "~"
12385  << blob->get_csum_chunk_size() << std::dec
12386  << ", object " << o->oid
12387  << dendl;
12388  } else {
12389  derr << __func__ << " failed with exit code: " << cpp_strerror(r) << dendl;
12390  }
12391  }
12392  log_latency(__func__,
12393  l_bluestore_csum_lat,
12394  mono_clock::now() - start,
12395  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
12396  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_ignore_data_csum) {
12397  return 0;
12398  }
12399  return r;
12400 }
12401 
12402 int BlueStore::_decompress(bufferlist& source, bufferlist* result)
12403 {
12404  int r = 0;
12405  auto start = mono_clock::now();
12406  auto i = source.cbegin();
12407  bluestore_compression_header_t chdr;
12408  decode(chdr, i);
12409  int alg = int(chdr.type);
12410  CompressorRef cp = compressor;
12411  if (!cp || (int)cp->get_type() != alg) {
12412  cp = Compressor::create(cct, alg);
12413  }
12414 
12415  if (!cp.get()) {
12416  // if compressor isn't available - error, because cannot return
12417  // decompressed data?
12418 
12419  const char* alg_name = Compressor::get_comp_alg_name(alg);
12420  derr << __func__ << " can't load decompressor " << alg_name << dendl;
12421  _set_compression_alert(false, alg_name);
12422  r = -EIO;
12423  } else {
12424  r = cp->decompress(i, chdr.length, *result, chdr.compressor_message);
12425  if (r < 0) {
12426  derr << __func__ << " decompression failed with exit code " << r << dendl;
12427  r = -EIO;
12428  }
12429  }
12430  log_latency(__func__,
12431  l_bluestore_decompress_lat,
12432  mono_clock::now() - start,
12433  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
12434  return r;
12435 }
12436 
12437 // this stores fiemap into interval_set, other variations
12438 // use it internally
12439 int BlueStore::_fiemap(
12440  CollectionHandle &c_,
12441  const ghobject_t& oid,
12442  uint64_t offset,
12443  size_t length,
12444  interval_set<uint64_t>& destset)
12445 {
12446  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12447  if (!c->exists)
12448  return -ENOENT;
12449  {
12450  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12451 
12452  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
12453  if (!o || !o->exists) {
12454  return -ENOENT;
12455  }
12456  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
12457 
12458  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
12459  << " size 0x" << o->onode.size << std::dec << dendl;
12460 
12461  boost::intrusive::set<Extent>::iterator ep, eend;
12462  if (offset >= o->onode.size)
12463  goto out;
12464 
12465  if (offset + length > o->onode.size) {
12466  length = o->onode.size - offset;
12467  }
12468 
12469  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, length);
12470  eend = o->extent_map.extent_map.end();
12471  ep = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset);
12472  while (length > 0) {
12473  dout(20) << __func__ << " offset " << offset << dendl;
12474  if (ep != eend && ep->logical_offset + ep->length <= offset) {
12475  ++ep;
12476  continue;
12477  }
12478 
12479  uint64_t x_len = length;
12480  if (ep != eend && ep->logical_offset <= offset) {
12481  uint64_t x_off = offset - ep->logical_offset;
12482  x_len = std::min(x_len, ep->length - x_off);
12483  dout(30) << __func__ << " lextent 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~"
12484  << x_len << std::dec << " blob " << ep->blob << dendl;
12485  destset.insert(offset, x_len);
12486  length -= x_len;
12487  offset += x_len;
12488  if (x_off + x_len == ep->length)
12489  ++ep;
12490  continue;
12491  }
12492  if (ep != eend &&
12493  ep->logical_offset > offset &&
12494  ep->logical_offset - offset < x_len) {
12495  x_len = ep->logical_offset - offset;
12496  }
12497  offset += x_len;
12498  length -= x_len;
12499  }
12500  }
12501 
12502  out:
12503  dout(20) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
12504  << " size = 0x(" << destset << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
12505  return 0;
12506 }
12507 
12508 int BlueStore::fiemap(
12509  CollectionHandle &c_,
12510  const ghobject_t& oid,
12511  uint64_t offset,
12512  size_t length,
12513  bufferlist& bl)
12514 {
12515  interval_set<uint64_t> m;
12516  int r = _fiemap(c_, oid, offset, length, m);
12517  if (r >= 0) {
12518  encode(m, bl);
12519  }
12520  return r;
12521 }
12522 
12523 int BlueStore::fiemap(
12524  CollectionHandle &c_,
12525  const ghobject_t& oid,
12526  uint64_t offset,
12527  size_t length,
12528  map<uint64_t, uint64_t>& destmap)
12529 {
12530  interval_set<uint64_t> m;
12531  int r = _fiemap(c_, oid, offset, length, m);
12532  if (r >= 0) {
12533  destmap = std::move(m).detach();
12534  }
12535  return r;
12536 }
12537 
12538 int BlueStore::readv(
12539  CollectionHandle &c_,
12540  const ghobject_t& oid,
12541  interval_set<uint64_t>& m,
12542  bufferlist& bl,
12543  uint32_t op_flags)
12544 {
12545  auto start = mono_clock::now();
12546  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12547  const coll_t &cid = c->get_cid();
12548  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << cid << " " << oid
12549  << " fiemap " << m
12550  << dendl;
12551  if (!c->exists)
12552  return -ENOENT;
12553 
12554  bl.clear();
12555  int r;
12556  {
12557  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12558  auto start1 = mono_clock::now();
12559  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
12560  log_latency("get_onode@read",
12561  l_bluestore_read_onode_meta_lat,
12562  mono_clock::now() - start1,
12563  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
