12564  if (!o || !o->exists) {
12565  r = -ENOENT;
12566  goto out;
12567  }
12568 
12569  if (m.empty()) {
12570  r = 0;
12571  goto out;
12572  }
12573 
12574  r = _do_readv(c, o, m, bl, op_flags);
12575  if (r == -EIO) {
12576  logger->inc(l_bluestore_read_eio);
12577  }
12578  }
12579 
12580  out:
12581  if (r >= 0 && _debug_data_eio(oid)) {
12582  r = -EIO;
12583  derr << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " INJECT EIO" << dendl;
12584  } else if (oid.hobj.pool > 0 && /* FIXME, see #23029 */
12585  cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_random_read_err &&
12586  (rand() % (int)(cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_random_read_err *
12587  100.0)) == 0) {
12588  dout(0) << __func__ << ": inject random EIO" << dendl;
12589  r = -EIO;
12590  }
12591  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid << " " << oid
12592  << " fiemap " << m << std::dec
12593  << " = " << r << dendl;
12594  log_latency(__func__,
12595  l_bluestore_read_lat,
12596  mono_clock::now() - start,
12597  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
12598  return r;
12599 }
12600 
12601 int BlueStore::_do_readv(
12602  Collection *c,
12603  OnodeRef& o,
12604  const interval_set<uint64_t>& m,
12605  bufferlist& bl,
12606  uint32_t op_flags,
12607  uint64_t retry_count)
12608 {
12609  FUNCTRACE(cct);
12610  int r = 0;
12611  int read_cache_policy = 0; // do not bypass clean or dirty cache
12612 
12613  dout(20) << __func__ << " fiemap " << m << std::hex
12614  << " size 0x" << o->onode.size << " (" << std::dec
12615  << o->onode.size << ")" << dendl;
12616 
12617  // generally, don't buffer anything, unless the client explicitly requests
12618  // it.
12619  bool buffered = false;
12620  if (op_flags & CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_WILLNEED) {
12621  dout(20) << __func__ << " will do buffered read" << dendl;
12622  buffered = true;
12623  } else if (cct->_conf->bluestore_default_buffered_read &&
12624  (op_flags & (CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_DONTNEED |
12625  CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_NOCACHE)) == 0) {
12626  dout(20) << __func__ << " defaulting to buffered read" << dendl;
12627  buffered = true;
12628  }
12629  // this method must be idempotent since we may call it several times
12630  // before we finally read the expected result.
12631  bl.clear();
12632 
12633  // call fiemap first!
12634  ceph_assert(m.range_start() <= o->onode.size);
12635  ceph_assert(m.range_end() <= o->onode.size);
12636  auto start = mono_clock::now();
12637  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, m.range_start(), m.range_end() - m.range_start());
12638  log_latency(__func__,
12639  l_bluestore_read_onode_meta_lat,
12640  mono_clock::now() - start,
12641  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
12642  "", l_bluestore_slow_read_onode_meta_count);
12643  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
12644 
12645  IOContext ioc(cct, NULL, !cct->_conf->bluestore_fail_eio);
12646  vector<std::tuple<ready_regions_t, vector<bufferlist>, blobs2read_t>> raw_results;
12647  raw_results.reserve(m.num_intervals());
12648  int i = 0;
12649  for (auto p = m.begin(); p != m.end(); p++, i++) {
12650  raw_results.push_back({});
12651  _read_cache(o, p.get_start(), p.get_len(), read_cache_policy,
12652  std::get<0>(raw_results[i]), std::get<2>(raw_results[i]));
12653  r = _prepare_read_ioc(std::get<2>(raw_results[i]), &std::get<1>(raw_results[i]), &ioc);
12654  // we always issue aio for reading, so errors other than EIO are not allowed
12655  if (r < 0)
12656  return r;
12657  }
12658 
12659  auto num_ios = m.size();
12660  if (ioc.has_pending_aios()) {
12661  num_ios = ioc.get_num_ios();
12662  bdev->aio_submit(&ioc);
12663  dout(20) << __func__ << " waiting for aio" << dendl;
12664  ioc.aio_wait();
12665  r = ioc.get_return_value();
12666  if (r < 0) {
12667  ceph_assert(r == -EIO); // no other errors allowed
12668  return -EIO;
12669  }
12670  }
12671  log_latency_fn(__func__,
12672  l_bluestore_read_wait_aio_lat,
12673  mono_clock::now() - start,
12674  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
12675  [&](auto lat) { return ", num_ios = " + stringify(num_ios); },
12676  l_bluestore_slow_read_wait_aio_count
12677  );
12678 
12679  ceph_assert(raw_results.size() == (size_t)m.num_intervals());
12680  i = 0;
12681  for (auto p = m.begin(); p != m.end(); p++, i++) {
12682  bool csum_error = false;
12683  bufferlist t;
12684  r = _generate_read_result_bl(o, p.get_start(), p.get_len(),
12685  std::get<0>(raw_results[i]),
12686  std::get<1>(raw_results[i]),
12687  std::get<2>(raw_results[i]),
12688  buffered, &csum_error, t);
12689  if (csum_error) {
12690  // Handles spurious read errors caused by a kernel bug.
12691  // We sometimes get all-zero pages as a result of the read under
12692  // high memory pressure. Retrying the failing read succeeds in most
12693  // cases.
12694  // See also: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/22464
12695  if (retry_count >= cct->_conf->bluestore_retry_disk_reads) {
12696  return -EIO;
12697  }
12698  return _do_readv(c, o, m, bl, op_flags, retry_count + 1);
12699  }
12700  bl.claim_append(t);
12701  }
12702  if (retry_count) {
12703  logger->inc(l_bluestore_reads_with_retries);
12704  dout(5) << __func__ << " read fiemap " << m
12705  << " failed " << retry_count << " times before succeeding"
12706  << dendl;
12707  }
12708  return bl.length();
12709 }
12710 
12711 int BlueStore::dump_onode(CollectionHandle &c_,
12712  const ghobject_t& oid,
12713  const string& section_name,
12714  Formatter *f)
12715 {
12716  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12717  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << dendl;
12718  if (!c->exists)
12719  return -ENOENT;
12720 
12721  int r;
12722  {
12723  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12724 
12725  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
12726  if (!o || !o->exists) {
12727  r = -ENOENT;
12728  goto out;
12729  }
12730  // FIXME minor: actually the next line isn't enough to
12731  // load shared blobs. Leaving as is for now..
12732  //
12733  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
12734 
12735  _dump_onode<0>(cct, *o);
12736  f->open_object_section(section_name.c_str());
12737  o->dump(f);
12738  f->close_section();
12739  r = 0;
12740  }
12741  out:
12742  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid
12743  << " = " << r << dendl;
12744  return r;
12745 }
12746 
12747 int BlueStore::getattr(
12748  CollectionHandle &c_,
12749  const ghobject_t& oid,
12750  const char *name,
12751  bufferptr& value)
12752 {
12753  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12754  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " " << name << dendl;
12755  if (!c->exists)
12756  return -ENOENT;
12757 
12758  int r;
12759  {
12760  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12761  mempool::bluestore_cache_meta::string k(name);
12762 
12763  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
12764  if (!o || !o->exists) {
12765  r = -ENOENT;
12766  goto out;
12767  }
12768 
12769  if (!o->onode.attrs.count(k)) {
12770  r = -ENODATA;
12771  goto out;
12772  }
12773  value = o->onode.attrs[k];
12774  r = 0;
12775  }
12776  out:
12777  if (r == 0 && _debug_mdata_eio(oid)) {
12778  r = -EIO;
12779  derr << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " INJECT EIO" << dendl;
12780  }
12781  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " " << name
12782  << " = " << r << dendl;
12783  return r;
12784 }
12785 
12786 int BlueStore::getattrs(
12787  CollectionHandle &c_,
12788  const ghobject_t& oid,
12789  map<string,bufferptr,less<>>& aset)
12790 {
12791  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12792  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << dendl;
12793  if (!c->exists)
12794  return -ENOENT;
12795 
12796  int r;
12797  {
12798  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12799 
12800  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
12801  if (!o || !o->exists) {
12802  r = -ENOENT;
12803  goto out;
12804  }
12805  for (auto& i : o->onode.attrs) {
12806  aset.emplace(i.first.c_str(), i.second);
12807  }
12808  r = 0;
12809  }
12810 
12811  out:
12812  if (r == 0 && _debug_mdata_eio(oid)) {
12813  r = -EIO;
12814  derr << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid << " INJECT EIO" << dendl;
12815  }
12816  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oid
12817  << " = " << r << dendl;
12818  return r;
12819 }
12820 
12821 int BlueStore::list_collections(vector<coll_t>& ls)
12822 {
12823  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
12824  ls.reserve(coll_map.size());
12825  for (ceph::unordered_map<coll_t, CollectionRef>::iterator p = coll_map.begin();
12826  p != coll_map.end();
12827  ++p)
12828  ls.push_back(p->first);
12829  return 0;
12830 }
12831 
12832 bool BlueStore::collection_exists(const coll_t& c)
12833 {
12834  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
12835  return coll_map.count(c);
12836 }
12837 
12838 int BlueStore::collection_empty(CollectionHandle& ch, bool *empty)
12839 {
12840  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << ch->cid << dendl;
12841  vector<ghobject_t> ls;
12842  ghobject_t next;
12843  int r = collection_list(ch, ghobject_t(), ghobject_t::get_max(), 1,
12844  &ls, &next);
12845  if (r < 0) {
12846  derr << __func__ << " collection_list returned: " << cpp_strerror(r)
12847  << dendl;
12848  return r;
12849  }
12850  *empty = ls.empty();
12851  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << ch->cid << " = " << (int)(*empty) << dendl;
12852  return 0;
12853 }
12854 
12855 int BlueStore::collection_bits(CollectionHandle& ch)
12856 {
12857  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << ch->cid << dendl;
12858  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection*>(ch.get());
12859  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12860  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << ch->cid << " = " << c->cnode.bits << dendl;
12861  return c->cnode.bits;
12862 }
12863 
12864 int BlueStore::collection_list(
12865  CollectionHandle &c_, const ghobject_t& start, const ghobject_t& end, int max,
12866  vector<ghobject_t> *ls, ghobject_t *pnext)
12867 {
12868  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12869  c->flush();
12870  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
12871  << " start " << start << " end " << end << " max " << max << dendl;
12872  int r;
12873  {
12874  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12875  r = _collection_list(c, start, end, max, false, ls, pnext);
12876  }
12877 
12878  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
12879  << " start " << start << " end " << end << " max " << max
12880  << " = " << r << ", ls.size() = " << ls->size()
12881  << ", next = " << (pnext ? *pnext : ghobject_t()) << dendl;
12882  return r;
12883 }
12884 
12885 int BlueStore::collection_list_legacy(
12886  CollectionHandle &c_, const ghobject_t& start, const ghobject_t& end, int max,
12887  vector<ghobject_t> *ls, ghobject_t *pnext)
12888 {
12889  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
12890  c->flush();
12891  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
12892  << " start " << start << " end " << end << " max " << max << dendl;
12893  int r;
12894  {
12895  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
12896  r = _collection_list(c, start, end, max, true, ls, pnext);
12897  }
12898 
12899  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
12900  << " start " << start << " end " << end << " max " << max
12901  << " = " << r << ", ls.size() = " << ls->size()
12902  << ", next = " << (pnext ? *pnext : ghobject_t()) << dendl;
12903  return r;
12904 }
12905 
12906 int BlueStore::_collection_list(
12907  Collection *c, const ghobject_t& start, const ghobject_t& end, int max,
12908  bool legacy, vector<ghobject_t> *ls, ghobject_t *pnext)
12909 {
12910 
12911  if (!c->exists)
12912  return -ENOENT;
12913 
12914  ghobject_t static_next;
12915  std::unique_ptr<CollectionListIterator> it;
12916  ghobject_t coll_range_temp_start, coll_range_temp_end;
12917  ghobject_t coll_range_start, coll_range_end;
12918  ghobject_t pend;
12919  bool temp;
12920 
12921  if (!pnext)
12922  pnext = &static_next;
12923 
12924  auto log_latency = make_scope_guard(
12925  [&, start_time = mono_clock::now(), func_name = __func__] {
12926  log_latency_fn(
12927  func_name,
12928  l_bluestore_clist_lat,
12929  mono_clock::now() - start_time,
12930  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_collection_list_age,
12931  [&](const ceph::timespan& lat) {
12932  ostringstream ostr;
12933  ostr << ", lat = " << timespan_str(lat)
12934  << " cid =" << c->cid
12935  << " start " << start << " end " << end
12936  << " max " << max;
12937  return ostr.str();
12938  });
12939  });
12940 
12941  if (start.is_max() || start.hobj.is_max()) {
12942  *pnext = ghobject_t::get_max();
12943  return 0;
12944  }
12945  get_coll_range(c->cid, c->cnode.bits, &coll_range_temp_start,
12946  &coll_range_temp_end, &coll_range_start, &coll_range_end, legacy);
12947  dout(20) << __func__
12948  << " range " << coll_range_temp_start
12949  << " to " << coll_range_temp_end
12950  << " and " << coll_range_start
12951  << " to " << coll_range_end
12952  << " start " << start << dendl;
12953  if (legacy) {
12954  it = std::make_unique<SimpleCollectionListIterator>(
12955  cct, db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ));
12956  } else {
12957  it = std::make_unique<SortedCollectionListIterator>(
12958  db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ));
12959  }
12960  if (start == ghobject_t() ||
12961  start.hobj == hobject_t() ||
12962  start == c->cid.get_min_hobj()) {
12963  it->upper_bound(coll_range_temp_start);
12964  temp = true;
12965  } else {
12966  if (start.hobj.is_temp()) {
12967  temp = true;
12968  ceph_assert(start >= coll_range_temp_start && start < coll_range_temp_end);
12969  } else {
12970  temp = false;
12971  ceph_assert(start >= coll_range_start && start < coll_range_end);
12972  }
12973  dout(20) << __func__ << " temp=" << (int)temp << dendl;
12974  it->lower_bound(start);
12975  }
12976  if (end.hobj.is_max()) {
12977  pend = temp ? coll_range_temp_end : coll_range_end;
12978  } else {
12979  if (end.hobj.is_temp()) {
12980  if (temp) {
12981  pend = end;
12982  } else {
12983  *pnext = ghobject_t::get_max();
12984  return 0;
12985  }
12986  } else {
12987  pend = temp ? coll_range_temp_end : end;
12988  }
12989  }
12990  dout(20) << __func__ << " pend " << pend << dendl;
12991  while (true) {
12992  if (!it->valid() || it->is_ge(pend)) {
12993  if (!it->valid())
12994  dout(20) << __func__ << " iterator not valid (end of db?)" << dendl;
12995  else
12996  dout(20) << __func__ << " oid " << it->oid() << " >= " << pend << dendl;
12997  if (temp) {
12998  if (end.hobj.is_temp()) {
12999  if (it->valid() && it->is_lt(coll_range_temp_end)) {
13000  *pnext = it->oid();
13001  return 0;
13002  }
13003  break;
13004  }
13005  dout(30) << __func__ << " switch to non-temp namespace" << dendl;
13006  temp = false;
13007  it->upper_bound(coll_range_start);
13008  if (end.hobj.is_max())
13009  pend = coll_range_end;
13010  else
13011  pend = end;
13012  dout(30) << __func__ << " pend " << pend << dendl;
13013  continue;
13014  }
13015  if (it->valid() && it->is_lt(coll_range_end)) {
13016  *pnext = it->oid();
13017  return 0;
13018  }
13019  break;
13020  }
13021  dout(20) << __func__ << " oid " << it->oid() << " end " << end << dendl;
13022  if (ls->size() >= (unsigned)max) {
13023  dout(20) << __func__ << " reached max " << max << dendl;
13024  *pnext = it->oid();
13025  return 0;
13026  }
13027  ls->push_back(it->oid());
13028  it->next();
13029  }
13030  *pnext = ghobject_t::get_max();
13031  return 0;
13032 }
13033 
13034 int BlueStore::omap_get(
13035  CollectionHandle &c_,
13036  const ghobject_t &oid,
13037  bufferlist *header,
13038  map<string, bufferlist> *out
13039  )
13040 {
13041  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13042  return _omap_get(c, oid, header, out);
13043 }
13044 
13045 int BlueStore::_omap_get(
13046  Collection *c,
13047  const ghobject_t &oid,
13048  bufferlist *header,
13049  map<string, bufferlist> *out
13050  )
13051 {
13052  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13053  if (!c->exists)
13054  return -ENOENT;
13055  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13056  int r = 0;
13057  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13058  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13059  r = -ENOENT;
13060  goto out;
13061  }
13062  r = _onode_omap_get(o, header, out);
13063  out:
13064  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13065  << dendl;
13066  return r;
13067 }
13068 
13069 int BlueStore::_onode_omap_get(
13070  const OnodeRef &o,
13071  bufferlist *header,
13072  map<string, bufferlist> *out
13073 )
13074 {
13075  int r = 0;
13076  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13077  r = -ENOENT;
13078  goto out;
13079  }
13080  if (!o->onode.has_omap())
13081  goto out;
13082  o->flush();
13083  {
13084  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
13085  string head, tail;
13086  o->get_omap_header(&head);
13087  o->get_omap_tail(&tail);
13088  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(prefix, 0, KeyValueDB::IteratorBounds{head, tail});
13089  it->lower_bound(head);
13090  while (it->valid()) {
13091  if (it->key() == head) {
13092  dout(30) << __func__ << " got header" << dendl;
13093  *header = it->value();
13094  } else if (it->key() >= tail) {
13095  dout(30) << __func__ << " reached tail" << dendl;
13096  break;
13097  } else {
13098  string user_key;
13099  o->decode_omap_key(it->key(), &user_key);
13100  dout(20) << __func__ << " got " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
13101  << " -> " << user_key << dendl;
13102  (*out)[user_key] = it->value();
13103  }
13104  it->next();
13105  }
13106  }
13107 out:
13108  return r;
13109 }
13110 
13111 int BlueStore::omap_get_header(
13112  CollectionHandle &c_,
13113  const ghobject_t &oid,
13114  bufferlist *header,
13115  bool allow_eio
13116  )
13117 {
13118  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13119  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13120  if (!c->exists)
13121  return -ENOENT;
13122  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13123  int r = 0;
13124  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13125  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13126  r = -ENOENT;
13127  goto out;
13128  }
13129  if (!o->onode.has_omap())
13130  goto out;
13131  o->flush();
13132  {
13133  string head;
13134  o->get_omap_header(&head);
13135  if (db->get(o->get_omap_prefix(), head, header) >= 0) {
13136  dout(30) << __func__ << " got header" << dendl;
13137  } else {
13138  dout(30) << __func__ << " no header" << dendl;
13139  }
13140  }
13141  out:
13142  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13143  << dendl;
13144  return r;
13145 }
13146 
13147 int BlueStore::omap_get_keys(
13148  CollectionHandle &c_,
13149  const ghobject_t &oid,
13150  set<string> *keys
13151  )
13152 {
13153  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13154  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13155  if (!c->exists)
13156  return -ENOENT;
13157  auto start1 = mono_clock::now();
13158  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13159  int r = 0;
13160  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13161  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13162  r = -ENOENT;
13163  goto out;
13164  }
13165  if (!o->onode.has_omap())
13166  goto out;
13167  o->flush();
13168  {
13169  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
13170  string head, tail;
13171  o->get_omap_key(string(), &head);
13172  o->get_omap_tail(&tail);
13173  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(prefix, 0, KeyValueDB::IteratorBounds{head, tail});
13174  it->lower_bound(head);
13175  while (it->valid()) {
13176  if (it->key() >= tail) {
13177  dout(30) << __func__ << " reached tail" << dendl;
13178  break;
13179  }
13180  string user_key;
13181  o->decode_omap_key(it->key(), &user_key);
13182  dout(20) << __func__ << " got " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
13183  << " -> " << user_key << dendl;
13184  keys->insert(user_key);
13185  it->next();
13186  }
13187  }
13188  out:
13189  c->store->log_latency(
13190  __func__,
13191  l_bluestore_omap_get_keys_lat,
13192  mono_clock::now() - start1,
13193  c->store->cct->_conf->bluestore_log_omap_iterator_age);
13194 
13195  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13196  << dendl;
13197  return r;
13198 }
13199 
13200 int BlueStore::omap_get_values(
13201  CollectionHandle &c_,
13202  const ghobject_t &oid,
13203  const set<string> &keys,
13204  map<string, bufferlist> *out
13205  )
13206 {
13207  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13208  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13209  if (!c->exists)
13210  return -ENOENT;
13211  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13212  auto start1 = mono_clock::now();
13213  int r = 0;
13214  string final_key;
13215  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13216  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13217  r = -ENOENT;
13218  goto out;
13219  }
13220  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
13221  goto out;
13222  }
13223  o->flush();
13224  {
13225  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
13226  o->get_omap_key(string(), &final_key);
13227  size_t base_key_len = final_key.size();
13228  for (set<string>::const_iterator p = keys.begin(); p != keys.end(); ++p) {
13229  final_key.resize(base_key_len); // keep prefix
13230  final_key += *p;
13231  bufferlist val;
13232  if (db->get(prefix, final_key, &val) >= 0) {
13233  dout(30) << __func__ << " got " << pretty_binary_string(final_key)
13234  << " -> " << *p << dendl;
13235  out->insert(make_pair(*p, val));
13236  }
13237  }
13238  }
13239  out:
13240  c->store->log_latency(
13241  __func__,
13242  l_bluestore_omap_get_values_lat,
13243  mono_clock::now() - start1,
13244  c->store->cct->_conf->bluestore_log_omap_iterator_age);
13245 
13246  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13247  << dendl;
13248  return r;
13249 }
13250 
13251 #ifdef WITH_SEASTAR
13252 int BlueStore::omap_get_values(
13253  CollectionHandle &c_,
13254  const ghobject_t &oid,
13255  const std::optional<string> &start_after,
13256  map<string, bufferlist> *output
13257  )
13258 {
13259  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13260  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13261  if (!c->exists)
13262  return -ENOENT;
13263  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13264  int r = 0;
13265  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13266  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13267  r = -ENOENT;
13268  goto out;
13269  }
13270  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
13271  goto out;
13272  }
13273  o->flush();
13274  {
13275  ObjectMap::ObjectMapIterator iter = get_omap_iterator(c_, oid);
13276  if (!iter) {
13277  r = -ENOENT;
13278  goto out;
13279  }
13280  iter->upper_bound(*start_after);
13281  for (; iter->valid(); iter->next()) {
13282  output->insert(make_pair(iter->key(), iter->value()));
13283  }
13284  }
13285 
13286 out:
13287  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13288  << dendl;
13289  return r;
13290 }
13291 #endif
13292 
13293 int BlueStore::omap_check_keys(
13294  CollectionHandle &c_,
13295  const ghobject_t &oid,
13296  const set<string> &keys,
13297  set<string> *out
13298  )
13299 {
13300  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13301  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << dendl;
13302  if (!c->exists)
13303  return -ENOENT;
13304  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13305  int r = 0;
13306  string final_key;
13307  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13308  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13309  r = -ENOENT;
13310  goto out;
13311  }
13312  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
13313  goto out;
13314  }
13315  o->flush();
13316  {
13317  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
13318  o->get_omap_key(string(), &final_key);
13319  size_t base_key_len = final_key.size();
13320  for (set<string>::const_iterator p = keys.begin(); p != keys.end(); ++p) {
13321  final_key.resize(base_key_len); // keep prefix
13322  final_key += *p;
13323  bufferlist val;
13324  if (db->get(prefix, final_key, &val) >= 0) {
13325  dout(30) << __func__ << " have " << pretty_binary_string(final_key)
13326  << " -> " << *p << dendl;
13327  out->insert(*p);
13328  } else {
13329  dout(30) << __func__ << " miss " << pretty_binary_string(final_key)
13330  << " -> " << *p << dendl;
13331  }
13332  }
13333  }
13334  out:
13335  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " oid " << oid << " = " << r
13336  << dendl;
13337  return r;
13338 }
13339 
13340 ObjectMap::ObjectMapIterator BlueStore::get_omap_iterator(
13341  CollectionHandle &c_,
13342  const ghobject_t &oid
13343  )
13344 {
13345  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection *>(c_.get());
13346  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->get_cid() << " " << oid << dendl;
13347  if (!c->exists) {
13348  return ObjectMap::ObjectMapIterator();
13349  }
13350  std::shared_lock l(c->lock);
13351  OnodeRef o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
13352  if (!o || !o->exists) {
13353  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << oid << "doesn't exist" <<dendl;
13354  return ObjectMap::ObjectMapIterator();
13355  }
13356  o->flush();
13357  dout(10) << __func__ << " has_omap = " << (int)o->onode.has_omap() <<dendl;
13358  auto bounds = KeyValueDB::IteratorBounds();
13359  if (o->onode.has_omap()) {
13360  std::string lower_bound, upper_bound;
13361  o->get_omap_key(string(), &lower_bound);
13362  o->get_omap_tail(&upper_bound);
13363  bounds.lower_bound = std::move(lower_bound);
13364  bounds.upper_bound = std::move(upper_bound);
13365  }
13366  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(o->get_omap_prefix(), 0, std::move(bounds));
13367  return ObjectMap::ObjectMapIterator(new OmapIteratorImpl(logger,c, o, it));
13368 }
13369 
13370 // -----------------
13371 // write helpers
13372 
13373 uint64_t BlueStore::_get_ondisk_reserved() const {
13374  ceph_assert(min_alloc_size);
13375  return round_up_to(
13376  std::max<uint64_t>(DB_SUPER_RESERVED, min_alloc_size), min_alloc_size);
13377 }
13378 
13379 void BlueStore::_prepare_ondisk_format_super(KeyValueDB::Transaction& t)
13380 {
13381  dout(10) << __func__ << " ondisk_format " << ondisk_format
13382  << " min_compat_ondisk_format " << min_compat_ondisk_format
13383  << dendl;
13384  ceph_assert(ondisk_format == latest_ondisk_format);
13385  {
13386  bufferlist bl;
13387  encode(ondisk_format, bl);
13388  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "ondisk_format", bl);
13389  }
13390  {
13391  bufferlist bl;
13392  encode(min_compat_ondisk_format, bl);
13393  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_compat_ondisk_format", bl);
13394  }
13395 }
13396 
13397 int BlueStore::_open_super_meta()
13398 {
13399  // nid
13400  {
13401  nid_max = 0;
13402  bufferlist bl;
13403  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "nid_max", &bl);
13404  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13405  try {
13406  uint64_t v;
13407  decode(v, p);
13408  nid_max = v;
13409  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13410  derr << __func__ << " unable to read nid_max" << dendl;
13411  return -EIO;
13412  }
13413  dout(1) << __func__ << " old nid_max " << nid_max << dendl;
13414  nid_last = nid_max.load();
13415  }
13416 
13417  // blobid
13418  {
13419  blobid_max = 0;
13420  bufferlist bl;
13421  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "blobid_max", &bl);
13422  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13423  try {
13424  uint64_t v;
13425  decode(v, p);
13426  blobid_max = v;
13427  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13428  derr << __func__ << " unable to read blobid_max" << dendl;
13429  return -EIO;
13430  }
13431  dout(1) << __func__ << " old blobid_max " << blobid_max << dendl;
13432  blobid_last = blobid_max.load();
13433  }
13434 
13435  // freelist
13436  {
13437  bufferlist bl;
13438  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "freelist_type", &bl);
13439  if (bl.length()) {
13440  freelist_type = std::string(bl.c_str(), bl.length());
13441  } else {
13442  ceph_abort_msg("Not Support extent freelist manager");
13443  }
13444  dout(5) << __func__ << "::NCB::freelist_type=" << freelist_type << dendl;
13445  }
13446  // ondisk format
13447  int32_t compat_ondisk_format = 0;
13448  {
13449  bufferlist bl;
13450  int r = db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "ondisk_format", &bl);
13451  if (r < 0) {
13452  // base case: kraken bluestore is v1 and readable by v1
13453  dout(20) << __func__ << " missing ondisk_format; assuming kraken"
13454  << dendl;
13455  ondisk_format = 1;
13456  compat_ondisk_format = 1;
13457  } else {
13458  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13459  try {
13460  decode(ondisk_format, p);
13461  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13462  derr << __func__ << " unable to read ondisk_format" << dendl;
13463  return -EIO;
13464  }
13465  bl.clear();
13466  {
13467  r = db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_compat_ondisk_format", &bl);
13468  ceph_assert(!r);
13469  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13470  try {
13471  decode(compat_ondisk_format, p);
13472  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13473  derr << __func__ << " unable to read compat_ondisk_format" << dendl;
13474  return -EIO;
13475  }
13476  }
13477  }
13478  dout(1) << __func__ << " ondisk_format " << ondisk_format
13479  << " compat_ondisk_format " << compat_ondisk_format
13480  << dendl;
13481  }
13482 
13483  if (latest_ondisk_format < compat_ondisk_format) {
13484  derr << __func__ << " compat_ondisk_format is "
13485  << compat_ondisk_format << " but we only understand version "
13486  << latest_ondisk_format << dendl;
13487  return -EPERM;
13488  }
13489 
13490  {
13491  bufferlist bl;
13492  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_alloc_size", &bl);
13493  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13494  try {
13495  uint64_t val;
13496  decode(val, p);
13497  min_alloc_size = val;
13498  min_alloc_size_order = std::countr_zero(val);
13499  min_alloc_size_mask = min_alloc_size - 1;
13500 
13501  ceph_assert(min_alloc_size == 1u << min_alloc_size_order);
13502  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13503  derr << __func__ << " unable to read min_alloc_size" << dendl;
13504  return -EIO;
13505  }
13506  dout(1) << __func__ << " min_alloc_size 0x" << std::hex << min_alloc_size
13507  << std::dec << dendl;
13508  logger->set(l_bluestore_alloc_unit, min_alloc_size);
13509  }
13510 
13511  // smr fields
13512  {
13513  bufferlist bl;
13514  int r = db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "zone_size", &bl);
13515  if (r >= 0) {
13516  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13517  decode(zone_size, p);
13518  dout(1) << __func__ << " zone_size 0x" << std::hex << zone_size << std::dec << dendl;
13519  ceph_assert(bdev->is_smr());
13520  } else {
13521  ceph_assert(!bdev->is_smr());
13522  }
13523  }
13524  {
13525  bufferlist bl;
13526  int r = db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "first_sequential_zone", &bl);
13527  if (r >= 0) {
13528  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13529  decode(first_sequential_zone, p);
13530  dout(1) << __func__ << " first_sequential_zone 0x" << std::hex
13531  << first_sequential_zone << std::dec << dendl;
13532  ceph_assert(bdev->is_smr());
13533  } else {
13534  ceph_assert(!bdev->is_smr());
13535  }
13536  }
13537 
13538  _set_per_pool_omap();
13539 
13540  _open_statfs();
13541  _set_alloc_sizes();
13542  _set_throttle_params();
13543 
13544  _set_csum();
13545  _set_compression();
13546  _set_blob_size();
13547 
13548  _validate_bdev();
13549  return 0;
13550 }
13551 
13552 int BlueStore::_upgrade_super()
13553 {
13554  dout(1) << __func__ << " from " << ondisk_format << ", latest "
13555  << latest_ondisk_format << dendl;
13556  if (ondisk_format < latest_ondisk_format) {
13557  ceph_assert(ondisk_format > 0);
13558  ceph_assert(ondisk_format < latest_ondisk_format);
13559 
13560  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
13561  if (ondisk_format == 1) {
13562  // changes:
13563  // - super: added ondisk_format
13564  // - super: added min_readable_ondisk_format
13565  // - super: added min_compat_ondisk_format
13566  // - super: added min_alloc_size
13567  // - super: removed min_min_alloc_size
13568  {
13569  bufferlist bl;
13570  db->get(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_min_alloc_size", &bl);
13571  auto p = bl.cbegin();
13572  try {
13573  uint64_t val;
13574  decode(val, p);
13575  min_alloc_size = val;
13576  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
13577  derr << __func__ << " failed to read min_min_alloc_size" << dendl;
13578  return -EIO;
13579  }
13580  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_alloc_size", bl);
13581  t->rmkey(PREFIX_SUPER, "min_min_alloc_size");
13582  }
13583  ondisk_format = 2;
13584  }
13585  if (ondisk_format == 2) {
13586  // changes:
13587  // - onode has FLAG_PERPOOL_OMAP. Note that we do not know that *all*
13588  // oondes are using the per-pool prefix until a repair is run; at that
13589  // point the per_pool_omap=1 key will be set.
13590  // - super: added per_pool_omap key, which indicates that *all* objects
13591  // are using the new prefix and key format
13592  ondisk_format = 3;
13593  }
13594  if (ondisk_format == 3) {
13595  // changes:
13596  // - FreelistManager keeps meta within bdev label
13597  int r = _write_out_fm_meta(0);
13598  ceph_assert(r == 0);
13599  ondisk_format = 4;
13600  }
13601  // This to be the last operation
13602  _prepare_ondisk_format_super(t);
13603  int r = db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
13604  ceph_assert(r == 0);
13605  }
13606  // done
13607  dout(1) << __func__ << " done" << dendl;
13608  return 0;
13609 }
13610 
13611 void BlueStore::_assign_nid(TransContext *txc, OnodeRef& o)
13612 {
13613  if (o->onode.nid) {
13614  ceph_assert(o->exists);
13615  return;
13616  }
13617  uint64_t nid = ++nid_last;
13618  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << nid << dendl;
13619  o->onode.nid = nid;
13620  txc->last_nid = nid;
13621  o->exists = true;
13622 }
13623 
13624 uint64_t BlueStore::_assign_blobid(TransContext *txc)
13625 {
13626  uint64_t bid = ++blobid_last;
13627  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << bid << dendl;
13628  txc->last_blobid = bid;
13629  return bid;
13630 }
13631 
13632 void BlueStore::get_db_statistics(Formatter *f)
13633 {
13634  db->get_statistics(f);
13635 }
13636 
13637 BlueStore::TransContext *BlueStore::_txc_create(
13638  Collection *c, OpSequencer *osr,
13639  list<Context*> *on_commits,
13640  TrackedOpRef osd_op)
13641 {
13642  TransContext *txc = new TransContext(cct, c, osr, on_commits);
13643  txc->t = db->get_transaction();
13644 
13645 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
13646  if (osd_op && osd_op->pg_trace) {
13647  txc->trace.init("TransContext", &trace_endpoint,
13648  &osd_op->pg_trace);
13649  txc->trace.event("txc create");
13650  txc->trace.keyval("txc seq", txc->seq);
13651  }
13652 #endif
13653 
13654  osr->queue_new(txc);
13655  dout(20) << __func__ << " osr " << osr << " = " << txc
13656  << " seq " << txc->seq << dendl;
13657  return txc;
13658 }
13659 
13660 void BlueStore::_txc_calc_cost(TransContext *txc)
13661 {
13662  // one "io" for the kv commit
13663  auto ios = 1 + txc->ioc.get_num_ios();
13664  auto cost = throttle_cost_per_io.load();
13665  txc->cost = ios * cost + txc->bytes;
13666  txc->ios = ios;
13667  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << txc << " cost " << txc->cost << " ("
13668  << ios << " ios * " << cost << " + " << txc->bytes
13669  << " bytes)" << dendl;
13670 }
13671 
13672 void BlueStore::_txc_update_store_statfs(TransContext *txc)
13673 {
13674  if (txc->statfs_delta.is_empty())
13675  return;
13676 
13677  logger->inc(l_bluestore_allocated, txc->statfs_delta.allocated());
13678  logger->inc(l_bluestore_stored, txc->statfs_delta.stored());
13679  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compressed, txc->statfs_delta.compressed());
13680  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compressed_allocated, txc->statfs_delta.compressed_allocated());
13681  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compressed_original, txc->statfs_delta.compressed_original());
13682 
13683  if (per_pool_stat_collection) {
13684  if (!is_statfs_recoverable()) {
13685  bufferlist bl;
13686  txc->statfs_delta.encode(bl);
13687  string key;
13688  get_pool_stat_key(txc->osd_pool_id, &key);
13689  txc->t->merge(PREFIX_STAT, key, bl);
13690  }
13691 
13692  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
13693  auto& stats = osd_pools[txc->osd_pool_id];
13694  stats += txc->statfs_delta;
13695 
13696  vstatfs += txc->statfs_delta; //non-persistent in this mode
13697 
13698  } else {
13699  if (!is_statfs_recoverable()) {
13700  bufferlist bl;
13701  txc->statfs_delta.encode(bl);
13702  txc->t->merge(PREFIX_STAT, BLUESTORE_GLOBAL_STATFS_KEY, bl);
13703  }
13704 
13705  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
13706  vstatfs += txc->statfs_delta;
13707  }
13708  txc->statfs_delta.reset();
13709 }
13710 
13711 void BlueStore::_txc_state_proc(TransContext *txc)
13712 {
13713  while (true) {
13714  dout(10) << __func__ << " txc " << txc
13715  << " " << txc->get_state_name() << dendl;
13716  switch (txc->get_state()) {
13717  case TransContext::STATE_PREPARE:
13718  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_prepare_lat);
13719  if (txc->ioc.has_pending_aios()) {
13720  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_AIO_WAIT);
13721 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
13722  if (txc->trace) {
13723  txc->trace.keyval("pending aios", txc->ioc.num_pending.load());
13724  }
13725 #endif
13726  txc->had_ios = true;
13727  _txc_aio_submit(txc);
13728  return;
13729  }
13730  // ** fall-thru **
13731 
13732  case TransContext::STATE_AIO_WAIT:
13733  {
13734  mono_clock::duration lat = throttle.log_state_latency(
13735  *txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_aio_wait_lat);
13736  if (ceph::to_seconds<double>(lat) >= cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age) {
13737  logger->inc(l_bluestore_slow_aio_wait_count);
13738  dout(0) << __func__ << " slow aio_wait, txc = " << txc
13739  << ", latency = " << lat
13740  << dendl;
13741  }
13742  }
13743 
13744  _txc_finish_io(txc); // may trigger blocked txc's too
13745  return;
13746 
13747  case TransContext::STATE_IO_DONE:
13748  ceph_assert(ceph_mutex_is_locked(txc->osr->qlock)); // see _txc_finish_io
13749  if (txc->had_ios) {
13750  ++txc->osr->txc_with_unstable_io;
13751  }
13752  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_io_done_lat);
13753  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_KV_QUEUED);
13754  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_sync_submit_transaction) {
13755  if (txc->last_nid >= nid_max ||
13756  txc->last_blobid >= blobid_max) {
13757  dout(20) << __func__
13758  << " last_{nid,blobid} exceeds max, submit via kv thread"
13759  << dendl;
13760  } else if (txc->osr->kv_committing_serially) {
13761  dout(20) << __func__ << " prior txc submitted via kv thread, us too"
13762  << dendl;
13763  // note: this is starvation-prone. once we have a txc in a busy
13764  // sequencer that is committing serially it is possible to keep
13765  // submitting new transactions fast enough that we get stuck doing
13766  // so. the alternative is to block here... fixme?
13767  } else if (txc->osr->txc_with_unstable_io) {
13768  dout(20) << __func__ << " prior txc(s) with unstable ios "
13769  << txc->osr->txc_with_unstable_io.load() << dendl;
13770  } else if (cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_randomize_serial_transaction &&
13771  rand() % cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_randomize_serial_transaction
13772  == 0) {
13773  dout(20) << __func__ << " DEBUG randomly forcing submit via kv thread"
13774  << dendl;
13775  } else {
13776  _txc_apply_kv(txc, true);
13777  }
13778  }
13779  {
13780  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
13781  kv_queue.push_back(txc);
13782  if (!kv_sync_in_progress) {
13783  kv_sync_in_progress = true;
13784  kv_cond.notify_one();
13785  }
13786  if (txc->get_state() != TransContext::STATE_KV_SUBMITTED) {
13787  kv_queue_unsubmitted.push_back(txc);
13788  ++txc->osr->kv_committing_serially;
13789  }
13790  if (txc->had_ios)
13791  kv_ios++;
13792  kv_throttle_costs += txc->cost;
13793  }
13794  return;
13795  case TransContext::STATE_KV_SUBMITTED:
13796  _txc_committed_kv(txc);
13797  // ** fall-thru **
13798 
13799  case TransContext::STATE_KV_DONE:
13800  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_kv_done_lat);
13801  if (txc->deferred_txn) {
13802  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_DEFERRED_QUEUED);
13803  _deferred_queue(txc);
13804  return;
13805  }
13806  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_FINISHING);
13807  break;
13808 
13809  case TransContext::STATE_DEFERRED_CLEANUP:
13810  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_deferred_cleanup_lat);
13811  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_FINISHING);
13812  // ** fall-thru **
13813 
13814  case TransContext::STATE_FINISHING:
13815  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_finishing_lat);
13816  _txc_finish(txc);
13817  return;
13818 
13819  default:
13820  derr << __func__ << " unexpected txc " << txc
13821  << " state " << txc->get_state_name() << dendl;
13822  ceph_abort_msg("unexpected txc state");
13823  return;
13824  }
13825  }
13826 }
13827 
13828 void BlueStore::_txc_finish_io(TransContext *txc)
13829 {
13830  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << txc << dendl;
13831 
13832  /*
13833  * we need to preserve the order of kv transactions,
13834  * even though aio will complete in any order.
13835  */
13836 
13837  OpSequencer *osr = txc->osr.get();
13838  std::lock_guard l(osr->qlock);
13839  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_IO_DONE);
13840  txc->ioc.release_running_aios();
13841  OpSequencer::q_list_t::iterator p = osr->q.iterator_to(*txc);
13842  while (p != osr->q.begin()) {
13843  --p;
13844  if (p->get_state() < TransContext::STATE_IO_DONE) {
13845  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << txc << " blocked by " << &*p << " "
13846  << p->get_state_name() << dendl;
13847  return;
13848  }
13849  if (p->get_state() > TransContext::STATE_IO_DONE) {
13850  ++p;
13851  break;
13852  }
13853  }
13854  do {
13855  _txc_state_proc(&*p++);
13856  } while (p != osr->q.end() &&
13857  p->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_IO_DONE);
13858 
13859  if (osr->kv_submitted_waiters) {
13860  osr->qcond.notify_all();
13861  }
13862 }
13863 
13864 void BlueStore::_txc_write_nodes(TransContext *txc, KeyValueDB::Transaction t)
13865 {
13866  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc
13867  << " onodes " << txc->onodes
13868  << " shared_blobs " << txc->shared_blobs
13869  << dendl;
13870 
13871  // finalize onodes
13872  for (auto o : txc->onodes) {
13873  _record_onode(o, t);
13874  o->flushing_count++;
13875  }
13876 
13877  // objects we modified but didn't affect the onode
13878  auto p = txc->modified_objects.begin();
13879  while (p != txc->modified_objects.end()) {
13880  if (txc->onodes.count(*p) == 0) {
13881  (*p)->flushing_count++;
13882  ++p;
13883  } else {
13884  // remove dups with onodes list to avoid problems in _txc_finish
13885  p = txc->modified_objects.erase(p);
13886  }
13887  }
13888 
13889  // finalize shared_blobs
13890  for (auto sb : txc->shared_blobs) {
13891  string key;
13892  auto sbid = sb->get_sbid();
13893  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
13894  if (sb->persistent->empty()) {
13895  dout(20) << __func__ << " shared_blob 0x"
13896  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
13897  << " is empty" << dendl;
13898  t->rmkey(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
13899  } else {
13900  bufferlist bl;
13901  encode(*(sb->persistent), bl);
13902  dout(20) << __func__ << " shared_blob 0x"
13903  << std::hex << sbid << std::dec
13904  << " is " << bl.length() << " " << *sb << dendl;
13905  t->set(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key, bl);
13906  }
13907  }
13908 }
13909 
13910 void BlueStore::BSPerfTracker::update_from_perfcounters(
13911  PerfCounters &logger)
13912 {
13913  os_commit_latency_ns.consume_next(
13914  logger.get_tavg_ns(
13915  l_bluestore_commit_lat));
13916  os_apply_latency_ns.consume_next(
13917  logger.get_tavg_ns(
13918  l_bluestore_commit_lat));
13919 }
13920 
13921 void BlueStore::_txc_finalize_kv(TransContext *txc, KeyValueDB::Transaction t)
13922 {
13923  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc << std::hex
13924  << " allocated 0x" << txc->allocated
13925  << " released 0x" << txc->released
13926  << std::dec << dendl;
13927 
13928  if (!fm->is_null_manager())
13929  {
13930  // We have to handle the case where we allocate *and* deallocate the
13931  // same region in this transaction. The freelist doesn't like that.
13932  // (Actually, the only thing that cares is the BitmapFreelistManager
13933  // debug check. But that's important.)
13934  interval_set<uint64_t> tmp_allocated, tmp_released;
13935  interval_set<uint64_t> *pallocated = &txc->allocated;
13936  interval_set<uint64_t> *preleased = &txc->released;
13937  if (!txc->allocated.empty() && !txc->released.empty()) {
13938  interval_set<uint64_t> overlap;
13939  overlap.intersection_of(txc->allocated, txc->released);
13940  if (!overlap.empty()) {
13941  tmp_allocated = txc->allocated;
13942  tmp_allocated.subtract(overlap);
13943  tmp_released = txc->released;
13944  tmp_released.subtract(overlap);
13945  dout(20) << __func__ << " overlap 0x" << std::hex << overlap
13946  << ", new allocated 0x" << tmp_allocated
13947  << " released 0x" << tmp_released << std::dec
13948  << dendl;
13949  pallocated = &tmp_allocated;
13950  preleased = &tmp_released;
13951  }
13952  }
13953 
13954  // update freelist with non-overlap sets
13955  for (interval_set<uint64_t>::iterator p = pallocated->begin();
13956  p != pallocated->end();
13957  ++p) {
13958  fm->allocate(p.get_start(), p.get_len(), t);
13959  }
13960  for (interval_set<uint64_t>::iterator p = preleased->begin();
13961  p != preleased->end();
13962  ++p) {
13963  dout(20) << __func__ << " release 0x" << std::hex << p.get_start()
13964  << "~" << p.get_len() << std::dec << dendl;
13965  fm->release(p.get_start(), p.get_len(), t);
13966  }
13967  }
13968 
13969 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
13970  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
13971  for (auto& i : txc->old_zone_offset_refs) {
13972  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm ref zone 0x" << std::hex << i.first.second
13973  << " offset 0x" << i.second << std::dec
13974  << " -> " << i.first.first->oid << dendl;
13975  string key;
13976  get_zone_offset_object_key(i.first.second, i.second, i.first.first->oid, &key);
13977  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key);
13978  }
13979  for (auto& i : txc->new_zone_offset_refs) {
13980  // (zone, offset) -> oid
13981  dout(20) << __func__ << " add ref zone 0x" << std::hex << i.first.second
13982  << " offset 0x" << i.second << std::dec
13983  << " -> " << i.first.first->oid << dendl;
13984  string key;
13985  get_zone_offset_object_key(i.first.second, i.second, i.first.first->oid, &key);
13986  bufferlist v;
13987  txc->t->set(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key, v);
13988  }
13989  }
13990 #endif
13991 
13992  _txc_update_store_statfs(txc);
13993 }
13994 
13995 void BlueStore::_txc_apply_kv(TransContext *txc, bool sync_submit_transaction)
13996 {
13997  ceph_assert(txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_KV_QUEUED);
13998  {
13999 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
14000  auto start = mono_clock::now();
14001 #endif
14002 
14003 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
14004  if (txc->trace) {
14005  txc->trace.event("db async submit");
14006  }
14007 #endif
14008 
14009  int r = cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_omit_kv_commit ? 0 : db->submit_transaction(txc->t);
14010  ceph_assert(r == 0);
14011  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_KV_SUBMITTED);
14012  if (txc->osr->kv_submitted_waiters) {
14013  std::lock_guard l(txc->osr->qlock);
14014  txc->osr->qcond.notify_all();
14015  }
14016 
14017 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
14018  if (txc->tracing) {
14019  tracepoint(
14020  bluestore,
14021  transaction_kv_submit_latency,
14022  txc->osr->get_sequencer_id(),
14023  txc->seq,
14024  sync_submit_transaction,
14025  ceph::to_seconds<double>(mono_clock::now() - start));
14026  }
14027 #endif
14028  }
14029 
14030  for (auto ls : { &txc->onodes, &txc->modified_objects }) {
14031  for (auto& o : *ls) {
14032  dout(20) << __func__ << " onode " << o << " had " << o->flushing_count
14033  << dendl;
14034  if (--o->flushing_count == 0 && o->waiting_count.load()) {
14035  std::lock_guard l(o->flush_lock);
14036  o->flush_cond.notify_all();
14037  }
14038  }
14039  }
14040 }
14041 
14042 void BlueStore::_txc_committed_kv(TransContext *txc)
14043 {
14044  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc << dendl;
14045  throttle.complete_kv(*txc);
14046  {
14047  std::lock_guard l(txc->osr->qlock);
14048  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_KV_DONE);
14049  if (txc->ch->commit_queue) {
14050  txc->ch->commit_queue->queue(txc->oncommits);
14051  } else {
14052  finisher.queue(txc->oncommits);
14053  }
14054  }
14055  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_kv_committing_lat);
14056  log_latency_fn(
14057  __func__,
14058  l_bluestore_commit_lat,
14059  mono_clock::now() - txc->start,
14060  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
14061  [&](auto lat) {
14062  return ", txc = " + stringify(txc);
14063  },
14064  l_bluestore_slow_committed_kv_count
14065  );
14066 }
14067 
14068 void BlueStore::_txc_finish(TransContext *txc)
14069 {
14070  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << txc << " onodes " << txc->onodes << dendl;
14071  ceph_assert(txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_FINISHING);
14072 
14073  for (auto& sb : txc->blobs_written) {
14074  sb->finish_write(txc->seq);
14075  }
14076  txc->blobs_written.clear();
14077  while (!txc->removed_collections.empty()) {
14078  _queue_reap_collection(txc->removed_collections.front());
14079  txc->removed_collections.pop_front();
14080  }
14081 
14082  OpSequencerRef osr = txc->osr;
14083  bool empty = false;
14084  bool submit_deferred = false;
14085  OpSequencer::q_list_t releasing_txc;
14086  {
14087  std::lock_guard l(osr->qlock);
14088  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_DONE);
14089  bool notify = false;
14090  while (!osr->q.empty()) {
14091  TransContext *txc = &osr->q.front();
14092  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc << " " << txc->get_state_name()
14093  << dendl;
14094  if (txc->get_state() != TransContext::STATE_DONE) {
14095  if (txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_PREPARE &&
14096  deferred_aggressive) {
14097  // for _osr_drain_preceding()
14098  notify = true;
14099  }
14100  if (txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_DEFERRED_QUEUED &&
14101  osr->q.size() > g_conf()->bluestore_max_deferred_txc) {
14102  submit_deferred = true;
14103  }
14104  break;
14105  }
14106 
14107  osr->q.pop_front();
14108  releasing_txc.push_back(*txc);
14109  }
14110 
14111  if (osr->q.empty()) {
14112  dout(20) << __func__ << " osr " << osr << " q now empty" << dendl;
14113  empty = true;
14114  }
14115 
14116  // only drain()/drain_preceding() need wakeup,
14117  // other cases use kv_submitted_waiters
14118  if (notify || empty) {
14119  osr->qcond.notify_all();
14120  }
14121  }
14122 
14123  while (!releasing_txc.empty()) {
14124  // release to allocator only after all preceding txc's have also
14125  // finished any deferred writes that potentially land in these
14126  // blocks
14127  auto txc = &releasing_txc.front();
14128  _txc_release_alloc(txc);
14129  releasing_txc.pop_front();
14130  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_done_lat);
14131  throttle.complete(*txc);
14132  delete txc;
14133  }
14134 
14135  if (submit_deferred) {
14136  // we're pinning memory; flush! we could be more fine-grained here but
14137  // i'm not sure it's worth the bother.
14138  deferred_try_submit();
14139  }
14140 
14141  if (empty && osr->zombie) {
14142  std::lock_guard l(zombie_osr_lock);
14143  if (zombie_osr_set.erase(osr->cid)) {
14144  dout(10) << __func__ << " reaping empty zombie osr " << osr << dendl;
14145  } else {
14146  dout(10) << __func__ << " empty zombie osr " << osr << " already reaped"
14147  << dendl;
14148  }
14149  }
14150 }
14151 
14152 void BlueStore::_txc_release_alloc(TransContext *txc)
14153 {
14154  bool discard_queued = false;
14155  // it's expected we're called with lazy_release_lock already taken!
14156  if (unlikely(cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_no_reuse_blocks ||
14157  txc->released.size() == 0)) {
14158  goto out;
14159  }
14160  discard_queued = bdev->try_discard(txc->released);
14161  // if async discard succeeded, will do alloc->release when discard callback
14162  // else we should release here
14163  if (!discard_queued) {
14164  dout(10) << __func__ << "(sync) " << txc << " " << std::hex
14165  << txc->released << std::dec << dendl;
14166  alloc->release(txc->released);
14167  }
14168 
14169 out:
14170  txc->allocated.clear();
14171  txc->released.clear();
14172 }
14173 
14174 void BlueStore::_osr_attach(Collection *c)
14175 {
14176  // note: caller has coll_lock
14177  auto q = coll_map.find(c->cid);
14178  if (q != coll_map.end()) {
14179  c->osr = q->second->osr;
14180  ldout(cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
14181  << " reusing osr " << c->osr << " from existing coll "
14182  << q->second << dendl;
14183  } else {
14184  std::lock_guard l(zombie_osr_lock);
14185  auto p = zombie_osr_set.find(c->cid);
14186  if (p == zombie_osr_set.end()) {
14187  c->osr = ceph::make_ref<OpSequencer>(this, next_sequencer_id++, c->cid);
14188  ldout(cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
14189  << " fresh osr " << c->osr << dendl;
14190  } else {
14191  c->osr = p->second;
14192  zombie_osr_set.erase(p);
14193  ldout(cct, 10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid
14194  << " resurrecting zombie osr " << c->osr << dendl;
14195  c->osr->zombie = false;
14196  }
14197  }
14198 }
14199 
14200 void BlueStore::_osr_register_zombie(OpSequencer *osr)
14201 {
14202  std::lock_guard l(zombie_osr_lock);
14203  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << osr << " " << osr->cid << dendl;
14204  osr->zombie = true;
14205  auto i = zombie_osr_set.emplace(osr->cid, osr);
14206  // this is either a new insertion or the same osr is already there
14207  ceph_assert(i.second || i.first->second == osr);
14208 }
14209 
14210 void BlueStore::_osr_drain_preceding(TransContext *txc)
14211 {
14212  OpSequencer *osr = txc->osr.get();
14213  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << txc << " osr " << osr << dendl;
14214  ++deferred_aggressive; // FIXME: maybe osr-local aggressive flag?
14215  {
14216  // submit anything pending
14217  osr->deferred_lock.lock();
14218  if (osr->deferred_pending && !osr->deferred_running) {
14219  _deferred_submit_unlock(osr);
14220  } else {
14221  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
14222  }
14223  }
14224  {
14225  // wake up any previously finished deferred events
14226  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
14227  if (!kv_sync_in_progress) {
14228  kv_sync_in_progress = true;
14229  kv_cond.notify_one();
14230  }
14231  }
14232  osr->drain_preceding(txc);
14233  --deferred_aggressive;
14234  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << osr << " done" << dendl;
14235 }
14236 
14237 void BlueStore::_osr_drain(OpSequencer *osr)
14238 {
14239  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << osr << dendl;
14240  ++deferred_aggressive; // FIXME: maybe osr-local aggressive flag?
14241  {
14242  // submit anything pending
14243  osr->deferred_lock.lock();
14244  if (osr->deferred_pending && !osr->deferred_running) {
14245  _deferred_submit_unlock(osr);
14246  } else {
14247  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
14248  }
14249  }
14250  {
14251  // wake up any previously finished deferred events
14252  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
14253  if (!kv_sync_in_progress) {
14254  kv_sync_in_progress = true;
14255  kv_cond.notify_one();
14256  }
14257  }
14258  osr->drain();
14259  --deferred_aggressive;
14260  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << osr << " done" << dendl;
14261 }
14262 
14263 void BlueStore::_osr_drain_all()
14264 {
14265  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
14266 
14267  set<OpSequencerRef> s;
14268  vector<OpSequencerRef> zombies;
14269  {
14270  std::shared_lock l(coll_lock);
14271  for (auto& i : coll_map) {
14272  s.insert(i.second->osr);
14273  }
14274  }
14275  {
14276  std::lock_guard l(zombie_osr_lock);
14277  for (auto& i : zombie_osr_set) {
14278  s.insert(i.second);
14279  zombies.push_back(i.second);
14280  }
14281  }
14282  dout(20) << __func__ << " osr_set " << s << dendl;
14283 
14284  ++deferred_aggressive;
14285  {
14286  // submit anything pending
14287  deferred_try_submit();
14288  }
14289  {
14290  // wake up any previously finished deferred events
14291  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
14292  kv_cond.notify_one();
14293  }
14294  {
14295  std::lock_guard l(kv_finalize_lock);
14296  kv_finalize_cond.notify_one();
14297  }
14298  for (auto osr : s) {
14299  dout(20) << __func__ << " drain " << osr << dendl;
14300  osr->drain();
14301  }
14302  --deferred_aggressive;
14303 
14304  {
14305  std::lock_guard l(zombie_osr_lock);
14306  for (auto& osr : zombies) {
14307  if (zombie_osr_set.erase(osr->cid)) {
14308  dout(10) << __func__ << " reaping empty zombie osr " << osr << dendl;
14309  ceph_assert(osr->q.empty());
14310  } else if (osr->zombie) {
14311  dout(10) << __func__ << " empty zombie osr " << osr
14312  << " already reaped" << dendl;
14313  ceph_assert(osr->q.empty());
14314  } else {
14315  dout(10) << __func__ << " empty zombie osr " << osr
14316  << " resurrected" << dendl;
14317  }
14318  }
14319  }
14320 
14321  dout(10) << __func__ << " done" << dendl;
14322 }
14323 
14324 
14325 void BlueStore::_kv_start()
14326 {
14327  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
14328 
14329  finisher.start();
14330  kv_sync_thread.create("bstore_kv_sync");
14331  kv_finalize_thread.create("bstore_kv_final");
14332 }
14333 
14334 void BlueStore::_kv_stop()
14335 {
14336  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
14337  {
14338  std::unique_lock l{kv_lock};
14339  while (!kv_sync_started) {
14340  kv_cond.wait(l);
14341  }
14342  kv_stop = true;
14343  kv_cond.notify_all();
14344  }
14345  {
14346  std::unique_lock l{kv_finalize_lock};
14347  while (!kv_finalize_started) {
14348  kv_finalize_cond.wait(l);
14349  }
14350  kv_finalize_stop = true;
14351  kv_finalize_cond.notify_all();
14352  }
14353  kv_sync_thread.join();
14354  kv_finalize_thread.join();
14355  ceph_assert(removed_collections.empty());
14356  {
14357  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
14358  kv_stop = false;
14359  }
14360  {
14361  std::lock_guard l(kv_finalize_lock);
14362  kv_finalize_stop = false;
14363  }
14364  dout(10) << __func__ << " stopping finishers" << dendl;
14365  finisher.wait_for_empty();
14366  finisher.stop();
14367  dout(10) << __func__ << " stopped" << dendl;
14368 }
14369 
14370 void BlueStore::_kv_sync_thread()
14371 {
14372  dout(10) << __func__ << " start" << dendl;
14373  deque<DeferredBatch*> deferred_stable_queue;
14374  std::unique_lock l{kv_lock};
14375  ceph_assert(!kv_sync_started);
14376  kv_sync_started = true;
14377  kv_cond.notify_all();
14378 
14379  auto t0 = mono_clock::now();
14380  timespan twait = ceph::make_timespan(0);
14381  size_t kv_submitted = 0;
14382 
14383  while (true) {
14384  auto period = cct->_conf->bluestore_kv_sync_util_logging_s;
14385  auto observation_period =
14386  ceph::make_timespan(period);
14387  auto elapsed = mono_clock::now() - t0;
14388  if (period && elapsed >= observation_period) {
14389  dout(5) << __func__ << " utilization: idle "
14390  << twait << " of " << elapsed
14391  << ", submitted: " << kv_submitted
14392  <<dendl;
14393  t0 = mono_clock::now();
14394  twait = ceph::make_timespan(0);
14395  kv_submitted = 0;
14396  }
14397  ceph_assert(kv_committing.empty());
14398  if (kv_queue.empty() &&
14399  ((deferred_done_queue.empty() && deferred_stable_queue.empty()) ||
14400  !deferred_aggressive)) {
14401  if (kv_stop)
14402  break;
14403  dout(20) << __func__ << " sleep" << dendl;
14404  auto t = mono_clock::now();
14405  kv_sync_in_progress = false;
14406  kv_cond.wait(l);
14407  twait += mono_clock::now() - t;
14408 
14409  dout(20) << __func__ << " wake" << dendl;
14410  } else {
14411  deque<TransContext*> kv_submitting;
14412  deque<DeferredBatch*> deferred_done, deferred_stable;
14413  uint64_t aios = 0, costs = 0;
14414 
14415  dout(20) << __func__ << " committing " << kv_queue.size()
14416  << " submitting " << kv_queue_unsubmitted.size()
14417  << " deferred done " << deferred_done_queue.size()
14418  << " stable " << deferred_stable_queue.size()
14419  << dendl;
14420  kv_committing.swap(kv_queue);
14421  kv_submitting.swap(kv_queue_unsubmitted);
14422  deferred_done.swap(deferred_done_queue);
14423  deferred_stable.swap(deferred_stable_queue);
14424  aios = kv_ios;
14425  costs = kv_throttle_costs;
14426  kv_ios = 0;
14427  kv_throttle_costs = 0;
14428  l.unlock();
14429 
14430  dout(30) << __func__ << " committing " << kv_committing << dendl;
14431  dout(30) << __func__ << " submitting " << kv_submitting << dendl;
14432  dout(30) << __func__ << " deferred_done " << deferred_done << dendl;
14433  dout(30) << __func__ << " deferred_stable " << deferred_stable << dendl;
14434 
14435  auto start = mono_clock::now();
14436 
14437  bool force_flush = false;
14438  // if bluefs is sharing the same device as data (only), then we
14439  // can rely on the bluefs commit to flush the device and make
14440  // deferred aios stable. that means that if we do have done deferred
14441  // txcs AND we are not on a single device, we need to force a flush.
14442  if (bluefs && bluefs_layout.single_shared_device()) {
14443  if (aios) {
14444  force_flush = true;
14445  } else if (kv_committing.empty() && deferred_stable.empty()) {
14446  force_flush = true; // there's nothing else to commit!
14447  } else if (deferred_aggressive) {
14448  force_flush = true;
14449  }
14450  } else {
14451  if (aios || !deferred_done.empty()) {
14452  force_flush = true;
14453  } else {
14454  dout(20) << __func__ << " skipping flush (no aios, no deferred_done)" << dendl;
14455  }
14456  }
14457 
14458  if (force_flush) {
14459  dout(20) << __func__ << " num_aios=" << aios
14460  << " force_flush=" << (int)force_flush
14461  << ", flushing, deferred done->stable" << dendl;
14462  // flush/barrier on block device
14463  bdev->flush();
14464 
14465  // if we flush then deferred done are now deferred stable
14466  if (deferred_stable.empty()) {
14467  deferred_stable.swap(deferred_done);
14468  } else {
14469  deferred_stable.insert(deferred_stable.end(), deferred_done.begin(),
14470  deferred_done.end());
14471  deferred_done.clear();
14472  }
14473  }
14474  auto after_flush = mono_clock::now();
14475 
14476  // we will use one final transaction to force a sync
14477  KeyValueDB::Transaction synct = db->get_transaction();
14478 
14479  // increase {nid,blobid}_max? note that this covers both the
14480  // case where we are approaching the max and the case we passed
14481  // it. in either case, we increase the max in the earlier txn
14482  // we submit.
14483  uint64_t new_nid_max = 0, new_blobid_max = 0;
14484  if (nid_last + cct->_conf->bluestore_nid_prealloc/2 > nid_max) {
14485  KeyValueDB::Transaction t =
14486  kv_submitting.empty() ? synct : kv_submitting.front()->t;
14487  new_nid_max = nid_last + cct->_conf->bluestore_nid_prealloc;
14488  bufferlist bl;
14489  encode(new_nid_max, bl);
14490  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "nid_max", bl);
14491  dout(10) << __func__ << " new_nid_max " << new_nid_max << dendl;
14492  }
14493  if (blobid_last + cct->_conf->bluestore_blobid_prealloc/2 > blobid_max) {
14494  KeyValueDB::Transaction t =
14495  kv_submitting.empty() ? synct : kv_submitting.front()->t;
14496  new_blobid_max = blobid_last + cct->_conf->bluestore_blobid_prealloc;
14497  bufferlist bl;
14498  encode(new_blobid_max, bl);
14499  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "blobid_max", bl);
14500  dout(10) << __func__ << " new_blobid_max " << new_blobid_max << dendl;
14501  }
14502 
14503  for (auto txc : kv_committing) {
14504  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_kv_queued_lat);
14505  if (txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_KV_QUEUED) {
14506  ++kv_submitted;
14507  _txc_apply_kv(txc, false);
14508  --txc->osr->kv_committing_serially;
14509  } else {
14510  ceph_assert(txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_KV_SUBMITTED);
14511  }
14512  if (txc->had_ios) {
14513  --txc->osr->txc_with_unstable_io;
14514  }
14515  }
14516 
14517  // release throttle *before* we commit. this allows new ops
14518  // to be prepared and enter pipeline while we are waiting on
14519  // the kv commit sync/flush. then hopefully on the next
14520  // iteration there will already be ops awake. otherwise, we
14521  // end up going to sleep, and then wake up when the very first
14522  // transaction is ready for commit.
14523  throttle.release_kv_throttle(costs);
14524 
14525  // cleanup sync deferred keys
14526  for (auto b : deferred_stable) {
14527  for (auto& txc : b->txcs) {
14528  bluestore_deferred_transaction_t& wt = *txc.deferred_txn;
14529  ceph_assert(wt.released.empty()); // only kraken did this
14530  string key;
14531  get_deferred_key(wt.seq, &key);
14532  synct->rm_single_key(PREFIX_DEFERRED, key);
14533  }
14534  }
14535 
14536 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
14537  auto sync_start = mono_clock::now();
14538 #endif
14539  // submit synct synchronously (block and wait for it to commit)
14540  int r = cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_omit_kv_commit ? 0 : db->submit_transaction_sync(synct);
14541  ceph_assert(r == 0);
14542 
14543 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
14544  for (auto txc : kv_committing) {
14545  if (txc->trace) {
14546  txc->trace.event("db sync submit");
14547  txc->trace.keyval("kv_committing size", kv_committing.size());
14548  }
14549  }
14550 #endif
14551 
14552  int committing_size = kv_committing.size();
14553  int deferred_size = deferred_stable.size();
14554 
14555 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
14556  double sync_latency = ceph::to_seconds<double>(mono_clock::now() - sync_start);
14557  for (auto txc: kv_committing) {
14558  if (txc->tracing) {
14559  tracepoint(
14560  bluestore,
14561  transaction_kv_sync_latency,
14562  txc->osr->get_sequencer_id(),
14563  txc->seq,
14564  kv_committing.size(),
14565  deferred_done.size(),
14566  deferred_stable.size(),
14567  sync_latency);
14568  }
14569  }
14570 #endif
14571 
14572  {
14573  std::unique_lock m{kv_finalize_lock};
14574  if (kv_committing_to_finalize.empty()) {
14575  kv_committing_to_finalize.swap(kv_committing);
14576  } else {
14577  kv_committing_to_finalize.insert(
14578  kv_committing_to_finalize.end(),
14579  kv_committing.begin(),
14580  kv_committing.end());
14581  kv_committing.clear();
14582  }
14583  if (deferred_stable_to_finalize.empty()) {
14584  deferred_stable_to_finalize.swap(deferred_stable);
14585  } else {
14586  deferred_stable_to_finalize.insert(
14587  deferred_stable_to_finalize.end(),
14588  deferred_stable.begin(),
14589  deferred_stable.end());
14590  deferred_stable.clear();
14591  }
14592  if (!kv_finalize_in_progress) {
14593  kv_finalize_in_progress = true;
14594  kv_finalize_cond.notify_one();
14595  }
14596  }
14597 
14598  if (new_nid_max) {
14599  nid_max = new_nid_max;
14600  dout(10) << __func__ << " nid_max now " << nid_max << dendl;
14601  }
14602  if (new_blobid_max) {
14603  blobid_max = new_blobid_max;
14604  dout(10) << __func__ << " blobid_max now " << blobid_max << dendl;
14605  }
14606 
14607  {
14608  auto finish = mono_clock::now();
14609  ceph::timespan dur_flush = after_flush - start;
14610  ceph::timespan dur_kv = finish - after_flush;
14611  ceph::timespan dur = finish - start;
14612  dout(20) << __func__ << " committed " << committing_size
14613  << " cleaned " << deferred_size
14614  << " in " << dur
14615  << " (" << dur_flush << " flush + " << dur_kv << " kv commit)"
14616  << dendl;
14617  log_latency("kv_flush",
14618  l_bluestore_kv_flush_lat,
14619  dur_flush,
14620  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
14621  log_latency("kv_commit",
14622  l_bluestore_kv_commit_lat,
14623  dur_kv,
14624  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
14625  log_latency("kv_sync",
14626  l_bluestore_kv_sync_lat,
14627  dur,
14628  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
14629  }
14630 
14631  l.lock();
14632  // previously deferred "done" are now "stable" by virtue of this
14633  // commit cycle.
14634  deferred_stable_queue.swap(deferred_done);
14635  }
14636  }
14637  dout(10) << __func__ << " finish" << dendl;
14638  kv_sync_started = false;
14639 }
14640 
14641 void BlueStore::_kv_finalize_thread()
14642 {
14643  deque<TransContext*> kv_committed;
14644  deque<DeferredBatch*> deferred_stable;
14645  dout(10) << __func__ << " start" << dendl;
14646  std::unique_lock l(kv_finalize_lock);
14647  ceph_assert(!kv_finalize_started);
14648  kv_finalize_started = true;
14649  kv_finalize_cond.notify_all();
14650  while (true) {
14651  ceph_assert(kv_committed.empty());
14652  ceph_assert(deferred_stable.empty());
14653  if (kv_committing_to_finalize.empty() &&
14654  deferred_stable_to_finalize.empty()) {
14655  if (kv_finalize_stop)
14656  break;
14657  dout(20) << __func__ << " sleep" << dendl;
14658  kv_finalize_in_progress = false;
14659  kv_finalize_cond.wait(l);
14660  dout(20) << __func__ << " wake" << dendl;
14661  } else {
14662  kv_committed.swap(kv_committing_to_finalize);
14663  deferred_stable.swap(deferred_stable_to_finalize);
14664  l.unlock();
14665  dout(20) << __func__ << " kv_committed " << kv_committed << dendl;
14666  dout(20) << __func__ << " deferred_stable " << deferred_stable << dendl;
14667 
14668  auto start = mono_clock::now();
14669 
14670  while (!kv_committed.empty()) {
14671  TransContext *txc = kv_committed.front();
14672  ceph_assert(txc->get_state() == TransContext::STATE_KV_SUBMITTED);
14673  _txc_state_proc(txc);
14674  kv_committed.pop_front();
14675  }
14676 
14677  for (auto b : deferred_stable) {
14678  auto p = b->txcs.begin();
14679  while (p != b->txcs.end()) {
14680  TransContext *txc = &*p;
14681  p = b->txcs.erase(p); // unlink here because
14682  _txc_state_proc(txc); // this may destroy txc
14683  }
14684  delete b;
14685  }
14686  deferred_stable.clear();
14687 
14688  if (!deferred_aggressive) {
14689  if (deferred_queue_size >= deferred_batch_ops.load() ||
14690  throttle.should_submit_deferred()) {
14691  deferred_try_submit();
14692  }
14693  }
14694 
14695  // this is as good a place as any ...
14696  _reap_collections();
14697 
14698  logger->set(l_bluestore_fragmentation,
14699  (uint64_t)(alloc->get_fragmentation() * 1000));
14700 
14701  log_latency("kv_final",
14702  l_bluestore_kv_final_lat,
14703  mono_clock::now() - start,
14704  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
14705 
14706  l.lock();
14707  }
14708  }
14709  dout(10) << __func__ << " finish" << dendl;
14710  kv_finalize_started = false;
14711 }
14712 
14713 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
14714 void BlueStore::_zoned_cleaner_start()
14715 {
14716  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
14717  zoned_cleaner_thread.create("bstore_zcleaner");
14718 }
14719 
14720 void BlueStore::_zoned_cleaner_stop()
14721 {
14722  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
14723  {
14724  std::unique_lock l{zoned_cleaner_lock};
14725  while (!zoned_cleaner_started) {
14726  zoned_cleaner_cond.wait(l);
14727  }
14728  zoned_cleaner_stop = true;
14729  zoned_cleaner_cond.notify_all();
14730  }
14731  zoned_cleaner_thread.join();
14732  {
14733  std::lock_guard l{zoned_cleaner_lock};
14734  zoned_cleaner_stop = false;
14735  }
14736  dout(10) << __func__ << " done" << dendl;
14737 }
14738 
14739 void BlueStore::_zoned_cleaner_thread()
14740 {
14741  dout(10) << __func__ << " start" << dendl;
14742  std::unique_lock l{zoned_cleaner_lock};
14743  ceph_assert(!zoned_cleaner_started);
14744  zoned_cleaner_started = true;
14745  zoned_cleaner_cond.notify_all();
14746  auto a = dynamic_cast<ZonedAllocator*>(alloc);
14747  ceph_assert(a);
14748  auto f = dynamic_cast<ZonedFreelistManager*>(fm);
14749  ceph_assert(f);
14750  while (true) {
14751  // thresholds to trigger cleaning
14752  // FIXME
14753  float min_score = .05; // score: bytes saved / bytes moved
14754  uint64_t min_saved = zone_size / 32; // min bytes saved to consider cleaning
14755  auto zone_to_clean = a->pick_zone_to_clean(min_score, min_saved);
14756  if (zone_to_clean < 0) {
14757  if (zoned_cleaner_stop) {
14758  break;
14759  }
14760  auto period = ceph::make_timespan(cct->_conf->bluestore_cleaner_sleep_interval);
14761  dout(20) << __func__ << " sleep for " << period << dendl;
14762  zoned_cleaner_cond.wait_for(l, period);
14763  dout(20) << __func__ << " wake" << dendl;
14764  } else {
14765  l.unlock();
14766  a->set_cleaning_zone(zone_to_clean);
14767  _zoned_clean_zone(zone_to_clean, a, f);
14768  a->clear_cleaning_zone(zone_to_clean);
14769  l.lock();
14770  }
14771  }
14772  dout(10) << __func__ << " finish" << dendl;
14773  zoned_cleaner_started = false;
14774 }
14775 
14776 void BlueStore::_zoned_clean_zone(
14777  uint64_t zone,
14778  ZonedAllocator *a,
14779  ZonedFreelistManager *f
14780  )
14781 {
14782  dout(10) << __func__ << " cleaning zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << std::dec << dendl;
14783 
14784  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO);
14785  std::string zone_start;
14786  get_zone_offset_object_key(zone, 0, ghobject_t(), &zone_start);
14787  for (it->lower_bound(zone_start); it->valid(); it->next()) {
14788  uint32_t z;
14789  uint64_t offset;
14790  ghobject_t oid;
14791  string k = it->key();
14792  int r = get_key_zone_offset_object(k, &z, &offset, &oid);
14793  if (r < 0) {
14794  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode zone ref " << pretty_binary_string(k)
14795  << dendl;
14796  continue;
14797  }
14798  if (zone != z) {
14799  dout(10) << __func__ << " reached end of zone refs" << dendl;
14800  break;
14801  }
14802  dout(10) << __func__ << " zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << " offset 0x" << offset
14803  << std::dec << " " << oid << dendl;
14804  _clean_some(oid, zone);
14805  }
14806 
14807  if (a->get_live_bytes(zone) > 0) {
14808  derr << "zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << " still has 0x" << a->get_live_bytes(zone)
14809  << " live bytes" << std::dec << dendl;
14810  // should we do something else here to avoid a live-lock in the event of a problem?
14811  return;
14812  }
14813 
14814  // make sure transactions flush/drain/commit (and data is all rewritten
14815  // safely elsewhere) before we blow away the cleaned zone
14816  _osr_drain_all();
14817 
14818  // reset the device zone
14819  dout(10) << __func__ << " resetting zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << std::dec << dendl;
14820  bdev->reset_zone(zone);
14821 
14822  // record that we can now write there
14823  f->mark_zone_to_clean_free(zone, db);
14824  bdev->flush();
14825 
14826  // then allow ourselves to start allocating there
14827  dout(10) << __func__ << " done cleaning zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << std::dec
14828  << dendl;
14829  a->reset_zone(zone);
14830 }
14831 
14832 void BlueStore::_clean_some(ghobject_t oid, uint32_t zone)
14833 {
14834  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << oid << " from zone 0x" << std::hex << zone << std::dec
14835  << dendl;
14836 
14837  CollectionRef cref = _get_collection_by_oid(oid);
14838  if (!cref) {
14839  dout(10) << __func__ << " can't find collection for " << oid << dendl;
14840  return;
14841  }
14842  Collection *c = cref.get();
14843 
14844  // serialize io dispatch vs other transactions
14845  std::lock_guard l(atomic_alloc_and_submit_lock);
14846  std::unique_lock l2(c->lock);
14847 
14848  auto o = c->get_onode(oid, false);
14849  if (!o) {
14850  dout(10) << __func__ << " can't find " << oid << dendl;
14851  return;
14852  }
14853 
14854  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
14855  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
14856 
14857  // NOTE: This is a naive rewrite strategy. If any blobs are
14858  // shared, they will be duplicated for each object that references
14859  // them. That means any cloned/snapshotted objects will explode
14860  // their utilization. This won't matter for RGW workloads, but
14861  // for RBD and CephFS it is completely unacceptable, and it's
14862  // entirely reasonable to have "archival" data workloads on SMR
14863  // for CephFS and (possibly/probably) RBD.
14864  //
14865  // At some point we need to replace this with something more
14866  // sophisticated that ensures that a shared blob gets moved once
14867  // and all referencing objects get updated to point to the new
14868  // location.
14869 
14870  map<uint32_t, uint32_t> to_move;
14871  for (auto& e : o->extent_map.extent_map) {
14872  bool touches_zone = false;
14873  for (auto& be : e.blob->get_blob().get_extents()) {
14874  if (be.is_valid()) {
14875  uint32_t z = be.offset / zone_size;
14876  if (z == zone) {
14877  touches_zone = true;
14878  break;
14879  }
14880  }
14881  }
14882  if (touches_zone) {
14883  to_move[e.logical_offset] = e.length;
14884  }
14885  }
14886  if (to_move.empty()) {
14887  dout(10) << __func__ << " no references to zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
14888  << std::dec << " from " << oid << dendl;
14889  return;
14890  }
14891 
14892  dout(10) << __func__ << " rewriting object extents 0x" << std::hex << to_move
14893  << std::dec << dendl;
14894  OpSequencer *osr = c->osr.get();
14895  TransContext *txc = _txc_create(c, osr, nullptr);
14896 
14897  spg_t pgid;
14898  if (c->cid.is_pg(&pgid)) {
14899  txc->osd_pool_id = pgid.pool();
14900  }
14901 
14902  for (auto& [offset, length] : to_move) {
14903  bufferlist bl;
14904  int r = _do_read(c, o, offset, length, bl, 0);
14905  ceph_assert(r == (int)length);
14906 
14907  r = _do_write(txc, cref, o, offset, length, bl, 0);
14908  ceph_assert(r >= 0);
14909  }
14910  txc->write_onode(o);
14911 
14912  _txc_write_nodes(txc, txc->t);
14913  _txc_finalize_kv(txc, txc->t);
14914  _txc_state_proc(txc);
14915 }
14916 #endif
14917 
14918 bluestore_deferred_op_t *BlueStore::_get_deferred_op(
14919  TransContext *txc, uint64_t len)
14920 {
14921  if (!txc->deferred_txn) {
14922  txc->deferred_txn = new bluestore_deferred_transaction_t;
14923  }
14924  txc->deferred_txn->ops.push_back(bluestore_deferred_op_t());
14925  logger->inc(l_bluestore_issued_deferred_writes);
14926  logger->inc(l_bluestore_issued_deferred_write_bytes, len);
14927  return &txc->deferred_txn->ops.back();
14928 }
14929 
14930 void BlueStore::_deferred_queue(TransContext *txc)
14931 {
14932  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc << " osr " << txc->osr << dendl;
14933 
14934  DeferredBatch *tmp;
14935  txc->osr->deferred_lock.lock();
14936  {
14937  if (!txc->osr->deferred_pending) {
14938  tmp = new DeferredBatch(cct, txc->osr.get());
14939  } else {
14940  tmp = txc->osr->deferred_pending;
14941  }
14942  }
14943 
14944  tmp->txcs.push_back(*txc);
14945  bluestore_deferred_transaction_t& wt = *txc->deferred_txn;
14946  for (auto opi = wt.ops.begin(); opi != wt.ops.end(); ++opi) {
14947  const auto& op = *opi;
14948  ceph_assert(op.op == bluestore_deferred_op_t::OP_WRITE);
14949  bufferlist::const_iterator p = op.data.begin();
14950  for (auto e : op.extents) {
14951  tmp->prepare_write(cct, wt.seq, e.offset, e.length, p);
14952  }
14953  }
14954 
14955  {
14956  ++deferred_queue_size;
14957  txc->osr->deferred_pending = tmp;
14958  // condition "tmp->txcs.size() == 1" mean deferred_pending was originally empty.
14959  // So we should add osr into deferred_queue.
14960  if (!txc->osr->deferred_running && (tmp->txcs.size() == 1)) {
14961  deferred_lock.lock();
14962  deferred_queue.push_back(*txc->osr);
14963  deferred_lock.unlock();
14964  }
14965 
14966  if (deferred_aggressive &&
14967  !txc->osr->deferred_running) {
14968  _deferred_submit_unlock(txc->osr.get());
14969  } else {
14970  txc->osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
14971  }
14972  }
14973  }
14974 
14975 void BlueStore::deferred_try_submit()
14976 {
14977  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << deferred_queue.size() << " osrs, "
14978  << deferred_queue_size << " txcs" << dendl;
14979  vector<OpSequencerRef> osrs;
14980 
14981  {
14982  std::lock_guard l(deferred_lock);
14983  osrs.reserve(deferred_queue.size());
14984  for (auto& osr : deferred_queue) {
14985  osrs.push_back(&osr);
14986  }
14987  }
14988 
14989  for (auto& osr : osrs) {
14990  osr->deferred_lock.lock();
14991  if (osr->deferred_pending) {
14992  if (!osr->deferred_running) {
14993  _deferred_submit_unlock(osr.get());
14994  } else {
14995  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
14996  dout(20) << __func__ << " osr " << osr << " already has running"
14997  << dendl;
14998  }
14999  } else {
15000  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
15001  dout(20) << __func__ << " osr " << osr << " has no pending" << dendl;
15002  }
15003  }
15004 
15005  {
15006  std::lock_guard l(deferred_lock);
15007  deferred_last_submitted = ceph_clock_now();
15008  }
15009 }
15010 
15011 void BlueStore::_deferred_submit_unlock(OpSequencer *osr)
15012 {
15013  dout(10) << __func__ << " osr " << osr
15014  << " " << osr->deferred_pending->iomap.size() << " ios pending "
15015  << dendl;
15016  ceph_assert(osr->deferred_pending);
15017  ceph_assert(!osr->deferred_running);
15018 
15019  auto b = osr->deferred_pending;
