15020  deferred_queue_size -= b->seq_bytes.size();
15021  ceph_assert(deferred_queue_size >= 0);
15022 
15023  osr->deferred_running = osr->deferred_pending;
15024  osr->deferred_pending = nullptr;
15025 
15026  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
15027 
15028  for (auto& txc : b->txcs) {
15029  throttle.log_state_latency(txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_deferred_queued_lat);
15030  }
15031  uint64_t start = 0, pos = 0;
15032  bufferlist bl;
15033  auto i = b->iomap.begin();
15034  while (true) {
15035  if (i == b->iomap.end() || i->first != pos) {
15036  if (bl.length()) {
15037  dout(20) << __func__ << " write 0x" << std::hex
15038  << start << "~" << bl.length()
15039  << " crc " << bl.crc32c(-1) << std::dec << dendl;
15040  if (!g_conf()->bluestore_debug_omit_block_device_write) {
15041  logger->inc(l_bluestore_submitted_deferred_writes);
15042  logger->inc(l_bluestore_submitted_deferred_write_bytes, bl.length());
15043  int r = bdev->aio_write(start, bl, &b->ioc, false);
15044  ceph_assert(r == 0);
15045  }
15046  }
15047  if (i == b->iomap.end()) {
15048  break;
15049  }
15050  start = 0;
15051  pos = i->first;
15052  bl.clear();
15053  }
15054  dout(20) << __func__ << " seq " << i->second.seq << " 0x"
15055  << std::hex << pos << "~" << i->second.bl.length() << std::dec
15056  << dendl;
15057  if (!bl.length()) {
15058  start = pos;
15059  }
15060  pos += i->second.bl.length();
15061  bl.claim_append(i->second.bl);
15062  ++i;
15063  }
15064 
15065  bdev->aio_submit(&b->ioc);
15066 }
15067 
15068 struct C_DeferredTrySubmit : public Context {
15069  BlueStore *store;
15070  C_DeferredTrySubmit(BlueStore *s) : store(s) {}
15071  void finish(int r) {
15072  store->deferred_try_submit();
15073  }
15074 };
15075 
15076 void BlueStore::_deferred_aio_finish(OpSequencer *osr)
15077 {
15078  dout(10) << __func__ << " osr " << osr << dendl;
15079  ceph_assert(osr->deferred_running);
15080  DeferredBatch *b = osr->deferred_running;
15081 
15082  {
15083  osr->deferred_lock.lock();
15084  ceph_assert(osr->deferred_running == b);
15085  osr->deferred_running = nullptr;
15086  if (!osr->deferred_pending) {
15087  dout(20) << __func__ << " dequeueing" << dendl;
15088  {
15089  deferred_lock.lock();
15090  auto q = deferred_queue.iterator_to(*osr);
15091  deferred_queue.erase(q);
15092  deferred_lock.unlock();
15093  }
15094  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
15095  } else {
15096  osr->deferred_lock.unlock();
15097  if (deferred_aggressive) {
15098  dout(20) << __func__ << " queuing async deferred_try_submit" << dendl;
15099  finisher.queue(new C_DeferredTrySubmit(this));
15100  } else {
15101  dout(20) << __func__ << " leaving queued, more pending" << dendl;
15102  }
15103  }
15104  }
15105 
15106  {
15107  uint64_t costs = 0;
15108  {
15109  for (auto& i : b->txcs) {
15110  TransContext *txc = &i;
15111  throttle.log_state_latency(*txc, logger, l_bluestore_state_deferred_aio_wait_lat);
15112  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_DEFERRED_CLEANUP);
15113  costs += txc->cost;
15114  }
15115  }
15116  throttle.release_deferred_throttle(costs);
15117  }
15118 
15119  {
15120  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
15121  deferred_done_queue.emplace_back(b);
15122 
15123  // in the normal case, do not bother waking up the kv thread; it will
15124  // catch us on the next commit anyway.
15125  if (deferred_aggressive && !kv_sync_in_progress) {
15126  kv_sync_in_progress = true;
15127  kv_cond.notify_one();
15128  }
15129  }
15130 }
15131 
15132 int BlueStore::_deferred_replay()
15133 {
15134  dout(10) << __func__ << " start" << dendl;
15135  int count = 0;
15136  int r = 0;
15137  interval_set<uint64_t> bluefs_extents;
15138  if (bluefs) {
15139  bluefs->foreach_block_extents(
15140  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev,
15141  [&] (uint64_t start, uint32_t len) {
15142  bluefs_extents.insert(start, len);
15143  }
15144  );
15145  }
15146  CollectionRef ch = _get_collection(coll_t::meta());
15147  bool fake_ch = false;
15148  if (!ch) {
15149  // hmm, replaying initial mkfs?
15150  ch = static_cast<Collection*>(create_new_collection(coll_t::meta()).get());
15151  fake_ch = true;
15152  }
15153  OpSequencer *osr = static_cast<OpSequencer*>(ch->osr.get());
15154  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_DEFERRED);
15155  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next(), ++count) {
15156  dout(20) << __func__ << " replay " << pretty_binary_string(it->key())
15157  << dendl;
15158  bluestore_deferred_transaction_t *deferred_txn =
15159  new bluestore_deferred_transaction_t;
15160  bufferlist bl = it->value();
15161  auto p = bl.cbegin();
15162  try {
15163  decode(*deferred_txn, p);
15164  } catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
15165  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode deferred txn "
15166  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
15167  delete deferred_txn;
15168  r = -EIO;
15169  goto out;
15170  }
15171  bool has_some = _eliminate_outdated_deferred(deferred_txn, bluefs_extents);
15172  if (has_some) {
15173  TransContext *txc = _txc_create(ch.get(), osr, nullptr);
15174  txc->deferred_txn = deferred_txn;
15175  txc->set_state(TransContext::STATE_KV_DONE);
15176  _txc_state_proc(txc);
15177  } else {
15178  delete deferred_txn;
15179  }
15180  }
15181  out:
15182  dout(20) << __func__ << " draining osr" << dendl;
15183  _osr_register_zombie(osr);
15184  _osr_drain_all();
15185  if (fake_ch) {
15186  new_coll_map.clear();
15187  }
15188  dout(10) << __func__ << " completed " << count << " events" << dendl;
15189  return r;
15190 }
15191 
15192 bool BlueStore::_eliminate_outdated_deferred(bluestore_deferred_transaction_t* deferred_txn,
15193  interval_set<uint64_t>& bluefs_extents)
15194 {
15195  bool has_some = false;
15196  dout(30) << __func__ << " bluefs_extents: " << std::hex << bluefs_extents << std::dec << dendl;
15197  auto it = deferred_txn->ops.begin();
15198  while (it != deferred_txn->ops.end()) {
15199  // We process a pair of _data_/_extents_ (here: it->data/it->extents)
15200  // by eliminating _extents_ that belong to bluefs, removing relevant parts of _data_
15201  // example:
15202  // +------------+---------------+---------------+---------------+
15203  // | data | aaaaaaaabbbbb | bbbbcccccdddd | ddddeeeeeefff |
15204  // | extent | 40000 - 44000 | 50000 - 58000 | 58000 - 60000 |
15205  // | in bluefs? | no | yes | no |
15206  // +------------+---------------+---------------+---------------+
15207  // result:
15208  // +------------+---------------+---------------+
15209  // | data | aaaaaaaabbbbb | ddddeeeeeefff |
15210  // | extent | 40000 - 44000 | 58000 - 60000 |
15211  // +------------+---------------+---------------+
15212  PExtentVector new_extents;
15213  ceph::buffer::list new_data;
15214  uint32_t data_offset = 0; // this tracks location of extent 'e' inside it->data
15215  dout(30) << __func__ << " input extents: " << it->extents << dendl;
15216  for (auto& e: it->extents) {
15217  interval_set<uint64_t> region;
15218  region.insert(e.offset, e.length);
15219 
15220  auto mi = bluefs_extents.lower_bound(e.offset);
15221  if (mi != bluefs_extents.begin()) {
15222  --mi;
15223  if (mi.get_end() <= e.offset) {
15224  ++mi;
15225  }
15226  }
15227  while (mi != bluefs_extents.end() && mi.get_start() < e.offset + e.length) {
15228  // The interval_set does not like (asserts) when we erase interval that does not exist.
15229  // Hence we do we implement (region-mi) by ((region+mi)-mi).
15230  region.union_insert(mi.get_start(), mi.get_len());
15231  region.erase(mi.get_start(), mi.get_len());
15232  ++mi;
15233  }
15234  // 'region' is now a subset of e, without parts used by bluefs
15235  // we trim coresponding parts from it->data (actally constructing new_data / new_extents)
15236  for (auto ki = region.begin(); ki != region.end(); ki++) {
15237  ceph::buffer::list chunk;
15238  // A chunk from it->data; data_offset is a an offset where 'e' was located;
15239  // 'ki.get_start() - e.offset' is an offset of ki inside 'e'.
15240  chunk.substr_of(it->data, data_offset + (ki.get_start() - e.offset), ki.get_len());
15241  new_data.claim_append(chunk);
15242  new_extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(ki.get_start(), ki.get_len()));
15243  }
15244  data_offset += e.length;
15245  }
15246  dout(30) << __func__ << " output extents: " << new_extents << dendl;
15247  if (it->data.length() != new_data.length()) {
15248  dout(10) << __func__ << " trimmed deferred extents: " << it->extents << "->" << new_extents << dendl;
15249  }
15250  if (new_extents.size() == 0) {
15251  it = deferred_txn->ops.erase(it);
15252  } else {
15253  has_some = true;
15254  std::swap(it->extents, new_extents);
15255  std::swap(it->data, new_data);
15256  ++it;
15257  }
15258  }
15259  return has_some;
15260 }
15261 
15262 // ---------------------------
15263 // transactions
15264 
15265 int BlueStore::queue_transactions(
15266  CollectionHandle& ch,
15267  vector<Transaction>& tls,
15268  TrackedOpRef op,
15269  ThreadPool::TPHandle *handle)
15270 {
15271  FUNCTRACE(cct);
15272  list<Context *> on_applied, on_commit, on_applied_sync;
15273  ObjectStore::Transaction::collect_contexts(
15274  tls, &on_applied, &on_commit, &on_applied_sync);
15275 
15276  auto start = mono_clock::now();
15277 
15278  Collection *c = static_cast<Collection*>(ch.get());
15279  OpSequencer *osr = c->osr.get();
15280  dout(10) << __func__ << " ch " << c << " " << c->cid << dendl;
15281 
15282  // With HM-SMR drives (and ZNS SSDs) we want the I/O allocation and I/O
15283  // submission to happen atomically because if I/O submission happens in a
15284  // different order than I/O allocation, we end up issuing non-sequential
15285  // writes to the drive. This is a temporary solution until ZONE APPEND
15286  // support matures in the kernel. For more information please see:
15287  // https://www.usenix.org/conference/vault20/presentation/bjorling
15288  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
15289  atomic_alloc_and_submit_lock.lock();
15290  }
15291 
15292  // prepare
15293  TransContext *txc = _txc_create(static_cast<Collection*>(ch.get()), osr,
15294  &on_commit, op);
15295 
15296  for (vector<Transaction>::iterator p = tls.begin(); p != tls.end(); ++p) {
15297  txc->bytes += (*p).get_num_bytes();
15298  _txc_add_transaction(txc, &(*p));
15299  }
15300  _txc_calc_cost(txc);
15301 
15302  _txc_write_nodes(txc, txc->t);
15303 
15304  // journal deferred items
15305  if (txc->deferred_txn) {
15306  txc->deferred_txn->seq = ++deferred_seq;
15307  bufferlist bl;
15308  encode(*txc->deferred_txn, bl);
15309  string key;
15310  get_deferred_key(txc->deferred_txn->seq, &key);
15311  txc->t->set(PREFIX_DEFERRED, key, bl);
15312  }
15313 
15314  _txc_finalize_kv(txc, txc->t);
15315 
15316 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
15317  if (txc->trace) {
15318  txc->trace.event("txc encode finished");
15319  }
15320 #endif
15321 
15322  if (handle)
15323  handle->suspend_tp_timeout();
15324 
15325  auto tstart = mono_clock::now();
15326 
15327  if (!throttle.try_start_transaction(
15328  *db,
15329  *txc,
15330  tstart)) {
15331  // ensure we do not block here because of deferred writes
15332  dout(10) << __func__ << " failed get throttle_deferred_bytes, aggressive"
15333  << dendl;
15334  ++deferred_aggressive;
15335  deferred_try_submit();
15336  {
15337  // wake up any previously finished deferred events
15338  std::lock_guard l(kv_lock);
15339  if (!kv_sync_in_progress) {
15340  kv_sync_in_progress = true;
15341  kv_cond.notify_one();
15342  }
15343  }
15344  throttle.finish_start_transaction(*db, *txc, tstart);
15345  --deferred_aggressive;
15346  }
15347  auto tend = mono_clock::now();
15348 
15349  if (handle)
15350  handle->reset_tp_timeout();
15351 
15352  logger->inc(l_bluestore_txc);
15353 
15354  // execute (start)
15355  _txc_state_proc(txc);
15356 
15357  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
15358  atomic_alloc_and_submit_lock.unlock();
15359  }
15360 
15361  // we're immediately readable (unlike FileStore)
15362  for (auto c : on_applied_sync) {
15363  c->complete(0);
15364  }
15365  if (!on_applied.empty()) {
15366  if (c->commit_queue) {
15367  c->commit_queue->queue(on_applied);
15368  } else {
15369  finisher.queue(on_applied);
15370  }
15371  }
15372 
15373 #ifdef WITH_BLKIN
15374  if (txc->trace) {
15375  txc->trace.event("txc applied");
15376  }
15377 #endif
15378 
15379  log_latency("submit_transact",
15380  l_bluestore_submit_lat,
15381  mono_clock::now() - start,
15382  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
15383  log_latency("throttle_transact",
15384  l_bluestore_throttle_lat,
15385  tend - tstart,
15386  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age);
15387  return 0;
15388 }
15389 
15390 void BlueStore::_txc_aio_submit(TransContext *txc)
15391 {
15392  dout(10) << __func__ << " txc " << txc << dendl;
15393  bdev->aio_submit(&txc->ioc);
15394 }
15395 
15396 void BlueStore::_txc_add_transaction(TransContext *txc, Transaction *t)
15397 {
15398  Transaction::iterator i = t->begin();
15399 
15400  _dump_transaction<30>(cct, t);
15401 
15402  vector<CollectionRef> cvec(i.colls.size());
15403  unsigned j = 0;
15404  for (vector<coll_t>::iterator p = i.colls.begin(); p != i.colls.end();
15405  ++p, ++j) {
15406  cvec[j] = _get_collection(*p);
15407  }
15408 
15409  vector<OnodeRef> ovec(i.objects.size());
15410 
15411  for (int pos = 0; i.have_op(); ++pos) {
15412  Transaction::Op *op = i.decode_op();
15413  int r = 0;
15414 
15415  // no coll or obj
15416  if (op->op == Transaction::OP_NOP)
15417  continue;
15418 
15419 
15420  // collection operations
15421  CollectionRef &c = cvec[op->cid];
15422 
15423  // initialize osd_pool_id and do a smoke test that all collections belong
15424  // to the same pool
15425  spg_t pgid;
15426  if (!!c ? c->cid.is_pg(&pgid) : false) {
15427  ceph_assert(txc->osd_pool_id == META_POOL_ID ||
15428  txc->osd_pool_id == pgid.pool());
15429  txc->osd_pool_id = pgid.pool();
15430  }
15431 
15432  switch (op->op) {
15433  case Transaction::OP_RMCOLL:
15434  {
15435  const coll_t &cid = i.get_cid(op->cid);
15436  r = _remove_collection(txc, cid, &c);
15437  if (!r)
15438  continue;
15439  }
15440  break;
15441 
15442  case Transaction::OP_MKCOLL:
15443  {
15444  ceph_assert(!c);
15445  const coll_t &cid = i.get_cid(op->cid);
15446  r = _create_collection(txc, cid, op->split_bits, &c);
15447  if (!r)
15448  continue;
15449  }
15450  break;
15451 
15452  case Transaction::OP_SPLIT_COLLECTION:
15453  ceph_abort_msg("deprecated");
15454  break;
15455 
15456  case Transaction::OP_SPLIT_COLLECTION2:
15457  {
15458  uint32_t bits = op->split_bits;
15459  uint32_t rem = op->split_rem;
15460  r = _split_collection(txc, c, cvec[op->dest_cid], bits, rem);
15461  if (!r)
15462  continue;
15463  }
15464  break;
15465 
15466  case Transaction::OP_MERGE_COLLECTION:
15467  {
15468  uint32_t bits = op->split_bits;
15469  r = _merge_collection(txc, &c, cvec[op->dest_cid], bits);
15470  if (!r)
15471  continue;
15472  }
15473  break;
15474 
15475  case Transaction::OP_COLL_HINT:
15476  {
15477  uint32_t type = op->hint;
15478  bufferlist hint;
15479  i.decode_bl(hint);
15480  auto hiter = hint.cbegin();
15481  if (type == Transaction::COLL_HINT_EXPECTED_NUM_OBJECTS) {
15482  uint32_t pg_num;
15483  uint64_t num_objs;
15484  decode(pg_num, hiter);
15485  decode(num_objs, hiter);
15486  dout(10) << __func__ << " collection hint objects is a no-op, "
15487  << " pg_num " << pg_num << " num_objects " << num_objs
15488  << dendl;
15489  } else {
15490  // Ignore the hint
15491  dout(10) << __func__ << " unknown collection hint " << type << dendl;
15492  }
15493  continue;
15494  }
15495  break;
15496 
15497  case Transaction::OP_COLL_SETATTR:
15498  r = -EOPNOTSUPP;
15499  break;
15500 
15501  case Transaction::OP_COLL_RMATTR:
15502  r = -EOPNOTSUPP;
15503  break;
15504 
15505  case Transaction::OP_COLL_RENAME:
15506  ceph_abort_msg("not implemented");
15507  break;
15508  }
15509  if (r < 0) {
15510  derr << __func__ << " error " << cpp_strerror(r)
15511  << " not handled on operation " << op->op
15512  << " (op " << pos << ", counting from 0)" << dendl;
15513  _dump_transaction<0>(cct, t);
15514  ceph_abort_msg("unexpected error");
15515  }
15516 
15517  // these operations implicity create the object
15518  bool create = false;
15519  if (op->op == Transaction::OP_TOUCH ||
15520  op->op == Transaction::OP_CREATE ||
15521  op->op == Transaction::OP_WRITE ||
15522  op->op == Transaction::OP_ZERO) {
15523  create = true;
15524  }
15525 
15526  // object operations
15527  std::unique_lock l(c->lock);
15528  OnodeRef &o = ovec[op->oid];
15529  if (!o) {
15530  ghobject_t oid = i.get_oid(op->oid);
15531  o = c->get_onode(oid, create, op->op == Transaction::OP_CREATE);
15532  }
15533  if (!create && (!o || !o->exists)) {
15534  dout(10) << __func__ << " op " << op->op << " got ENOENT on "
15535  << i.get_oid(op->oid) << dendl;
15536  r = -ENOENT;
15537  goto endop;
15538  }
15539 
15540  switch (op->op) {
15541  case Transaction::OP_CREATE:
15542  case Transaction::OP_TOUCH:
15543  r = _touch(txc, c, o);
15544  break;
15545 
15546  case Transaction::OP_WRITE:
15547  {
15548  uint64_t off = op->off;
15549  uint64_t len = op->len;
15550  uint32_t fadvise_flags = i.get_fadvise_flags();
15551  bufferlist bl;
15552  i.decode_bl(bl);
15553  r = _write(txc, c, o, off, len, bl, fadvise_flags);
15554  }
15555  break;
15556 
15557  case Transaction::OP_ZERO:
15558  {
15559  uint64_t off = op->off;
15560  uint64_t len = op->len;
15561  r = _zero(txc, c, o, off, len);
15562  }
15563  break;
15564 
15565  case Transaction::OP_TRIMCACHE:
15566  {
15567  // deprecated, no-op
15568  }
15569  break;
15570 
15571  case Transaction::OP_TRUNCATE:
15572  {
15573  uint64_t off = op->off;
15574  r = _truncate(txc, c, o, off);
15575  }
15576  break;
15577 
15578  case Transaction::OP_REMOVE:
15579  {
15580  r = _remove(txc, c, o);
15581  }
15582  break;
15583 
15584  case Transaction::OP_SETATTR:
15585  {
15586  string name = i.decode_string();
15587  bufferptr bp;
15588  i.decode_bp(bp);
15589  r = _setattr(txc, c, o, name, bp);
15590  }
15591  break;
15592 
15593  case Transaction::OP_SETATTRS:
15594  {
15595  map<string, bufferptr> aset;
15596  i.decode_attrset(aset);
15597  r = _setattrs(txc, c, o, aset);
15598  }
15599  break;
15600 
15601  case Transaction::OP_RMATTR:
15602  {
15603  string name = i.decode_string();
15604  r = _rmattr(txc, c, o, name);
15605  }
15606  break;
15607 
15608  case Transaction::OP_RMATTRS:
15609  {
15610  r = _rmattrs(txc, c, o);
15611  }
15612  break;
15613 
15614  case Transaction::OP_CLONE:
15615  {
15616  OnodeRef& no = ovec[op->dest_oid];
15617  if (!no) {
15618  const ghobject_t& noid = i.get_oid(op->dest_oid);
15619  no = c->get_onode(noid, true);
15620  }
15621  r = _clone(txc, c, o, no);
15622  }
15623  break;
15624 
15625  case Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE:
15626  ceph_abort_msg("deprecated");
15627  break;
15628 
15629  case Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE2:
15630  {
15631  OnodeRef& no = ovec[op->dest_oid];
15632  if (!no) {
15633  const ghobject_t& noid = i.get_oid(op->dest_oid);
15634  no = c->get_onode(noid, true);
15635  }
15636  uint64_t srcoff = op->off;
15637  uint64_t len = op->len;
15638  uint64_t dstoff = op->dest_off;
15639  r = _clone_range(txc, c, o, no, srcoff, len, dstoff);
15640  }
15641  break;
15642 
15643  case Transaction::OP_COLL_ADD:
15644  ceph_abort_msg("not implemented");
15645  break;
15646 
15647  case Transaction::OP_COLL_REMOVE:
15648  ceph_abort_msg("not implemented");
15649  break;
15650 
15651  case Transaction::OP_COLL_MOVE:
15652  ceph_abort_msg("deprecated");
15653  break;
15654 
15655  case Transaction::OP_COLL_MOVE_RENAME:
15656  case Transaction::OP_TRY_RENAME:
15657  {
15658  ceph_assert(op->cid == op->dest_cid);
15659  const ghobject_t& noid = i.get_oid(op->dest_oid);
15660  OnodeRef& no = ovec[op->dest_oid];
15661  if (!no) {
15662  no = c->get_onode(noid, false);
15663  }
15664  r = _rename(txc, c, o, no, noid);
15665  }
15666  break;
15667 
15668  case Transaction::OP_OMAP_CLEAR:
15669  {
15670  r = _omap_clear(txc, c, o);
15671  }
15672  break;
15673  case Transaction::OP_OMAP_SETKEYS:
15674  {
15675  bufferlist aset_bl;
15676  i.decode_attrset_bl(&aset_bl);
15677  r = _omap_setkeys(txc, c, o, aset_bl);
15678  }
15679  break;
15680  case Transaction::OP_OMAP_RMKEYS:
15681  {
15682  bufferlist keys_bl;
15683  i.decode_keyset_bl(&keys_bl);
15684  r = _omap_rmkeys(txc, c, o, keys_bl);
15685  }
15686  break;
15687  case Transaction::OP_OMAP_RMKEYRANGE:
15688  {
15689  string first, last;
15690  first = i.decode_string();
15691  last = i.decode_string();
15692  r = _omap_rmkey_range(txc, c, o, first, last);
15693  }
15694  break;
15695  case Transaction::OP_OMAP_SETHEADER:
15696  {
15697  bufferlist bl;
15698  i.decode_bl(bl);
15699  r = _omap_setheader(txc, c, o, bl);
15700  }
15701  break;
15702 
15703  case Transaction::OP_SETALLOCHINT:
15704  {
15705  r = _set_alloc_hint(txc, c, o,
15706  op->expected_object_size,
15707  op->expected_write_size,
15708  op->hint);
15709  }
15710  break;
15711 
15712  default:
15713  derr << __func__ << " bad op " << op->op << dendl;
15714  ceph_abort();
15715  }
15716 
15717  endop:
15718  if (r < 0) {
15719  bool ok = false;
15720 
15721  if (r == -ENOENT && !(op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE ||
15722  op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONE ||
15723  op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE2 ||
15724  op->op == Transaction::OP_COLL_ADD ||
15725  op->op == Transaction::OP_SETATTR ||
15726  op->op == Transaction::OP_SETATTRS ||
15727  op->op == Transaction::OP_RMATTR ||
15728  op->op == Transaction::OP_OMAP_SETKEYS ||
15729  op->op == Transaction::OP_OMAP_RMKEYS ||
15730  op->op == Transaction::OP_OMAP_RMKEYRANGE ||
15731  op->op == Transaction::OP_OMAP_SETHEADER))
15732  // -ENOENT is usually okay
15733  ok = true;
15734  if (r == -ENODATA)
15735  ok = true;
15736 
15737  if (!ok) {
15738  const char *msg = "unexpected error code";
15739 
15740  if (r == -ENOENT && (op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE ||
15741  op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONE ||
15742  op->op == Transaction::OP_CLONERANGE2))
15743  msg = "ENOENT on clone suggests osd bug";
15744 
15745  if (r == -ENOSPC)
15746  // For now, if we hit _any_ ENOSPC, crash, before we do any damage
15747  // by partially applying transactions.
15748  msg = "ENOSPC from bluestore, misconfigured cluster";
15749 
15750  if (r == -ENOTEMPTY) {
15751  msg = "ENOTEMPTY suggests garbage data in osd data dir";
15752  }
15753 
15754  derr << __func__ << " error " << cpp_strerror(r)
15755  << " not handled on operation " << op->op
15756  << " (op " << pos << ", counting from 0)"
15757  << dendl;
15758  derr << msg << dendl;
15759  _dump_transaction<0>(cct, t);
15760  ceph_abort_msg("unexpected error");
15761  }
15762  }
15763  }
15764 }
15765 
15766 
15767 
15768 // -----------------
15769 // write operations
15770 
15771 int BlueStore::_touch(TransContext *txc,
15772  CollectionRef& c,
15773  OnodeRef& o)
15774 {
15775  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
15776  int r = 0;
15777  _assign_nid(txc, o);
15778  txc->write_onode(o);
15779  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
15780  return r;
15781 }
15782 
15783 void BlueStore::_pad_zeros(
15784  bufferlist *bl, uint64_t *offset,
15785  uint64_t chunk_size)
15786 {
15787  auto length = bl->length();
15788  dout(30) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << *offset << "~" << length
15789  << " chunk_size 0x" << chunk_size << std::dec << dendl;
15790  dout(40) << "before:\n";
15791  bl->hexdump(*_dout);
15792  *_dout << dendl;
15793  // front
15794  size_t front_pad = *offset % chunk_size;
15795  size_t back_pad = 0;
15796  size_t pad_count = 0;
15797  if (front_pad) {
15798  size_t front_copy = std::min<uint64_t>(chunk_size - front_pad, length);
15799  bufferptr z = ceph::buffer::create_small_page_aligned(chunk_size);
15800  z.zero(0, front_pad, false);
15801  pad_count += front_pad;
15802  bl->begin().copy(front_copy, z.c_str() + front_pad);
15803  if (front_copy + front_pad < chunk_size) {
15804  back_pad = chunk_size - (length + front_pad);
15805  z.zero(front_pad + length, back_pad, false);
15806  pad_count += back_pad;
15807  }
15808  bufferlist old, t;
15809  old.swap(*bl);
15810  t.substr_of(old, front_copy, length - front_copy);
15811  bl->append(z);
15812  bl->claim_append(t);
15813  *offset -= front_pad;
15814  length += pad_count;
15815  }
15816 
15817  // back
15818  uint64_t end = *offset + length;
15819  unsigned back_copy = end % chunk_size;
15820  if (back_copy) {
15821  ceph_assert(back_pad == 0);
15822  back_pad = chunk_size - back_copy;
15823  ceph_assert(back_copy <= length);
15824  bufferptr tail(chunk_size);
15825  bl->begin(length - back_copy).copy(back_copy, tail.c_str());
15826  tail.zero(back_copy, back_pad, false);
15827  bufferlist old;
15828  old.swap(*bl);
15829  bl->substr_of(old, 0, length - back_copy);
15830  bl->append(tail);
15831  length += back_pad;
15832  pad_count += back_pad;
15833  }
15834  dout(20) << __func__ << " pad 0x" << std::hex << front_pad << " + 0x"
15835  << back_pad << " on front/back, now 0x" << *offset << "~"
15836  << length << std::dec << dendl;
15837  dout(40) << "after:\n";
15838  bl->hexdump(*_dout);
15839  *_dout << dendl;
15840  if (pad_count)
15841  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, pad_count);
15842  ceph_assert(bl->length() == length);
15843 }
15844 
15845 void BlueStore::_do_write_small(
15846  TransContext *txc,
15847  CollectionRef &c,
15848  OnodeRef& o,
15849  uint64_t offset, uint64_t length,
15850  bufferlist::iterator& blp,
15851  WriteContext *wctx)
15852 {
15853  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
15854  << std::dec << dendl;
15855  ceph_assert(length < min_alloc_size);
15856 
15857  uint64_t end_offs = offset + length;
15858 
15859  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small);
15860  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_bytes, length);
15861 
15862  bufferlist bl;
15863  blp.copy(length, bl);
15864 
15865  auto max_bsize = std::max(wctx->target_blob_size, min_alloc_size);
15866  auto min_off = offset >= max_bsize ? offset - max_bsize : 0;
15867  uint32_t alloc_len = min_alloc_size;
15868  auto offset0 = p2align<uint64_t>(offset, alloc_len);
15869 
15870  bool any_change;
15871 
15872  // search suitable extent in both forward and reverse direction in
15873  // [offset - target_max_blob_size, offset + target_max_blob_size] range
15874  // then check if blob can be reused via can_reuse_blob func or apply
15875  // direct/deferred write (the latter for extents including or higher
15876  // than 'offset' only).
15877  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, min_off, offset + max_bsize - min_off);
15878 
15879 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
15880  // On zoned devices, the first goal is to support non-overwrite workloads,
15881  // such as RGW, with large, aligned objects. Therefore, for user writes
15882  // _do_write_small should not trigger. OSDs, however, write and update a tiny
15883  // amount of metadata, such as OSD maps, to disk. For those cases, we
15884  // temporarily just pad them to min_alloc_size and write them to a new place
15885  // on every update.
15886  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
15887  uint64_t b_off = p2phase<uint64_t>(offset, alloc_len);
15888  uint64_t b_off0 = b_off;
15889  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx->old_extents);
15890 
15891  // Zero detection -- small block
15892  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_zero_block_detection || !bl.is_zero()) {
15893  BlobRef b = c->new_blob();
15894  _pad_zeros(&bl, &b_off0, min_alloc_size);
15895  wctx->write(offset, b, alloc_len, b_off0, bl, b_off, length, false, true);
15896  } else { // if (bl.is_zero())
15897  dout(20) << __func__ << " skip small zero block " << std::hex
15898  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
15899  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
15900  << std::dec << dendl;
15901  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped);
15902  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped_bytes, length);
15903  }
15904 
15905  return;
15906  }
15907 #endif
15908 
15909  // Look for an existing mutable blob we can use.
15910  auto begin = o->extent_map.extent_map.begin();
15911  auto end = o->extent_map.extent_map.end();
15912  auto ep = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset);
15913  if (ep != begin) {
15914  --ep;
15915  if (ep->blob_end() <= offset) {
15916  ++ep;
15917  }
15918  }
15919  auto prev_ep = end;
15920  if (ep != begin) {
15921  prev_ep = ep;
15922  --prev_ep;
15923  }
15924 
15925  boost::container::flat_set<const bluestore_blob_t*> inspected_blobs;
15926  // We don't want to have more blobs than min alloc units fit
15927  // into 2 max blobs
15928  size_t blob_threshold = max_blob_size / min_alloc_size * 2 + 1;
15929  bool above_blob_threshold = false;
15930 
15931  inspected_blobs.reserve(blob_threshold);
15932 
15933  uint64_t max_off = 0;
15934  auto start_ep = ep;
15935  auto end_ep = ep; // exclusively
15936  do {
15937  any_change = false;
15938 
15939  if (ep != end && ep->logical_offset < offset + max_bsize) {
15940  BlobRef b = ep->blob;
15941  if (!above_blob_threshold) {
15942  inspected_blobs.insert(&b->get_blob());
15943  above_blob_threshold = inspected_blobs.size() >= blob_threshold;
15944  }
15945  max_off = ep->logical_end();
15946  auto bstart = ep->blob_start();
15947 
15948  dout(20) << __func__ << " considering " << *b
15949  << " bstart 0x" << std::hex << bstart << std::dec << dendl;
15950  if (bstart >= end_offs) {
15951  dout(20) << __func__ << " ignoring distant " << *b << dendl;
15952  } else if (!b->get_blob().is_mutable()) {
15953  dout(20) << __func__ << " ignoring immutable " << *b << dendl;
15954  } else if (ep->logical_offset % min_alloc_size !=
15955  ep->blob_offset % min_alloc_size) {
15956  dout(20) << __func__ << " ignoring offset-skewed " << *b << dendl;
15957  } else {
15958  uint64_t chunk_size = b->get_blob().get_chunk_size(block_size);
15959  // can we pad our head/tail out with zeros?
15960  uint64_t head_pad, tail_pad;
15961  head_pad = p2phase(offset, chunk_size);
15962  tail_pad = p2nphase(end_offs, chunk_size);
15963  if (head_pad || tail_pad) {
15964  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset - head_pad,
15965  end_offs - offset + head_pad + tail_pad);
15966  }
15967  if (head_pad &&
15968  o->extent_map.has_any_lextents(offset - head_pad, head_pad)) {
15969  head_pad = 0;
15970  }
15971  if (tail_pad && o->extent_map.has_any_lextents(end_offs, tail_pad)) {
15972  tail_pad = 0;
15973  }
15974 
15975  uint64_t b_off = offset - head_pad - bstart;
15976  uint64_t b_len = length + head_pad + tail_pad;
15977 
15978  // direct write into unused blocks of an existing mutable blob?
15979  if ((b_off % chunk_size == 0 && b_len % chunk_size == 0) &&
15980  b->get_blob().get_ondisk_length() >= b_off + b_len &&
15981  b->get_blob().is_unused(b_off, b_len) &&
15982  b->get_blob().is_allocated(b_off, b_len)) {
15983  _apply_padding(head_pad, tail_pad, bl);
15984 
15985  dout(20) << __func__ << " write to unused 0x" << std::hex
15986  << b_off << "~" << b_len
15987  << " pad 0x" << head_pad << " + 0x" << tail_pad
15988  << std::dec << " of mutable " << *b << dendl;
15989  _buffer_cache_write(txc, b, b_off, bl,
15990  wctx->buffered ? 0 : Buffer::FLAG_NOCACHE);
15991 
15992  if (!g_conf()->bluestore_debug_omit_block_device_write) {
15993  if (b_len < prefer_deferred_size) {
15994  dout(20) << __func__ << " deferring small 0x" << std::hex
15995  << b_len << std::dec << " unused write via deferred" << dendl;
15996  bluestore_deferred_op_t *op = _get_deferred_op(txc, bl.length());
15997  op->op = bluestore_deferred_op_t::OP_WRITE;
15998  b->get_blob().map(
15999  b_off, b_len,
16000  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
16001  op->extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(offset, length));
16002  return 0;
16003  });
16004  op->data = bl;
16005  } else {
16006  b->get_blob().map_bl(
16007  b_off, bl,
16008  [&](uint64_t offset, bufferlist& t) {
16009  bdev->aio_write(offset, t,
16010  &txc->ioc, wctx->buffered);
16011  });
16012  }
16013  }
16014  b->dirty_blob().calc_csum(b_off, bl);
16015  dout(20) << __func__ << " lex old " << *ep << dendl;
16016  Extent *le = o->extent_map.set_lextent(c, offset, b_off + head_pad, length,
16017  b,
16018  &wctx->old_extents);
16019  b->dirty_blob().mark_used(le->blob_offset, le->length);
16020 
16021  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += le->length;
16022  dout(20) << __func__ << " lex " << *le << dendl;
16023  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_unused);
16024  return;
16025  }
16026  // read some data to fill out the chunk?
16027  uint64_t head_read = p2phase(b_off, chunk_size);
16028  uint64_t tail_read = p2nphase(b_off + b_len, chunk_size);
16029  if ((head_read || tail_read) &&
16030  (b->get_blob().get_ondisk_length() >= b_off + b_len + tail_read) &&
16031  head_read + tail_read < min_alloc_size) {
16032  b_off -= head_read;
16033  b_len += head_read + tail_read;
16034 
16035  } else {
16036  head_read = tail_read = 0;
16037  }
16038 
16039  // chunk-aligned deferred overwrite?
16040  if (b->get_blob().get_ondisk_length() >= b_off + b_len &&
16041  b_off % chunk_size == 0 &&
16042  b_len % chunk_size == 0 &&
16043  b->get_blob().is_allocated(b_off, b_len)) {
16044 
16045  _apply_padding(head_pad, tail_pad, bl);
16046 
16047  dout(20) << __func__ << " reading head 0x" << std::hex << head_read
16048  << " and tail 0x" << tail_read << std::dec << dendl;
16049  if (head_read) {
16050  bufferlist head_bl;
16051  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o, offset - head_pad - head_read, head_read,
16052  head_bl, 0);
16053  ceph_assert(r >= 0 && r <= (int)head_read);
16054  size_t zlen = head_read - r;
16055  if (zlen) {
16056  head_bl.append_zero(zlen);
16057  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, zlen);
16058  }
16059  head_bl.claim_append(bl);
16060  bl.swap(head_bl);
16061  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_penalty_read_ops);
16062  }
16063  if (tail_read) {
16064  bufferlist tail_bl;
16065  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o, offset + length + tail_pad, tail_read,
16066  tail_bl, 0);
16067  ceph_assert(r >= 0 && r <= (int)tail_read);
16068  size_t zlen = tail_read - r;
16069  if (zlen) {
16070  tail_bl.append_zero(zlen);
16071  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, zlen);
16072  }
16073  bl.claim_append(tail_bl);
16074  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_penalty_read_ops);
16075  }
16076  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_pre_read);
16077 
16078  _buffer_cache_write(txc, b, b_off, bl,
16079  wctx->buffered ? 0 : Buffer::FLAG_NOCACHE);
16080 
16081  b->dirty_blob().calc_csum(b_off, bl);
16082 
16083  if (!g_conf()->bluestore_debug_omit_block_device_write) {
16084  bluestore_deferred_op_t *op = _get_deferred_op(txc, bl.length());
16085  op->op = bluestore_deferred_op_t::OP_WRITE;
16086  int r = b->get_blob().map(
16087  b_off, b_len,
16088  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
16089  op->extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(offset, length));
16090  return 0;
16091  });
16092  ceph_assert(r == 0);
16093  op->data = std::move(bl);
16094  dout(20) << __func__ << " deferred write 0x" << std::hex << b_off << "~"
16095  << b_len << std::dec << " of mutable " << *b
16096  << " at " << op->extents << dendl;
16097  }
16098 
16099  Extent *le = o->extent_map.set_lextent(c, offset, offset - bstart, length,
16100  b, &wctx->old_extents);
16101  b->dirty_blob().mark_used(le->blob_offset, le->length);
16102  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += le->length;
16103  dout(20) << __func__ << " lex " << *le << dendl;
16104  return;
16105  }
16106  // try to reuse blob if we can
16107  if (b->can_reuse_blob(min_alloc_size,
16108  max_bsize,
16109  offset0 - bstart,
16110  &alloc_len)) {
16111  ceph_assert(alloc_len == min_alloc_size); // expecting data always
16112  // fit into reused blob
16113  // Need to check for pending writes desiring to
16114  // reuse the same pextent. The rationale is that during GC two chunks
16115  // from garbage blobs(compressed?) can share logical space within the same
16116  // AU. That's in turn might be caused by unaligned len in clone_range2.
16117  // Hence the second write will fail in an attempt to reuse blob at
16118  // do_alloc_write().
16119  if (!wctx->has_conflict(b,
16120  offset0,
16121  offset0 + alloc_len,
16122  min_alloc_size)) {
16123 
16124  // we can't reuse pad_head/pad_tail since they might be truncated
16125  // due to existent extents
16126  uint64_t b_off = offset - bstart;
16127  uint64_t b_off0 = b_off;
16128  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx->old_extents);
16129 
16130  // Zero detection -- small block
16131  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_zero_block_detection || !bl.is_zero()) {
16132  _pad_zeros(&bl, &b_off0, chunk_size);
16133 
16134  dout(20) << __func__ << " reuse blob " << *b << std::hex
16135  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
16136  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
16137  << std::dec << dendl;
16138 
16139  wctx->write(offset, b, alloc_len, b_off0, bl, b_off, length,
16140  false, false);
16141  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_unused);
16142  } else { // if (bl.is_zero())
16143  dout(20) << __func__ << " skip small zero block " << std::hex
16144  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
16145  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
16146  << std::dec << dendl;
16147  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped);
16148  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped_bytes, length);
16149  }
16150 
16151  return;
16152  }
16153  }
16154  }
16155  ++ep;
16156  end_ep = ep;
16157  any_change = true;
16158  } // if (ep != end && ep->logical_offset < offset + max_bsize)
16159 
16160  // check extent for reuse in reverse order
16161  if (prev_ep != end && prev_ep->logical_offset >= min_off) {
16162  BlobRef b = prev_ep->blob;
16163  if (!above_blob_threshold) {
16164  inspected_blobs.insert(&b->get_blob());
16165  above_blob_threshold = inspected_blobs.size() >= blob_threshold;
16166  }
16167  start_ep = prev_ep;
16168  auto bstart = prev_ep->blob_start();
16169  dout(20) << __func__ << " considering " << *b
16170  << " bstart 0x" << std::hex << bstart << std::dec << dendl;
16171  if (b->can_reuse_blob(min_alloc_size,
16172  max_bsize,
16173  offset0 - bstart,
16174  &alloc_len)) {
16175  ceph_assert(alloc_len == min_alloc_size); // expecting data always
16176  // fit into reused blob
16177  // Need to check for pending writes desiring to
16178  // reuse the same pextent. The rationale is that during GC two chunks
16179  // from garbage blobs(compressed?) can share logical space within the same
16180  // AU. That's in turn might be caused by unaligned len in clone_range2.
16181  // Hence the second write will fail in an attempt to reuse blob at
16182  // do_alloc_write().
16183  if (!wctx->has_conflict(b,
16184  offset0,
16185  offset0 + alloc_len,
16186  min_alloc_size)) {
16187 
16188  uint64_t b_off = offset - bstart;
16189  uint64_t b_off0 = b_off;
16190  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx->old_extents);
16191 
16192  // Zero detection -- small block
16193  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_zero_block_detection || !bl.is_zero()) {
16194  uint64_t chunk_size = b->get_blob().get_chunk_size(block_size);
16195  _pad_zeros(&bl, &b_off0, chunk_size);
16196 
16197  dout(20) << __func__ << " reuse blob " << *b << std::hex
16198  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
16199  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
16200  << std::dec << dendl;
16201 
16202  wctx->write(offset, b, alloc_len, b_off0, bl, b_off, length,
16203  false, false);
16204  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_unused);
16205  } else { // if (bl.is_zero())
16206  dout(20) << __func__ << " skip small zero block " << std::hex
16207  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
16208  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
16209  << std::dec << dendl;
16210  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped);
16211  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped_bytes, length);
16212  }
16213 
16214  return;
16215  }
16216  }
16217  if (prev_ep != begin) {
16218  --prev_ep;
16219  any_change = true;
16220  } else {
16221  prev_ep = end; // to avoid useless first extent re-check
16222  }
16223  } // if (prev_ep != end && prev_ep->logical_offset >= min_off)
16224  } while (any_change);
16225 
16226  if (above_blob_threshold) {
16227  dout(10) << __func__ << " request GC, blobs >= " << inspected_blobs.size()
16228  << " " << std::hex << min_off << "~" << max_off << std::dec
16229  << dendl;
16230  ceph_assert(start_ep != end_ep);
16231  for (auto ep = start_ep; ep != end_ep; ++ep) {
16232  dout(20) << __func__ << " inserting for GC "
16233  << std::hex << ep->logical_offset << "~" << ep->length
16234  << std::dec << dendl;
16235 
16236  wctx->extents_to_gc.union_insert(ep->logical_offset, ep->length);
16237  }
16238  // insert newly written extent to GC
16239  wctx->extents_to_gc.union_insert(offset, length);
16240  dout(20) << __func__ << " inserting (last) for GC "
16241  << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
16242  << std::dec << dendl;
16243  }
16244  uint64_t b_off = p2phase<uint64_t>(offset, alloc_len);
16245  uint64_t b_off0 = b_off;
16246  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx->old_extents);
16247 
16248  // Zero detection -- small block
16249  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_zero_block_detection || !bl.is_zero()) {
16250  // new blob.
16251  BlobRef b = c->new_blob();
16252  _pad_zeros(&bl, &b_off0, block_size);
16253  wctx->write(offset, b, alloc_len, b_off0, bl, b_off, length,
16254  min_alloc_size != block_size, // use 'unused' bitmap when alloc granularity
16255  // doesn't match disk one only
16256  true);
16257  } else { // if (bl.is_zero())
16258  dout(20) << __func__ << " skip small zero block " << std::hex
16259  << " (0x" << b_off0 << "~" << bl.length() << ")"
16260  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << length << ")"
16261  << std::dec << dendl;
16262  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped);
16263  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_small_skipped_bytes, length);
16264  }
16265 
16266  return;
16267 }
16268 
16269 bool BlueStore::BigDeferredWriteContext::can_defer(
16270  BlueStore::extent_map_t::iterator ep,
16271  uint64_t prefer_deferred_size,
16272  uint64_t block_size,
16273  uint64_t offset,
16274  uint64_t l)
16275 {
16276  bool res = false;
16277  auto& blob = ep->blob->get_blob();
16278  if (offset >= ep->blob_start() &&
16279  blob.is_mutable()) {
16280  off = offset;
16281  b_off = offset - ep->blob_start();
16282  uint64_t chunk_size = blob.get_chunk_size(block_size);
16283  uint64_t ondisk = blob.get_ondisk_length();
16284  used = std::min(l, ondisk - b_off);
16285 
16286  // will read some data to fill out the chunk?
16287  head_read = p2phase<uint64_t>(b_off, chunk_size);
16288  tail_read = p2nphase<uint64_t>(b_off + used, chunk_size);
16289  b_off -= head_read;
16290 
16291  ceph_assert(b_off % chunk_size == 0);
16292  ceph_assert(blob_aligned_len() % chunk_size == 0);
16293 
16294  res = blob_aligned_len() < prefer_deferred_size &&
16295  blob_aligned_len() <= ondisk &&
16296  blob.is_allocated(b_off, blob_aligned_len());
16297  if (res) {
16298  blob_ref = ep->blob;
16299  blob_start = ep->blob_start();
16300  }
16301  }
16302  return res;
16303 }
16304 
16305 bool BlueStore::BigDeferredWriteContext::apply_defer()
16306 {
16307  int r = blob_ref->get_blob().map(
16308  b_off, blob_aligned_len(),
16309  [&](const bluestore_pextent_t& pext,
16310  uint64_t offset,
16311  uint64_t length) {
16312  // apply deferred if overwrite breaks blob continuity only.
16313  // if it totally overlaps some pextent - fallback to regular write
16314  if (pext.offset < offset ||
16315  pext.end() > offset + length) {
16316  res_extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(offset, length));
16317  return 0;
16318  }
16319  return -1;
16320  });
16321  return r >= 0;
16322 }
16323 
16324 void BlueStore::_do_write_big_apply_deferred(
16325  TransContext* txc,
16326  CollectionRef& c,
16327  OnodeRef& o,
16328  BlueStore::BigDeferredWriteContext& dctx,
16329  bufferlist::iterator& blp,
16330  WriteContext* wctx)
16331 {
16332  bufferlist bl;
16333  dout(20) << __func__ << " reading head 0x" << std::hex << dctx.head_read
16334  << " and tail 0x" << dctx.tail_read << std::dec << dendl;
16335  if (dctx.head_read) {
16336  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o,
16337  dctx.off - dctx.head_read,
16338  dctx.head_read,
16339  bl,
16340  0);
16341  ceph_assert(r >= 0 && r <= (int)dctx.head_read);
16342  size_t zlen = dctx.head_read - r;
16343  if (zlen) {
16344  bl.append_zero(zlen);
16345  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, zlen);
16346  }
16347  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_penalty_read_ops);
16348  }
16349  blp.copy(dctx.used, bl);
16350 
16351  if (dctx.tail_read) {
16352  bufferlist tail_bl;
16353  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o,
16354  dctx.off + dctx.used, dctx.tail_read,
16355  tail_bl, 0);
16356  ceph_assert(r >= 0 && r <= (int)dctx.tail_read);
16357  size_t zlen = dctx.tail_read - r;
16358  if (zlen) {
16359  tail_bl.append_zero(zlen);
16360  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, zlen);
16361  }
16362  bl.claim_append(tail_bl);
16363  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_penalty_read_ops);
16364  }
16365  auto& b0 = dctx.blob_ref;
16366  _buffer_cache_write(txc, b0, dctx.b_off, bl,
16367  wctx->buffered ? 0 : Buffer::FLAG_NOCACHE);
16368 
16369  b0->dirty_blob().calc_csum(dctx.b_off, bl);
16370 
16371  Extent* le = o->extent_map.set_lextent(c, dctx.off,
16372  dctx.off - dctx.blob_start, dctx.used, b0, &wctx->old_extents);
16373 
16374  // in fact this is a no-op for big writes but left here to maintain
16375  // uniformity and avoid missing after some refactor.
16376  b0->dirty_blob().mark_used(le->blob_offset, le->length);
16377  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += le->length;
16378 
16379  if (!g_conf()->bluestore_debug_omit_block_device_write) {
16380  bluestore_deferred_op_t* op = _get_deferred_op(txc, bl.length());
16381  op->op = bluestore_deferred_op_t::OP_WRITE;
16382  op->extents.swap(dctx.res_extents);
16383  op->data = std::move(bl);
16384  }
16385 }
16386 
16387 void BlueStore::_do_write_big(
16388  TransContext *txc,
16389  CollectionRef &c,
16390  OnodeRef& o,
16391  uint64_t offset, uint64_t length,
16392  bufferlist::iterator& blp,
16393  WriteContext *wctx)
16394 {
16395  dout(10) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
16396  << " target_blob_size 0x" << wctx->target_blob_size << std::dec
16397  << " compress " << (int)wctx->compress
16398  << dendl;
16399  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big);
16400  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_bytes, length);
16401  auto max_bsize = std::max(wctx->target_blob_size, min_alloc_size);
16402  uint64_t prefer_deferred_size_snapshot = prefer_deferred_size.load();
16403  while (length > 0) {
16404  bool new_blob = false;
16405  BlobRef b;
16406  uint32_t b_off = 0;
16407  uint32_t l = 0;
16408 
16409  //attempting to reuse existing blob
16410  if (!wctx->compress) {
16411  // enforce target blob alignment with max_bsize
16412  l = max_bsize - p2phase(offset, max_bsize);
16413  l = std::min(uint64_t(l), length);
16414 
16415  auto end = o->extent_map.extent_map.end();
16416 
16417  dout(20) << __func__ << " may be defer: 0x" << std::hex
16418  << offset << "~" << l
16419  << std::dec << dendl;
16420 
16421  if (prefer_deferred_size_snapshot &&
16422  l <= prefer_deferred_size_snapshot * 2) {
16423  // Single write that spans two adjusted existing blobs can result
16424  // in up to two deferred blocks of 'prefer_deferred_size'
16425  // So we're trying to minimize the amount of resulting blobs
16426  // and preserve 2 blobs rather than inserting one more in between
16427  // E.g. write 0x10000~20000 over existing blobs
16428  // (0x0~20000 and 0x20000~20000) is better (from subsequent reading
16429  // performance point of view) to result in two deferred writes to
16430  // existing blobs than having 3 blobs: 0x0~10000, 0x10000~20000, 0x30000~10000
16431 
16432  // look for an existing mutable blob we can write into
16433  auto ep = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset);
16434  auto ep_next = end;
16435  BigDeferredWriteContext head_info, tail_info;
16436 
16437  bool will_defer = ep != end ?
16438  head_info.can_defer(ep,
16439  prefer_deferred_size_snapshot,
16440  block_size,
16441  offset,
16442  l) :
16443  false;
16444  auto offset_next = offset + head_info.used;
16445  auto remaining = l - head_info.used;
16446  if (will_defer && remaining) {
16447  will_defer = false;
16448  if (remaining <= prefer_deferred_size_snapshot) {
16449  ep_next = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset_next);
16450  // check if we can defer remaining totally
16451  will_defer = ep_next == end ?
16452  false :
16453  tail_info.can_defer(ep_next,
16454  prefer_deferred_size_snapshot,
16455  block_size,
16456  offset_next,
16457  remaining);
16458  will_defer = will_defer && remaining == tail_info.used;
16459  }
16460  }
16461  if (will_defer) {
16462  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << *(head_info.blob_ref)
16463  << " deferring big " << std::hex
16464  << " (0x" << head_info.b_off << "~" << head_info.blob_aligned_len() << ")"
16465  << std::dec << " write via deferred"
16466  << dendl;
16467  if (remaining) {
16468  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << *(tail_info.blob_ref)
16469  << " deferring big " << std::hex
16470  << " (0x" << tail_info.b_off << "~" << tail_info.blob_aligned_len() << ")"
16471  << std::dec << " write via deferred"
16472  << dendl;
16473  }
16474 
16475  will_defer = head_info.apply_defer();
16476  if (!will_defer) {
16477  dout(20) << __func__
16478  << " deferring big fell back, head isn't continuous"
16479  << dendl;
16480  } else if (remaining) {
16481  will_defer = tail_info.apply_defer();
16482  if (!will_defer) {
16483  dout(20) << __func__
16484  << " deferring big fell back, tail isn't continuous"
16485  << dendl;
16486  }
16487  }
16488  }
16489  if (will_defer) {
16490  _do_write_big_apply_deferred(txc, c, o, head_info, blp, wctx);
16491  if (remaining) {
16492  _do_write_big_apply_deferred(txc, c, o, tail_info,
16493  blp, wctx);
16494  }
16495  dout(20) << __func__ << " defer big: 0x" << std::hex
16496  << offset << "~" << l
16497  << std::dec << dendl;
16498  offset += l;
16499  length -= l;
16500  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_blobs, remaining ? 2 : 1);
16501  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_deferred, remaining ? 2 : 1);
16502  continue;
16503  }
16504  }
16505  dout(20) << __func__ << " lookup for blocks to reuse..." << dendl;
16506 
16507  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, l, &wctx->old_extents);
16508 
16509  // seek again as punch_hole could invalidate ep
16510  auto ep = o->extent_map.seek_lextent(offset);
16511  auto begin = o->extent_map.extent_map.begin();
16512  auto prev_ep = end;
16513  if (ep != begin) {
16514  prev_ep = ep;
16515  --prev_ep;
16516  }
16517 
16518  auto min_off = offset >= max_bsize ? offset - max_bsize : 0;
16519  // search suitable extent in both forward and reverse direction in
16520  // [offset - target_max_blob_size, offset + target_max_blob_size] range
16521  // then check if blob can be reused via can_reuse_blob func.
16522  bool any_change;
16523  do {
16524  any_change = false;
16525  if (ep != end && ep->logical_offset < offset + max_bsize) {
16526  dout(20) << __func__ << " considering " << *ep
16527  << " bstart 0x" << std::hex << ep->blob_start() << std::dec << dendl;
16528 
16529  if (offset >= ep->blob_start() &&
16530  ep->blob->can_reuse_blob(min_alloc_size, max_bsize,
16531  offset - ep->blob_start(),
16532  &l)) {
16533  b = ep->blob;
16534  b_off = offset - ep->blob_start();
16535  prev_ep = end; // to avoid check below
16536  dout(20) << __func__ << " reuse blob " << *b << std::hex
16537  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << l << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
16538  } else {
16539  ++ep;
16540  any_change = true;
16541  }
16542  }
16543 
16544  if (prev_ep != end && prev_ep->logical_offset >= min_off) {
16545  dout(20) << __func__ << " considering rev " << *prev_ep
16546  << " bstart 0x" << std::hex << prev_ep->blob_start() << std::dec << dendl;
16547  if (prev_ep->blob->can_reuse_blob(min_alloc_size, max_bsize,
16548  offset - prev_ep->blob_start(),
16549  &l)) {
16550  b = prev_ep->blob;
16551  b_off = offset - prev_ep->blob_start();
16552  dout(20) << __func__ << " reuse blob " << *b << std::hex
16553  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << l << ")" << std::dec << dendl;
16554  } else if (prev_ep != begin) {
16555  --prev_ep;
16556  any_change = true;
16557  } else {
16558  prev_ep = end; // to avoid useless first extent re-check
16559  }
16560  }
16561  } while (b == nullptr && any_change);
16562  } else {
16563  // trying to utilize as longer chunk as permitted in case of compression.
16564  l = std::min(max_bsize, length);
16565  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, l, &wctx->old_extents);
16566  } // if (!wctx->compress)
16567 
16568  if (b == nullptr) {
16569  b = c->new_blob();
16570  b_off = 0;
16571  new_blob = true;
16572  }
16573  bufferlist t;
16574  blp.copy(l, t);
16575 
16576  // Zero detection -- big block
16577  if (!cct->_conf->bluestore_zero_block_detection || !t.is_zero()) {
16578  wctx->write(offset, b, l, b_off, t, b_off, l, false, new_blob);
16579 
16580  dout(20) << __func__ << " schedule write big: 0x"
16581  << std::hex << offset << "~" << l << std::dec
16582  << (new_blob ? " new " : " reuse ")
16583  << *b << dendl;
16584 
16585  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_blobs);
16586  } else { // if (!t.is_zero())
16587  dout(20) << __func__ << " skip big zero block " << std::hex
16588  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << t.length() << ")"
16589  << " (0x" << b_off << "~" << l << ")"
16590  << std::dec << dendl;
16591  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_skipped_blobs);
16592  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_big_skipped_bytes, l);
16593  }
16594 
16595  offset += l;
16596  length -= l;
16597  }
16598 }
16599 
16600 int BlueStore::_do_alloc_write(
16601  TransContext *txc,
16602  CollectionRef coll,
16603  OnodeRef& o,
16604  WriteContext *wctx)
16605 {
16606  dout(20) << __func__ << " txc " << txc
16607  << " " << wctx->writes.size() << " blobs"
16608  << dendl;
16609  if (wctx->writes.empty()) {
16610  return 0;
16611  }
16612 
16613  CompressorRef c;
16614  double crr = 0;
16615  if (wctx->compress) {
16616  c = select_option(
16617  "compression_algorithm",
16618  compressor,
16619  [&]() {
16620  string val;
16621  if (coll->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::COMPRESSION_ALGORITHM, &val)) {
16622  CompressorRef cp = compressor;
16623  if (!cp || cp->get_type_name() != val) {
16624  cp = Compressor::create(cct, val);
16625  if (!cp) {
16626  if (_set_compression_alert(false, val.c_str())) {
16627  derr << __func__ << " unable to initialize " << val.c_str()
16628  << " compressor" << dendl;
16629  }
16630  }
16631  }
16632  return std::optional<CompressorRef>(cp);
16633  }
16634  return std::optional<CompressorRef>();
16635  }
16636  );
16637 
16638  crr = select_option(
16639  "compression_required_ratio",
16640  cct->_conf->bluestore_compression_required_ratio,
16641  [&]() {
16642  double val;
16643  if (coll->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::COMPRESSION_REQUIRED_RATIO, &val)) {
16644  return std::optional<double>(val);
16645  }
16646  return std::optional<double>();
16647  }
16648  );
16649  }
16650 
16651  // checksum
16652  int64_t csum = csum_type.load();
16653  csum = select_option(
16654  "csum_type",
16655  csum,
16656  [&]() {
16657  int64_t val;
16658  if (coll->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::CSUM_TYPE, &val)) {
16659  return std::optional<int64_t>(val);
16660  }
16661  return std::optional<int64_t>();
16662  }
16663  );
16664 
16665  // compress (as needed) and calc needed space
16666  uint64_t need = 0;
16667  uint64_t data_size = 0;
16668  // 'need' is amount of space that must be provided by allocator.
16669  // 'data_size' is a size of data that will be transferred to disk.
16670  // Note that data_size is always <= need. This comes from:
16671  // - write to blob was unaligned, and there is free space
16672  // - data has been compressed
16673  //
16674  // We make one decision and apply it to all blobs.
16675  // All blobs will be deferred or none will.
16676  // We assume that allocator does its best to provide contiguous space,
16677  // and the condition is : (data_size < deferred).
16678 
16679  auto max_bsize = std::max(wctx->target_blob_size, min_alloc_size);
16680  for (auto& wi : wctx->writes) {
16681  if (c && wi.blob_length > min_alloc_size) {
16682  auto start = mono_clock::now();
16683 
16684  // compress
16685  ceph_assert(wi.b_off == 0);
16686  ceph_assert(wi.blob_length == wi.bl.length());
16687 
16688  // FIXME: memory alignment here is bad
16689  bufferlist t;
16690  std::optional<int32_t> compressor_message;
16691  int r = c->compress(wi.bl, t, compressor_message);
16692  uint64_t want_len_raw = wi.blob_length * crr;
16693  uint64_t want_len = p2roundup(want_len_raw, min_alloc_size);
16694  bool rejected = false;
16695  uint64_t compressed_len = t.length();
16696  // do an approximate (fast) estimation for resulting blob size
16697  // that doesn't take header overhead into account
16698  uint64_t result_len = p2roundup(compressed_len, min_alloc_size);
16699  if (r == 0 && result_len <= want_len && result_len < wi.blob_length) {
16700  bluestore_compression_header_t chdr;
16701  chdr.type = c->get_type();
16702  chdr.length = t.length();
16703  chdr.compressor_message = compressor_message;
16704  encode(chdr, wi.compressed_bl);
16705  wi.compressed_bl.claim_append(t);
16706 
16707  compressed_len = wi.compressed_bl.length();
16708  result_len = p2roundup(compressed_len, min_alloc_size);
16709  if (result_len <= want_len && result_len < wi.blob_length) {
16710  // Cool. We compressed at least as much as we were hoping to.
16711  // pad out to min_alloc_size
16712  wi.compressed_bl.append_zero(result_len - compressed_len);
16713  wi.compressed_len = compressed_len;
16714  wi.compressed = true;
16715  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, result_len - compressed_len);
16716  dout(20) << __func__ << std::hex << " compressed 0x" << wi.blob_length
16717  << " -> 0x" << compressed_len << " => 0x" << result_len
16718  << " with " << c->get_type()
16719  << std::dec << dendl;
16720  txc->statfs_delta.compressed() += compressed_len;
16721  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_original() += wi.blob_length;
16722  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_allocated() += result_len;
16723  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compress_success_count);
16724  need += result_len;
16725  data_size += result_len;
16726  } else {
16727  rejected = true;
16728  }
16729  } else if (r != 0) {
16730  dout(5) << __func__ << std::hex << " 0x" << wi.blob_length
16731  << " bytes compressed using " << c->get_type_name()
16732  << std::dec
16733  << " failed with errcode = " << r
16734  << ", leaving uncompressed"
16735  << dendl;
16736  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compress_rejected_count);
16737  need += wi.blob_length;
16738  data_size += wi.bl.length();
16739  } else {
16740  rejected = true;
16741  }
16742 
16743  if (rejected) {
16744  dout(20) << __func__ << std::hex << " 0x" << wi.blob_length
16745  << " compressed to 0x" << compressed_len << " -> 0x" << result_len
16746  << " with " << c->get_type()
16747  << ", which is more than required 0x" << want_len_raw
16748  << " -> 0x" << want_len
16749  << ", leaving uncompressed"
16750  << std::dec << dendl;
16751  logger->inc(l_bluestore_compress_rejected_count);
16752  need += wi.blob_length;
16753  data_size += wi.bl.length();
16754  }
16755  log_latency("compress@_do_alloc_write",
16756  l_bluestore_compress_lat,
16757  mono_clock::now() - start,
16758  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age );
16759  } else {
16760  need += wi.blob_length;
16761  data_size += wi.bl.length();
16762  }
16763  }
16764  PExtentVector prealloc;
16765  prealloc.reserve(2 * wctx->writes.size());
16766  int64_t prealloc_left = 0;
16767  prealloc_left = alloc->allocate(
16768  need, min_alloc_size, need,
16769  0, &prealloc);
16770  if (prealloc_left < 0 || prealloc_left < (int64_t)need) {
16771  derr << __func__ << " failed to allocate 0x" << std::hex << need
16772  << " allocated 0x " << (prealloc_left < 0 ? 0 : prealloc_left)
16773  << " min_alloc_size 0x" << min_alloc_size
16774  << " available 0x " << alloc->get_free()
16775  << std::dec << dendl;
16776  if (prealloc.size()) {
16777  alloc->release(prealloc);
16778  }
16779  return -ENOSPC;
16780  }
16781  _collect_allocation_stats(need, min_alloc_size, prealloc);
16782 
16783  dout(20) << __func__ << std::hex << " need=0x" << need << " data=0x" << data_size
16784  << " prealloc " << prealloc << dendl;
16785  auto prealloc_pos = prealloc.begin();
16786  ceph_assert(prealloc_pos != prealloc.end());
16787 
16788  for (auto& wi : wctx->writes) {
16789  bluestore_blob_t& dblob = wi.b->dirty_blob();
16790  uint64_t b_off = wi.b_off;
16791  bufferlist *l = &wi.bl;
16792  uint64_t final_length = wi.blob_length;
16793  uint64_t csum_length = wi.blob_length;
16794  if (wi.compressed) {
16795  final_length = wi.compressed_bl.length();
16796  csum_length = final_length;
16797  unsigned csum_order = std::countr_zero(csum_length);
16798  l = &wi.compressed_bl;
16799  dblob.set_compressed(wi.blob_length, wi.compressed_len);
16800  if (csum != Checksummer::CSUM_NONE) {
16801  dout(20) << __func__
16802  << " initialize csum setting for compressed blob " << *wi.b
16803  << " csum_type " << Checksummer::get_csum_type_string(csum)
16804  << " csum_order " << csum_order
16805  << " csum_length 0x" << std::hex << csum_length
16806  << " blob_length 0x" << wi.blob_length
16807  << " compressed_length 0x" << wi.compressed_len << std::dec
16808  << dendl;
16809  dblob.init_csum(csum, csum_order, csum_length);
16810  }
16811  } else if (wi.new_blob) {
16812  unsigned csum_order;
16813  // initialize newly created blob only
16814  ceph_assert(dblob.is_mutable());
16815  if (l->length() != wi.blob_length) {
16816  // hrm, maybe we could do better here, but let's not bother.
16817  dout(20) << __func__ << " forcing csum_order to block_size_order "
16818  << block_size_order << dendl;
16819  csum_order = block_size_order;
16820  } else {
16821  csum_order = std::min<unsigned>(wctx->csum_order, std::countr_zero(l->length()));
16822  }
16823  // try to align blob with max_blob_size to improve
16824  // its reuse ratio, e.g. in case of reverse write
16825  uint32_t suggested_boff =
16826  (wi.logical_offset - (wi.b_off0 - wi.b_off)) % max_bsize;
16827  if ((suggested_boff % (1 << csum_order)) == 0 &&
16828  suggested_boff + final_length <= max_bsize &&
16829  suggested_boff > b_off) {
16830  dout(20) << __func__ << " forcing blob_offset to 0x"
16831  << std::hex << suggested_boff << std::dec << dendl;
16832  ceph_assert(suggested_boff >= b_off);
16833  csum_length += suggested_boff - b_off;
16834  b_off = suggested_boff;
16835  }
16836  if (csum != Checksummer::CSUM_NONE) {
16837  dout(20) << __func__
16838  << " initialize csum setting for new blob " << *wi.b
16839  << " csum_type " << Checksummer::get_csum_type_string(csum)
16840  << " csum_order " << csum_order
16841  << " csum_length 0x" << std::hex << csum_length << std::dec
16842  << dendl;
16843  dblob.init_csum(csum, csum_order, csum_length);
16844  }
16845  }
16846 
16847  PExtentVector extents;
16848  int64_t left = final_length;
16849  auto prefer_deferred_size_snapshot = prefer_deferred_size.load();
16850  while (left > 0) {
16851  ceph_assert(prealloc_left > 0);
16852  if (prealloc_pos->length <= left) {
16853  prealloc_left -= prealloc_pos->length;
16854  left -= prealloc_pos->length;
16855  txc->statfs_delta.allocated() += prealloc_pos->length;
16856  extents.push_back(*prealloc_pos);
16857  ++prealloc_pos;
16858  } else {
16859  extents.emplace_back(prealloc_pos->offset, left);
16860  prealloc_pos->offset += left;
16861  prealloc_pos->length -= left;
16862  prealloc_left -= left;
16863  txc->statfs_delta.allocated() += left;
16864  left = 0;
16865  break;
16866  }
16867  }
16868  for (auto& p : extents) {
16869  txc->allocated.insert(p.offset, p.length);
16870  }
16871  dblob.allocated(p2align(b_off, min_alloc_size), final_length, extents);
16872 
16873  dout(20) << __func__ << " blob " << *wi.b << dendl;
16874  if (dblob.has_csum()) {
16875  dblob.calc_csum(b_off, *l);
16876  }
16877 
16878  if (wi.mark_unused) {
16879  ceph_assert(!dblob.is_compressed());
16880  auto b_end = b_off + wi.bl.length();
16881  if (b_off) {
16882  dblob.add_unused(0, b_off);
16883  }
16884  uint64_t llen = dblob.get_logical_length();
16885  if (b_end < llen) {
16886  dblob.add_unused(b_end, llen - b_end);
16887  }
16888  }
16889 
16890  Extent *le = o->extent_map.set_lextent(coll, wi.logical_offset,
16891  b_off + (wi.b_off0 - wi.b_off),
16892  wi.length0,
16893  wi.b,
16894  nullptr);
16895  wi.b->dirty_blob().mark_used(le->blob_offset, le->length);
16896  txc->statfs_delta.stored() += le->length;
16897  dout(20) << __func__ << " lex " << *le << dendl;
16898  _buffer_cache_write(txc, wi.b, b_off, wi.bl,
16899  wctx->buffered ? 0 : Buffer::FLAG_NOCACHE);
16900 
16901  // queue io
16902  if (!g_conf()->bluestore_debug_omit_block_device_write) {
16903  if (data_size < prefer_deferred_size_snapshot) {
16904  dout(20) << __func__ << " deferring 0x" << std::hex
16905  << l->length() << std::dec << " write via deferred" << dendl;
16906  bluestore_deferred_op_t *op = _get_deferred_op(txc, l->length());
16907  op->op = bluestore_deferred_op_t::OP_WRITE;
16908  int r = wi.b->get_blob().map(
16909  b_off, l->length(),
16910  [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
16911  op->extents.emplace_back(bluestore_pextent_t(offset, length));
16912  return 0;
16913  });
16914  ceph_assert(r == 0);
16915  op->data = *l;
16916  } else {
16917  wi.b->get_blob().map_bl(
16918  b_off, *l,
16919  [&](uint64_t offset, bufferlist& t) {
16920  bdev->aio_write(offset, t, &txc->ioc, false);
16921  });
16922  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_new);
16923  }
16924  }
16925  }
16926  ceph_assert(prealloc_pos == prealloc.end());
16927  ceph_assert(prealloc_left == 0);
16928  return 0;
16929 }
16930 
16931 void BlueStore::_wctx_finish(
16932  TransContext *txc,
16933  CollectionRef& c,
16934  OnodeRef& o,
16935  WriteContext *wctx,
16936  set<SharedBlob*> *maybe_unshared_blobs)
16937 {
16938 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
16939  bool is_smr = bdev && bdev->is_smr();
16940  if (is_smr) {
16941  for (auto& w : wctx->writes) {
16942  for (auto& e : w.b->get_blob().get_extents()) {
16943  if (!e.is_valid()) {
16944  continue;
16945  }
16946  uint32_t zone = e.offset / zone_size;
16947  if (!o->onode.zone_offset_refs.count(zone)) {
16948  uint64_t zoff = e.offset % zone_size;
16949  dout(20) << __func__ << " add ref zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
16950  << " offset 0x" << zoff << std::dec << dendl;
16951  txc->note_write_zone_offset(o, zone, zoff);
16952  }
16953  }
16954  }
16955  }
16956  set<uint32_t> zones_with_releases;
16957 #endif
16958 
16959  auto oep = wctx->old_extents.begin();
16960  while (oep != wctx->old_extents.end()) {
16961  auto &lo = *oep;
16962  oep = wctx->old_extents.erase(oep);
16963  dout(20) << __func__ << " lex_old " << lo.e << dendl;
16964  BlobRef b = lo.e.blob;
16965  const bluestore_blob_t& blob = b->get_blob();
16966  if (blob.is_compressed()) {
16967  if (lo.blob_empty) {
16968  txc->statfs_delta.compressed() -= blob.get_compressed_payload_length();
16969  }
16970  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_original() -= lo.e.length;
16971  }
16972  auto& r = lo.r;
16973  txc->statfs_delta.stored() -= lo.e.length;
16974  if (!r.empty()) {
16975  dout(20) << __func__ << " blob " << *b << " release " << r << dendl;
16976  if (blob.is_shared()) {
16977  PExtentVector final;
16978  c->load_shared_blob(b->shared_blob);
16979  bool unshare = false;
16980  bool* unshare_ptr =
16981  !maybe_unshared_blobs || b->is_referenced() ? nullptr : &unshare;
16982  for (auto e : r) {
16983  b->shared_blob->put_ref(
16984  e.offset, e.length, &final,
16985  unshare_ptr);
16986 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
16987  // we also drop zone ref for shared blob extents
16988  if (is_smr && e.is_valid()) {
16989  zones_with_releases.insert(e.offset / zone_size);
16990  }
16991 #endif
16992  }
16993  if (unshare) {
16994  ceph_assert(maybe_unshared_blobs);
16995  maybe_unshared_blobs->insert(b->shared_blob.get());
16996  }
16997  dout(20) << __func__ << " shared_blob release " << final
16998  << " from " << *b->shared_blob << dendl;
16999  txc->write_shared_blob(b->shared_blob);
17000  r.clear();
17001  r.swap(final);
17002  }
17003  }
17004  // we can't invalidate our logical extents as we drop them because
17005  // other lextents (either in our onode or others) may still
17006  // reference them. but we can throw out anything that is no
17007  // longer allocated. Note that this will leave behind edge bits
17008  // that are no longer referenced but not deallocated (until they
17009  // age out of the cache naturally).
17010  b->discard_unallocated(c.get());
17011  for (auto e : r) {
17012  dout(20) << __func__ << " release " << e << dendl;
17013  txc->released.insert(e.offset, e.length);
17014  txc->statfs_delta.allocated() -= e.length;
17015  if (blob.is_compressed()) {
17016  txc->statfs_delta.compressed_allocated() -= e.length;
17017  }
17018 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
17019  if (is_smr && e.is_valid()) {
17020  zones_with_releases.insert(e.offset / zone_size);
17021  }
17022 #endif
17023  }
17024 
17025  if (b->is_spanning() && !b->is_referenced() && lo.blob_empty) {
17026  dout(20) << __func__ << " spanning_blob_map removing empty " << *b
17027  << dendl;
17028  o->extent_map.spanning_blob_map.erase(b->id);
17029  }
17030  delete &lo;
17031  }
17032 
17033 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
17034  if (!zones_with_releases.empty()) {
17035  // we need to fault the entire extent range in here to determinte if we've dropped
17036  // all refs to a zone.
17037  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, OBJECT_MAX_SIZE);
17038  for (auto& b : o->extent_map.extent_map) {
17039  for (auto& e : b.blob->get_blob().get_extents()) {
17040  if (e.is_valid()) {
17041  zones_with_releases.erase(e.offset / zone_size);
17042  }
17043  }
17044  }
17045  for (auto zone : zones_with_releases) {
17046  auto p = o->onode.zone_offset_refs.find(zone);
17047  if (p != o->onode.zone_offset_refs.end()) {
17048  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm ref zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
17049  << " offset 0x" << p->second << std::dec << dendl;
17050  txc->note_release_zone_offset(o, zone, p->second);
17051  }
17052  }
17053  }
17054 #endif
17055 }
17056 
17057 void BlueStore::_do_write_data(
17058  TransContext *txc,
17059  CollectionRef& c,
17060  OnodeRef& o,
17061  uint64_t offset,
17062  uint64_t length,
17063  bufferlist& bl,
17064  WriteContext *wctx)
17065 {
17066  uint64_t end = offset + length;
17067  bufferlist::iterator p = bl.begin();
17068 
17069  if (offset / min_alloc_size == (end - 1) / min_alloc_size &&
17070  (length != min_alloc_size)) {
17071  // we fall within the same block
17072  _do_write_small(txc, c, o, offset, length, p, wctx);
17073  } else {
17074  uint64_t head_offset, head_length;
17075  uint64_t middle_offset, middle_length;
17076  uint64_t tail_offset, tail_length;
17077 
17078  head_offset = offset;
17079  head_length = p2nphase(offset, min_alloc_size);
17080 
17081  tail_offset = p2align(end, min_alloc_size);
17082  tail_length = p2phase(end, min_alloc_size);
17083 
17084  middle_offset = head_offset + head_length;
17085  middle_length = length - head_length - tail_length;
17086 
17087  if (head_length) {
17088  _do_write_small(txc, c, o, head_offset, head_length, p, wctx);
17089  }
17090 
17091  _do_write_big(txc, c, o, middle_offset, middle_length, p, wctx);
17092 
17093  if (tail_length) {
17094  _do_write_small(txc, c, o, tail_offset, tail_length, p, wctx);
17095  }
17096  }
17097 }
17098 
17099 void BlueStore::_choose_write_options(
17100  CollectionRef& c,
17101  OnodeRef& o,
17102  uint32_t fadvise_flags,
17103  WriteContext *wctx)
17104 {
17105  if (fadvise_flags & CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_WILLNEED) {
17106  dout(20) << __func__ << " will do buffered write" << dendl;
17107  wctx->buffered = true;
17108  } else if (cct->_conf->bluestore_default_buffered_write &&
17109  (fadvise_flags & (CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_DONTNEED |
17110  CEPH_OSD_OP_FLAG_FADVISE_NOCACHE)) == 0) {
17111  dout(20) << __func__ << " defaulting to buffered write" << dendl;
17112  wctx->buffered = true;
17113  }
17114 
17115  // apply basic csum block size
17116  wctx->csum_order = block_size_order;
17117 
17118  // compression parameters
17119  unsigned alloc_hints = o->onode.alloc_hint_flags;
17120  auto cm = select_option(
17121  "compression_mode",
17122  comp_mode.load(),
17123  [&]() {
17124  string val;
17125  if (c->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::COMPRESSION_MODE, &val)) {
17126  return std::optional<Compressor::CompressionMode>(
17127  Compressor::get_comp_mode_type(val));
17128  }
17129  return std::optional<Compressor::CompressionMode>();
17130  }
17131  );
17132 
17133  wctx->compress = (cm != Compressor::COMP_NONE) &&
17134  ((cm == Compressor::COMP_FORCE) ||
17135  (cm == Compressor::COMP_AGGRESSIVE &&
17136  (alloc_hints & CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_INCOMPRESSIBLE) == 0) ||
17137  (cm == Compressor::COMP_PASSIVE &&
17138  (alloc_hints & CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_COMPRESSIBLE)));
17139 
17140  if ((alloc_hints & CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_SEQUENTIAL_READ) &&
17141  (alloc_hints & CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_RANDOM_READ) == 0 &&
17142  (alloc_hints & (CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_IMMUTABLE |
17143  CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_APPEND_ONLY)) &&
17144  (alloc_hints & CEPH_OSD_ALLOC_HINT_FLAG_RANDOM_WRITE) == 0) {
17145 
17146  dout(20) << __func__ << " will prefer large blob and csum sizes" << dendl;
17147 
17148  if (o->onode.expected_write_size) {
17149  wctx->csum_order = std::max(min_alloc_size_order,
17150  (uint8_t)std::countr_zero(o->onode.expected_write_size));
17151  } else {
17152  wctx->csum_order = min_alloc_size_order;
17153  }
17154 
17155  if (wctx->compress) {
17156  wctx->target_blob_size = select_option(
17157  "compression_max_blob_size",
17158  comp_max_blob_size.load(),
17159  [&]() {
17160  int64_t val;
17161  if (c->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::COMPRESSION_MAX_BLOB_SIZE, &val)) {
17162  return std::optional<uint64_t>((uint64_t)val);
17163  }
17164  return std::optional<uint64_t>();
17165  }
17166  );
17167  }
17168  } else {
17169  if (wctx->compress) {
17170  wctx->target_blob_size = select_option(
17171  "compression_min_blob_size",
17172  comp_min_blob_size.load(),
17173  [&]() {
17174  int64_t val;
17175  if (c->pool_opts.get(pool_opts_t::COMPRESSION_MIN_BLOB_SIZE, &val)) {
17176  return std::optional<uint64_t>((uint64_t)val);
17177  }
17178  return std::optional<uint64_t>();
17179  }
17180  );
17181  }
17182  }
17183 
17184  uint64_t max_bsize = max_blob_size.load();
17185  if (wctx->target_blob_size == 0 || wctx->target_blob_size > max_bsize) {
17186  wctx->target_blob_size = max_bsize;
17187  }
17188 
17189  // set the min blob size floor at 2x the min_alloc_size, or else we
17190  // won't be able to allocate a smaller extent for the compressed
17191  // data.
17192  if (wctx->compress &&
17193  wctx->target_blob_size < min_alloc_size * 2) {
17194  wctx->target_blob_size = min_alloc_size * 2;
17195  }
17196 
17197  dout(20) << __func__ << " prefer csum_order " << wctx->csum_order
17198  << " target_blob_size 0x" << std::hex << wctx->target_blob_size
17199  << " compress=" << (int)wctx->compress
17200  << " buffered=" << (int)wctx->buffered
17201  << std::dec << dendl;
17202 }
17203 
17204 int BlueStore::_do_gc(
17205  TransContext *txc,
17206  CollectionRef& c,
17207  OnodeRef& o,
17208  const WriteContext& wctx,
17209  uint64_t *dirty_start,
17210  uint64_t *dirty_end)
17211 {
17212 
17213  bool dirty_range_updated = false;
17214  WriteContext wctx_gc;
17215  wctx_gc.fork(wctx); // make a clone for garbage collection
17216 
17217  auto & extents_to_collect = wctx.extents_to_gc;
17218  for (auto it = extents_to_collect.begin();
17219  it != extents_to_collect.end();
17220  ++it) {
17221  bufferlist bl;
17222  auto offset = (*it).first;
17223  auto length = (*it).second;
17224  dout(20) << __func__ << " processing " << std::hex
17225  << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17226  << dendl;
17227  int r = _do_read(c.get(), o, offset, length, bl, 0);
17228  ceph_assert(r == (int)length);
17229 
17230  _do_write_data(txc, c, o, offset, length, bl, &wctx_gc);
17231  logger->inc(l_bluestore_gc_merged, length);
17232 
17233  if (*dirty_start > offset) {
17234  *dirty_start = offset;
17235  dirty_range_updated = true;
17236  }
17237 
17238  if (*dirty_end < offset + length) {
17239  *dirty_end = offset + length;
17240  dirty_range_updated = true;
17241  }
17242  }
17243  if (dirty_range_updated) {
17244  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, *dirty_start, *dirty_end);
17245  }
17246 
17247  dout(30) << __func__ << " alloc write" << dendl;
17248  int r = _do_alloc_write(txc, c, o, &wctx_gc);
17249  if (r < 0) {
17250  derr << __func__ << " _do_alloc_write failed with " << cpp_strerror(r)
17251  << dendl;
17252  return r;
17253  }
17254 
17255  _wctx_finish(txc, c, o, &wctx_gc);
17256  return 0;
17257 }
17258 
17259 int BlueStore::_do_write(
17260  TransContext *txc,
17261  CollectionRef& c,
17262  OnodeRef& o,
17263  uint64_t offset,
17264  uint64_t length,
17265  bufferlist& bl,
17266  uint32_t fadvise_flags)
17267 {
17268  int r = 0;
17269 
17270  dout(20) << __func__
17271  << " " << o->oid
17272  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length
17273  << " - have 0x" << o->onode.size
17274  << " (" << std::dec << o->onode.size << ")"
17275  << " bytes" << std::hex
17276  << " fadvise_flags 0x" << fadvise_flags
17277  << " alloc_hint 0x" << o->onode.alloc_hint_flags
17278  << " expected_object_size " << o->onode.expected_object_size
17279  << " expected_write_size " << o->onode.expected_write_size
17280  << std::dec
17281  << dendl;
17282  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
17283 
17284  if (length == 0) {
17285  return 0;
17286  }
17287 
17288  uint64_t end = offset + length;
17289 
17290  GarbageCollector gc(c->store->cct);
17291  int64_t benefit = 0;
17292  auto dirty_start = offset;
17293  auto dirty_end = end;
17294 
17295  WriteContext wctx;
17296  _choose_write_options(c, o, fadvise_flags, &wctx);
17297  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, length);
17298  _do_write_data(txc, c, o, offset, length, bl, &wctx);
17299  r = _do_alloc_write(txc, c, o, &wctx);
17300  if (r < 0) {
17301  derr << __func__ << " _do_alloc_write failed with " << cpp_strerror(r)
17302  << dendl;
17303  goto out;
17304  }
17305 
17306  if (wctx.extents_to_gc.empty() ||
17307  wctx.extents_to_gc.range_start() > offset ||
17308  wctx.extents_to_gc.range_end() < offset + length) {
17309  benefit = gc.estimate(offset,
17310  length,
17311  o->extent_map,
17312  wctx.old_extents,
17313  min_alloc_size);
17314  }
17315 
17316  // NB: _wctx_finish() will empty old_extents
17317  // so we must do gc estimation before that
17318  _wctx_finish(txc, c, o, &wctx);
17319  if (end > o->onode.size) {
17320  dout(20) << __func__ << " extending size to 0x" << std::hex << end
17321  << std::dec << dendl;
17322  o->onode.size = end;
17323  }
17324 
17325  if (benefit >= g_conf()->bluestore_gc_enable_total_threshold) {
17326  wctx.extents_to_gc.union_of(gc.get_extents_to_collect());
17327  dout(20) << __func__
17328  << " perform garbage collection for compressed extents, "
17329  << "expected benefit = " << benefit << " AUs" << dendl;
17330  }
17331  if (!wctx.extents_to_gc.empty()) {
17332  dout(20) << __func__ << " perform garbage collection" << dendl;
17333 
17334  r = _do_gc(txc, c, o,
17335  wctx,
17336  &dirty_start, &dirty_end);
17337  if (r < 0) {
17338  derr << __func__ << " _do_gc failed with " << cpp_strerror(r)
17339  << dendl;
17340  goto out;
17341  }
17342  dout(20)<<__func__<<" gc range is " << std::hex << dirty_start
