17343  << "~" << dirty_end - dirty_start << std::dec << dendl;
17344  }
17345  o->extent_map.compress_extent_map(dirty_start, dirty_end - dirty_start);
17346  o->extent_map.dirty_range(dirty_start, dirty_end - dirty_start);
17347 
17348  r = 0;
17349 
17350  out:
17351  return r;
17352 }
17353 
17354 int BlueStore::_write(TransContext *txc,
17355  CollectionRef& c,
17356  OnodeRef& o,
17357  uint64_t offset, size_t length,
17358  bufferlist& bl,
17359  uint32_t fadvise_flags)
17360 {
17361  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17362  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17363  << dendl;
17364  int r = 0;
17365  if (offset + length >= OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
17366  r = -E2BIG;
17367  } else {
17368  _assign_nid(txc, o);
17369  r = _do_write(txc, c, o, offset, length, bl, fadvise_flags);
17370  txc->write_onode(o);
17371  }
17372  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17373  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17374  << " = " << r << dendl;
17375  return r;
17376 }
17377 
17378 int BlueStore::_zero(TransContext *txc,
17379  CollectionRef& c,
17380  OnodeRef& o,
17381  uint64_t offset, size_t length)
17382 {
17383  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17384  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17385  << dendl;
17386  int r = 0;
17387  if (offset + length >= OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
17388  r = -E2BIG;
17389  } else {
17390  _assign_nid(txc, o);
17391  r = _do_zero(txc, c, o, offset, length);
17392  }
17393  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17394  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17395  << " = " << r << dendl;
17396  return r;
17397 }
17398 
17399 int BlueStore::_do_zero(TransContext *txc,
17400  CollectionRef& c,
17401  OnodeRef& o,
17402  uint64_t offset, size_t length)
17403 {
17404  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17405  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17406  << dendl;
17407  int r = 0;
17408 
17409  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
17410 
17411  WriteContext wctx;
17412  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, length);
17413  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx.old_extents);
17414  o->extent_map.dirty_range(offset, length);
17415  _wctx_finish(txc, c, o, &wctx);
17416 
17417  if (length > 0 && offset + length > o->onode.size) {
17418  o->onode.size = offset + length;
17419  dout(20) << __func__ << " extending size to " << offset + length
17420  << dendl;
17421  }
17422  txc->write_onode(o);
17423 
17424  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17425  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << "~" << length << std::dec
17426  << " = " << r << dendl;
17427  return r;
17428 }
17429 
17430 void BlueStore::_do_truncate(
17431  TransContext *txc, CollectionRef& c, OnodeRef& o, uint64_t offset,
17432  set<SharedBlob*> *maybe_unshared_blobs)
17433 {
17434  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17435  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << std::dec << dendl;
17436 
17437  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *o);
17438 
17439  if (offset == o->onode.size)
17440  return;
17441 
17442  WriteContext wctx;
17443  if (offset < o->onode.size) {
17444  uint64_t length = o->onode.size - offset;
17445  o->extent_map.fault_range(db, offset, length);
17446  o->extent_map.punch_hole(c, offset, length, &wctx.old_extents);
17447  o->extent_map.dirty_range(offset, length);
17448 
17449  _wctx_finish(txc, c, o, &wctx, maybe_unshared_blobs);
17450 
17451  // if we have shards past EOF, ask for a reshard
17452  if (!o->onode.extent_map_shards.empty() &&
17453  o->onode.extent_map_shards.back().offset >= offset) {
17454  dout(10) << __func__ << " request reshard past EOF" << dendl;
17455  if (offset) {
17456  o->extent_map.request_reshard(offset - 1, offset + length);
17457  } else {
17458  o->extent_map.request_reshard(0, length);
17459  }
17460  }
17461  }
17462 
17463  o->onode.size = offset;
17464 
17465  txc->write_onode(o);
17466 }
17467 
17468 int BlueStore::_truncate(TransContext *txc,
17469  CollectionRef& c,
17470  OnodeRef& o,
17471  uint64_t offset)
17472 {
17473  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17474  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << std::dec
17475  << dendl;
17476 
17477  auto start_time = mono_clock::now();
17478  int r = 0;
17479  if (offset >= OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
17480  r = -E2BIG;
17481  } else {
17482  _do_truncate(txc, c, o, offset);
17483  }
17484  log_latency_fn(
17485  __func__,
17486  l_bluestore_truncate_lat,
17487  mono_clock::now() - start_time,
17488  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
17489  [&](const ceph::timespan& lat) {
17490  ostringstream ostr;
17491  ostr << ", lat = " << timespan_str(lat)
17492  << " cid =" << c->cid
17493  << " oid =" << o->oid;
17494  return ostr.str();
17495  }
17496  );
17497  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17498  << " 0x" << std::hex << offset << std::dec
17499  << " = " << r << dendl;
17500  return r;
17501 }
17502 
17503 int BlueStore::_do_remove(
17504  TransContext *txc,
17505  CollectionRef& c,
17506  OnodeRef& o)
17507 {
17508  set<SharedBlob*> maybe_unshared_blobs;
17509  bool is_gen = !o->oid.is_no_gen();
17510  _do_truncate(txc, c, o, 0, is_gen ? &maybe_unshared_blobs : nullptr);
17511  if (o->onode.has_omap()) {
17512  o->flush();
17513  _do_omap_clear(txc, o);
17514  }
17515  o->exists = false;
17516  string key;
17517  for (auto &s : o->extent_map.shards) {
17518  dout(20) << __func__ << " removing shard 0x" << std::hex
17519  << s.shard_info->offset << std::dec << dendl;
17520  generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(o->key, s.shard_info->offset, &key,
17521  [&](const string& final_key) {
17522  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_OBJ, final_key);
17523  }
17524  );
17525  }
17526  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_OBJ, o->key.c_str(), o->key.size());
17527  txc->note_removed_object(o);
17528  o->extent_map.clear();
17529  o->onode = bluestore_onode_t();
17530  _debug_obj_on_delete(o->oid);
17531 
17532  if (!is_gen || maybe_unshared_blobs.empty()) {
17533  return 0;
17534  }
17535 
17536  // see if we can unshare blobs still referenced by the head
17537  dout(10) << __func__ << " gen and maybe_unshared_blobs "
17538  << maybe_unshared_blobs << dendl;
17539  ghobject_t nogen = o->oid;
17540  nogen.generation = ghobject_t::NO_GEN;
17541  OnodeRef h = c->get_onode(nogen, false);
17542 
17543  if (!h || !h->exists) {
17544  return 0;
17545  }
17546  // Set maybe_unshared_blobs contains those shared blobs that have all nref=1.
17547  // Is .head object is using all those segments?
17548  // If it is using all, then no one else can use the shared blob,
17549  // and we can fallback to regular non-shared blob.
17550 
17551  // Note. We only process loaded shared blobs.
17552  // This is very smart optimization - there is no way that we can unshare blob
17553  // that is not yet loaded! We must have had inspected it to even check nrefs.
17554  dout(20) << __func__ << " checking for unshareable blobs on " << h
17555  << " " << h->oid << dendl;
17556  map<SharedBlob*,bluestore_extent_ref_map_t> expect;
17557  for (auto& e : h->extent_map.extent_map) {
17558  const bluestore_blob_t& b = e.blob->get_blob();
17559  SharedBlob *sb = e.blob->shared_blob.get();
17560  if (b.is_shared() &&
17561  sb->loaded &&
17562  maybe_unshared_blobs.count(sb)) {
17563  if (b.is_compressed()) {
17564  expect[sb].get(0, b.get_ondisk_length());
17565  } else {
17566  // todo: it seems to be an overkill to go through map()
17567  b.map(e.blob_offset, e.length, [&](uint64_t off, uint64_t len) {
17568  expect[sb].get(off, len);
17569  return 0;
17570  });
17571  }
17572  }
17573  }
17574 
17575  // expect has now refs set exactly as .head is using it
17576  vector<SharedBlob*> unshared_blobs;
17577  unshared_blobs.reserve(maybe_unshared_blobs.size());
17578  for (auto& p : expect) {
17579  dout(20) << " ? " << *p.first << " vs " << p.second << dendl;
17580  if (p.first->persistent->ref_map == p.second) {
17581  // yup, .head is only one that is using the shared blob now
17582  SharedBlob *sb = p.first;
17583  dout(20) << __func__ << " unsharing " << *sb << dendl;
17584  unshared_blobs.push_back(sb);
17585  txc->unshare_blob(sb);
17586  uint64_t sbid = c->make_blob_unshared(sb);
17587  string key;
17588  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
17589  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
17590  }
17591  }
17592 
17593  if (unshared_blobs.empty()) {
17594  return 0;
17595  }
17596 
17597  // And now a run through .head extents to clear up freshly unshared blobs.
17598  for (auto& e : h->extent_map.extent_map) {
17599  const bluestore_blob_t& b = e.blob->get_blob();
17600  SharedBlob *sb = e.blob->shared_blob.get();
17601  if (b.is_shared() &&
17602  std::find(unshared_blobs.begin(), unshared_blobs.end(),
17603  sb) != unshared_blobs.end()) {
17604  dout(20) << __func__ << " unsharing " << e << dendl;
17605  bluestore_blob_t& blob = e.blob->dirty_blob();
17606  blob.clear_flag(bluestore_blob_t::FLAG_SHARED);
17607  if (e.blob->shared_blob->nref > 1) {
17608  // Each blob on creation gets its own unique (empty) shared_blob.
17609  // In function ExtentMap::dup() we sometimes merge 2 blobs,
17610  // so they share common shared_blob used for ref counting.
17611  // Imagine 2 blobs having same shared_blob, and shared blob gets just unshared.
17612  // We cleared shared_blob content so it is now logically empty,
17613  // but now those 2 blobs share it.
17614  // This is illegal, as empty shared blobs should be unique.
17615  // Fixing by re-creation.
17616 
17617  // Here we skip set_shared_blob() because e.blob is already in BufferCacheShard
17618  // and cannot do add_blob() twice
17619  e.blob->shared_blob = new SharedBlob(c.get());
17620  }
17621  h->extent_map.dirty_range(e.logical_offset, 1);
17622  }
17623  }
17624  txc->write_onode(h);
17625 
17626  return 0;
17627 }
17628 
17629 int BlueStore::_remove(TransContext *txc,
17630  CollectionRef& c,
17631  OnodeRef& o)
17632 {
17633  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17634  << " onode " << o.get()
17635  << " txc "<< txc << dendl;
17636  auto start_time = mono_clock::now();
17637  int r = _do_remove(txc, c, o);
17638 
17639  log_latency_fn(
17640  __func__,
17641  l_bluestore_remove_lat,
17642  mono_clock::now() - start_time,
17643  cct->_conf->bluestore_log_op_age,
17644  [&](const ceph::timespan& lat) {
17645  ostringstream ostr;
17646  ostr << ", lat = " << timespan_str(lat)
17647  << " cid =" << c->cid
17648  << " oid =" << o->oid;
17649  return ostr.str();
17650  }
17651  );
17652 
17653  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17654  return r;
17655 }
17656 
17657 int BlueStore::_setattr(TransContext *txc,
17658  CollectionRef& c,
17659  OnodeRef& o,
17660  const string& name,
17661  bufferptr& val)
17662 {
17663  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17664  << " " << name << " (" << val.length() << " bytes)"
17665  << dendl;
17666  int r = 0;
17667  if (val.is_partial()) {
17668  auto& b = o->onode.attrs[name.c_str()] = bufferptr(val.c_str(),
17669  val.length());
17670  b.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_meta);
17671  } else {
17672  auto& b = o->onode.attrs[name.c_str()] = val;
17673  b.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_meta);
17674  }
17675  txc->write_onode(o);
17676  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17677  << " " << name << " (" << val.length() << " bytes)"
17678  << " = " << r << dendl;
17679  return r;
17680 }
17681 
17682 int BlueStore::_setattrs(TransContext *txc,
17683  CollectionRef& c,
17684  OnodeRef& o,
17685  const map<string,bufferptr>& aset)
17686 {
17687  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17688  << " " << aset.size() << " keys"
17689  << dendl;
17690  int r = 0;
17691  for (map<string,bufferptr>::const_iterator p = aset.begin();
17692  p != aset.end(); ++p) {
17693  if (p->second.is_partial()) {
17694  auto& b = o->onode.attrs[p->first.c_str()] =
17695  bufferptr(p->second.c_str(), p->second.length());
17696  b.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_meta);
17697  } else {
17698  auto& b = o->onode.attrs[p->first.c_str()] = p->second;
17699  b.reassign_to_mempool(mempool::mempool_bluestore_cache_meta);
17700  }
17701  }
17702  txc->write_onode(o);
17703  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17704  << " " << aset.size() << " keys"
17705  << " = " << r << dendl;
17706  return r;
17707 }
17708 
17709 
17710 int BlueStore::_rmattr(TransContext *txc,
17711  CollectionRef& c,
17712  OnodeRef& o,
17713  const string& name)
17714 {
17715  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17716  << " " << name << dendl;
17717  int r = 0;
17718  auto it = o->onode.attrs.find(name.c_str());
17719  if (it == o->onode.attrs.end())
17720  goto out;
17721 
17722  o->onode.attrs.erase(it);
17723  txc->write_onode(o);
17724 
17725  out:
17726  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17727  << " " << name << " = " << r << dendl;
17728  return r;
17729 }
17730 
17731 int BlueStore::_rmattrs(TransContext *txc,
17732  CollectionRef& c,
17733  OnodeRef& o)
17734 {
17735  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17736  int r = 0;
17737 
17738  if (o->onode.attrs.empty())
17739  goto out;
17740 
17741  o->onode.attrs.clear();
17742  txc->write_onode(o);
17743 
17744  out:
17745  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17746  return r;
17747 }
17748 
17749 void BlueStore::_do_omap_clear(TransContext *txc, OnodeRef& o)
17750 {
17751  const string& omap_prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17752  string prefix, tail;
17753  o->get_omap_header(&prefix);
17754  o->get_omap_tail(&tail);
17755  txc->t->rm_range_keys(omap_prefix, prefix, tail);
17756  txc->t->rmkey(omap_prefix, tail);
17757  o->onode.clear_omap_flag();
17758  dout(20) << __func__ << " remove range start: "
17759  << pretty_binary_string(prefix) << " end: "
17760  << pretty_binary_string(tail) << dendl;
17761 }
17762 
17763 int BlueStore::_omap_clear(TransContext *txc,
17764  CollectionRef& c,
17765  OnodeRef& o)
17766 {
17767  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17768  auto t0 = mono_clock::now();
17769 
17770  int r = 0;
17771  if (o->onode.has_omap()) {
17772  o->flush();
17773  _do_omap_clear(txc, o);
17774  txc->write_onode(o);
17775  }
17776  logger->tinc(l_bluestore_omap_clear_lat, mono_clock::now() - t0);
17777 
17778  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17779  return r;
17780 }
17781 
17782 int BlueStore::_omap_setkeys(TransContext *txc,
17783  CollectionRef& c,
17784  OnodeRef& o,
17785  bufferlist &bl)
17786 {
17787  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17788  int r;
17789  auto p = bl.cbegin();
17790  __u32 num;
17791  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
17792  if (o->oid.is_pgmeta()) {
17793  o->onode.set_omap_flags_pgmeta();
17794  } else {
17795  o->onode.set_omap_flags(per_pool_omap == OMAP_BULK);
17796  }
17797  txc->write_onode(o);
17798 
17799  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17800  string key_tail;
17801  bufferlist tail;
17802  o->get_omap_tail(&key_tail);
17803  txc->t->set(prefix, key_tail, tail);
17804  } else {
17805  txc->note_modified_object(o);
17806  }
17807  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17808  string final_key;
17809  o->get_omap_key(string(), &final_key);
17810  size_t base_key_len = final_key.size();
17811  decode(num, p);
17812  while (num--) {
17813  string key;
17814  bufferlist value;
17815  decode(key, p);
17816  decode(value, p);
17817  final_key.resize(base_key_len); // keep prefix
17818  final_key += key;
17819  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << pretty_binary_string(final_key)
17820  << " <- " << key << dendl;
17821  txc->t->set(prefix, final_key, value);
17822  }
17823  r = 0;
17824  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17825  return r;
17826 }
17827 
17828 int BlueStore::_omap_setheader(TransContext *txc,
17829  CollectionRef& c,
17830  OnodeRef& o,
17831  bufferlist& bl)
17832 {
17833  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17834  int r;
17835  string key;
17836  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
17837  if (o->oid.is_pgmeta()) {
17838  o->onode.set_omap_flags_pgmeta();
17839  } else {
17840  o->onode.set_omap_flags(per_pool_omap == OMAP_BULK);
17841  }
17842  txc->write_onode(o);
17843 
17844  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17845  string key_tail;
17846  bufferlist tail;
17847  o->get_omap_tail(&key_tail);
17848  txc->t->set(prefix, key_tail, tail);
17849  } else {
17850  txc->note_modified_object(o);
17851  }
17852  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17853  o->get_omap_header(&key);
17854  txc->t->set(prefix, key, bl);
17855  r = 0;
17856  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17857  return r;
17858 }
17859 
17860 int BlueStore::_omap_rmkeys(TransContext *txc,
17861  CollectionRef& c,
17862  OnodeRef& o,
17863  bufferlist& bl)
17864 {
17865  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17866  int r = 0;
17867  auto p = bl.cbegin();
17868  __u32 num;
17869  string final_key;
17870  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
17871  goto out;
17872  }
17873  {
17874  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17875  o->get_omap_key(string(), &final_key);
17876  size_t base_key_len = final_key.size();
17877  decode(num, p);
17878  logger->inc(l_bluestore_omap_rmkeys_count, num);
17879  while (num--) {
17880  string key;
17881  decode(key, p);
17882  final_key.resize(base_key_len); // keep prefix
17883  final_key += key;
17884  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm " << pretty_binary_string(final_key)
17885  << " <- " << key << dendl;
17886  txc->t->rmkey(prefix, final_key);
17887  }
17888  }
17889  txc->note_modified_object(o);
17890 
17891  out:
17892  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
17893  return r;
17894 }
17895 
17896 int BlueStore::_omap_rmkey_range(TransContext *txc,
17897  CollectionRef& c,
17898  OnodeRef& o,
17899  const string& first, const string& last)
17900 {
17901  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid << dendl;
17902  string key_first, key_last;
17903  int r = 0;
17904  if (!o->onode.has_omap()) {
17905  goto out;
17906  }
17907  {
17908  const string& prefix = o->get_omap_prefix();
17909  o->flush();
17910  o->get_omap_key(first, &key_first);
17911  o->get_omap_key(last, &key_last);
17912  logger->inc(l_bluestore_omap_rmkey_ranges_count);
17913  txc->t->rm_range_keys(prefix, key_first, key_last);
17914  dout(20) << __func__ << " remove range start: "
17915  << pretty_binary_string(key_first) << " end: "
17916  << pretty_binary_string(key_last) << dendl;
17917  }
17918  txc->note_modified_object(o);
17919 
17920  out:
17921  return r;
17922 }
17923 
17924 int BlueStore::_set_alloc_hint(
17925  TransContext *txc,
17926  CollectionRef& c,
17927  OnodeRef& o,
17928  uint64_t expected_object_size,
17929  uint64_t expected_write_size,
17930  uint32_t flags)
17931 {
17932  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17933  << " object_size " << expected_object_size
17934  << " write_size " << expected_write_size
17935  << " flags " << ceph_osd_alloc_hint_flag_string(flags)
17936  << dendl;
17937  int r = 0;
17938  o->onode.expected_object_size = expected_object_size;
17939  o->onode.expected_write_size = expected_write_size;
17940  o->onode.alloc_hint_flags = flags;
17941  txc->write_onode(o);
17942  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << o->oid
17943  << " object_size " << expected_object_size
17944  << " write_size " << expected_write_size
17945  << " flags " << ceph_osd_alloc_hint_flag_string(flags)
17946  << " = " << r << dendl;
17947  return r;
17948 }
17949 
17950 int BlueStore::_clone(TransContext *txc,
17951  CollectionRef& c,
17952  OnodeRef& oldo,
17953  OnodeRef& newo)
17954 {
17955  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
17956  << newo->oid << dendl;
17957  int r = 0;
17958  if (oldo->oid.hobj.get_hash() != newo->oid.hobj.get_hash()) {
17959  derr << __func__ << " mismatched hash on " << oldo->oid
17960  << " and " << newo->oid << dendl;
17961  return -EINVAL;
17962  }
17963 
17964  _assign_nid(txc, newo);
17965 
17966  // clone data
17967  oldo->flush();
17968  _do_truncate(txc, c, newo, 0);
17969  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_clone_cow) {
17970  _do_clone_range(txc, c, oldo, newo, 0, oldo->onode.size, 0);
17971  } else {
17972  bufferlist bl;
17973  r = _do_read(c.get(), oldo, 0, oldo->onode.size, bl, 0);
17974  if (r < 0)
17975  goto out;
17976  r = _do_write(txc, c, newo, 0, oldo->onode.size, bl, 0);
17977  if (r < 0)
17978  goto out;
17979  }
17980 
17981  // clone attrs
17982  newo->onode.attrs = oldo->onode.attrs;
17983 
17984  // clone omap
17985  if (newo->onode.has_omap()) {
17986  dout(20) << __func__ << " clearing old omap data" << dendl;
17987  newo->flush();
17988  _do_omap_clear(txc, newo);
17989  }
17990  if (oldo->onode.has_omap()) {
17991  dout(20) << __func__ << " copying omap data" << dendl;
17992  if (newo->oid.is_pgmeta()) {
17993  newo->onode.set_omap_flags_pgmeta();
17994  } else {
17995  newo->onode.set_omap_flags(per_pool_omap == OMAP_BULK);
17996  }
17997  // check if prefix for omap key is exactly the same size for both objects
17998  // otherwise rewrite_omap_key will corrupt data
17999  ceph_assert(oldo->onode.flags == newo->onode.flags);
18000  const string& prefix = newo->get_omap_prefix();
18001  string head, tail;
18002  oldo->get_omap_header(&head);
18003  oldo->get_omap_tail(&tail);
18004  KeyValueDB::Iterator it = db->get_iterator(prefix, 0, KeyValueDB::IteratorBounds{head, tail});
18005  it->lower_bound(head);
18006  while (it->valid()) {
18007  if (it->key() >= tail) {
18008  dout(30) << __func__ << " reached tail" << dendl;
18009  break;
18010  } else {
18011  dout(30) << __func__ << " got header/data "
18012  << pretty_binary_string(it->key()) << dendl;
18013  string key;
18014  newo->rewrite_omap_key(it->key(), &key);
18015  txc->t->set(prefix, key, it->value());
18016  }
18017  it->next();
18018  }
18019  string new_tail;
18020  bufferlist new_tail_value;
18021  newo->get_omap_tail(&new_tail);
18022  txc->t->set(prefix, new_tail, new_tail_value);
18023  }
18024 
18025  txc->write_onode(newo);
18026  r = 0;
18027 
18028  out:
18029  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
18030  << newo->oid << " = " << r << dendl;
18031  return r;
18032 }
18033 
18034 int BlueStore::_do_clone_range(
18035  TransContext *txc,
18036  CollectionRef& c,
18037  OnodeRef& oldo,
18038  OnodeRef& newo,
18039  uint64_t srcoff,
18040  uint64_t length,
18041  uint64_t dstoff)
18042 {
18043  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
18044  << newo->oid
18045  << " 0x" << std::hex << srcoff << "~" << length << " -> "
18046  << " 0x" << dstoff << "~" << length << std::dec << dendl;
18047  oldo->extent_map.fault_range(db, srcoff, length);
18048  newo->extent_map.fault_range(db, dstoff, length);
18049  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *oldo);
18050  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *newo);
18051 
18052  if (elastic_shared_blobs) {
18053  oldo->extent_map.dup_esb(this, txc, c, oldo, newo, srcoff, length, dstoff);
18054  } else {
18055  oldo->extent_map.dup(this, txc, c, oldo, newo, srcoff, length, dstoff);
18056  }
18057 
18058 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
18059  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
18060  // duplicate the refs for the shared region.
18061  Extent dummy(dstoff);
18062  for (auto e = newo->extent_map.extent_map.lower_bound(dummy);
18063  e != newo->extent_map.extent_map.end();
18064  ++e) {
18065  if (e->logical_offset >= dstoff + length) {
18066  break;
18067  }
18068  for (auto& ex : e->blob->get_blob().get_extents()) {
18069  // note that we may introduce a new extent reference that is
18070  // earlier than the first zone ref. we allow this since it is
18071  // a lot of work to avoid and has marginal impact on cleaning
18072  // performance.
18073  if (!ex.is_valid()) {
18074  continue;
18075  }
18076  uint32_t zone = ex.offset / zone_size;
18077  if (!newo->onode.zone_offset_refs.count(zone)) {
18078  uint64_t zoff = ex.offset % zone_size;
18079  dout(20) << __func__ << " add ref zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
18080  << " offset 0x" << zoff << std::dec
18081  << " -> " << newo->oid << dendl;
18082  txc->note_write_zone_offset(newo, zone, zoff);
18083  }
18084  }
18085  }
18086  }
18087 #endif
18088 
18089  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *oldo);
18090  _dump_onode<30>(cct, *newo);
18091  return 0;
18092 }
18093 
18094 int BlueStore::_clone_range(TransContext *txc,
18095  CollectionRef& c,
18096  OnodeRef& oldo,
18097  OnodeRef& newo,
18098  uint64_t srcoff, uint64_t length, uint64_t dstoff)
18099 {
18100  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
18101  << newo->oid << " from 0x" << std::hex << srcoff << "~" << length
18102  << " to offset 0x" << dstoff << std::dec << dendl;
18103  int r = 0;
18104 
18105  if (srcoff + length >= OBJECT_MAX_SIZE ||
18106  dstoff + length >= OBJECT_MAX_SIZE) {
18107  r = -E2BIG;
18108  goto out;
18109  }
18110  if (srcoff + length > oldo->onode.size) {
18111  r = -EINVAL;
18112  goto out;
18113  }
18114 
18115  _assign_nid(txc, newo);
18116 
18117  if (length > 0) {
18118  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_clone_cow) {
18119  _do_zero(txc, c, newo, dstoff, length);
18120  _do_clone_range(txc, c, oldo, newo, srcoff, length, dstoff);
18121  } else {
18122  bufferlist bl;
18123  r = _do_read(c.get(), oldo, srcoff, length, bl, 0);
18124  if (r < 0)
18125  goto out;
18126  r = _do_write(txc, c, newo, dstoff, bl.length(), bl, 0);
18127  if (r < 0)
18128  goto out;
18129  }
18130  }
18131 
18132  txc->write_onode(newo);
18133  r = 0;
18134 
18135  out:
18136  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
18137  << newo->oid << " from 0x" << std::hex << srcoff << "~" << length
18138  << " to offset 0x" << dstoff << std::dec
18139  << " = " << r << dendl;
18140  return r;
18141 }
18142 
18143 int BlueStore::_rename(TransContext *txc,
18144  CollectionRef& c,
18145  OnodeRef& oldo,
18146  OnodeRef& newo,
18147  const ghobject_t& new_oid)
18148 {
18149  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << oldo->oid << " -> "
18150  << new_oid << dendl;
18151  int r;
18152  ghobject_t old_oid = oldo->oid;
18153  mempool::bluestore_cache_meta::string new_okey;
18154 
18155  if (newo) {
18156  if (newo->exists) {
18157  r = -EEXIST;
18158  goto out;
18159  }
18160  ceph_assert(txc->onodes.count(newo) == 0);
18161  }
18162 
18163  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_OBJ, oldo->key.c_str(), oldo->key.size());
18164 
18165  // rewrite shards
18166  {
18167  oldo->extent_map.fault_range(db, 0, oldo->onode.size);
18168  get_object_key(cct, new_oid, &new_okey);
18169  string key;
18170  for (auto &s : oldo->extent_map.shards) {
18171  generate_extent_shard_key_and_apply(oldo->key, s.shard_info->offset, &key,
18172  [&](const string& final_key) {
18173  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_OBJ, final_key);
18174  }
18175  );
18176  s.dirty = true;
18177  }
18178  }
18179 
18180  newo = oldo;
18181  txc->write_onode(newo);
18182 
18183  // this adjusts oldo->{oid,key}, and reset oldo to a fresh empty
18184  // Onode in the old slot
18185  c->onode_space.rename(oldo, old_oid, new_oid, new_okey);
18186  r = 0;
18187 
18188  // hold a ref to new Onode in old name position, to ensure we don't drop
18189  // it from the cache before this txc commits (or else someone may come along
18190  // and read newo's metadata via the old name).
18191  txc->note_modified_object(oldo);
18192 
18193 #ifdef HAVE_LIBZBD
18194  if (bdev->is_smr()) {
18195  // adjust zone refs
18196  for (auto& [zone, offset] : newo->onode.zone_offset_refs) {
18197  dout(20) << __func__ << " rm ref zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
18198  << " offset 0x" << offset << std::dec
18199  << " -> " << oldo->oid << dendl;
18200  string key;
18201  get_zone_offset_object_key(zone, offset, oldo->oid, &key);
18202  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key);
18203 
18204  dout(20) << __func__ << " add ref zone 0x" << std::hex << zone
18205  << " offset 0x" << offset << std::dec
18206  << " -> " << newo->oid << dendl;
18207  get_zone_offset_object_key(zone, offset, newo->oid, &key);
18208  bufferlist v;
18209  txc->t->set(PREFIX_ZONED_CL_INFO, key, v);
18210  }
18211  }
18212 #endif
18213 
18214  out:
18215  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " " << old_oid << " -> "
18216  << new_oid << " = " << r << dendl;
18217  return r;
18218 }
18219 
18220 // collections
18221 
18222 int BlueStore::_create_collection(
18223  TransContext *txc,
18224  const coll_t &cid,
18225  unsigned bits,
18226  CollectionRef *c)
18227 {
18228  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << cid << " bits " << bits << dendl;
18229  int r;
18230  bufferlist bl;
18231 
18232  {
18233  std::unique_lock l(coll_lock);
18234  if (*c) {
18235  r = -EEXIST;
18236  goto out;
18237  }
18238  auto p = new_coll_map.find(cid);
18239  ceph_assert(p != new_coll_map.end());
18240  *c = p->second;
18241  (*c)->cnode.bits = bits;
18242  coll_map[cid] = *c;
18243  new_coll_map.erase(p);
18244  }
18245  encode((*c)->cnode, bl);
18246  txc->t->set(PREFIX_COLL, stringify(cid), bl);
18247  r = 0;
18248 
18249  out:
18250  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid << " bits " << bits << " = " << r << dendl;
18251  return r;
18252 }
18253 
18254 int BlueStore::_remove_collection(TransContext *txc, const coll_t &cid,
18255  CollectionRef *c)
18256 {
18257  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << cid << dendl;
18258  int r;
18259 
18260  (*c)->flush_all_but_last();
18261  {
18262  std::unique_lock l(coll_lock);
18263  if (!*c) {
18264  r = -ENOENT;
18265  goto out;
18266  }
18267  size_t nonexistent_count = 0;
18268  ceph_assert((*c)->exists);
18269  if ((*c)->onode_space.map_any([&](Onode* o) {
18270  if (o->exists) {
18271  dout(1) << __func__ << " " << o->oid << " " << o
18272  << " exists in onode_map" << dendl;
18273  return true;
18274  }
18275  ++nonexistent_count;
18276  return false;
18277  })) {
18278  r = -ENOTEMPTY;
18279  goto out;
18280  }
18281  vector<ghobject_t> ls;
18282  ghobject_t next;
18283  // Enumerate onodes in db, up to nonexistent_count + 1
18284  // then check if all of them are marked as non-existent.
18285  // Bypass the check if (next != ghobject_t::get_max())
18286  r = _collection_list(c->get(), ghobject_t(), ghobject_t::get_max(),
18287  nonexistent_count + 1, false, &ls, &next);
18288  if (r >= 0) {
18289  // If true mean collecton has more objects than nonexistent_count,
18290  // so bypass check.
18291  bool exists = (!next.is_max());
18292  for (auto it = ls.begin(); !exists && it < ls.end(); ++it) {
18293  dout(10) << __func__ << " oid " << *it << dendl;
18294  auto onode = (*c)->onode_space.lookup(*it);
18295  exists = !onode || onode->exists;
18296  if (exists) {
18297  dout(1) << __func__ << " " << *it
18298  << " exists in db, "
18299  << (!onode ? "not present in ram" : "present in ram")
18300  << dendl;
18301  }
18302  }
18303  if (!exists) {
18304  _do_remove_collection(txc, c);
18305  r = 0;
18306  } else {
18307  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid
18308  << " is non-empty" << dendl;
18309  r = -ENOTEMPTY;
18310  }
18311  }
18312  }
18313 out:
18314  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid << " = " << r << dendl;
18315  return r;
18316 }
18317 
18318 void BlueStore::_do_remove_collection(TransContext *txc,
18319  CollectionRef *c)
18320 {
18321  coll_map.erase((*c)->cid);
18322  txc->removed_collections.push_back(*c);
18323  (*c)->exists = false;
18324  _osr_register_zombie((*c)->osr.get());
18325  txc->t->rmkey(PREFIX_COLL, stringify((*c)->cid));
18326  c->reset();
18327 }
18328 
18329 int BlueStore::_split_collection(TransContext *txc,
18330  CollectionRef& c,
18331  CollectionRef& d,
18332  unsigned bits, int rem)
18333 {
18334  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " to " << d->cid << " "
18335  << " bits " << bits << dendl;
18336  std::unique_lock l(c->lock);
18337  std::unique_lock l2(d->lock);
18338  int r;
18339 
18340  // flush all previous deferred writes on this sequencer. this is a bit
18341  // heavyweight, but we need to make sure all deferred writes complete
18342  // before we split as the new collection's sequencer may need to order
18343  // this after those writes, and we don't bother with the complexity of
18344  // moving those TransContexts over to the new osr.
18345  _osr_drain_preceding(txc);
18346 
18347  // move any cached items (onodes and referenced shared blobs) that will
18348  // belong to the child collection post-split. leave everything else behind.
18349  // this may include things that don't strictly belong to the now-smaller
18350  // parent split, but the OSD will always send us a split for every new
18351  // child.
18352 
18353  spg_t pgid, dest_pgid;
18354  bool is_pg = c->cid.is_pg(&pgid);
18355  ceph_assert(is_pg);
18356  is_pg = d->cid.is_pg(&dest_pgid);
18357  ceph_assert(is_pg);
18358 
18359  // the destination should initially be empty.
18360  ceph_assert(d->onode_space.empty());
18361  ceph_assert(d->shared_blob_set.empty());
18362  ceph_assert(d->cnode.bits == bits);
18363 
18364  c->split_cache(d.get());
18365 
18366  // adjust bits. note that this will be redundant for all but the first
18367  // split call for this parent (first child).
18368  c->cnode.bits = bits;
18369  ceph_assert(d->cnode.bits == bits);
18370  r = 0;
18371 
18372  bufferlist bl;
18373  encode(c->cnode, bl);
18374  txc->t->set(PREFIX_COLL, stringify(c->cid), bl);
18375 
18376  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << c->cid << " to " << d->cid << " "
18377  << " bits " << bits << " = " << r << dendl;
18378  return r;
18379 }
18380 
18381 int BlueStore::_merge_collection(
18382  TransContext *txc,
18383  CollectionRef *c,
18384  CollectionRef& d,
18385  unsigned bits)
18386 {
18387  dout(15) << __func__ << " " << (*c)->cid << " to " << d->cid
18388  << " bits " << bits << dendl;
18389  std::unique_lock l((*c)->lock);
18390  std::unique_lock l2(d->lock);
18391  int r;
18392 
18393  coll_t cid = (*c)->cid;
18394 
18395  // flush all previous deferred writes on the source collection to ensure
18396  // that all deferred writes complete before we merge as the target collection's
18397  // sequencer may need to order new ops after those writes.
18398 
18399  _osr_drain((*c)->osr.get());
18400 
18401  // move any cached items (onodes and referenced shared blobs) that will
18402  // belong to the child collection post-split. leave everything else behind.
18403  // this may include things that don't strictly belong to the now-smaller
18404  // parent split, but the OSD will always send us a split for every new
18405  // child.
18406 
18407  spg_t pgid, dest_pgid;
18408  bool is_pg = cid.is_pg(&pgid);
18409  ceph_assert(is_pg);
18410  is_pg = d->cid.is_pg(&dest_pgid);
18411  ceph_assert(is_pg);
18412 
18413  // adjust bits. note that this will be redundant for all but the first
18414  // merge call for the parent/target.
18415  d->cnode.bits = bits;
18416 
18417  // behavior depends on target (d) bits, so this after that is updated.
18418  (*c)->split_cache(d.get());
18419 
18420  // remove source collection
18421  {
18422  std::unique_lock l3(coll_lock);
18423  _do_remove_collection(txc, c);
18424  }
18425 
18426  r = 0;
18427 
18428  bufferlist bl;
18429  encode(d->cnode, bl);
18430  txc->t->set(PREFIX_COLL, stringify(d->cid), bl);
18431 
18432  dout(10) << __func__ << " " << cid << " to " << d->cid << " "
18433  << " bits " << bits << " = " << r << dendl;
18434  return r;
18435 }
18436 
18437 void BlueStore::log_latency(
18438  const char* name,
18439  int idx,
18440  const ceph::timespan& l,
18441  double lat_threshold,
18442  const char* info,
18443  int idx2) const
18444 {
18445  logger->tinc(idx, l);
18446  if (lat_threshold > 0.0 &&
18447  l >= make_timespan(lat_threshold)) {
18448  dout(0) << __func__ << " slow operation observed for " << name
18449  << ", latency = " << l
18450  << info
18451  << dendl;
18452  if (idx2 > l_bluestore_first && idx2 < l_bluestore_last) {
18453  logger->inc(idx2);
18454  }
18455  }
18456 }
18457 
18458 void BlueStore::log_latency_fn(
18459  const char* name,
18460  int idx,
18461  const ceph::timespan& l,
18462  double lat_threshold,
18463  std::function<string (const ceph::timespan& lat)> fn,
18464  int idx2) const
18465 {
18466  logger->tinc(idx, l);
18467  if (lat_threshold > 0.0 &&
18468  l >= make_timespan(lat_threshold)) {
18469  dout(0) << __func__ << " slow operation observed for " << name
18470  << ", latency = " << l
18471  << fn(l)
18472  << dendl;
18473  if (idx2 > l_bluestore_first && idx2 < l_bluestore_last) {
18474  logger->inc(idx2);
18475  }
18476  }
18477 }
18478 
18479 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
18480 void BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::emit_initial_tracepoint(
18481  KeyValueDB &db,
18482  TransContext &txc,
18483  mono_clock::time_point start_throttle_acquire)
18484 {
18485  pending_kv_ios += txc.ios;
18486  if (txc.deferred_txn) {
18487  pending_deferred_ios += txc.ios;
18488  }
18489 
18490  uint64_t started = 0;
18491  uint64_t completed = 0;
18492  if (should_trace(&started, &completed)) {
18493  txc.tracing = true;
18494  uint64_t rocksdb_base_level,
18495  rocksdb_estimate_pending_compaction_bytes,
18496  rocksdb_cur_size_all_mem_tables,
18497  rocksdb_compaction_pending,
18498  rocksdb_mem_table_flush_pending,
18499  rocksdb_num_running_compactions,
18500  rocksdb_num_running_flushes,
18501  rocksdb_actual_delayed_write_rate;
18502  db.get_property(
18503  "rocksdb.base-level",
18504  &rocksdb_base_level);
18505  db.get_property(
18506  "rocksdb.estimate-pending-compaction-bytes",
18507  &rocksdb_estimate_pending_compaction_bytes);
18508  db.get_property(
18509  "rocksdb.cur-size-all-mem-tables",
18510  &rocksdb_cur_size_all_mem_tables);
18511  db.get_property(
18512  "rocksdb.compaction-pending",
18513  &rocksdb_compaction_pending);
18514  db.get_property(
18515  "rocksdb.mem-table-flush-pending",
18516  &rocksdb_mem_table_flush_pending);
18517  db.get_property(
18518  "rocksdb.num-running-compactions",
18519  &rocksdb_num_running_compactions);
18520  db.get_property(
18521  "rocksdb.num-running-flushes",
18522  &rocksdb_num_running_flushes);
18523  db.get_property(
18524  "rocksdb.actual-delayed-write-rate",
18525  &rocksdb_actual_delayed_write_rate);
18526 
18527 
18528  tracepoint(
18529  bluestore,
18530  transaction_initial_state,
18531  txc.osr->get_sequencer_id(),
18532  txc.seq,
18533  throttle_bytes.get_current(),
18534  throttle_deferred_bytes.get_current(),
18535  pending_kv_ios,
18536  pending_deferred_ios,
18537  started,
18538  completed,
18539  ceph::to_seconds<double>(mono_clock::now() - start_throttle_acquire));
18540 
18541  tracepoint(
18542  bluestore,
18543  transaction_initial_state_rocksdb,
18544  txc.osr->get_sequencer_id(),
18545  txc.seq,
18546  rocksdb_base_level,
18547  rocksdb_estimate_pending_compaction_bytes,
18548  rocksdb_cur_size_all_mem_tables,
18549  rocksdb_compaction_pending,
18550  rocksdb_mem_table_flush_pending,
18551  rocksdb_num_running_compactions,
18552  rocksdb_num_running_flushes,
18553  rocksdb_actual_delayed_write_rate);
18554  }
18555 }
18556 #endif
18557 
18558 mono_clock::duration BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::log_state_latency(
18559  TransContext &txc, PerfCounters *logger, int state)
18560 {
18561  mono_clock::time_point now = mono_clock::now();
18562  mono_clock::duration lat = now - txc.last_stamp;
18563  logger->tinc(state, lat);
18564 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
18565  if (txc.tracing &&
18566  state >= l_bluestore_state_prepare_lat &&
18567  state <= l_bluestore_state_done_lat) {
18568  OID_ELAPSED("", lat.to_nsec() / 1000.0, txc.get_state_latency_name(state));
18569  tracepoint(
18570  bluestore,
18571  transaction_state_duration,
18572  txc.osr->get_sequencer_id(),
18573  txc.seq,
18574  state,
18575  ceph::to_seconds<double>(lat));
18576  }
18577 #endif
18578  txc.last_stamp = now;
18579  return lat;
18580 }
18581 
18582 bool BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::try_start_transaction(
18583  KeyValueDB &db,
18584  TransContext &txc,
18585  mono_clock::time_point start_throttle_acquire)
18586 {
18587  throttle_bytes.get(txc.cost);
18588 
18589  if (!txc.deferred_txn || throttle_deferred_bytes.get_or_fail(txc.cost)) {
18590  emit_initial_tracepoint(db, txc, start_throttle_acquire);
18591  return true;
18592  } else {
18593  return false;
18594  }
18595 }
18596 
18597 void BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::finish_start_transaction(
18598  KeyValueDB &db,
18599  TransContext &txc,
18600  mono_clock::time_point start_throttle_acquire)
18601 {
18602  ceph_assert(txc.deferred_txn);
18603  throttle_deferred_bytes.get(txc.cost);
18604  emit_initial_tracepoint(db, txc, start_throttle_acquire);
18605 }
18606 
18607 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
18608 void BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::complete_kv(TransContext &txc)
18609 {
18610  pending_kv_ios -= 1;
18611  ios_completed_since_last_traced++;
18612  if (txc.tracing) {
18613  tracepoint(
18614  bluestore,
18615  transaction_commit_latency,
18616  txc.osr->get_sequencer_id(),
18617  txc.seq,
18618  ceph::to_seconds<double>(mono_clock::now() - txc.start));
18619  }
18620 }
18621 #endif
18622 
18623 #if defined(WITH_LTTNG)
18624 void BlueStore::BlueStoreThrottle::complete(TransContext &txc)
18625 {
18626  if (txc.deferred_txn) {
18627  pending_deferred_ios -= 1;
18628  }
18629  if (txc.tracing) {
18630  mono_clock::time_point now = mono_clock::now();
18631  mono_clock::duration lat = now - txc.start;
18632  tracepoint(
18633  bluestore,
18634  transaction_total_duration,
18635  txc.osr->get_sequencer_id(),
18636  txc.seq,
18637  ceph::to_seconds<double>(lat));
18638  }
18639 }
18640 #endif
18641 
18642 const string prefix_onode = "o";
18643 const string prefix_onode_shard = "x";
18644 const string prefix_other = "Z";
18645 //Itrerates through the db and collects the stats
18646 void BlueStore::generate_db_histogram(Formatter *f)
18647 {
18648  //globals
18649  uint64_t num_onodes = 0;
18650  uint64_t num_shards = 0;
18651  uint64_t num_super = 0;
18652  uint64_t num_coll = 0;
18653  uint64_t num_omap = 0;
18654  uint64_t num_pgmeta_omap = 0;
18655  uint64_t num_deferred = 0;
18656  uint64_t num_alloc = 0;
18657  uint64_t num_stat = 0;
18658  uint64_t num_others = 0;
18659  uint64_t num_shared_shards = 0;
18660  size_t max_key_size =0, max_value_size = 0;
18661  uint64_t total_key_size = 0, total_value_size = 0;
18662  size_t key_size = 0, value_size = 0;
18663  KeyValueHistogram hist;
18664 
18665  auto start = coarse_mono_clock::now();
18666 
18667  KeyValueDB::WholeSpaceIterator iter = db->get_wholespace_iterator();
18668  iter->seek_to_first();
18669  while (iter->valid()) {
18670  dout(30) << __func__ << " Key: " << iter->key() << dendl;
18671  key_size = iter->key_size();
18672  value_size = iter->value_size();
18673  hist.value_hist[hist.get_value_slab(value_size)]++;
18674  max_key_size = std::max(max_key_size, key_size);
18675  max_value_size = std::max(max_value_size, value_size);
18676  total_key_size += key_size;
18677  total_value_size += value_size;
18678 
18679  pair<string,string> key(iter->raw_key());
18680 
18681  if (key.first == PREFIX_SUPER) {
18682  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_SUPER, key_size, value_size);
18683  num_super++;
18684  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_STAT) {
18685  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_STAT, key_size, value_size);
18686  num_stat++;
18687  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_COLL) {
18688  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_COLL, key_size, value_size);
18689  num_coll++;
18690  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_OBJ) {
18691  if (key.second.back() == ONODE_KEY_SUFFIX) {
18692  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, prefix_onode, key_size, value_size);
18693  num_onodes++;
18694  } else {
18695  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, prefix_onode_shard, key_size, value_size);
18696  num_shards++;
18697  }
18698  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_OMAP) {
18699  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_OMAP, key_size, value_size);
18700  num_omap++;
18701  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP) {
18702  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_PERPOOL_OMAP, key_size, value_size);
18703  num_omap++;
18704  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP) {
18705  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_PERPG_OMAP, key_size, value_size);
18706  num_omap++;
18707  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_PGMETA_OMAP) {
18708  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_PGMETA_OMAP, key_size, value_size);
18709  num_pgmeta_omap++;
18710  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_DEFERRED) {
18711  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_DEFERRED, key_size, value_size);
18712  num_deferred++;
18713  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_ALLOC || key.first == PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP) {
18714  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_ALLOC, key_size, value_size);
18715  num_alloc++;
18716  } else if (key.first == PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB) {
18717  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key_size, value_size);
18718  num_shared_shards++;
18719  } else {
18720  hist.update_hist_entry(hist.key_hist, prefix_other, key_size, value_size);
18721  num_others++;
18722  }
18723  iter->next();
18724  }
18725 
18726  ceph::timespan duration = coarse_mono_clock::now() - start;
18727  f->open_object_section("rocksdb_key_value_stats");
18728  f->dump_unsigned("num_onodes", num_onodes);
18729  f->dump_unsigned("num_shards", num_shards);
18730  f->dump_unsigned("num_super", num_super);
18731  f->dump_unsigned("num_coll", num_coll);
18732  f->dump_unsigned("num_omap", num_omap);
18733  f->dump_unsigned("num_pgmeta_omap", num_pgmeta_omap);
18734  f->dump_unsigned("num_deferred", num_deferred);
18735  f->dump_unsigned("num_alloc", num_alloc);
18736  f->dump_unsigned("num_stat", num_stat);
18737  f->dump_unsigned("num_shared_shards", num_shared_shards);
18738  f->dump_unsigned("num_others", num_others);
18739  f->dump_unsigned("max_key_size", max_key_size);
18740  f->dump_unsigned("max_value_size", max_value_size);
18741  f->dump_unsigned("total_key_size", total_key_size);
18742  f->dump_unsigned("total_value_size", total_value_size);
18743  f->close_section();
18744 
18745  hist.dump(f);
18746 
18747  dout(20) << __func__ << " finished in " << duration << " seconds" << dendl;
18748 
18749 }
18750 
18751 void BlueStore::_shutdown_cache()
18752 {
18753  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
18754  for (auto i : buffer_cache_shards) {
18755  i->flush();
18756  ceph_assert(i->empty());
18757  }
18758  for (auto& p : coll_map) {
18759  p.second->onode_space.clear();
18760  if (!p.second->shared_blob_set.empty()) {
18761  derr << __func__ << " stray shared blobs on " << p.first << dendl;
18762  p.second->shared_blob_set.dump<0>(cct);
18763  }
18764  ceph_assert(p.second->onode_space.empty());
18765  ceph_assert(p.second->shared_blob_set.empty());
18766  }
18767  coll_map.clear();
18768  for (auto i : onode_cache_shards) {
18769  ceph_assert(i->empty());
18770  }
18771 }
18772 
18773 // For external caller.
18774 // We use a best-effort policy instead, e.g.,
18775 // we don't care if there are still some pinned onodes/data in the cache
18776 // after this command is completed.
18777 int BlueStore::flush_cache(ostream *os)
18778 {
18779  dout(10) << __func__ << dendl;
18780  for (auto i : onode_cache_shards) {
18781  i->flush();
18782  }
18783  for (auto i : buffer_cache_shards) {
18784  i->flush();
18785  }
18786 
18787  return 0;
18788 }
18789 
18790 void BlueStore::_apply_padding(uint64_t head_pad,
18791  uint64_t tail_pad,
18792  bufferlist& padded)
18793 {
18794  if (head_pad) {
18795  padded.prepend_zero(head_pad);
18796  }
18797  if (tail_pad) {
18798  padded.append_zero(tail_pad);
18799  }
18800  if (head_pad || tail_pad) {
18801  dout(20) << __func__ << " can pad head 0x" << std::hex << head_pad
18802  << " tail 0x" << tail_pad << std::dec << dendl;
18803  logger->inc(l_bluestore_write_pad_bytes, head_pad + tail_pad);
18804  }
18805 }
18806 
18807 void BlueStore::_record_onode(OnodeRef& o, KeyValueDB::Transaction &txn)
18808 {
18809  // finalize extent_map shards
18810  o->extent_map.update(txn, false);
18811  if (o->extent_map.needs_reshard()) {
18812  o->extent_map.reshard(db, txn);
18813  o->extent_map.update(txn, true);
18814  if (o->extent_map.needs_reshard()) {
18815  dout(20) << __func__ << " warning: still wants reshard, check options?"
18816  << dendl;
18817  o->extent_map.clear_needs_reshard();
18818  }
18819  logger->inc(l_bluestore_onode_reshard);
18820  }
18821 
18822  // bound encode
18823  size_t bound = 0;
18824  denc(o->onode, bound);
18825  o->extent_map.bound_encode_spanning_blobs(bound);
18826  if (o->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
18827  denc(o->extent_map.inline_bl, bound);
18828  }
18829 
18830  // encode
18831  bufferlist bl;
18832  unsigned onode_part, blob_part, extent_part;
18833  {
18834  auto p = bl.get_contiguous_appender(bound, true);
18835  denc(o->onode, p);
18836  onode_part = p.get_logical_offset();
18837  o->extent_map.encode_spanning_blobs(p);
18838  blob_part = p.get_logical_offset() - onode_part;
18839  if (o->onode.extent_map_shards.empty()) {
18840  denc(o->extent_map.inline_bl, p);
18841  }
18842  extent_part = p.get_logical_offset() - onode_part - blob_part;
18843  }
18844 
18845  dout(20) << __func__ << " onode " << o->oid << " is " << bl.length()
18846  << " (" << onode_part << " bytes onode + "
18847  << blob_part << " bytes spanning blobs + "
18848  << extent_part << " bytes inline extents)"
18849  << dendl;
18850 
18851 
18852  txn->set(PREFIX_OBJ, o->key.c_str(), o->key.size(), bl);
18853 }
18854 
18855 void BlueStore::_log_alerts(osd_alert_list_t& alerts)
18856 {
18857  std::lock_guard l(qlock);
18858  size_t used = bluefs && bluefs_layout.shared_bdev == BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW ?
18859  bluefs->get_used(BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW) : 0;
18860  if (used > 0) {
18861  auto db_used = bluefs->get_used(BlueFS::BDEV_DB);
18862  auto db_total = bluefs->get_total(BlueFS::BDEV_DB);
18863  ostringstream ss;
18864  ss << "spilled over " << byte_u_t(used)
18865  << " metadata from 'db' device (" << byte_u_t(db_used)
18866  << " used of " << byte_u_t(db_total) << ") to slow device";
18867  spillover_alert = ss.str();
18868  } else if (!spillover_alert.empty()){
18869  spillover_alert.clear();
18870  }
18871 
18872  if (!spurious_read_errors_alert.empty() &&
18873  cct->_conf->bluestore_warn_on_spurious_read_errors) {
18874  alerts.emplace(
18875  "BLUESTORE_SPURIOUS_READ_ERRORS",
18876  spurious_read_errors_alert);
18877  }
18878  if (!disk_size_mismatch_alert.empty()) {
18879  alerts.emplace(
18880  "BLUESTORE_DISK_SIZE_MISMATCH",
18881  disk_size_mismatch_alert);
18882  }
18883  if (!legacy_statfs_alert.empty()) {
18884  alerts.emplace(
18885  "BLUESTORE_LEGACY_STATFS",
18886  legacy_statfs_alert);
18887  }
18888  if (!spillover_alert.empty() &&
18889  cct->_conf->bluestore_warn_on_bluefs_spillover) {
18890  alerts.emplace(
18891  "BLUEFS_SPILLOVER",
18892  spillover_alert);
18893  }
18894  if (!no_per_pg_omap_alert.empty()) {
18895  alerts.emplace(
18896  "BLUESTORE_NO_PER_PG_OMAP",
18897  no_per_pg_omap_alert);
18898  }
18899  if (!no_per_pool_omap_alert.empty()) {
18900  alerts.emplace(
18901  "BLUESTORE_NO_PER_POOL_OMAP",
18902  no_per_pool_omap_alert);
18903  }
18904  string s0(failed_cmode);
18905 
18906  if (!failed_compressors.empty()) {
18907  if (!s0.empty()) {
18908  s0 += ", ";
18909  }
18910  s0 += "unable to load:";
18911  bool first = true;
18912  for (auto& s : failed_compressors) {
18913  if (first) {
18914  first = false;
18915  } else {
18916  s0 += ", ";
18917  }
18918  s0 += s;
18919  }
18920  alerts.emplace(
18921  "BLUESTORE_NO_COMPRESSION",
18922  s0);
18923  }
18924 }
18925 
18926 void BlueStore::_collect_allocation_stats(uint64_t need, uint32_t alloc_size,
18927  const PExtentVector& extents)
18928 {
18929  if (alloc_size != min_alloc_size) {
18930  alloc_stats_count++;
18931  alloc_stats_fragments += extents.size();
18932  alloc_stats_size += need;
18933  }
18934 
18935  for (auto& e : extents) {
18936  logger->hinc(l_bluestore_allocate_hist, e.length, need);
18937  }
18938 }
18939 
18940 void BlueStore::_record_allocation_stats()
18941 {
18942  // don't care about data consistency,
18943  // fields can be partially modified while making the tuple
18944  auto t0 = std::make_tuple(
18945  alloc_stats_count.exchange(0),
18946  alloc_stats_fragments.exchange(0),
18947  alloc_stats_size.exchange(0));
18948 
18949  dout(0) << " allocation stats probe "
18950  << probe_count << ":"
18951  << " cnt: " << std::get<0>(t0)
18952  << " frags: " << std::get<1>(t0)
18953  << " size: " << std::get<2>(t0)
18954  << dendl;
18955 
18956 
18957  //
18958  // Keep the history for probes from the power-of-two sequence:
18959  // -1, -2, -4, -8, -16
18960  //
18961  size_t base = 1;
18962  for (auto& t : alloc_stats_history) {
18963  dout(0) << " probe -"
18964  << base + (probe_count % base) << ": "
18965  << std::get<0>(t)
18966  << ", " << std::get<1>(t)
18967  << ", " << std::get<2>(t)
18968  << dendl;
18969  base <<= 1;
18970  }
18971  dout(0) << "------------" << dendl;
18972 
18973  ++ probe_count;
18974 
18975  for (ssize_t i = alloc_stats_history.size() - 1 ; i > 0 ; --i) {
18976  if ((probe_count % (1 << i)) == 0) {
18977  alloc_stats_history[i] = alloc_stats_history[i - 1];
18978  }
18979  }
18980  alloc_stats_history[0].swap(t0);
18981 }
18982 
18983 // ===========================================
18984 // BlueStoreRepairer
18985 
18986 size_t BlueStoreRepairer::StoreSpaceTracker::filter_out(
18987  const interval_set<uint64_t>& extents)
18988 {
18989  ceph_assert(granularity); // initialized
18990  // can't call for the second time
18991  ceph_assert(!was_filtered_out);
18992  ceph_assert(collections_bfs.size() == objects_bfs.size());
18993 
18994  uint64_t prev_pos = 0;
18995  uint64_t npos = collections_bfs.size();
18996 
18997  bloom_vector collections_reduced;
18998  bloom_vector objects_reduced;
18999 
19000  for (auto e : extents) {
19001  if (e.second == 0) {
19002  continue;
19003  }
19004  uint64_t pos = max(e.first / granularity, prev_pos);
19005  uint64_t end_pos = 1 + (e.first + e.second - 1) / granularity;
19006  while (pos != npos && pos < end_pos) {
19007  ceph_assert( collections_bfs[pos].element_count() ==
19008  objects_bfs[pos].element_count());
19009  if (collections_bfs[pos].element_count()) {
19010  collections_reduced.push_back(std::move(collections_bfs[pos]));
19011  objects_reduced.push_back(std::move(objects_bfs[pos]));
19012  }
19013  ++pos;
19014  }
19015  prev_pos = end_pos;
19016  }
19017  collections_reduced.swap(collections_bfs);
19018  objects_reduced.swap(objects_bfs);
19019  was_filtered_out = true;
19020  return collections_bfs.size();
19021 }
19022 
19023 bool BlueStoreRepairer::remove_key(KeyValueDB *db,
19024  const string& prefix,
19025  const string& key)
19026 {
19027  std::lock_guard l(lock);
19028  if (!remove_key_txn) {
19029  remove_key_txn = db->get_transaction();
19030  }
19031  ++to_repair_cnt;
19032  remove_key_txn->rmkey(prefix, key);
19033 
19034  return true;
19035 }
19036 
19037 void BlueStoreRepairer::fix_per_pool_omap(KeyValueDB *db, int val)
19038 {
19039  std::lock_guard l(lock); // possibly redundant
19040  ceph_assert(fix_per_pool_omap_txn == nullptr);
19041  fix_per_pool_omap_txn = db->get_transaction();
19042  ++to_repair_cnt;
19043  bufferlist bl;
19044  bl.append(stringify(val));
19045  fix_per_pool_omap_txn->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "per_pool_omap", bl);
19046 }
19047 
19048 bool BlueStoreRepairer::fix_shared_blob(
19049  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn,
19050  uint64_t sbid,
19051  bluestore_extent_ref_map_t* ref_map,
19052  size_t repaired)
19053 {
19054  string key;
19055  get_shared_blob_key(sbid, &key);
19056  if (ref_map) {
19057  bluestore_shared_blob_t persistent(sbid, std::move(*ref_map));
19058  bufferlist bl;
19059  encode(persistent, bl);
19060  txn->set(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key, bl);
19061  } else {
19062  txn->rmkey(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, key);
19063  }
19064  to_repair_cnt += repaired;
19065  return true;
19066 }
19067 
19068 bool BlueStoreRepairer::fix_statfs(KeyValueDB *db,
19069  const string& key,
19070  const store_statfs_t& new_statfs)
19071 {
19072  std::lock_guard l(lock);
19073  if (!fix_statfs_txn) {
19074  fix_statfs_txn = db->get_transaction();
19075  }
19076  BlueStore::volatile_statfs vstatfs;
19077  vstatfs = new_statfs;
19078  bufferlist bl;
19079  vstatfs.encode(bl);
19080  ++to_repair_cnt;
19081  fix_statfs_txn->set(PREFIX_STAT, key, bl);
19082  return true;
19083 }
19084 
19085 bool BlueStoreRepairer::fix_leaked(KeyValueDB *db,
19086  FreelistManager* fm,
19087  uint64_t offset, uint64_t len)
19088 {
19089  std::lock_guard l(lock);
19090  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
19091 
19092  if (!fix_fm_leaked_txn) {
19093  fix_fm_leaked_txn = db->get_transaction();
19094  }
19095  ++to_repair_cnt;
19096  fm->release(offset, len, fix_fm_leaked_txn);
19097  return true;
19098 }
19099 bool BlueStoreRepairer::fix_false_free(KeyValueDB *db,
19100  FreelistManager* fm,
19101  uint64_t offset, uint64_t len)
19102 {
19103  std::lock_guard l(lock);
19104  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
19105 
19106  if (!fix_fm_false_free_txn) {
19107  fix_fm_false_free_txn = db->get_transaction();
19108  }
19109  ++to_repair_cnt;
19110  fm->allocate(offset, len, fix_fm_false_free_txn);
19111  return true;
19112 }
19113 
19114 bool BlueStoreRepairer::fix_spanning_blobs(
19115  KeyValueDB* db,
19116  std::function<void(KeyValueDB::Transaction)> f)
19117 {
19118  std::lock_guard l(lock);
19119  if (!fix_onode_txn) {
19120  fix_onode_txn = db->get_transaction();
19121  }
19122  f(fix_onode_txn);
19123  ++to_repair_cnt;
19124  return true;
19125 }
19126 
19127 bool BlueStoreRepairer::preprocess_misreference(KeyValueDB *db)
19128 {
19129  //NB: not for use in multithreading mode!!!
19130  if (misreferenced_extents.size()) {
19131  size_t n = space_usage_tracker.filter_out(misreferenced_extents);
19132  ceph_assert(n > 0);
19133  if (!fix_misreferences_txn) {
19134  fix_misreferences_txn = db->get_transaction();
19135  }
19136  return true;
19137  }
19138  return false;
19139 }
19140 
19141 unsigned BlueStoreRepairer::apply(KeyValueDB* db)
19142 {
19143  //NB: not for use in multithreading mode!!!
19144  if (fix_per_pool_omap_txn) {
19145  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_per_pool_omap_txn) == 0;
19146  ceph_assert(ok);
19147  fix_per_pool_omap_txn = nullptr;
19148  }
19149  if (fix_fm_leaked_txn) {
19150  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_fm_leaked_txn) == 0;
19151  ceph_assert(ok);
19152  fix_fm_leaked_txn = nullptr;
19153  }
19154  if (fix_fm_false_free_txn) {
19155  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_fm_false_free_txn) == 0;
19156  ceph_assert(ok);
19157  fix_fm_false_free_txn = nullptr;
19158  }
19159  if (remove_key_txn) {
19160  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(remove_key_txn) == 0;
19161  ceph_assert(ok);
19162  remove_key_txn = nullptr;
19163  }
19164  if (fix_misreferences_txn) {
19165  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_misreferences_txn) == 0;
19166  ceph_assert(ok);
19167  fix_misreferences_txn = nullptr;
19168  }
19169  if (fix_onode_txn) {
19170  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_onode_txn) == 0;
19171  ceph_assert(ok);
19172  fix_onode_txn = nullptr;
19173  }
19174  if (fix_shared_blob_txn) {
19175  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_shared_blob_txn) == 0;
19176  ceph_assert(ok);
19177  fix_shared_blob_txn = nullptr;
19178  }
19179  if (fix_statfs_txn) {
19180  auto ok = db->submit_transaction_sync(fix_statfs_txn) == 0;
19181  ceph_assert(ok);
19182  fix_statfs_txn = nullptr;
19183  }
19184  if (need_compact) {
19185  db->compact();
19186  need_compact = false;
19187  }
19188  unsigned repaired = to_repair_cnt;
19189  to_repair_cnt = 0;
19190  return repaired;
19191 }
19192 
19193 // =======================================================
19194 // RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector
19195 
19196 uint8_t RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::select_prefer_bdev(void* h) {
19197  ceph_assert(h != nullptr);
19198  uint64_t hint = reinterpret_cast<uint64_t>(h);
19199  uint8_t res;
19200  switch (hint) {
19201  case LEVEL_SLOW:
19202  res = BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW;
19203  if (db_avail4slow > 0) {
19204  // considering statically available db space vs.
19205  // - observed maximums on DB dev for DB/WAL/UNSORTED data
19206  // - observed maximum spillovers
19207  uint64_t max_db_use = 0; // max db usage we potentially observed
19208  max_db_use += per_level_per_dev_max.at(BlueFS::BDEV_DB, LEVEL_LOG - LEVEL_FIRST);
19209  max_db_use += per_level_per_dev_max.at(BlueFS::BDEV_DB, LEVEL_WAL - LEVEL_FIRST);
19210  max_db_use += per_level_per_dev_max.at(BlueFS::BDEV_DB, LEVEL_DB - LEVEL_FIRST);
19211  // this could go to db hence using it in the estimation
19212  max_db_use += per_level_per_dev_max.at(BlueFS::BDEV_SLOW, LEVEL_DB - LEVEL_FIRST);
19213 
19214  auto db_total = l_totals[LEVEL_DB - LEVEL_FIRST];
19215  uint64_t avail = min(
19216  db_avail4slow,
19217  max_db_use < db_total ? db_total - max_db_use : 0);
19218 
19219  // considering current DB dev usage for SLOW data
19220  if (avail > per_level_per_dev_usage.at(BlueFS::BDEV_DB, LEVEL_SLOW - LEVEL_FIRST)) {
19221  res = BlueFS::BDEV_DB;
19222  }
19223  }
19224  break;
19225  case LEVEL_LOG:
19226  case LEVEL_WAL:
19227  res = BlueFS::BDEV_WAL;
19228  break;
19229  case LEVEL_DB:
19230  default:
19231  res = BlueFS::BDEV_DB;
19232  break;
19233  }
19234  return res;
19235 }
19236 
19237 void RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::get_paths(const std::string& base, paths& res) const
19238 {
19239  auto db_size = l_totals[LEVEL_DB - LEVEL_FIRST];
19240  res.emplace_back(base, db_size);
19241  auto slow_size = l_totals[LEVEL_SLOW - LEVEL_FIRST];
19242  if (slow_size == 0) {
19243  slow_size = db_size;
19244  }
19245  res.emplace_back(base + ".slow", slow_size);
19246 }
19247 
19248 void* RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::get_hint_by_dir(std::string_view dirname) const {
19249  uint8_t res = LEVEL_DB;
19250  if (dirname.length() > 5) {
19251  // the "db.slow" and "db.wal" directory names are hard-coded at
19252  // match up with bluestore. the slow device is always the second
19253  // one (when a dedicated block.db device is present and used at
19254  // bdev 0). the wal device is always last.
19255  if (boost::algorithm::ends_with(dirname, ".slow")) {
19256  res = LEVEL_SLOW;
19257  }
19258  else if (boost::algorithm::ends_with(dirname, ".wal")) {
19259  res = LEVEL_WAL;
19260  }
19261  }
19262  return reinterpret_cast<void*>(res);
19263 }
19264 
19265 void RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::dump(ostream& sout) {
19266  auto max_x = per_level_per_dev_usage.get_max_x();
19267  auto max_y = per_level_per_dev_usage.get_max_y();
19268 
19269  sout << "RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector Usage Matrix:" << std::endl;
19270  constexpr std::array<const char*, 8> names{ {
19271  "DEV/LEV",
19272  "WAL",
19273  "DB",
19274  "SLOW",
19275  "*",
19276  "*",
19277  "REAL",
19278  "FILES",
19279  } };
19280  const size_t width = 12;
19281  for (size_t i = 0; i < names.size(); ++i) {
19282  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19283  sout.width(width);
19284  sout << names[i];
19285  }
19286  sout << std::endl;
19287  for (size_t l = 0; l < max_y; l++) {
19288  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19289  sout.width(width);
19290  switch (l + LEVEL_FIRST) {
19291  case LEVEL_LOG:
19292  sout << "LOG"; break;
19293  case LEVEL_WAL:
19294  sout << "WAL"; break;
19295  case LEVEL_DB:
19296  sout << "DB"; break;
19297  case LEVEL_SLOW:
19298  sout << "SLOW"; break;
19299  case LEVEL_MAX:
19300  sout << "TOTAL"; break;
19301  }
19302  for (size_t d = 0; d < max_x; d++) {
19303  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19304  sout.width(width);
19305  sout << stringify(byte_u_t(per_level_per_dev_usage.at(d, l)));
19306  }
19307  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19308  sout.width(width);
19309  sout << stringify(per_level_files[l]) << std::endl;
19310  }
19311  ceph_assert(max_x == per_level_per_dev_max.get_max_x());
19312  ceph_assert(max_y == per_level_per_dev_max.get_max_y());
19313  sout << "MAXIMUMS:" << std::endl;
19314  for (size_t l = 0; l < max_y; l++) {
19315  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19316  sout.width(width);
19317  switch (l + LEVEL_FIRST) {
19318  case LEVEL_LOG:
19319  sout << "LOG"; break;
19320  case LEVEL_WAL:
19321  sout << "WAL"; break;
19322  case LEVEL_DB:
19323  sout << "DB"; break;
19324  case LEVEL_SLOW:
19325  sout << "SLOW"; break;
19326  case LEVEL_MAX:
19327  sout << "TOTAL"; break;
19328  }
19329  for (size_t d = 0; d < max_x - 1; d++) {
19330  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19331  sout.width(width);
19332  sout << stringify(byte_u_t(per_level_per_dev_max.at(d, l)));
19333  }
19334  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19335  sout.width(width);
19336  sout << stringify(byte_u_t(per_level_per_dev_max.at(max_x - 1, l)));
19337  sout << std::endl;
19338  }
19339  string sizes[] = {
19340  ">> SIZE <<",
19341  stringify(byte_u_t(l_totals[LEVEL_WAL - LEVEL_FIRST])),
19342  stringify(byte_u_t(l_totals[LEVEL_DB - LEVEL_FIRST])),
19343  stringify(byte_u_t(l_totals[LEVEL_SLOW - LEVEL_FIRST])),
19344  };
19345  for (size_t i = 0; i < (sizeof(sizes) / sizeof(sizes[0])); i++) {
19346  sout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
19347  sout.width(width);
19348  sout << sizes[i];
19349  }
19350  sout << std::endl;
19351 }
19352 
19353 BlueFSVolumeSelector* RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::clone_empty() const {
19354  RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector* ns =
19355  new RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector(0, 0, 0,
19356  0, 0, 0,
19357  0, 0, false);
19358  return ns;
19359 }
19360 
19361 bool RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector::compare(BlueFSVolumeSelector* other) {
19362  RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector* o = dynamic_cast<RocksDBBlueFSVolumeSelector*>(other);
19363  ceph_assert(o);
19364  bool equal = true;
19365  for (size_t x = 0; x < BlueFS::MAX_BDEV + 1; x++) {
19366  for (size_t y = 0; y <LEVEL_MAX - LEVEL_FIRST + 1; y++) {
19367  equal &= (per_level_per_dev_usage.at(x, y) == o->per_level_per_dev_usage.at(x, y));
19368  }
19369  }
19370  for (size_t t = 0; t < LEVEL_MAX - LEVEL_FIRST + 1; t++) {
19371  equal &= (per_level_files[t] == o->per_level_files[t]);
19372  }
19373  return equal;
19374 }
19375 
19376 // =======================================================
19377 
19378 //================================================================================================================
19379 // BlueStore is committing all allocation information (alloc/release) into RocksDB before the client Write is performed.
19380 // This cause a delay in write path and add significant load to the CPU/Memory/Disk.
19381 // The reason for the RocksDB updates is that it allows Ceph to survive any failure without losing the allocation state.
19382 //
19383 // We changed the code skiping RocksDB updates on allocation time and instead performing a full desatge of the allocator object
19384 // with all the OSD allocation state in a single step during umount().
19385 // This change leads to a 25% increase in IOPS and reduced latency in small random-write workload, but exposes the system
19386 // to losing allocation info in failure cases where we don't call umount.
19387 // We add code to perform a full allocation-map rebuild from information stored inside the ONode which is used in failure cases.
19388 // When we perform a graceful shutdown there is no need for recovery and we simply read the allocation-map from a flat file
19389 // where we store the allocation-map during umount().
19390 //================================================================================================================
19391 
19392 #undef dout_prefix
19393 #define dout_prefix *_dout << "bluestore::NCB::" << __func__ << "::"
19394 
19395 static const std::string allocator_dir = "ALLOCATOR_NCB_DIR";
19396 static const std::string allocator_file = "ALLOCATOR_NCB_FILE";
19397 static uint32_t s_format_version = 0x01; // support future changes to allocator-map file
19398 static uint32_t s_serial = 0x01;
19399 
19400 #if 1
19401 #define CEPHTOH_32 le32toh
19402 #define CEPHTOH_64 le64toh
19403 #define HTOCEPH_32 htole32
19404 #define HTOCEPH_64 htole64
19405 #else
19406 // help debug the encode/decode by forcing alien format
19407 #define CEPHTOH_32 be32toh
19408 #define CEPHTOH_64 be64toh
19409 #define HTOCEPH_32 htobe32
19410 #define HTOCEPH_64 htobe64
19411 #endif
19412 
19413 // 48 Bytes header for on-disk alloator image
19414 const uint64_t ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE = 0x1FACE0FF;
19415 struct allocator_image_header {
19416  uint32_t format_version; // 0x00
19417  uint32_t valid_signature; // 0x04
19418  utime_t timestamp; // 0x08
19419  uint32_t serial; // 0x10
19420  uint32_t pad[0x7]; // 0x14
19421 
19422  allocator_image_header() {
19423  memset((char*)this, 0, sizeof(allocator_image_header));
19424  }
19425 
19426  // create header in CEPH format
19427  allocator_image_header(utime_t timestamp, uint32_t format_version, uint32_t serial) {
19428  this->format_version = format_version;
19429  this->timestamp = timestamp;
19430  this->valid_signature = ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE;
19431  this->serial = serial;
19432  memset(this->pad, 0, sizeof(this->pad));
19433  }
19434 
19435  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const allocator_image_header& header) {
19436  out << "format_version = " << header.format_version << std::endl;
19437  out << "valid_signature = " << header.valid_signature << "/" << ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE << std::endl;
19438  out << "timestamp = " << header.timestamp << std::endl;
19439  out << "serial = " << header.serial << std::endl;
19440  for (unsigned i = 0; i < sizeof(header.pad)/sizeof(uint32_t); i++) {
19441  if (header.pad[i]) {
19442  out << "header.pad[" << i << "] = " << header.pad[i] << std::endl;
19443  }
19444  }
19445  return out;
19446  }
19447 
19448  DENC(allocator_image_header, v, p) {
19449  denc(v.format_version, p);
19450  denc(v.valid_signature, p);
19451  denc(v.timestamp.tv.tv_sec, p);
19452  denc(v.timestamp.tv.tv_nsec, p);
19453  denc(v.serial, p);
19454  for (auto& pad: v.pad) {
19455  denc(pad, p);
19456  }
19457  }
19458 
19459 
19460  int verify(CephContext* cct, const std::string &path) {
19461  if (valid_signature == ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE) {
19462  for (unsigned i = 0; i < (sizeof(pad) / sizeof(uint32_t)); i++) {
19463  if (this->pad[i]) {
19464  derr << "Illegal Header - pad[" << i << "]="<< pad[i] << dendl;
19465  return -1;
19466  }
19467  }
19468  return 0;
19469  }
19470  else {
19471  derr << "Illegal Header - signature="<< valid_signature << "(" << ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE << ")" << dendl;
19472  return -1;
19473  }
19474  }
19475 };
19476 WRITE_CLASS_DENC(allocator_image_header)
19477 
19478 // 56 Bytes trailer for on-disk alloator image
19479 struct allocator_image_trailer {
19480  extent_t null_extent; // 0x00
19481 
19482  uint32_t format_version; // 0x10
19483  uint32_t valid_signature; // 0x14
19484 
19485  utime_t timestamp; // 0x18
19486 
19487  uint32_t serial; // 0x20
19488  uint32_t pad; // 0x24
19489  uint64_t entries_count; // 0x28
19490  uint64_t allocation_size; // 0x30
19491 
19492  // trailer is created in CEPH format
19493  allocator_image_trailer(utime_t timestamp, uint32_t format_version, uint32_t serial, uint64_t entries_count, uint64_t allocation_size) {
19494  memset((char*)&(this->null_extent), 0, sizeof(this->null_extent));
19495  this->format_version = format_version;
19496  this->valid_signature = ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE;
19497  this->timestamp = timestamp;
19498  this->serial = serial;
19499  this->pad = 0;
19500  this->entries_count = entries_count;
19501  this->allocation_size = allocation_size;
19502  }
19503 
19504  allocator_image_trailer() {
19505  memset((char*)this, 0, sizeof(allocator_image_trailer));
19506  }
19507 
19508  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const allocator_image_trailer& trailer) {
19509  if (trailer.null_extent.offset || trailer.null_extent.length) {
19510  out << "trailer.null_extent.offset = " << trailer.null_extent.offset << std::endl;
19511  out << "trailer.null_extent.length = " << trailer.null_extent.length << std::endl;
19512  }
19513  out << "format_version = " << trailer.format_version << std::endl;
19514  out << "valid_signature = " << trailer.valid_signature << "/" << ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE << std::endl;
19515  out << "timestamp = " << trailer.timestamp << std::endl;
19516  out << "serial = " << trailer.serial << std::endl;
19517  if (trailer.pad) {
19518  out << "trailer.pad= " << trailer.pad << std::endl;
19519  }
19520  out << "entries_count = " << trailer.entries_count << std::endl;
19521  out << "allocation_size = " << trailer.allocation_size << std::endl;
19522  return out;
19523  }
19524 
19525  int verify(CephContext* cct, const std::string &path, const allocator_image_header *p_header, uint64_t entries_count, uint64_t allocation_size) {
19526  if (valid_signature == ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE) {
19527 
19528  // trailer must starts with null extents (both fields set to zero) [no need to convert formats for zero)
19529  if (null_extent.offset || null_extent.length) {
19530  derr << "illegal trailer - null_extent = [" << null_extent.offset << "," << null_extent.length << "]"<< dendl;
19531  return -1;
19532  }
19533 
19534  if (serial != p_header->serial) {
19535  derr << "Illegal trailer: header->serial(" << p_header->serial << ") != trailer->serial(" << serial << ")" << dendl;
19536  return -1;
19537  }
19538 
19539  if (format_version != p_header->format_version) {
19540  derr << "Illegal trailer: header->format_version(" << p_header->format_version
19541  << ") != trailer->format_version(" << format_version << ")" << dendl;
19542  return -1;
19543  }
19544 
19545  if (timestamp != p_header->timestamp) {
19546  derr << "Illegal trailer: header->timestamp(" << p_header->timestamp
19547  << ") != trailer->timestamp(" << timestamp << ")" << dendl;
19548  return -1;
19549  }
19550 
19551  if (this->entries_count != entries_count) {
19552  derr << "Illegal trailer: entries_count(" << entries_count << ") != trailer->entries_count("
19553  << this->entries_count << ")" << dendl;
19554  return -1;
19555  }
19556 
19557  if (this->allocation_size != allocation_size) {
19558  derr << "Illegal trailer: allocation_size(" << allocation_size << ") != trailer->allocation_size("
19559  << this->allocation_size << ")" << dendl;
19560  return -1;
19561  }
19562 
19563  if (pad) {
19564  derr << "Illegal Trailer - pad="<< pad << dendl;
19565  return -1;
19566  }
19567 
19568  // if arrived here -> trailer is valid !!
19569  return 0;
19570  } else {
19571  derr << "Illegal Trailer - signature="<< valid_signature << "(" << ALLOCATOR_IMAGE_VALID_SIGNATURE << ")" << dendl;
19572  return -1;
19573  }
19574  }
19575 
19576  DENC(allocator_image_trailer, v, p) {
19577  denc(v.null_extent.offset, p);
19578  denc(v.null_extent.length, p);
19579  denc(v.format_version, p);
19580  denc(v.valid_signature, p);
19581  denc(v.timestamp.tv.tv_sec, p);
19582  denc(v.timestamp.tv.tv_nsec, p);
19583  denc(v.serial, p);
19584  denc(v.pad, p);
19585  denc(v.entries_count, p);
19586  denc(v.allocation_size, p);
19587  }
19588 };
19589 WRITE_CLASS_DENC(allocator_image_trailer)
19590 
19591 
19592 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19593 // invalidate old allocation file if exists so will go directly to recovery after failure
19594 // we can safely ignore non-existing file
19595 int BlueStore::invalidate_allocation_file_on_bluefs()
19596 {
19597  // mark that allocation-file was invalidated and we should destage a new copy whne closing db
19598  need_to_destage_allocation_file = true;
19599  dout(10) << __func__ << " need_to_destage_allocation_file was set" << dendl;
19600 
19601  BlueFS::FileWriter *p_handle = nullptr;
19602  if (!bluefs->dir_exists(allocator_dir)) {
19603  dout(5) << "allocator_dir(" << allocator_dir << ") doesn't exist" << dendl;
19604  // nothing to do -> return
19605  return 0;
19606  }
19607 
19608  int ret = bluefs->stat(allocator_dir, allocator_file, nullptr, nullptr);
19609  if (ret != 0) {
19610  dout(5) << __func__ << " allocator_file(" << allocator_file << ") doesn't exist" << dendl;
19611  // nothing to do -> return
19612  return 0;
19613  }
19614 
19615 
19616  ret = bluefs->open_for_write(allocator_dir, allocator_file, &p_handle, true);
19617  if (ret != 0) {
19618  derr << __func__ << "::NCB:: Failed open_for_write with error-code "
19619  << ret << dendl;
19620  return -1;
19621  }
19622 
19623  dout(5) << "invalidate using bluefs->truncate(p_handle, 0)" << dendl;
19624  ret = bluefs->truncate(p_handle, 0);
19625  if (ret != 0) {
19626  derr << __func__ << "::NCB:: Failed truncaste with error-code "
19627  << ret << dendl;
19628  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
19629  return -1;
19630  }
19631 
19632  bluefs->fsync(p_handle);
19633  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
19634 
19635  return 0;
19636 }
19637 
19638 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19639 int BlueStore::copy_allocator(Allocator* src_alloc, Allocator* dest_alloc, uint64_t* p_num_entries)
19640 {
19641  *p_num_entries = 0;
19642  auto count_entries = [&](uint64_t extent_offset, uint64_t extent_length) {
19643  (*p_num_entries)++;
19644  };
19645  src_alloc->foreach(count_entries);
19646 
19647  dout(5) << "count num_entries=" << *p_num_entries << dendl;
19648 
19649  // add 16K extra entries in case new allocation happened
19650  (*p_num_entries) += 16*1024;
19651  unique_ptr<extent_t[]> arr;
19652  try {
19653  arr = make_unique<extent_t[]>(*p_num_entries);
19654  } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
19655  derr << "****Failed dynamic allocation, num_entries=" << *p_num_entries << dendl;
19656  return -1;
19657  }
19658 
19659  uint64_t idx = 0;
19660  auto copy_entries = [&](uint64_t extent_offset, uint64_t extent_length) {
19661  if (extent_length > 0) {
19662  if (idx < *p_num_entries) {
19663  arr[idx] = {extent_offset, extent_length};
19664  }
19665  idx++;
19666  }
19667  else {
19668  derr << "zero length extent!!! offset=" << extent_offset << ", index=" << idx << dendl;
19669  }
19670  };
19671  src_alloc->foreach(copy_entries);
19672 
19673  dout(5) << "copy num_entries=" << idx << dendl;
19674  if (idx > *p_num_entries) {
19675  derr << "****spillover, num_entries=" << *p_num_entries << ", spillover=" << (idx - *p_num_entries) << dendl;
19676  ceph_assert(idx <= *p_num_entries);
19677  }
19678 
19679  *p_num_entries = idx;
19680 
19681  for (idx = 0; idx < *p_num_entries; idx++) {
19682  const extent_t *p_extent = &arr[idx];
19683  dest_alloc->init_add_free(p_extent->offset, p_extent->length);
19684  }
19685 
19686  return 0;
19687 }
19688 
19689 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19690 static uint32_t flush_extent_buffer_with_crc(BlueFS::FileWriter *p_handle, const char* buffer, const char *p_curr, uint32_t crc)
19691 {
19692  std::ptrdiff_t length = p_curr - buffer;
19693  p_handle->append(buffer, length);
19694 
19695  crc = ceph_crc32c(crc, (const uint8_t*)buffer, length);
19696  uint32_t encoded_crc = HTOCEPH_32(crc);
19697  p_handle->append((byte*)&encoded_crc, sizeof(encoded_crc));
19698 
19699  return crc;
19700 }
19701 
19702 const unsigned MAX_EXTENTS_IN_BUFFER = 4 * 1024; // 4K extents = 64KB of data
