19703 // write the allocator to a flat bluefs file - 4K extents at a time
19704 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19705 int BlueStore::store_allocator(Allocator* src_allocator)
19706 {
19707  // when storing allocations to file we must be sure there is no background compactions
19708  // the easiest way to achieve it is to make sure db is closed
19709  ceph_assert(db == nullptr);
19710  utime_t start_time = ceph_clock_now();
19711  int ret = 0;
19712 
19713  // create dir if doesn't exist already
19714  if (!bluefs->dir_exists(allocator_dir) ) {
19715  ret = bluefs->mkdir(allocator_dir);
19716  if (ret != 0) {
19717  derr << "Failed mkdir with error-code " << ret << dendl;
19718  return -1;
19719  }
19720  }
19721  bluefs->compact_log();
19722  // reuse previous file-allocation if exists
19723  ret = bluefs->stat(allocator_dir, allocator_file, nullptr, nullptr);
19724  bool overwrite_file = (ret == 0);
19725  BlueFS::FileWriter *p_handle = nullptr;
19726  ret = bluefs->open_for_write(allocator_dir, allocator_file, &p_handle, overwrite_file);
19727  if (ret != 0) {
19728  derr << __func__ << "Failed open_for_write with error-code " << ret << dendl;
19729  return -1;
19730  }
19731 
19732  uint64_t file_size = p_handle->file->fnode.size;
19733  uint64_t allocated = p_handle->file->fnode.get_allocated();
19734  dout(10) << "file_size=" << file_size << ", allocated=" << allocated << dendl;
19735 
19736  bluefs->sync_metadata(false);
19737  unique_ptr<Allocator> allocator(clone_allocator_without_bluefs(src_allocator));
19738  if (!allocator) {
19739  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
19740  return -1;
19741  }
19742 
19743  // store all extents (except for the bluefs extents we removed) in a single flat file
19744  utime_t timestamp = ceph_clock_now();
19745  uint32_t crc = -1;
19746  {
19747  allocator_image_header header(timestamp, s_format_version, s_serial);
19748  bufferlist header_bl;
19749  encode(header, header_bl);
19750  crc = header_bl.crc32c(crc);
19751  encode(crc, header_bl);
19752  p_handle->append(header_bl);
19753  }
19754 
19755  crc = -1; // reset crc
19756  extent_t buffer[MAX_EXTENTS_IN_BUFFER]; // 64KB
19757  extent_t *p_curr = buffer;
19758  const extent_t *p_end = buffer + MAX_EXTENTS_IN_BUFFER;
19759  uint64_t extent_count = 0;
19760  uint64_t allocation_size = 0;
19761  auto iterated_allocation = [&](uint64_t extent_offset, uint64_t extent_length) {
19762  if (extent_length == 0) {
19763  derr << __func__ << "" << extent_count << "::[" << extent_offset << "," << extent_length << "]" << dendl;
19764  ret = -1;
19765  return;
19766  }
19767  p_curr->offset = HTOCEPH_64(extent_offset);
19768  p_curr->length = HTOCEPH_64(extent_length);
19769  extent_count++;
19770  allocation_size += extent_length;
19771  p_curr++;
19772 
19773  if (p_curr == p_end) {
19774  crc = flush_extent_buffer_with_crc(p_handle, (const char*)buffer, (const char*)p_curr, crc);
19775  p_curr = buffer; // recycle the buffer
19776  }
19777  };
19778  allocator->foreach(iterated_allocation);
19779  // if got null extent -> fail the operation
19780  if (ret != 0) {
19781  derr << "Illegal extent, fail store operation" << dendl;
19782  derr << "invalidate using bluefs->truncate(p_handle, 0)" << dendl;
19783  bluefs->truncate(p_handle, 0);
19784  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
19785  return -1;
19786  }
19787 
19788  // if we got any leftovers -> add crc and append to file
19789  if (p_curr > buffer) {
19790  crc = flush_extent_buffer_with_crc(p_handle, (const char*)buffer, (const char*)p_curr, crc);
19791  }
19792 
19793  {
19794  allocator_image_trailer trailer(timestamp, s_format_version, s_serial, extent_count, allocation_size);
19795  bufferlist trailer_bl;
19796  encode(trailer, trailer_bl);
19797  uint32_t crc = -1;
19798  crc = trailer_bl.crc32c(crc);
19799  encode(crc, trailer_bl);
19800  p_handle->append(trailer_bl);
19801  }
19802 
19803  bluefs->fsync(p_handle);
19804  bluefs->truncate(p_handle, p_handle->pos);
19805  bluefs->fsync(p_handle);
19806 
19807  utime_t duration = ceph_clock_now() - start_time;
19808  dout(5) <<"WRITE-extent_count=" << extent_count << ", allocation_size=" << allocation_size << ", serial=" << s_serial << dendl;
19809  dout(5) <<"p_handle->pos=" << p_handle->pos << " WRITE-duration=" << duration << " seconds" << dendl;
19810 
19811  bluefs->close_writer(p_handle);
19812  need_to_destage_allocation_file = false;
19813  return 0;
19814 }
19815 
19816 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19817 Allocator* BlueStore::create_bitmap_allocator(uint64_t bdev_size) {
19818  // create allocator
19819  uint64_t alloc_size = min_alloc_size;
19820  Allocator* alloc = Allocator::create(cct, "bitmap", bdev_size, alloc_size,
19821  zone_size, first_sequential_zone,
19822  "recovery");
19823  if (alloc) {
19824  return alloc;
19825  } else {
19826  derr << "Failed Allocator Creation" << dendl;
19827  return nullptr;
19828  }
19829 }
19830 
19831 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19832 size_t calc_allocator_image_header_size()
19833 {
19834  utime_t timestamp = ceph_clock_now();
19835  allocator_image_header header(timestamp, s_format_version, s_serial);
19836  bufferlist header_bl;
19837  encode(header, header_bl);
19838  uint32_t crc = -1;
19839  crc = header_bl.crc32c(crc);
19840  encode(crc, header_bl);
19841 
19842  return header_bl.length();
19843 }
19844 
19845 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19846 int calc_allocator_image_trailer_size()
19847 {
19848  utime_t timestamp = ceph_clock_now();
19849  uint64_t extent_count = -1;
19850  uint64_t allocation_size = -1;
19851  uint32_t crc = -1;
19852  bufferlist trailer_bl;
19853  allocator_image_trailer trailer(timestamp, s_format_version, s_serial, extent_count, allocation_size);
19854 
19855  encode(trailer, trailer_bl);
19856  crc = trailer_bl.crc32c(crc);
19857  encode(crc, trailer_bl);
19858  return trailer_bl.length();
19859 }
19860 
19861 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
19862 int BlueStore::__restore_allocator(Allocator* allocator, uint64_t *num, uint64_t *bytes)
19863 {
19864  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_inject_allocation_from_file_failure > 0) {
19865  boost::mt11213b rng(time(NULL));
19866  boost::uniform_real<> ur(0, 1);
19867  if (ur(rng) < cct->_conf->bluestore_debug_inject_allocation_from_file_failure) {
19868  derr << __func__ << " failure injected." << dendl;
19869  return -1;
19870  }
19871  }
19872  utime_t start_time = ceph_clock_now();
19873  BlueFS::FileReader *p_temp_handle = nullptr;
19874  int ret = bluefs->open_for_read(allocator_dir, allocator_file, &p_temp_handle, false);
19875  if (ret != 0) {
19876  dout(1) << "Failed open_for_read with error-code " << ret << dendl;
19877  return -1;
19878  }
19879  unique_ptr<BlueFS::FileReader> p_handle(p_temp_handle);
19880  uint64_t read_alloc_size = 0;
19881  uint64_t file_size = p_handle->file->fnode.size;
19882  dout(5) << "file_size=" << file_size << ",sizeof(extent_t)=" << sizeof(extent_t) << dendl;
19883 
19884  // make sure we were able to store a valid copy
19885  if (file_size == 0) {
19886  dout(1) << "No Valid allocation info on disk (empty file)" << dendl;
19887  return -1;
19888  }
19889 
19890  // first read the header
19891  size_t offset = 0;
19892  allocator_image_header header;
19893  int header_size = calc_allocator_image_header_size();
19894  {
19895  bufferlist header_bl,temp_bl;
19896  int read_bytes = bluefs->read(p_handle.get(), offset, header_size, &temp_bl, nullptr);
19897  if (read_bytes != header_size) {
19898  derr << "Failed bluefs->read() for header::read_bytes=" << read_bytes << ", req_bytes=" << header_size << dendl;
19899  return -1;
19900  }
19901 
19902  offset += read_bytes;
19903 
19904  header_bl.claim_append(temp_bl);
19905  auto p = header_bl.cbegin();
19906  decode(header, p);
19907  if (header.verify(cct, path) != 0 ) {
19908  derr << "header = \n" << header << dendl;
19909  return -1;
19910  }
19911 
19912  uint32_t crc_calc = -1, crc;
19913  crc_calc = header_bl.cbegin().crc32c(p.get_off(), crc_calc); //crc from begin to current pos
19914  decode(crc, p);
19915  if (crc != crc_calc) {
19916  derr << "crc mismatch!!! crc=" << crc << ", crc_calc=" << crc_calc << dendl;
19917  derr << "header = \n" << header << dendl;
19918  return -1;
19919  }
19920 
19921  // increment version for next store
19922  s_serial = header.serial + 1;
19923  }
19924 
19925  // then read the payload (extents list) using a recycled buffer
19926  extent_t buffer[MAX_EXTENTS_IN_BUFFER]; // 64KB
19927  uint32_t crc = -1;
19928  int trailer_size = calc_allocator_image_trailer_size();
19929  uint64_t extent_count = 0;
19930  uint64_t extents_bytes_left = file_size - (header_size + trailer_size + sizeof(crc));
19931  while (extents_bytes_left) {
19932  int req_bytes = std::min(extents_bytes_left, static_cast<uint64_t>(sizeof(buffer)));
19933  int read_bytes = bluefs->read(p_handle.get(), offset, req_bytes, nullptr, (char*)buffer);
19934  if (read_bytes != req_bytes) {
19935  derr << "Failed bluefs->read()::read_bytes=" << read_bytes << ", req_bytes=" << req_bytes << dendl;
19936  return -1;
19937  }
19938 
19939  offset += read_bytes;
19940  extents_bytes_left -= read_bytes;
19941 
19942  const unsigned num_extent_in_buffer = read_bytes/sizeof(extent_t);
19943  const extent_t *p_end = buffer + num_extent_in_buffer;
19944  for (const extent_t *p_ext = buffer; p_ext < p_end; p_ext++) {
19945  uint64_t offset = CEPHTOH_64(p_ext->offset);
19946  uint64_t length = CEPHTOH_64(p_ext->length);
19947  read_alloc_size += length;
19948 
19949  if (length > 0) {
19950  allocator->init_add_free(offset, length);
19951  extent_count ++;
19952  } else {
19953  derr << "extent with zero length at idx=" << extent_count << dendl;
19954  return -1;
19955  }
19956  }
19957 
19958  uint32_t calc_crc = ceph_crc32c(crc, (const uint8_t*)buffer, read_bytes);
19959  read_bytes = bluefs->read(p_handle.get(), offset, sizeof(crc), nullptr, (char*)&crc);
19960  if (read_bytes == sizeof(crc) ) {
19961  crc = CEPHTOH_32(crc);
19962  if (crc != calc_crc) {
19963  derr << "data crc mismatch!!! crc=" << crc << ", calc_crc=" << calc_crc << dendl;
19964  derr << "extents_bytes_left=" << extents_bytes_left << ", offset=" << offset << ", extent_count=" << extent_count << dendl;
19965  return -1;
19966  }
19967 
19968  offset += read_bytes;
19969  if (extents_bytes_left) {
19970  extents_bytes_left -= read_bytes;
19971  }
19972  } else {
19973  derr << "Failed bluefs->read() for crc::read_bytes=" << read_bytes << ", req_bytes=" << sizeof(crc) << dendl;
19974  return -1;
19975  }
19976 
19977  }
19978 
19979  // finally, read the trailer and verify it is in good shape and that we got all the extents
19980  {
19981  bufferlist trailer_bl,temp_bl;
19982  int read_bytes = bluefs->read(p_handle.get(), offset, trailer_size, &temp_bl, nullptr);
19983  if (read_bytes != trailer_size) {
19984  derr << "Failed bluefs->read() for trailer::read_bytes=" << read_bytes << ", req_bytes=" << trailer_size << dendl;
19985  return -1;
19986  }
19987  offset += read_bytes;
19988 
19989  trailer_bl.claim_append(temp_bl);
19990  uint32_t crc_calc = -1;
19991  uint32_t crc;
19992  allocator_image_trailer trailer;
19993  auto p = trailer_bl.cbegin();
19994  decode(trailer, p);
19995  if (trailer.verify(cct, path, &header, extent_count, read_alloc_size) != 0 ) {
19996  derr << "trailer=\n" << trailer << dendl;
19997  return -1;
19998  }
19999 
20000  crc_calc = trailer_bl.cbegin().crc32c(p.get_off(), crc_calc); //crc from begin to current pos
20001  decode(crc, p);
20002  if (crc != crc_calc) {
20003  derr << "trailer crc mismatch!::crc=" << crc << ", crc_calc=" << crc_calc << dendl;
20004  derr << "trailer=\n" << trailer << dendl;
20005  return -1;
20006  }
20007  }
20008 
20009  utime_t duration = ceph_clock_now() - start_time;
20010  dout(5) << "READ--extent_count=" << extent_count << ", read_alloc_size= "
20011  << read_alloc_size << ", file_size=" << file_size << dendl;
20012  dout(5) << "READ duration=" << duration << " seconds, s_serial=" << header.serial << dendl;
20013  *num = extent_count;
20014  *bytes = read_alloc_size;
20015  return 0;
20016 }
20017 
20018 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20019 int BlueStore::restore_allocator(Allocator* dest_allocator, uint64_t *num, uint64_t *bytes)
20020 {
20021  utime_t start = ceph_clock_now();
20022  auto temp_allocator = unique_ptr<Allocator>(create_bitmap_allocator(bdev->get_size()));
20023  int ret = __restore_allocator(temp_allocator.get(), num, bytes);
20024  if (ret != 0) {
20025  return ret;
20026  }
20027 
20028  uint64_t num_entries = 0;
20029  dout(5) << " calling copy_allocator(bitmap_allocator -> shared_alloc.a)" << dendl;
20030  copy_allocator(temp_allocator.get(), dest_allocator, &num_entries);
20031  utime_t duration = ceph_clock_now() - start;
20032  dout(5) << "restored in " << duration << " seconds, num_entries=" << num_entries << dendl;
20033  return ret;
20034 }
20035 
20036 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20037 void BlueStore::set_allocation_in_simple_bmap(SimpleBitmap* sbmap, uint64_t offset, uint64_t length)
20038 {
20039  dout(30) << __func__ << " 0x" << std::hex
20040  << offset << "~" << length
20041  << " " << min_alloc_size_mask
20042  << dendl;
20043  ceph_assert((offset & min_alloc_size_mask) == 0);
20044  ceph_assert((length & min_alloc_size_mask) == 0);
20045  sbmap->set(offset >> min_alloc_size_order, length >> min_alloc_size_order);
20046 }
20047 
20048 void BlueStore::ExtentDecoderPartial::_consume_new_blob(bool spanning,
20049  uint64_t extent_no,
20050  uint64_t sbid,
20051  BlobRef b)
20052 {
20053  [[maybe_unused]] auto cct = store.cct;
20054  ceph_assert(per_pool_statfs);
20055  ceph_assert(oid != ghobject_t());
20056 
20057  auto &blob = b->get_blob();
20058  if(spanning) {
20059  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << spanning << " " << b->id << dendl;
20060  ceph_assert(b->id >= 0);
20061  spanning_blobs[b->id] = b;
20062  ++stats.spanning_blob_count;
20063  } else {
20064  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << spanning << " " << extent_no << dendl;
20065  blobs[extent_no] = b;
20066  }
20067  bool compressed = blob.is_compressed();
20068  if (!blob.is_shared()) {
20069  for (auto& pe : blob.get_extents()) {
20070  if (pe.offset == bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET) {
20071  ++stats.skipped_illegal_extent;
20072  continue;
20073  }
20074  store.set_allocation_in_simple_bmap(&sbmap, pe.offset, pe.length);
20075 
20076  per_pool_statfs->allocated() += pe.length;
20077  if (compressed) {
20078  per_pool_statfs->compressed_allocated() += pe.length;
20079  }
20080  }
20081  if (compressed) {
20082  per_pool_statfs->compressed() +=
20083  blob.get_compressed_payload_length();
20084  ++stats.compressed_blob_count;
20085  }
20086  } else {
20087  auto it = sb_info.find(sbid);
20088  if (it == sb_info.end()) {
20089  derr << __func__ << " shared blob not found:" << sbid
20090  << dendl;
20091  }
20092  auto &sbi = *it;
20093  auto pool_id = oid.hobj.get_logical_pool();
20094  if (sbi.pool_id == sb_info_t::INVALID_POOL_ID) {
20095  sbi.pool_id = pool_id;
20096  size_t alloc_delta = sbi.allocated_chunks << min_alloc_size_order;
20097  per_pool_statfs->allocated() += alloc_delta;
20098  if (compressed) {
20099  per_pool_statfs->compressed_allocated() += alloc_delta;
20100  ++stats.compressed_blob_count;
20101  }
20102  }
20103  if (compressed) {
20104  per_pool_statfs->compressed() +=
20105  blob.get_compressed_payload_length();
20106  }
20107  }
20108 }
20109 
20110 void BlueStore::ExtentDecoderPartial::consume_blobid(Extent* le,
20111  bool spanning,
20112  uint64_t blobid)
20113 {
20114  [[maybe_unused]] auto cct = store.cct;
20115  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << spanning << " " << blobid << dendl;
20116  auto &map = spanning ? spanning_blobs : blobs;
20117  auto it = map.find(blobid);
20118  ceph_assert(it != map.end());
20119  per_pool_statfs->stored() += le->length;
20120  if (it->second->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
20121  per_pool_statfs->compressed_original() += le->length;
20122  }
20123 }
20124 
20125 void BlueStore::ExtentDecoderPartial::consume_blob(Extent* le,
20126  uint64_t extent_no,
20127  uint64_t sbid,
20128  BlobRef b)
20129 {
20130  _consume_new_blob(false, extent_no, sbid, b);
20131  per_pool_statfs->stored() += le->length;
20132  if (b->get_blob().is_compressed()) {
20133  per_pool_statfs->compressed_original() += le->length;
20134  }
20135 }
20136 
20137 void BlueStore::ExtentDecoderPartial::consume_spanning_blob(uint64_t sbid,
20138  BlobRef b)
20139 {
20140  _consume_new_blob(true, 0/*doesn't matter*/, sbid, b);
20141 }
20142 
20143 void BlueStore::ExtentDecoderPartial::reset(const ghobject_t _oid,
20144  volatile_statfs* _per_pool_statfs)
20145 {
20146  oid = _oid;
20147  per_pool_statfs = _per_pool_statfs;
20148  blob_map_t empty;
20149  blob_map_t empty2;
20150  std::swap(blobs, empty);
20151  std::swap(spanning_blobs, empty2);
20152 }
20153 
20154 int BlueStore::read_allocation_from_onodes(SimpleBitmap *sbmap, read_alloc_stats_t& stats)
20155 {
20156  sb_info_space_efficient_map_t sb_info;
20157  // iterate over all shared blobs
20158  auto it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_SHARED_BLOB, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
20159  if (!it) {
20160  derr << "failed getting shared blob's iterator" << dendl;
20161  return -ENOENT;
20162  }
20163  if (it) {
20164  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next()) {
20165  const auto& key = it->key();
20166  dout(20) << __func__ << " decode sb " << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
20167  uint64_t sbid = 0;
20168  if (get_key_shared_blob(key, &sbid) != 0) {
20169  derr << __func__ << " bad shared blob key '" << pretty_binary_string(key)
20170  << "'" << dendl;
20171  }
20172  bluestore_shared_blob_t shared_blob(sbid);
20173  bufferlist bl = it->value();
20174  auto blp = bl.cbegin();
20175  try {
20176  decode(shared_blob, blp);
20177  }
20178  catch (ceph::buffer::error& e) {
20179  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode Shared Blob"
20180  << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
20181  continue;
20182  }
20183  dout(20) << __func__ << " " << shared_blob << dendl;
20184  uint64_t allocated = 0;
20185  for (auto& r : shared_blob.ref_map.ref_map) {
20186  ceph_assert(r.first != bluestore_pextent_t::INVALID_OFFSET);
20187  set_allocation_in_simple_bmap(sbmap, r.first, r.second.length);
20188  allocated += r.second.length;
20189  }
20190  auto &sbi = sb_info.add_or_adopt(sbid);
20191  ceph_assert(p2phase(allocated, min_alloc_size) == 0);
20192  sbi.allocated_chunks += (allocated >> min_alloc_size_order);
20193  ++stats.shared_blob_count;
20194  }
20195  }
20196 
20197  it = db->get_iterator(PREFIX_OBJ, KeyValueDB::ITERATOR_NOCACHE);
20198  if (!it) {
20199  derr << "failed getting onode's iterator" << dendl;
20200  return -ENOENT;
20201  }
20202 
20203  uint64_t kv_count = 0;
20204  uint64_t count_interval = 1'000'000;
20205  ExtentDecoderPartial edecoder(*this,
20206  stats,
20207  *sbmap,
20208  sb_info,
20209  min_alloc_size_order);
20210 
20211  // iterate over all ONodes stored in RocksDB
20212  for (it->lower_bound(string()); it->valid(); it->next(), kv_count++) {
20213  // trace an even after every million processed objects (typically every 5-10 seconds)
20214  if (kv_count && (kv_count % count_interval == 0) ) {
20215  dout(5) << __func__ << " processed objects count = " << kv_count << dendl;
20216  }
20217 
20218  auto key = it->key();
20219  auto okey = key;
20220  dout(20) << __func__ << " decode onode " << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
20221  ghobject_t oid;
20222  if (!is_extent_shard_key(it->key())) {
20223  int r = get_key_object(okey, &oid);
20224  if (r != 0) {
20225  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode onode key = "
20226  << pretty_binary_string(okey) << dendl;
20227  return -EIO;
20228  }
20229  edecoder.reset(oid,
20230  &stats.actual_pool_vstatfs[oid.hobj.get_logical_pool()]);
20231  Onode dummy_on(cct);
20232  Onode::decode_raw(&dummy_on,
20233  it->value(),
20234  edecoder);
20235  ++stats.onode_count;
20236  } else {
20237  uint32_t offset;
20238  int r = get_key_extent_shard(key, &okey, &offset);
20239  if (r != 0) {
20240  derr << __func__ << " failed to decode onode extent key = "
20241  << pretty_binary_string(key) << dendl;
20242  return -EIO;
20243  }
20244  r = get_key_object(okey, &oid);
20245  if (r != 0) {
20246  derr << __func__
20247  << " failed to decode onode key= " << pretty_binary_string(okey)
20248  << " from extent key= " << pretty_binary_string(key)
20249  << dendl;
20250  return -EIO;
20251  }
20252  ceph_assert(oid == edecoder.get_oid());
20253  edecoder.decode_some(it->value(), nullptr);
20254  ++stats.shard_count;
20255  }
20256  }
20257 
20258  std::lock_guard l(vstatfs_lock);
20259  store_statfs_t s;
20260  osd_pools.clear();
20261  for (auto& p : stats.actual_pool_vstatfs) {
20262  if (per_pool_stat_collection) {
20263  osd_pools[p.first] = p.second;
20264  }
20265  stats.actual_store_vstatfs += p.second;
20266  p.second.publish(&s);
20267  dout(5) << __func__ << " recovered pool "
20268  << std::hex
20269  << p.first << "->" << s
20270  << std::dec
20271  << " per-pool:" << per_pool_stat_collection
20272  << dendl;
20273  }
20274  vstatfs = stats.actual_store_vstatfs;
20275  vstatfs.publish(&s);
20276  dout(5) << __func__ << " recovered " << s
20277  << dendl;
20278  return 0;
20279 }
20280 
20281 //---------------------------------------------------------
20282 int BlueStore::reconstruct_allocations(SimpleBitmap *sbmap, read_alloc_stats_t &stats)
20283 {
20284  // first set space used by superblock
20285  auto super_length = std::max<uint64_t>(min_alloc_size, DB_SUPER_RESERVED);
20286  set_allocation_in_simple_bmap(sbmap, 0, super_length);
20287  stats.extent_count++;
20288 
20289  // then set all space taken by Objects
20290  int ret = read_allocation_from_onodes(sbmap, stats);
20291  if (ret < 0) {
20292  derr << "failed read_allocation_from_onodes()" << dendl;
20293  return ret;
20294  }
20295 
20296  return 0;
20297 }
20298 
20299 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20300 static void copy_simple_bitmap_to_allocator(SimpleBitmap* sbmap, Allocator* dest_alloc, uint64_t alloc_size)
20301 {
20302  int alloc_size_shift = std::countr_zero(alloc_size);
20303  uint64_t offset = 0;
20304  extent_t ext = sbmap->get_next_clr_extent(offset);
20305  while (ext.length != 0) {
20306  dest_alloc->init_add_free(ext.offset << alloc_size_shift, ext.length << alloc_size_shift);
20307  offset = ext.offset + ext.length;
20308  ext = sbmap->get_next_clr_extent(offset);
20309  }
20310 }
20311 
20312 //---------------------------------------------------------
20313 int BlueStore::read_allocation_from_drive_on_startup()
20314 {
20315  int ret = 0;
20316 
20317  ret = _open_collections();
20318  if (ret < 0) {
20319  return ret;
20320  }
20321  auto shutdown_cache = make_scope_guard([&] {
20322  _shutdown_cache();
20323  });
20324 
20325  utime_t start = ceph_clock_now();
20326  read_alloc_stats_t stats = {};
20327  SimpleBitmap sbmap(cct, (bdev->get_size()/ min_alloc_size));
20328  ret = reconstruct_allocations(&sbmap, stats);
20329  if (ret != 0) {
20330  return ret;
20331  }
20332 
20333  copy_simple_bitmap_to_allocator(&sbmap, alloc, min_alloc_size);
20334 
20335  utime_t duration = ceph_clock_now() - start;
20336  dout(1) << "::Allocation Recovery was completed in " << duration << " seconds, extent_count=" << stats.extent_count << dendl;
20337  return ret;
20338 }
20339 
20340 
20341 
20342 
20343 // Only used for debugging purposes - we build a secondary allocator from the Onodes and compare it to the existing one
20344 // Not meant to be run by customers
20345 #ifdef CEPH_BLUESTORE_TOOL_RESTORE_ALLOCATION
20346 
20347 //---------------------------------------------------------
20348 int cmpfunc (const void * a, const void * b)
20349 {
20350  if ( ((extent_t*)a)->offset > ((extent_t*)b)->offset ) {
20351  return 1;
20352  }
20353  else if( ((extent_t*)a)->offset < ((extent_t*)b)->offset ) {
20354  return -1;
20355  }
20356  else {
20357  return 0;
20358  }
20359 }
20360 
20361 // compare the allocator built from Onodes with the system allocator (CF-B)
20362 //---------------------------------------------------------
20363 int BlueStore::compare_allocators(Allocator* alloc1, Allocator* alloc2, uint64_t req_extent_count, uint64_t memory_target)
20364 {
20365  uint64_t allocation_size = std::min((req_extent_count) * sizeof(extent_t), memory_target / 3);
20366  uint64_t extent_count = allocation_size/sizeof(extent_t);
20367  dout(5) << "req_extent_count=" << req_extent_count << ", granted extent_count="<< extent_count << dendl;
20368 
20369  unique_ptr<extent_t[]> arr1;
20370  unique_ptr<extent_t[]> arr2;
20371  try {
20372  arr1 = make_unique<extent_t[]>(extent_count);
20373  arr2 = make_unique<extent_t[]>(extent_count);
20374  } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
20375  derr << "****Failed dynamic allocation, extent_count=" << extent_count << dendl;
20376  return -1;
20377  }
20378 
20379  // copy the extents from the allocators into simple array and then compare them
20380  uint64_t size1 = 0, size2 = 0;
20381  uint64_t idx1 = 0, idx2 = 0;
20382  auto iterated_mapper1 = [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
20383  size1 += length;
20384  if (idx1 < extent_count) {
20385  arr1[idx1++] = {offset, length};
20386  }
20387  else if (idx1 == extent_count) {
20388  derr << "(2)compare_allocators:: spillover" << dendl;
20389  idx1 ++;
20390  }
20391 
20392  };
20393 
20394  auto iterated_mapper2 = [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
20395  size2 += length;
20396  if (idx2 < extent_count) {
20397  arr2[idx2++] = {offset, length};
20398  }
20399  else if (idx2 == extent_count) {
20400  derr << "(2)compare_allocators:: spillover" << dendl;
20401  idx2 ++;
20402  }
20403  };
20404 
20405  alloc1->foreach(iterated_mapper1);
20406  alloc2->foreach(iterated_mapper2);
20407 
20408  qsort(arr1.get(), std::min(idx1, extent_count), sizeof(extent_t), cmpfunc);
20409  qsort(arr2.get(), std::min(idx2, extent_count), sizeof(extent_t), cmpfunc);
20410 
20411  if (idx1 == idx2) {
20412  idx1 = idx2 = std::min(idx1, extent_count);
20413  if (memcmp(arr1.get(), arr2.get(), sizeof(extent_t) * idx2) == 0) {
20414  return 0;
20415  }
20416  derr << "Failed memcmp(arr1, arr2, sizeof(extent_t)*idx2)" << dendl;
20417  for (uint64_t i = 0; i < idx1; i++) {
20418  if (memcmp(arr1.get()+i, arr2.get()+i, sizeof(extent_t)) != 0) {
20419  derr << "!!!![" << i << "] arr1::<" << arr1[i].offset << "," << arr1[i].length << ">" << dendl;
20420  derr << "!!!![" << i << "] arr2::<" << arr2[i].offset << "," << arr2[i].length << ">" << dendl;
20421  return -1;
20422  }
20423  }
20424  return 0;
20425  } else {
20426  derr << "mismatch:: idx1=" << idx1 << " idx2=" << idx2 << dendl;
20427  return -1;
20428  }
20429 }
20430 
20431 //---------------------------------------------------------
20432 int BlueStore::add_existing_bluefs_allocation(Allocator* allocator, read_alloc_stats_t &stats)
20433 {
20434  // then add space used by bluefs to store rocksdb
20435  unsigned extent_count = 0;
20436  if (bluefs) {
20437  bluefs->foreach_block_extents(
20438  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev,
20439  [&](uint64_t start, uint32_t len) {
20440  allocator->init_rm_free(start, len);
20441  stats.extent_count++;
20442  }
20443  );
20444  }
20445 
20446  dout(5) << "bluefs extent_count=" << extent_count << dendl;
20447  return 0;
20448 }
20449 
20450 //---------------------------------------------------------
20451 int BlueStore::read_allocation_from_drive_for_bluestore_tool()
20452 {
20453  dout(5) << __func__ << dendl;
20454  int ret = 0;
20455  uint64_t memory_target = cct->_conf.get_val<Option::size_t>("osd_memory_target");
20456  ret = _open_db_and_around(true, false);
20457  if (ret < 0) {
20458  return ret;
20459  }
20460 
20461  ret = _open_collections();
20462  if (ret < 0) {
20463  _close_db_and_around();
20464  return ret;
20465  }
20466 
20467  utime_t duration;
20468  read_alloc_stats_t stats = {};
20469  utime_t start = ceph_clock_now();
20470 
20471  auto shutdown_cache = make_scope_guard([&] {
20472  dout(1) << "Allocation Recovery was completed in " << duration
20473  << " seconds; insert_count=" << stats.insert_count
20474  << "; extent_count=" << stats.extent_count << dendl;
20475  _shutdown_cache();
20476  _close_db_and_around();
20477  });
20478 
20479  {
20480  auto allocator = unique_ptr<Allocator>(create_bitmap_allocator(bdev->get_size()));
20481  //reconstruct allocations into a temp simple-bitmap and copy into allocator
20482  {
20483  SimpleBitmap sbmap(cct, (bdev->get_size()/ min_alloc_size));
20484  ret = reconstruct_allocations(&sbmap, stats);
20485  if (ret != 0) {
20486  return ret;
20487  }
20488  copy_simple_bitmap_to_allocator(&sbmap, allocator.get(), min_alloc_size);
20489  }
20490 
20491  // add allocation space used by the bluefs itself
20492  ret = add_existing_bluefs_allocation(allocator.get(), stats);
20493  if (ret < 0) {
20494  return ret;
20495  }
20496 
20497  duration = ceph_clock_now() - start;
20498  stats.insert_count = 0;
20499  auto count_entries = [&](uint64_t extent_offset, uint64_t extent_length) {
20500  stats.insert_count++;
20501  };
20502  allocator->foreach(count_entries);
20503  ret = compare_allocators(allocator.get(), alloc, stats.insert_count, memory_target);
20504  if (ret == 0) {
20505  dout(5) << "Allocator drive - file integrity check OK" << dendl;
20506  } else {
20507  derr << "FAILURE. Allocator from file and allocator from metadata differ::ret=" << ret << dendl;
20508  }
20509  }
20510 
20511  dout(1) << stats << dendl;
20512  return ret;
20513 }
20514 
20515 //---------------------------------------------------------
20516 Allocator* BlueStore::clone_allocator_without_bluefs(Allocator *src_allocator)
20517 {
20518  uint64_t bdev_size = bdev->get_size();
20519  Allocator* allocator = create_bitmap_allocator(bdev_size);
20520  if (allocator) {
20521  dout(5) << "bitmap-allocator=" << allocator << dendl;
20522  } else {
20523  derr << "****failed create_bitmap_allocator()" << dendl;
20524  return nullptr;
20525  }
20526 
20527  uint64_t num_entries = 0;
20528  copy_allocator(src_allocator, allocator, &num_entries);
20529 
20530  // BlueFS stores its internal allocation outside RocksDB (FM) so we should not destage them to the allcoator-file
20531  // we are going to hide bluefs allocation during allocator-destage as they are stored elsewhere
20532  {
20533  bluefs->foreach_block_extents(
20534  bluefs_layout.shared_bdev,
20535  [&] (uint64_t start, uint32_t len) {
20536  allocator->init_add_free(start, len);
20537  }
20538  );
20539  }
20540 
20541  return allocator;
20542 }
20543 
20544 //---------------------------------------------------------
20545 static void clear_allocation_objects_from_rocksdb(KeyValueDB *db, CephContext *cct, const std::string &path)
20546 {
20547  dout(5) << "t->rmkeys_by_prefix(PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP)" << dendl;
20548  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
20549  t->rmkeys_by_prefix(PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP);
20550  db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
20551 }
20552 
20553 //---------------------------------------------------------
20554 void BlueStore::copy_allocator_content_to_fm(Allocator *allocator, FreelistManager *real_fm)
20555 {
20556  unsigned max_txn = 1024;
20557  dout(5) << "max_transaction_submit=" << max_txn << dendl;
20558  uint64_t size = 0, idx = 0;
20559  KeyValueDB::Transaction txn = db->get_transaction();
20560  auto iterated_insert = [&](uint64_t offset, uint64_t length) {
20561  size += length;
20562  real_fm->release(offset, length, txn);
20563  if ((++idx % max_txn) == 0) {
20564  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
20565  txn = db->get_transaction();
20566  }
20567  };
20568  allocator->foreach(iterated_insert);
20569  if (idx % max_txn != 0) {
20570  db->submit_transaction_sync(txn);
20571  }
20572  dout(5) << "size=" << size << ", num extents=" << idx << dendl;
20573 }
20574 
20575 //---------------------------------------------------------
20576 Allocator* BlueStore::initialize_allocator_from_freelist(FreelistManager *real_fm)
20577 {
20578  dout(5) << "real_fm->enumerate_next" << dendl;
20579  Allocator* allocator2 = create_bitmap_allocator(bdev->get_size());
20580  if (allocator2) {
20581  dout(5) << "bitmap-allocator=" << allocator2 << dendl;
20582  } else {
20583  return nullptr;
20584  }
20585 
20586  uint64_t size2 = 0, idx2 = 0;
20587  real_fm->enumerate_reset();
20588  uint64_t offset, length;
20589  while (real_fm->enumerate_next(db, &offset, &length)) {
20590  allocator2->init_add_free(offset, length);
20591  ++idx2;
20592  size2 += length;
20593  }
20594  real_fm->enumerate_reset();
20595 
20596  dout(5) << "size2=" << size2 << ", num2=" << idx2 << dendl;
20597  return allocator2;
20598 }
20599 
20600 //---------------------------------------------------------
20601 // close the active fm and open it in a new mode like makefs()
20602 // but make sure to mark the full device space as allocated
20603 // later we will mark all exetents from the allocator as free
20604 int BlueStore::reset_fm_for_restore()
20605 {
20606  dout(5) << "<<==>> fm->clear_null_manager()" << dendl;
20607  fm->shutdown();
20608  delete fm;
20609  fm = nullptr;
20610  freelist_type = "bitmap";
20611  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
20612  // call _open_fm() with fm_restore set to TRUE
20613  // this will mark the full device space as allocated (and not just the reserved space)
20614  _open_fm(t, true, true, true);
20615  if (fm == nullptr) {
20616  derr << "Failed _open_fm()" << dendl;
20617  return -1;
20618  }
20619  db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
20620  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
20621  dout(5) << "fm was reactivated in full mode" << dendl;
20622  return 0;
20623 }
20624 
20625 
20626 //---------------------------------------------------------
20627 // create a temp allocator filled with allocation state from the fm
20628 // and compare it to the base allocator passed in
20629 int BlueStore::verify_rocksdb_allocations(Allocator *allocator)
20630 {
20631  dout(5) << "verify that alloc content is identical to FM" << dendl;
20632  // initialize from freelist
20633  Allocator* temp_allocator = initialize_allocator_from_freelist(fm);
20634  if (temp_allocator == nullptr) {
20635  return -1;
20636  }
20637 
20638  uint64_t insert_count = 0;
20639  auto count_entries = [&](uint64_t extent_offset, uint64_t extent_length) {
20640  insert_count++;
20641  };
20642  temp_allocator->foreach(count_entries);
20643  uint64_t memory_target = cct->_conf.get_val<Option::size_t>("osd_memory_target");
20644  int ret = compare_allocators(allocator, temp_allocator, insert_count, memory_target);
20645 
20646  delete temp_allocator;
20647 
20648  if (ret == 0) {
20649  dout(5) << "SUCCESS!!! compare(allocator, temp_allocator)" << dendl;
20650  return 0;
20651  } else {
20652  derr << "**** FAILURE compare(allocator, temp_allocator)::ret=" << ret << dendl;
20653  return -1;
20654  }
20655 }
20656 
20657 //---------------------------------------------------------
20658 int BlueStore::db_cleanup(int ret)
20659 {
20660  _shutdown_cache();
20661  _close_db_and_around();
20662  return ret;
20663 }
20664 
20665 //---------------------------------------------------------
20666 // convert back the system from null-allocator to using rocksdb to store allocation
20667 int BlueStore::push_allocation_to_rocksdb()
20668 {
20669  if (cct->_conf->bluestore_allocation_from_file) {
20670  derr << "cct->_conf->bluestore_allocation_from_file must be cleared first" << dendl;
20671  derr << "please change default to false in ceph.conf file>" << dendl;
20672  return -1;
20673  }
20674 
20675  dout(5) << "calling open_db_and_around() in read/write mode" << dendl;
20676  int ret = _open_db_and_around(false);
20677  if (ret < 0) {
20678  return ret;
20679  }
20680 
20681  if (!fm->is_null_manager()) {
20682  derr << "This is not a NULL-MANAGER -> nothing to do..." << dendl;
20683  return db_cleanup(0);
20684  }
20685 
20686  // start by creating a clone copy of the shared-allocator
20687  unique_ptr<Allocator> allocator(clone_allocator_without_bluefs(alloc));
20688  if (!allocator) {
20689  return db_cleanup(-1);
20690  }
20691 
20692  // remove all objects of PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP from RocksDB to guarantee a clean start
20693  clear_allocation_objects_from_rocksdb(db, cct, path);
20694 
20695  // then open fm in new mode with the full devie marked as alloctaed
20696  if (reset_fm_for_restore() != 0) {
20697  return db_cleanup(-1);
20698  }
20699 
20700  // push the free-space from the allocator (shared-alloc without bfs) to rocksdb
20701  copy_allocator_content_to_fm(allocator.get(), fm);
20702 
20703  // compare the allocator info with the info stored in the fm/rocksdb
20704  if (verify_rocksdb_allocations(allocator.get()) == 0) {
20705  // all is good -> we can commit to rocksdb allocator
20706  commit_to_real_manager();
20707  } else {
20708  return db_cleanup(-1);
20709  }
20710 
20711  // can't be too paranoid :-)
20712  dout(5) << "Running full scale verification..." << dendl;
20713  // close db/fm/allocator and start fresh
20714  db_cleanup(0);
20715  dout(5) << "calling open_db_and_around() in read-only mode" << dendl;
20716  ret = _open_db_and_around(true);
20717  if (ret < 0) {
20718  return db_cleanup(ret);
20719  }
20720  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
20721  ceph_assert(verify_rocksdb_allocations(allocator.get()) == 0);
20722 
20723  return db_cleanup(ret);
20724 }
20725 
20726 #endif // CEPH_BLUESTORE_TOOL_RESTORE_ALLOCATION
20727 
20728 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20729 int BlueStore::commit_freelist_type()
20730 {
20731  // When freelist_type to "bitmap" we will store allocation in RocksDB
20732  // When allocation-info is stored in a single file we set freelist_type to "null"
20733  // This will direct the startup code to read allocation from file and not RocksDB
20734  KeyValueDB::Transaction t = db->get_transaction();
20735  if (t == nullptr) {
20736  derr << "db->get_transaction() failed!!!" << dendl;
20737  return -1;
20738  }
20739 
20740  bufferlist bl;
20741  bl.append(freelist_type);
20742  t->set(PREFIX_SUPER, "freelist_type", bl);
20743 
20744  int ret = db->submit_transaction_sync(t);
20745  if (ret != 0) {
20746  derr << "Failed db->submit_transaction_sync(t)" << dendl;
20747  }
20748  return ret;
20749 }
20750 
20751 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20752 int BlueStore::commit_to_null_manager()
20753 {
20754  dout(5) << __func__ << " Set FreelistManager to NULL FM..." << dendl;
20755  fm->set_null_manager();
20756  freelist_type = "null";
20757 #if 1
20758  return commit_freelist_type();
20759 #else
20760  // should check how long this step take on a big configuration as deletes are expensive
20761  if (commit_freelist_type() == 0) {
20762  // remove all objects of PREFIX_ALLOC_BITMAP from RocksDB to guarantee a clean start
20763  clear_allocation_objects_from_rocksdb(db, cct, path);
20764  }
20765 #endif
20766 }
20767 
20768 
20769 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
20770 int BlueStore::commit_to_real_manager()
20771 {
20772  dout(5) << "Set FreelistManager to Real FM..." << dendl;
20773  ceph_assert(!fm->is_null_manager());
20774  freelist_type = "bitmap";
20775  int ret = commit_freelist_type();
20776  if (ret == 0) {
20777  //remove the allocation_file
20778  invalidate_allocation_file_on_bluefs();
20779  ret = bluefs->unlink(allocator_dir, allocator_file);
20780  bluefs->sync_metadata(false);
20781  if (ret == 0) {
20782  dout(5) << "Remove Allocation File successfully" << dendl;
20783  }
20784  else {
20785  derr << "Remove Allocation File ret_code=" << ret << dendl;
20786  }
20787  }
20788 
20789  return ret;
20790 }
20791
